campaign.story:
Born into the outcast breed of werewolves known as the Monoki, eighteen-year-old Rodney Marcelli is reluctantly pulled into an ancient war between good and evil, during a modern time where the line has blurred. 
With the help of Snow Paw, the Pureblood Monoki, and the supernatural evil slayer, Night Hunter, Rod must learn to master his newly found lycanthropy and mysterious kinetic energy power that only he possesses. Rod must fight the Dark Covenant in order to avenge his friends and family, and to save the girl he loves from the master vampire, Lord Malice. 
Rodney Marcelli is Night Wolf!
Welcome to the Night Wolf #1-5: Urban Fantasy Werewolf Coming of Age Drama Kickstarter campaign! My name is Robert A. Multari and I'm the creator/writer of Night Wolf. 
It has been my dream since I was a kid, struggling with Attention Deficit Disorder and Dyslexia, to be a comic book creator because comic books have helped me to overcome my learning disabilities. I've had the pleasure of self-publishing Night Wolf Issues 1 through 4, with the help of my past Kickstarter backers, who I refer to as my Wolf Pack. 
Now, I stand ready to publish my Night Wolf Issue 5 which is 100% complete, and is ready to send off to the printers. That’s why I’ve come back to pay for the printing and the rewards that you will receive for backing my project.
The Kickstarter staff on on day one selected Night Wolf #1-5: Urban Fantasy Werewolf Coming-of-Age Drama as a “Project We Love,” which is their way of highlighting brilliant examples of creativity. We are very thankful and honored that we were tagged!
Night Wolf Issue 1
Rodney Marcelli, a small town high school senior from a wealthy family, had everything a teenage boy could want; popularity, a beautiful girlfriend, and a full-ride football scholarship to Keystone State University. However, as his eighteenth birthday draws near Rodney is haunted by nightmares of ghoulish creatures and visions of losing his loved ones. During his waking life, Rodney starts to notice elements of his nightmares are coming true as vampires, werewolves, witches, and demons start to invade his sleepy little town.
Night Wolf Issue 2
Rodney, still haunted by nightmarish visions, has a growing concern that something terrible is about to happen in his sleepy little town. On the night of his 18th birthday, Rod and his girlfriend, Jennifer Conway, are attending their high school Homecoming Dance, where they are crowned Queen and King. Their celebration dance is cut short by the twin witches, Janelle and Circe, who crash the party unleashing monsters upon the unsuspecting student body and faculty. Rod and Jen barely make their escape outside only to be confronted by the bloodthirsty werewolf, Black Claw.
Night Wolf Issue 3
Rodney is left for dead after his first encounter with the cruel werewolf, Black Claw, who has taken Rod’s girlfriend, Jennifer Conway, prisoner. Rod awakens the next morning in the hospital where he overhears a doctor speaking with FBI Agents, who want to question Rod about the four missing teenage girls and the massacre at the Homecoming Dance. Afraid the Agents would not believe him, Rod quickly escapes out a window. Upon returning home, Rod discovers a horrifying scene left for him. Then, without warning he is overtaken by horde of vampires and werewolves.
Night Wolf Issue 4
After fending off a horde of vampires and werewolves, Rodney and Snow Paw flee to escape the FBI Special Investigation Agents, who have come to investigate the scene. While hiding in the dense woods behind Rodney’s family’s home, Snow Paw tells him of their Monoki werewolf heritage. Snow Paw concludes that Rodney is unlike all other members of their breed. Then without warning, the supernatural monster slayer, Night Hunter, drops in on them armed to the teeth, with his sights on Rodney.
Night Wolf Issue 5
After gathering supplies from his family home, Rodney Marcelli embarks on a journey with Snow Paw to one of her safe houses deep in the Appalachian Mountains. Upon arrival, Snow Paw wastes no time to begin Rodney’s weapons training and teaching him how to control his lycanthropy, in preparation for the upcoming battle against the Dark Covenant. Meanwhile, FBI Special Investigation Agents are hot on their trail, and Lord Malice’s sinister plan for Jennifer Conway starts to unfold.
Fans of Supernatural, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Underworld, and other anti-hero monster horror stories.

Hi, I'm Robert A. Multari, but you can call me Rob. It’s been my dream since I was a kid, struggling with Attention Deficit Disorder and Dyslexia, to be in the comic book business. Comic books helped me learn how to deal with my learning disability. When I was 14-years-old, I wrote fan fiction for the X-Men and submitted it to Marvel in hopes that Stan Lee would read it. Someone from Marvel was nice enough to write back to me saying that Stan loves to hear from his fans and encouraged me to keep up my writing. As naive as I was at the time, it spread my passion for the business like a wild fire and inspired me to go to art school at Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, where I graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Applied Media Arts. I have been working on Night Wolf since I was 16-years-old. The story and the characters have grown up with me, evolving into the amazing tale that it is today.
Why a werewolf comic book? Well, I have always loved any werewolf or supernatural related entertainment in movies, video games, etc. I didn't feel like there were any comic books out there doing werewolves any justice, so I decided to make a comic book based on a werewolf anti-hero myself. In high school, after I started developing Night Wolf, I got into Werewolf: The Apocalypse is a role-playing game by White Wolf Publishing.  I love the artwork in the game guides so much that I longed for them to put out a comic book to build on their world. Unfortunately, it never happened, but the artwork heavily influenced how I like my werewolves should look in my comics.

As a Kickstarter Superbacker and a life time comic book collector, I know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged. Therefore, all comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.
Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection. The Mystery Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.
Furthermore, for this campaign, I will be handling fulfillment 100% in-house. I want to make sure that everything arrives to you as quickly as possible and limit the possibility of unforeseen delays, which is why I will be rolling up my sleeves to personally overseeing fulfillment for every backer.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In April of 2016, I launched a failed Kickstarter campaign for Night Wolf Issues 1-3. I played the game on hard, setting a $20,000 goal. However, I did manage to raise $5,064 from my 74 backers, unfortunately Kickstarter is all or nothing. At the time I only had the character designs, a cover and 5 sequential pages during that launch. Even though the Kickstarter didn’t fund I was bound and determined to publish my story. Because I didn’t have the funds to finish the first issue, I decided to raise the money on my own doing freelance web design work to pay for the artwork.

After self-publishing Night Wolf Issues 1 and 2, I launched another Kickstarter in October 2019 to print Night Wolf Issues 3 with a more reasonable funding goal of $5,000. The campaign successfully over funded, thanks to the amazing 217 backers that I refer to as my Wolf Pack. Since then I have launch two more successfully over funded Kickstarter campaigns, thanks to returning/new Wolf Pack members, for Night Wolf Issue 4 and the Night Wolf Volume 1 trade paperback. Now, I'm back and ready to release Night Wolf Issue 5 which is 100% completely finished and print ready!

I know 2020 was very challenging, and there is still a lot going on all over the world right now in 2021. This turmoil is very stressful for us all. Collecting, reading, and creating comics books have always been an escape from the stressful things in my life. My hope is that by creating my comics books and putting them out into the world for you to enjoy also helps to relieve some of your stress as well. And that is what I am laser focused on doing!

In addition, I have been educating myself through the Comixlaunch course, which is a Kickstarter training program created by Tyler James. Tyler is the Publisher of ComixTribe and has successfully funded many Kickstarter campaigns. Through the ComixLaunch community I have also been a part of a ComixLaunch Mastermind group of independent creators that have all ran successful campaigns in the past, and I've spent time learning and being mentored by the very talented members of the group.

project_data.project_name: Night Wolf #1-5: Urban Fantasy Werewolf Coming-of-Age Drama

campaign.story:
Faking Filmation is a documentary that explores the depths of fandom, intellectual property and the dangerous intersection between them while tracing the origin and evolution of cartoons, the history of Filmation and one man's mission to create the ultimate love letter to the creators of his favorite cartoon show.
Faking Filmation Poster by Ken Coleman
Synopsis:
James Eatock has an obsession: 80s cartoons. While most fans of the era can quote various episodes and talk in depth about character backstory, James' encyclopedic knowledge goes much deeper. He can tell you when and where characters appear with slightly different color shades, when lines were dubbed in, when and where storyboards were different than the final episode, and knows all about unproduced shows and future plans. He lives and breathes it and specifically, He-Man and the Masters of the Universe. Ever since he was a kid, he's wanted to tell He-Man stories and while he's authored books for Dark Horse detailing every single episode of the beloved cartoon, edited the celebrated fan magazine, cereal:geek, and remains a popular resource for 80s cartoons, his childhood goal has alluded him - until 2017. 
Four years ago, James decided he was going to fulfill his dreams and create an unofficial He-Man cartoon that, ideally, would seamlessly fit into the heralded Filmation version of the famed character. The look, the sounds, the voices, the music - It was all going to be like the Filmation series. After 3.5 years of hard work with a handful of collaborators all volunteering their efforts because they shared the same passion as James, the cartoon was completed and ready to showcase at Power-Con - and then came the legal warnings from NBC/Universal, the rights holder for He-Man and the Masters of the Universe. With his childhood dream on the precipice of becoming a reality, James must now choose what he wants to do: does he shelve it and save himself from expensive legal action? Does he find a way around the situation? Does he release it no matter what - because dreams matter more than money? Of course, he has decided to journey forward!
James Eatock at Power-Con 2019
While chronicling James' journey to create and release his unofficial cartoon, we will talk to industry insiders, animation aficionados, and cartoon lovers from everywhere about the impact of cartoons, the current state of cartoon culture, Saturday morning, weekday and prime time Cartoons, the rise and fall of Filmation, the impact of He-Man and the Masters of the Universe, Fan Films and so much more!!!
While the main drive of the film will be James' story including his beginnings, personal life and so forth, it's all being wrapped in a giant discussion about cartoons with some of the most respected and talented people on the planet. So what kind of topics will the film showcase? LOTS:
Cartoon history/evolution, the rise and fall of Saturday Morning, emergence of afternoon/weekday cartoon dominance, prime time toons, cartoons and learning, hand-drawn vs CG, Cartoon Network and 24/7 cartoons, cartoons for adults, branding/licensing, cartoons and politics, cartoons and toys, viewer impact, domestic and foreign production, cartoon heroes and villains, from movies to television to youtube and SO MANY MORE!
Those are some very broad topics but just know our focus rests in episode content created for television - that's what we consider cartoons for the purposes of this film - even when practice was to bundle theatrical shorts for air on TV.

But what cartoons will we discuss and showcase?
Of course, we'll discuss He-Man and the Masters of the Universe and She-ra: Princess of Power given the obvious tie to James' story, but we'll also explore other shows like G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero, Transformers, M.A.S.K., C.O.P.S., Visionaries, The Mighty Hercules, Blackstar, Bravestarr, The Real Ghostbusters, Captain Planet, Reboot, Scooby-Doo, The Flintstones, The Simpsons, South Park, Rick and Morty, Adventure Time, Batman: The Animated Series, X-Men, Spider-Man, Thundercats but basically whatever  people bring up during our discussions! There is certainly a heavy 80s and 90s influence with the above shows, but it would be impossible to tell this story and leave out hits from the 60s and 70s, plus everything that's happened in the last 20 years too!

It's also no surprise, given the title that we will be looking specifically at the work of Filmation, since that studio directly impacted James and had a HUGE part in creating Saturday Morning (and weekday afternoon) cartoon culture. We'll look and explore the vast majority of their shows in some way and look to explore their full history.
Lou Scheimer, New York Times Article, 2013
Will the film discuss any other topics?
Given the nature of James' story, we'll look into the history of fan-driven projects and all the legal issues with creating content that one might not own.
Here are some of the people who have agreed to participate in our production if we get funded:
Erika Scheimer - Producer/Production Coordinator/Voice Actor, He-Man, She-Ra
Rob Lamb - Writer/Storyboard Artist, He-Man, She-Ra, Filmation's Ghostbusters
Tom Tataranowicz - Director/Producer/Animator, He-Man, She-Ra, Biker Mice from Mars
Andy Mangels - Co-Author, Creating the Filmation Generation
Larry Houston - X-Men: TAS, G.I. Joe, TMNT, C.O.P.S., Batman: TAS, Exosquad
J. Larry Carroll - Writer, TMNT, Captain Planet, G.I. Joe, Thundercats, Bravestarr, She-ra
Victor Dal Chele - Director/Storyboard Artist, Extreme Ghostbusters, Exosquad, SWAT Kats
Ron Friedman - Writer, Transformers: The Movie, Bionic Six, G.I. Joe, Fantastic Four
Brynne Chandler - Writer, Batman: TAS, Spider-Man, Gargoyles, TMNT, He-Man, She-ra
Christy Marx - Writer, Bucky O'Hare, G.I. Joe, Dino-Riders, Jem
Zadoc Angell - Co-founder of The He-Man and She-Ra Episode Review Website & Producer, Van Helsing
Val Staples - Event Director, Power-Con
"MOTU Joe" Teague - Masters of the Universe collector and pop culture expert
Daniel Benedict - Filmmaker, Fall of Grayskull, The Bloody Man
Dusan Mitrovic - Director/Producer, The Return of Faker
Andrew Cramer - Lead colorist, The Return of Faker
Keith Seymour - Special FX, The Return of Faker
Jukka Issakainen - Writer, Dark Horse MOTU books / Colorist, "The Return of Faker"
Jay Bartlett - Toy Collector, Action Figure Adventure, Nintendo Quest
Jordan Morris - Writer, Former Toy Store Owner
Glenn Stanway - Video Game Producer
AND MANY MORE PROFESSIONALS, FANS, COLLECTORS, INSIDERS AND PEOPLE LIKE YOU!
 BASE GOAL - "SORTA FAKING IT" - $30,000 - ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!!!! 
Our base goal lets us tell more of the story about Filmation, James, and his initial mission with his cartoon, The Return of Faker. You'll see and hear more about this pioneering studio via interviews with people that worked there, and people from the animation industry. You'll hear about the impact and evolution of cartoon culture with as many people as can film. NOTE: Due to the pandemic and the on-going, ever-changing travel and health restrictions, we might have to capture most of these interviews remotely. 

 STRETCH GOAL - "THE RETURN OF FAKER?" - $37,500 - ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!!!!
This is a fun add-on that we'll give to all backers that pledge above $29 for a physical reward. Essentially, we'll send a second disc-cover your way that'll make your DVD or Blu Ray case feel like the ultimate unofficial release of James' cartoon, "The Return of Faker." While this alternate art hasn't been designed yet, expect it be quite nostalgic. Remember, "The Return of Faker" is an unofficial, fan-film and this campaign and documentary focuses on the process to create, and, potentially and legitimately release the cartoon as it pertains to the larger telling of James' story. As such, there will be some process elements that appear on parts of the cover - because that's what this is all about!
James Eatock's Dream Art for this stretch goal! We know it can't be this for legal reasons - but too fun not to share!

 STRETCH GOAL  - "COMPLETELY FAKING IT" - $50,000 - ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!!!!
This is the master ULTIMATE vision, the project we really want to make. This allows us to trace the history of Saturday morning cartoons, the rise of Filmation, and the origins of the He-Man and the Masters of the Universe cartoon and how all of this impacted James at an early age. We'll chart James' story and other fans that have dared to make unofficial tributes to the shows and brands that impacted them - and we'll also see what happens next in James' journey forward with The Return of Faker, specifically watching him try to achieve his NINE goals for his cartoon. Production quality increases as our resources increase, so we hope to conduct interviews in peson versus remotely. NOTE: This version will take more time since we will be traveling, and shooting with more people - but the result will be night and day compared to the $30K version.
THANK YOU!!!

 STRETCH GOAL - MINI COMIC - $65,000 - ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!!!! 
Everyone who's backed at $29 for a physical reward item, or HIGHER, will receive a brand new FAKE 8-page Mini Comic. The mini comic will emulate the look and feel of the original Masters of the Universe mini comics (see below), but contain all new unofficial fan-created content related to our campaign. Do we have the power to hit this goal?
Original Masters of the Universe Mini Comic, shown to illustrate the look, feel and size of our unofficial FAKE fan mini comic!
 STRETCH GOAL - LONGER RUNTIME - $80,000 - ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!!!! 
We did it? YOU DID IT!
 STRETCH GOAL - Stand-alone Short Documentary - $90,000 - ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!!!! 
IF WE HIT $90,000, ALL THE BACKERS will get a 22-44mins stand-alone short documentary on a subject matter that ALL THE BACKERS get to vote on and suggest topic ideas. This stand-alone piece could be an expanded look at Filmation or another animation studio, it could be a look at another cartoon series like Thundercats or G.I. Joe, or it could about the cross pollination between European, American and Asian studios and creators, and that impact on the industry. LOTS OF OPTIONS and we will sort those possibilities out IF we hit $90,000 AFTER the campaign.
How is this possible? That sounds like a lot more work! It's true, it will be more work, but going into our interviews, we can reserve some time to address the subject matter and craft responses just for this piece of bonus content. Essentially, if we're talking about cartoons, animation and evolution with people anyway, we will push for a few more questions about this topic. On top of that, we can use voice over and imagery to connect the dots and tell the story, whatever that may be. Since we do not know if we will hit $90,000, and since we do not know the subject matter, it's really hard to predict the length which is why we have left the length up in the air. I think it would be safer to suggest something shorter and the more we raise above and beyond the $90K, the more we can explore the subject while continuing to support our main documentary. MORE is BETTER!
 STRETCH GOAL - SHOW THE WORLD - $100,000 - ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!!!! 
Hitting $100,000 is the ultimate symbol of support for all things Filmation, Masters of the Universe and James - it shows the world how much this stuff matters. Such a feat might even help James on his journey to properly and publicly release “The Return of Faker” and could even conjure additional intangible rewards for all of us because we chose to make this happen now because this stuff DOES matter; it's not just for kids. So, let's send a signal and shine a beacon of hope for all the Filmation fans out there, those who love and adore Lou Scheimer and his legacy, and all of us in the cartoon community. WE CAN DO THIS!!
James and Lou
BE IN THE FILM!
Selecting this tier guarantees you a spot in the film or one of our select bonus features. Share you opinion, thoughts and feelings on any number of things we might ask, but it'll likely relate to He-Man, Filmation, Cartoons or James Eatock! Filming with you will depend our on our funding level, travel restrictions and your schedule and location. For example, we may cross paths at Power-Con. We may not. In a worst case scenario, we will look to employ tools like Zoom or Skype to get you in the film. 

ON-SCREEN CREDITS!
These credits are great for adding to your IMDB page and of course sharing your love and passion about our film project. The Executive Producer tier even lets you see early and rough cuts of the film ahead of everyone and anyone else!

DIGITAL DOWNLOADS

RETRO SLIDE VIEWER
Enjoy this add-on item with any tier. You'll get exclusive access to unique imagery with this fun retro experience. Will you dare to view these top secret images?

VHS COPY

BLU-RAY and DVD COPIES

They will include select bonus features - mainly due to space restrictions - but you'll be able to access and download all our bonus features digitally. Also, we have another tier that includes a second Blu-ray Disc that'll be packed full of Bonus Content and will have at least ONE item that IS NOT available anywhere else.

ASSOCIATE PRODUCER TIER
Have your name listed as an associate producer in the end credits of the film AND, if you so wish, James will add your name to the end of "The Return of Faker" too! PLUS you'll get our DVD/BLU Ray Cereal Box-Like Slip Case designed by James Eatock! Free Prize inside as well! And James has offered to send you a Filmation-Like Faker Model sheet as well - if you select this tier or higher!

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER TIER
We love our executive producers so much that we're now adding a few special perks to that tier not directly listed. Our Exec Producers will now receive a VHS Copy of our film (if desired) as well as a special separate poster print not shown yet, our Retro Slide Viewer and their likeness done in Filmation style and added to "The Return of Faker" too! 

SPONSOR THE FILM!
In addition to everything listed in the Executive Producer tier and the listed criteria, your name/brand/company/show/convention/event LOGO will be shown up front at the very beginning of the film for all to see, mentioned in all our advertising, on all our physical media (discs, posters etc) and in press releases. We reserve the right to restrict, limit, adjust or manipulate that logo, name, or wording if it's not appropriate, causes legal infringement or represents bad taste. You must supply your logo for us and perform any required technical adjustments we need to include it in the film. Below is an example of how we've shown sponsor logos in other productions:

Welcome to the world of ADD-ONs for Kickstarter campaigns! Want 2 DVDs, Blu-Rays or something else we're offering? Here's your chance! People have demanded Kickstarter add the ability for people to load up their pledge with multiple items above and beyond a specific tier - and we love this too! For our campaign you'll find extra copies of the movie, but also, unique items like Posters and Sketches that aren't part of the other tiers. So if you want the add-on items, you have to back at a tier to access them!
Here's a sample sketch that we're offering, wonderfully illustrated by James Eatock. James will offer these to any backer and CHALLENGES you to make him draw ANY CHARACTER from any CARTOON! Limit one character per sketch, done in this unique style. These sketches will likely be sent independently of other rewards.
Sample Sketch by James Eatock
We're also offering DVD/Blu-Ray slip cases that emulate that fun cereal box aesthetic and ours has been designed by James Eatock. Of course if we're talking cereal box, you've gotta have a free prize inside!
Here's a rough, work-in-progress shot of our DVD/Blu Ray Cereal Box Slip Case!
 One more unique Add-On is the chance to have your likeness done in Filmation Style! AND, with your permission, James will add your filmation-likeness to a crowdshot in "The Return of Faker." You'll also get a digital image of the crowd shot emailed to you too!
While we thought just turning you into a "Filmation" version of yourself was cool, James wanted to take it to the next level!
Many of you visiting this campaign are curious if we will include The Return of Faker as  bonus material, in some sort of uncut, unaltered capacity. I can say our current goal is to include The Return of Faker as a piece of bonus content. To make this possible, we will seed the cartoon center-frame and have various "pop-up facts" that appear throughout the runtime that further showcase the process to make the unofficial cartoon come to fruition. None of the pop-ups will cover the cartoon but will appear beside the cartoon and point out things like dialogue that was used from other episodes, instances where other Filmation cartoon characters were used for reference poses, FX work etc. This is important because a lot of time and effort went into creating this unofficial cartoon and given that the focus of this documentary is the cartoon, it's creation and hopefully, it's release, showcasing it uncut and in full, further showcases our goals.
A little process teaser that shows how "The Return of Faker" team created some shots
But there's more...
I firmly believe this is a rare opportunity to take James' love for cartoons from the 80s and his efforts to make The Return of Faker as a vehicle to unpack all of cartoon history, and of course, Filmation. I've been waiting for a great, current day story about 80s cartoons for a long time and to have one that follows an individual who's hellbent and driven beyond any relative rational sense of sanity to most people is RARE. It'll be great if we hit our base goal and showcase how James and his team made The Return of Faker, but it will be special and significant if we can showcase the James' journey to see his childhood dream come true. Specifically, there are NINE key goals that James has and wants to accomplish with "The Return of Faker" - and they're all awesome!!!
The Return of Faker - Title Screen
It's no secret that making films is not a cheap endeavor. Below you will see the projected cost of this film, for the full blown feature length, global release version - which is only a starting point depending how long the journey takes to truly unfold and resolve. On average, documentaries take 3-5 years to shoot, edit and complete. We think our story will resolve sooner than that with delivery around the 2 year mark. 
Rob McCallum - Writer/Director, Pyre Productions
Locked in a tower in parts unknown, Rob McCallum spends his time building elaborate story-driven worlds, playing with action figures, video games or air drumming to some of his favorite tunes. This Emmy-nominated and award-winning filmmaker has been featured on NBC, CBS, CBC Radio•One, WIRE, /Film and Destructoid over the course of his career that includes sales to Netflix, Super Channel, Tubi, and other broadcasters around the world. He’s obsessed with all things Jim Henson, has a deep love of Masters of the Universe and one day wants to visit Duckburg.

campaign.story:
“Behind every great fortune, there is a crime!” ~ Lucky Luciano 
The Dust Bunny Mafia is my series of noir stories featuring  anthropomorphic animals.  I'm doing this Kickstarter to pay for the  printing of a new set of tales based on real life mafia events.  Here's one of my favorites:

The Cal Neva Resort and Casino is a resort and casino straddling the border between Nevada and California on the shores of Lake Tahoe. The original building was constructed in 1926 and was a casino property so colorful that it rivaled Vegas during its heyday.
Once gambling came to The Cal Neva in 1928, the property’s state line status became a boon for gambling. If county sheriffs were to raid the lake from  either the California or Nevada side, guests would simply move to  whichever side of the room was safe. 
In 1960, entertainer Frank Sinatra  purchased the Resort alongside Dean Martin and Chicago mobster Sam Giancana.
Introducing Based on a True Story Vol. 3
Cover art by Juan Gomez, colors by Ryan Kroboth.

Based on a True Story Vol. 3 is a 32 page mini comic collection (8.5" X 5.5") containing 29 comics, printed in  glorious full color, each based on a real life mobster story.

For years I have been fascinated with mobsters, but more memorable to me than Hollywood interpretations of the mafia lifestyle are the real life  stories of the Italian American mafia.

Who will love Dust Bunny Mafia?
Fans of mafia-related pop culture like The Godfather, Goodfellas, and The Sopranos.
Lovers of Saturday morning cartoons and the Sunday funny papers.
People who like cartoons such as Looney Tunes and Animaniacs.
Collectors of high quality independent comic books.

Campaign Exclusives
Limited edition poker chip
Your mobimal featured on the back cover line-up
Your mobimal on the limited edition poker chip
Mobimal Line-up Cameo (Back Cover)
In 1932, the press happened to snap a photograph featuring an arrest lineup of Chicago mafia and New York gangsters: Paul 'The Waiter' Ricca, Sylvester  Agoglio, Charles 'Lucky' Luciano, Meyer Lansky, John Senna (Rocco  Fischetti), and Harry Brown. A mobimal modeled after you could be featured in a re-creation of this photograph on the back-cover of the booklet.
Mobimals pictured here are for display purposes only.

Limited Edition Variant Cover - Geoff Munn
For Based on a True Story Volume 3, I wanted to do something different, so I commissioned Geoff Munn of  Pocket Science Studios to create a variant cover based on my comic Clam  Up. Geoff knocked it out of the park, creating an image that explains  what happens between panels 2 and 3 of the below Dust Bunny Mafia strip.
***DOMESTIC U.S. SHIPPING INCLUDED***
Exclusive Story Only to Be Released in This Edition
One of the stranger stories that I've adapted in this edition is the story of Aladena “Jimmy the Weasel” Fratianno, who was a longtime Mafia hit man and  Los Angeles mob boss before turning into an FBI informant. 
After turning  informant, he spent most of his time traveling the country to testify  against fellow mobsters and becoming the highest-paid participant in the  history of the federal witness-protection program. 
Life in retirement  did not always go smoothly, as he sued his hand-picked biographer of his  first book, “The Last Mafioso,” saying it contained false quotes. He  blamed the second, “Vengeance Is Mine,” for his being dropped from the  witness program’s payroll in 1987. 
Fratianno gained his nickname from  running “like a weasel” from a pursuing police officer, though, like  Benjamin “Bugsy” Siegel, he was seldom called it to his face.
Based on a True Story T-Shirts
Based on a True Story T-shirts are Included with several tiers. Below you will find several designs that are parody shirts featuring some well known mafia-related businesses that are featured in this volume.

Schofield's Flowers - Chicago, IL
Schofield's Flowers was established in 1896 by William F. Schofield, A.K.A. "Big Bill". It was located at 738 North State Street on the north side of the city of Chicago.

In 1921, with only $10,000 dollars and .38 caliber pistol in hand, Dean O'Banion an American mobster of Irish heritage, made "Big Bill" Schofield an offer he could not refuse, and they became "business" partners. 
The Chicago North Side Gang transformed Schofield's into the florist of choice for mob funerals, all of the North State Street Gang's weddings, holidays and special occasions, like providing the wreaths for the victims of the Saint Valentine's Day Massacre. 

Umberto's Clam House - Manhattan (New York City), NY
 On April 7, 1972, around 4:30 a.m., “Crazy Joe” Gallo and his family entered Umbertos Clam House in Manhattan’s Little Italy to celebrate his  43rd birthday and what would be his last meal. 

Earlier that evening, the Gallo party had visited the  Copacabana nightclub to see a performance by comedian Don Rickles and singer Peter  Lemongello. Once at Umbertos, the Gallo party took two tables in the  back corner, with Gallo and his bodyguard Peter “Pete the Greek”  Diapoulas facing the wall. 
Between seafood courses, four gunmen walked into the dining room and opened fire with .32- and .38-caliber revolvers. Gallo swore and attempted to draw his handgun, but twenty shots were  fired at him, and he was hit in the back, elbow and buttock. After overturning a butcher block dining table, Gallo staggered to the front door.  

The mortally wounded Gallo stumbled into the street and collapsed. He  was taken in a police car to the hospital where he was  pronounced dead shortly after at around 5:30 a.m.

Pelican Tomato Company - New Orleans, LA
Inspired by Carlos Marcello, an American crime boss considered to be  the Godfather of New Orleans crime from 1947 until the late 1980s.

Carlos claimed that he was simply a salesman for the Pelican Tomato Company and earned $1500 a month. Despite his illegal profits in motels, restaurants, banks, beer and liquor stores, taxi and bus firms, etc.
According to a Washington Post article in May of 1975, which headline  read, “U.S. Government Buys Produce Linked to Mafia” the Defense  Department bought $1.1 million worth of produce from a firm whose top  salesman was Carlos Marcello, alleged Mafia godfather of New Orleans.
Although responsible government officials privately insist they don’t like doing business with a reputed Mafia boss, they are obliged by law to buy their tomatoes from the lowest bidder.

What do people say about the Dust Bunny Mafia? 
***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY VOL. 1, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
***DOMESTIC U.S. SHIPPING INCLUDED, and all books come signed by creator Bret Juliano.***

Where's the Money Going?

Bret "The Fedora" Juliano - Creator
Bret Juliano is a cartoonist and creator of the all ages Dust Bunny Mafia comic, which has over 700 comics and Mobimals in its archive. In late  2016, Bret published Meet the Family, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic  collection. In 2019, he successfully funded a Kickstarter for Based on a True Story Vol. 1, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection. In 2020, Bret returned to Kickstarter to fund his second Dust Bunny Mafia collection, The Blind Tiger, and Based on a True Story Vol. 2. Earlier this year, he funded a deck of playing cards featuring the Dust Bunny Mafia. 
My dust bunny mobsters have also been included in several anthologies including Unlawful Good, Forgotten Histories and Out of the Deep as part of the Let’s Make Comics: Chicago Collective. I'm also an avid consumer of mafia trivia, both fact and fiction, and a passionate collector of fedoras.
For as far back as I can remember I was always drawing. When I was a kid, my dream job was to be an animator for Disney, but as I grew up, my focus shifted into the world of comics...newspaper styled comics especially.
Garfield, Calvin and Hobbes, Peanuts, Zits, Get Fuzzy...I could keep going, but I won't. I would read the Sunday funny paper back to back for years.
These were the things that brought joy to me and my comics, the Dust Bunny Mafia in particular, is my opportunity to tell my stories and give back in comics form.
What about the rewards?
Add-ons
After selecting your pledge tier (physical rewards only), you can add other Dust Bunny Mafia merchandise to your pledge.

Welcome back, everyone.
Joel Hodgson here. Before we get started, I know it's been a really long, strange, difficult 12 months for a lot of us, so I hope everyone is doing okay and staying safe.
So... where were we?
In the not-too-distant past – about 6 years ago, November 2015 AD – we ran a Kickstarter to BRING BACK MST3K after 15 years in hibernation.
It was a little bit stressful, and a lot of work, but I've gotta tell you... the whole experience went better than we had ever hoped:
Thanks to you, our campaign broke a bunch of Kickstarter records.
Over 48,000 of you took up the cause... and together, we raised over $6 million.
With your help, we got picked up on Netflix and made 20 new episodes!
And you know, you can't ever please everybody, but it seems like most of you were pretty happy with 'em.... and the critics were too: 
Also, having those new episodes on Netflix, along with a lot of our "classic" episodes, helped a lot of folks discover Mystery Science Theater for the first time. So, if you weren't there to help #BringBackMST3K... Welcome! We're glad you're here to help  #MakeMoreMST3K.
Thanks to our Kickstarter, we also built up enough momentum to experiment with taking MST3K in new directions, including three live national tours, where we got to meet thousands of you in person!  Also, during our live tours, it became really clear to me that MST3K works best when you can experience it together, with your family and friends, or your fellow MSTies.
Anyway: as you know, nothing good lasts forever.  Sometime in late 2019, during our third live tour, we got word: even though Netflix liked how our new episodes came out, they wouldn't be renewing us for a third new season.
(Sometimes, business is just business, you know? Was it disappointing not to get renewed? Well, sure. But starting now, we want to focus on looking forward, not back. And when you see what we're planning now, I hope you'll agree that this could end up being the best thing for MST3K in the long run.)
Then, the day after we finished the live tour, the whole world shut down for a year. And you know, as terrible as COVID has been, it did mean that I had plenty of time to think about where Mystery Science Theater can go next.
When I thought about it long enough, I realized three important things:
 1. The world isn't done with MST3K yet.
 We still want to make more episodes of MST3K.
A lot of you still want us to make more MST3K.
2. It's time to try something new.
If enough of you want more MST3K, maybe we don't need anyone to renew us.
From now on, we want you to decide how long MST3K keeps going.
We don't need a network to "let us" make more MST3K. We can make it for you. 
When we do, you should be the first ones to see it.
3. We need a better space for sharing MST3K, and watching it together.
Without a network, we'll need a home for new MST3K, and...
We want it to be easy to enjoy MST3K live with other people, so...
We need our own online theater for live screenings and events! 
I'm glad you asked, friend... because that's what this new Kickstarter is all about.
Thanks to all of you, Mystery Science Theater 3000 has come a long way since our first Kickstarter.  Now, if you decide to get involved again, here's what we can do next:
1. MAKE MORE MST3K episodes with a new, sustainable model, that lets you decide how long we should keep going, and lets us bring new episodes directly to you, without depending on a network to distribute or keep renewing us for new seasons.
2. BUILD THE GIZMOPLEX, our own virtual online theater, where we can host frequent live screenings, premieres, and community events – and you can host MST3K watch parties with friends whenever you want. More on that in a minute. 
Man... you're way ahead of me. 
If you were part of our first Kickstarter, this next part might sound familiar:
 If our new Kickstarter can raise at least $2,000,000, we'll be able to make three more new episodes of Mystery Science Theater 3000...but we'll also have enough to build the Gizmoplex. 
And then – just like last time – the more we raise, the more we can do! Here's what we'll be able to do at each of our goals, all the way up to our final goal of $5.5 million: 
UPDATE (5/8): We hit $6.4M, which means JOEL ROBINSON will return to HOST 2 NEW EPISODES and we'll add a 13TH NEW EPISODE!
Also, you know, we don't want to get ahead of ourselves, but if things go well, we've got a lot of other ideas we'd like to add into the mix. You can find out more about that below, and also in this Backer Update.
Now listen, I hope you're already convinced that the best reason to join our new Kickstarter is because we'll able to #MakeMoreMST3K and #BuildTheGizmoplex.
But since this is Kickstarter, let's talk about REWARDS.
I'm really proud of how most of the rewards from our first Kickstarter campaign turned out, and ever since then, a lot of you told me how much you loved them too. So, this time around, I want to do our best to "raise the bar." You'll have to decide for yourself if we pull it off, but I'll tell you that we've got a few rewards this time that I'm really excited about – especially the Gizmoplex DIY Concession Pack, our new Challenge Coins, and a pretty amazing design for an MST3K Musical Snow Globe!

REWARD TIMING
While a handful of rewards – like the "MST3K Season 13: Collector's Box Set" on DVD and Blu-Ray – might not be available until as late as June 2022, other rewards – like Weekly Production Updates – will start within just a few weeks of when our Kickstarter campaign ends. So, don't let the "June 2022" delivery date scare you. Kickstarter just asks us to list the latest date when we expect all rewards to be sent out.
Now, I know this is already a lot of information, especially if you already watched our video, and I think I've told you most of the really important stuff.
And, if you still want more information, there's a lot more detail below, so keep reading if you want to know more about...
How the Gizmoplex will work!
How the Gizmoplex can make MST3K better! 
How we set our funding goals!
How we'll spend whatever we raise!
Also, one of the things I like best about Kickstarter is that it's not just a "monologue," but a really great way to have a conversation with all of you who care about the show. So, if there are other things you want to know about, I hope you'll take a look at our FAQ... and if the answer isn't there, I hope you'll ask!
We'll also do our best to read and respond to all of your comments. But just so you know, I'm pretty sure that our first Kickstarter also got more comments than any project that came before it! So, if that happens again, please be patient if it takes us a little while to get to everything. We've got a whole month, and a lot more to tell you!
There's one more thing I need to say before you go, and it's pretty important:
Over the last year, as I was trying to imagine where Mystery Science Theater can go next, I also spent a lot of time thinking about how we got here.
(It's kind of crazy to realize that it's been almost six years since our first Kickstarter, and almost thirty-three years since we first aired on KTMA on Thanksgiving in 1988.)
Anyway, when I look back on everything that's happened, it's really clear that our first Kickstarter was one of the defining moments in Mystery Science history. For our first campaign, we asked you to help us make new episodes, and to prove to "the networks" that there was still an audience for MST3K... and you did!
But together, we've done a lot more than that. Thanks to you, Mystery Science Theater has been able to produce 2 new seasons, 20 new episodes, 6 comic books, 3 live national tours, and 1 record-breaking Kickstarter.
Today, I hope you'll join us again to write MST3K's next chapter: to prove that we can #MakeMoreMST3K without depending on a network to keep us alive, and to #BuildTheGizmoplex, a unique online theater where MST3K can continue to grow.
But – and this is the important part – I also want to be cautious. We're all just crawling out from COVID, and it's been a difficult year. I know that things are more difficult for a lot of people than they were during our first Kickstarter. If you decide to pledge, please: only give what feels comfortable, even if it's just a few bucks. And if you can't afford anything, that's okay too! We'll find other ways for you to stay involved, and to make sure you can still get access to all of our new episodes and Gizmoplex events.
That's all: more than anything, please just take care of yourself... and if you can't help out right now, don't think twice about it. We'll still be here when you're ready.
I guess that's everything, so... we've got 30 days. Let's see how this thing goes.
Cheers & Thanks,
Joel


Hey, you're still here. So, I guess you want more details, huh?
Oh yeah, that's right. Thanks for reminding me.
I think the Gizmoplex might be the biggest "new idea" we're working with this time around, so there are a lot of details and possibilities I'm excited to share with you as we go. Here's what you should know right away.
Having a Gizmoplex All-Access Pass has three important benefits:
1. Live Premieres & Events: The Gizmoplex will host at least TWO LIVE EVENTS EVERY MONTH for our first year, where you can join me, our cast and writers, and some special surprise guests. Each event will be like a night at the theater, and will have a lot of fun surprises. Some of our ideas include theme nights hosted by our cast and special guests, live commentaries, and maybe even live riffing! Also, we won't just screen episodes: it'll be a real show, and could include new sketches, trailers (done "MST3K style"), live Q&A panel discussions, interviews, contests... and the return of the MST3K "viewer mail" segment! (And yes, if you can't make one, you'll be able to see it after.)
2. The MST3K Watch Club: To make it easier to watch MST3K with your friends, the Gizmoplex will also be the official home of the MST3K Watch Club! Each month, you'll get on-demand access to a new selection of episodes, and the ability to host your own live screenings for up to 10 people! Anyone with a Gizmoplex Pass can join for free, and if you want to invite someone who doesn't, they can get a "Day Pass" for just $0.99!
3. Gizmoplex Apps: Since we reached our second goal ($3.3M) we'll be able to develop apps that bring the Gizmoplex to mobile devices and TVs! Right now, the plan is to include apps for six of the most popular platforms: iOS, Android, AppleTV, AndroidTV, FireTV and Roku. And no promises, but we're also looking into apps for XBOX, PlayStation and Samsung TVs. Like Crow says: we're gonna conquer cyberspace, man! (Read more about the apps here.)
So, if you think about it, we think it's a pretty different model than we could pull off anywhere else. I really want the Gizmoplex to feel like something new: less like another Netflix with nothing but MST, and more like a charming, off the radar, suburban cineplex that plays movies for 99 cents, long after their first run.
If we get this right, the Gizmoplex Pass won't just give you a monthly subscription to a catalog of MST3K episodes, or a place to watch the episodes you own on-demand: it'll be more like a "Season Pass" that gives you tickets to every show at your favorite theater: front row, opening night, every time. Take that, Moviepass!
You can read a LOT more about our plans for the Gizmoplex in this Backer Update.
Also, even though this won't make a lot of sense until I give you more details, there's one more thing I want you to understand:
The Gizmoplex won't just be our new online theater and event space. It's also going to be an important new location that The Mads are creating on the show, and inside the world of Mystery Science Theater, as their next step toward world domination: the first cineplex on the moon!
Anyway, I think it'll all make sense when you see it... but until then, remember, “It’s just a show, I should really just relax.”
So, there you have it: in a nutshell, this is what we want to do. After 33 years, it's time for Mystery Science "Theater" to have an actual (virtual) theater that MSTies can call their own. It's time... to #BuildTheGizmoplex.
Any other questions?
Oh, wait. I think I know what you're going to ask. 
Just like last time, I'm sure some of you are wondering, so go ahead and ask. 
I knew that's what you were gonna ask! And since we're asking you to pledge some of your hard-earned money – especially after a difficult year – I want to be really open and transparent about this. So, let's break this down a little bit.
1. Without a network supporting us, we need to fund everything ourselves. During our first Kickstarter, we estimated that, once production was up and running, we'd be able to produce new episodes for about $250K each. In the end, though, the budget for each new episode ended up being closer to $350K. For the last two seasons, we were able to cover the difference through our deal with Netflix... but this time, we're on our own. We've got a lot of ways we can keep the budget lower, but, you know... it's still going to cost something. And when you think about it, $350K for 90 minutes of television is still one of the best deals in show business.
2. We still can't spend everything we raise on Kickstarter to make the show.
Campaign Fees: Between Kickstarter and the credit card processor, we pay about 8% of your pledge in fees. There's also a fee for CrowdOx, the platform we'll use to manage all of your surveys and rewards after the campaign ends.
Making Rewards: We reserve about 20% of your pledge in order to design, produce, print, sort and pack all of your rewards. And that's not even including shipping, which we're not collecting until after our Kickstarter campaign ends!
Dedicated Support: During our first Kickstarter, we underestimated the amount of work involved in providing customer support and creating detailed backer updates, so we had to depend on volunteers to do a lot of it. This time, we want to make sure we're prepared, so we budgeted about 4% of each pledge for that.
Building & Running the Gizmoplex: We really want the Gizmoplex to be great, but getting it started will take some work – and keeping it running also means we'll have some monthly fees to cover. We also need some budget to support all of the special live events we're planning to host. So, we're using about 3% of your pledge for that.
When you put it all together, we have to spend about 35% of what we raise just to cover Kickstarter expenses, and to keep all the promises we're making to you.

3. The more episodes we make, the less each one costs! Like we explained during our first Kickstarter, the basic idea is pretty simple: for some parts of production, we have to spend the same amount up front, no matter how many episodes we're making.
For example, let's say that our writers realize the show needs a custom-built oversized rubber chicken. No matter how many episodes we have, it's going to cost $1000 to make. So, if we only use it in three episodes, we have to spend $333 per episode on a rubber chicken. But, if we use the chicken in twelve episodes, that $1000 goes a lot farther, and our rubber chicken kaiju only costs us $83 for each episode. Make sense?
     Based on those numbers, you can see that the cost for each episode gets lower as the number of episodes goes up:
So yeah, just like our first Kickstarter, I know that a fair number of you won't care about these types of details... but since some of you will, we want to be as clear as possible.
1. KEEP CIRCULATING THE URL. Back in the day, MST3K wasn’t seen nationwide and we encouraged people to record the shows on VHS and send them to their friends and loved ones. It was our version of “I Want My MTV.” Every episode of MST3K ended with a message that encouraged MSTies to “Keep Circulating the Tapes,” and you guys did. Then, in our last Kickstarter, we updated that to "Keep Circulating the URL," and you did that too. Now, we've got a new URL, so we're asking you again:
2. FOLLOW @MST3K ON SOCIAL MEDIA. Be sure you're following our account on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube. Those are one of our best ways to keep everyone up-to-date on what's going on, so encourage your fellow MSTies to follow them too! We really appreciate it, and we couldn’t do it without you. You’re like our virtual street team!
3. CIRCULATE THE MESSAGE FROM EACH UPDATE. From now until our Kickstarter ends on May 7, most of the backer updates that we send will include a suggested message or image. Copy, paste, and post them on your own social accounts to help spread the word. It's as simple as that! 
4. CHECK IN WITH YOUR FELLOW MSTIES.  We don't want you to pressure anyone, but we do hope you'll check in to make sure they know about this Kickstarter.  And when you do, be sure to remind them that pledging even a $1 token pledge will still help us unlock more Challenge Goals, Bonus Rewards, and get them weekly updates all the way through the production of Season 13!
5. JOIN OUR "VIRTUAL STREET TEAM." If you've got a little extra time, and want to make sure we reach our final goal, there are more specific ways to volunteer and help. If you want to get specific "assignments" to help us #MakeMoreMST3K, you can sign up to be part of our elite volunteer team.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we learned last time, there are always risks with Kickstarter... and the world is a little crazier right now than usual. Here are a few that we've considered:

• After a difficult economic year, this might not be a good time for some people to offer financial support to a robot puppet show dedicated to cheesy movies.

• COVID is a huge unknown, and could still impact all sorts of things, from our production schedule and approach, to our timeframe for producing and delivering your rewards.

• Another ship could block the Suez Canal, trapping your challenge coins and snow globes for weeks, months, or years. But also, what are the odds it'll happen twice in one year?

• Building the Gizmoplex is a big undertaking, and we'll be depending on a few tech partners to make specific parts of the experience possible. So, if one of our partners ran into problems, there's always a risk of that affecting the Gizmoplex.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print our new story, THE BOOK OF DEMONS (41 page story in a 48 page perfect bound book) and produce our NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN!
Here's our cover:

Who will love Boston Metaphysical Society?
Fans of Penny Dreadful, Girl Genius, Ruse, steampunk and gaslamp fantasy stories.
People who like to read paranormal, historical fiction, and/or alternate history.
If you like character-driven comics with a mix of paranormal and science fiction, then these are the comics for you!
THE STORY
When Erin, Caitlin’s mother, discovers her daughter can control a demon, she is outraged. In her mind, only a Great House has the right to such power, but who will listen to a poor Irish woman? House Lowell will. For Alice Lowell has inherited an old Puritan journal which describes how to find and enslave a demon, but she needs a psychic to do it. Kidnapping Caitlin is the first step in a plan to rid her husband’s House of debt. But with a demon to do their bidding, her ambitions will be limitless.
The Book of Demons can be read as a standalone, but it is a continuation of Ghosts and Demons.
First Three Pages:
NEW TO BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY?
If you are new to the series, the original six issue mini-series is about an ex-Pinkerton detective, a spirit photographer, and a genius scientist who battle supernatural forces in late 1800’s Boston. They  live in an alternate steampunk history where ghosts and demons are a normal part of life. Families known as the Great Houses control the economy of the Great States of America while the middle class and lower classes sole purpose are to serve the Great Houses.
The original trade paperback is available in several reward tiers.
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the  original mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a  ten page  short story called, Hunter-Killer,  and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the American Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship.  I introduce three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain;  Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
The complete sequential art version of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.
WHAT ELSE IS THERE?
Our three previous standalone sequels will be available as well. And they are:
THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN 
STORY: Granville and Tesla are in a race for time to save Boston from a mysterious disease that turns human beings into machines.

THE SPIRIT OF REBELLION 
 STORY: Caitlin flees to Philadelphia only to discover a ghost, a rebellion, and perhaps, her destiny.

GHOSTS AND DEMONS 
 STORY:  A disturbing dream leads Caitlin and the team to face off with a new enemy.
THE BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY COLORING BOOK:
Twenty (20) gorgeous illustrations for you to relax  and color away to your heart's content. Includes illustrations of  Samuel, Granville, Caitlin, Tesla, Houdini, and more! It will be an 8  1/2 x 11 book and is suitable for all ages. Art by Alejandro Lee
OTHER REWARDS
In addition to THE BOOK OF DEMONS, we are offering the trade paperback, the anthology Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude, the first novel set in this universe, Boston Metaphysical Society: A Storm of Secrets, plus a NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique bronze color. (Designed by Alejandro Lee.)
Lapel Pin Set
A set of SEVEN Boston Metaphysical pins (Plague Doctor, Bowler Hat, Teapot, Dirigible, Tesla, 1800's Box Camera, and Triquetra) in a lovely gift box with our logo are available as well. (As long as supplies last.)
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS
The award winning novel, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS, is a prequel to the original graphic novel though it can be read as a standalone. It takes place five years prior to the original series.
It was awarded a Silver Medal as well as The Write Companion Award for Best Overall TOP PICK - Adult, Children's and Young Adult categories in the 2019 Feathered Quill Book Awards.
Story: As the Great Houses of Boston jockey for power, an ex-Pinkerton detective, his psychic wife, and his father-in-law must contend with treachery, subterfuge, and a new supernatural threat, in this political and supernatural thriller set in an alternate-history Boston of 1890.
The award winning cover is by Luisa Preissler. Title Graphics by Anke Koopman.

And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers  include it as either a pdf or print version.
The Underground - A Boston Metaphysical Society Short Story (Available as an Add-on for all tiers and is already included in the Granville Woods and All Things BMS tiers.) 
In The Underground,  Andrew O'Sullivan takes his young daughter, Caitlin, on a case that might reveal a past and a potential future neither of them expected. This is a prose story and is available in Epub or mobi formats. (Previously published in Last Stop on the #13.)
NEW REWARD TIER!
SPECIAL COMMISSION REWARD TIER (KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE)
Ever wanted to time travel? This will be the closest you’ll ever come when our fabulous artist Gwynn Tavares draws you into the illustration with the Granville and Alma (See image) in period costume. This will be an 11 x 17 inch poster on 80 lb. Classic Stripple. She’s only doing five, so jump on this now before they are gone.
 THE MONEY: 
SHIPPING:
Shipping last year was a challenge.  My stalwart shipping envelopes met their match at USPS, so this year I will be using the ULINE S-165 cardboard mailers (or their equivalent) along with boards and extra packing material for anything outside of California (and probably in California as well.) Those who order the Nothing But Books and All Things BMS will get the usual sturdy cardboard box as those have worked well in the past.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING: We were able to obtain discounted international postage for over 55 countries this year. I have passed on those savings to you depending on your shipping address. To extend these savings even further, for those who pledge to the Nothing But Books or the All Things BMS, and it is shipped to one of those 55 countries, we will be splitting up the rewards into two boxes in order for you to receive the discount. 
THE TEAM FOR THE SEQUELS:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A   TV, feature film, comic book writer, and novelist, Madeleine holds an   MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as  the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories, novellas, and a novel based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Other comic projects include the short story, The Scout which is part of The 4th Monkey anthology, The Sanctuary (The Edgar Allan Poe Chronicles anthology), The Marriage Counselor (The Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthology), The Glob (Night Wolf Vol. 1), Infinity Tree (Menagerie: Declassified) and the upcoming The Airship Pirate (The Rum Row anthology), and The Birth (Stan Yak Vampire Anthology).
Gwynn Tavares – Artist/Colorist: Gwynn started out her art career as a sculptor. After a few years working on   movie special effects, she decided to go into sequential art and was  the  artist for Amelia Sky. Majoring as in illustrator, Gwynn is also an  accomplished comedian and currently lives in France.
Troy Peteri – Letterer: Troy is a Los   Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON   MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the   last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series  for  Radical Comics.
THE TEAM FOR BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY TRADE PAPERBACK:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing, Writer/Creator. (See credits above.)
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from   the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever   since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a   comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky  Cloonan,  and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for  BOOM!  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series. Emily  is  currently doing storyboards for Nickelodeon.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta,   she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent   projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone   else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre   related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist:  Based in  Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist.  He worked  as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to  his work on  he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work  includes Bob  Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn   Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for   his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also   writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist  Christopher  Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT  bestselling  anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6) (See credits above.)

The graphic novel was nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 Geekie Awards.
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston   Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art   by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling,   Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is   both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly   illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with   Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk   world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in   believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them."  -  Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY.  Not only does it bring my  love of science fiction and history  together, (which by the way, equals  steampunk), the steampunk time  period allows me to address the themes  of classism, sexism, and racism  in America in a thoughtful and engaging  way. For at its very core,  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American  story. And you can't tell an  American story without including women and  people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters  who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different  points  of view, are able to work together for the common good.

campaign.story:
Our first stretch goal rewards everyone!
STRETCH GOAL £3500
Physical Backers
-HOLOGRAPHIC TRADING CARD
If we hit £3500 every backer of a physical copy will receive a Holographic Trading Card of our lead Hell’na.
Yes sir, bringing back the 90’s trading card craze with beautiful Holographic Foil.
Complete with Character History and Statistics
+
ALL BACKERS
-DIGITAL SCREENSAVER/WALLPAPERS
At £3500 all backers will receive this great digital wallpaper pack featuring 5 Hi-res images formated for computer monitors and phone screensavers.
So how do we get there?
Well. I need all you amazing people to like and share the campaign and talk up how amazing those personal video messages were that you received 🤓
So get those thumbs moving people!
Set in a future New Zealand /Aotearoa, the world has been ripped apart when the moon was destroyed by the terrorist attack.
Technology is dead.
Those left behind have been changed by ancient energies being pulled from the earth.
The powers of Gods.
Now the last Gods have returned.
And they are not happy with what they have found. 


 An Axeland woman who must assemble a ragtag group of mercenaries and escort a vessel of the Māori god Tāne through a new world in search of the Demigod Māui.
It is a journey of people discovering their place in a vibrant new world, rich in culture, danger, and mystery


THIS LAND #1:Whakaoho / Awakenings includes 28 pages of Art and Story
4 Pages of Backmatter exploring the world
Issue 1 of 5 printed on 150 GSM silk Paper U.S. Standard Comicbookx Size
Gloss 250 GSM Cover
Digital Deluxe PDF included with every book!
Also included is a 29 Page DIgital Preview for issues 2-5!
Inked Artwork for all 5 Issues are COMPLETE!


If you like any of these things then yes, absolutely you're going to love it:
Stories that feature: Gods and Monsters, Super Powers, Ancient Languages, Myths and Legends. Bounty Hunters, Mercenaries, A War to end all Wars. Post-apocalyptic future and rebuilding a world from the ashes of an old one.
TV & films like Lord of the Rings, Moana, American Gods, The Hobbit, The Neverending Story. The Princess Bride. Kipo and The Age Of The Wonderbeasts.
Videogames like: The Legend of Zelda. World of Warcraft, Skyrim, Witcher, God of War
My main goals for this project have been to Introduce the world to powerful stories and the legends of Aotearoa. Leave a resource to help normalise Te Reo (The Maori Language) globally and within NZ homes and to make it part of the everyday language for young Kiwi kids to absorb. Raise enough money for lettering for issue 2





“What do mean you don’t know your history?” I had just completed the UK citizenship test and realised not a single one of my Uk friends could have passed this. How was that possible?
How did the NZ school system teach me better about British history than theirs had!
Hang on a minute.
I didn’t know my NZ history either.
Why was that?
My recollection of Māori legends was limited to picture books in primary school.
I had virtually no grasp of Te Reo (the Maori language) aside from kia ora /Hello and kapai/Thankyou so why was that?
Looking at Aotearoa/NZ from afar I see so many potential opportunities where my younger self could have been exposed and educated in the history of my country rather than it been given lip service and more than often treated with conscious/unconscious racism.
I'm interested in telling stories that show Māori myths and legends' as important to the identity of all New Zealanders whether we're Māori, Pākeha, or Tauiwi.
So I created a new world where our people are using the lessons and legends of the past to guide them (literally in some cases) to a better tomorrow.
I grew up with Tintin and Asterix books and somehow still remember French and Latin words from those books and believe that comics are the perfect medium to subtly introduce Te Reo Māori for another generation.
Not only for the children of New Zealand but potentially for a global audience as well.
That Book is THIS LAND
2020 was difficult for everyone. I have worked hard my collaborators to find solutions to get the book to completion and we now have 5 issues completely inked and ready for colouring and lettering.
The good news is Issue 1 is complete!
Issue 2 is coloured!
Issue 3/4/5 are inked!
In 2019 we had 2 successful print runs of Issue 1 in the UK and sold almost 1000 copies.
We have refined the book and added 4 additional pages of story to give YOU the reader the best bang for your back and elevate the story to the next level!
Kickstarter Fees
Shipping and Packaging
New Print Run
Lettering for Issue 2 plus a few lettering changes for issue 1 (new pages)
Colouring for Issue 3




NOTE: NOT FINAL LETTERING

CHECK OUT THE ORIGINAL ART AVAILABLE BY CLICKING HERE







Some things to remember - 
1) Pledge early and help spread the word, as this helps our Kickstarter stay at the top of the projects list longer and will also helps our endeavour to reach our goal.

2) The more we make the more you get. If we are able to reach our goal and beyond our stretch goals then we will load you guys up with some extras.

3) You are not charged until the end of the Kickstarter so pledging early doesn't mean you will be charged straight away.

4) We are always here to answer any questions. The team will always be on hand to answer any questions which include add on's, specials and anything else about the project or story.


So what are you waiting for?
Back us today and be part of History!
We will be successful!
The earlier you back the earlier you can help us unlock some extra stretch goals and goodies for everyone!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
None! 
Issue 1 is complete!
issue 2 is coloured
Issue 3,4& 5 are inked!

For a sneak peek of the remaining 5 issues art go to http://www.arohacomics.com and sign up to our newsletter for access to our Colouring book/preview of the entire series!! (Also included for each pledge)

As a Kickstarter backer myself, I know how much it means to ask you to support a new project with your hard earned money.

 I've made every effort to minimize any risk to you as a potential backer before launching this campaign. Part of this endeavor was making sure the first issue was 100% complete so that when (with your help) the campaign is successful, files can be uploaded to the printer immediately and digital files will ship to backers upon receiving the completed surveys. 
 
 I have already been in contact with multiple printers and have chosen to go with Rich at Comic Printing UK , who have already done a fantastic job on the First print run and is the go to man for Independent comics in the UK

In New Zealand we are working with Jason and his team at Beyond the Ledge Press in Christchurch who
are ready to hit the presses should we need upon the campaign's completion. 

There are already 28 copies of the First printing in New Zealand Randy to go out.
The only thing holding those back is the distributor (Mum!) will be heading back from visiting Australia and will be in quarantine hotel for 14 days!
 
 This campaign will be my first Kickstarter, so I will not claim to be an expert, but I have made every effort to educate and surround myself with knowledgeable individuals who have run successful Kickstarter campaigns in the past. Including attending Tyler James & Jeremy Melloul's ComixLaunch Course (http://pro.comixlaunch.com) for creating a successful Kickstarter campaign. 
 
 This project is close to my heart, and my goal is to make sure that every backer leaves this experience satisfied and eagerly looking forward to the next instalment of THIS LAND. 
 
 If you have any questions or concerns that I may not have covered, please feel free to message me. I want to make your involvement in my project as rewarding as possible.
 
 I thank you for your time and support!
 
 Mark Abnett
