campaign.story:
Mia Raven. The thief who became a detective who became a thief, 
only this time she steals from crooks.
 Mia Raven: swarthy, strong-willed woman who cares less about the law than she does recovering stolen items. Mia Raven: gun-toting feminist icon with a troubled past, bad attitude and tattered psyche. Mia Raven: CEO and founder of Recovery Incorporated, a company that will help you get your (valuable) stolen item back when the police can't. Or won't. For a hefty price, of course.
Recovery Incorporated is a 24 page, over-sized 9x12 inch European formatted comic, part 1 in a 4 issue mini-series.
 My name is Michael Penick and I've been a professional artist and writer for over twenty years now, a freelancer in the advertising, film, illustration, comic book, motion graphics, and interface design industries. A jack of all trades, really, but my first love has always been visual storytelling, and at 51, I'm tired of letting all the stories I've been developing and writing languish alone in my imagination and on my computer. 
Thanks to all the wonderful and generous support I've received so far, its time to interrupt this regularly scheduled kickstarter page and introduce some stretch goals! If so many stretch goals seem generous, then you're just going to have to live with it! 😉 I'm so grateful for how my campaign has gone so far that I want to help you get as much extra stuff as I can!  
 Recovery Incorporated - Another Day At The Office marks the beginning of my journey to bring those stories to you. It's the first of a four issue mini-series. I've been working on issue 02 since the beginning of the year. If you'd like to keep up with my progress, you can sign up for my newsletter here.
The first issue of Recovery Incorporated is finished. In fact, it's been finished since 2012! I was hired, at the time, to create a story for a British magazine. I brought my long time friend and writing partner Dean Deckard along with me to help in the creation process. The story would unfold in eight page increments each month. 
 Unfortunately, the financier of the magazine, who lived in Eastern Europe, had trouble getting funds to the UK, which meant the editor there couldn't get funds to me! In light of that, I felt i had no choice but to stop my comic from running in the magazine. It was only a few months later that the entire magazine folded. It was a sad, but not uncommon affair, in the comics world.
I "shelved" the story at the time because, well, I really needed to find work and make up for the months I had just spent working for no pay, but I also felt it wasn't really something American comic book readers would be into. In the time between then and now, however, the independent comic book market in the US has truly flourished, as has the Kickstarter platform. So here I am.
 Because I've been around. Ive seen what the publishing world looks like and what the contracts look like. I think, more and more, that Kickstarter is the future of comics and, potentially, publishing. I think this is the place to be. Even with an industry publisher I'd have to do my own marketing if i really wanted my book to be successful, so why not just do the rest of the work while I'm at it? And if I'm really, brutally honest with you, my ADD makes it easier for me to work for myself than under the deadlines imposed by the comic book industry most of the time. I'm a self-motivated guy - I don't require artificial stimulation to motivate me. Kickstarter provides me with the one link that was missing in my ability to complete my own production chain.
To answer that, let me ask yet another question: what makes Mia Raven different from all the other Femme Fatales you've seen in recent years? A lot of things. 
 First off, she's a thief, not a spy. 
 Second, she's into using her brains far more than she is using guns or sex. 
 Third, unlike other people in the modern world of storytelling (think storytellers whose names rhyme with Bay Bay Haybrams), I like to plan ahead - I know what happens to Mia through each of the 4 planned story arcs. I know her character arc from before issue 01 begins through where we leave her on the final page of her saga. 
     You know what allows me to do? It allows me to put clues in issue 01 for which you won't see a payoff for another 10 issues. Those are the kinds of stories I love reading, so those are the kinds of stories I endeavor to write. 
 I also like to do my research. Everything you'll find in these stories - every piece of tech, every security system or vehicle or any other such thing - either exists or is technically plausible. I love science, so I love to get it in wherever I can. I also hate when stories do ridiculous stuff I know is impossible - I don't write 80s Bond films, okay? 😉 
     To up the ante even further, I served in the army, in the infantry, for a little over 4 years. I fast-roped out of Black Hawks, skydived out of all manner of military aircraft (even at night), trudged through the jungle on moonless nights wearing NVGs with an IR laser attached to my rifle - I got to do a lot of high speed stuff in my 4 years, stuff that not only allow me to bring a lot of knowledge and accuracy to my stories, but authenticity to my characters and the things I put them through.
 I've just shown you the first eight pages of my comic. Why? Because this is like the opening scene in Raiders of the Lost Ark - it introduces you to the character and the kind of thing she does, but the actual plot of this story doesn't begin until the next page.
     One thing you might notice about Recovery Incorporated is that it's not drawn to typical American comic book proportions. It was commissioned for european standards, which I love, so that's the way I plan to print it. That means Recovery Incorporated will be printed at 9x12 inches, making my comic as wide as typical American comics are tall. I want the work to be presented the size it was intended to be shown. Not only will you be getting a larger comic than normal, but you're getting more story per page than typical American comics. There's plenty of story left in 16 pages, and I plan on having issue 2 ready to go once you get issue 01 in your hands. 
     A word of caution, however...
     While there's no nudity in Recovery Incorporated, there's adult language and reference to adult situations. This isn't for kids. It would be irresponsible for me to not let you know that up front.
     So what are early readers saying about the first issue of Recovery Incorporated?
 Andy Jenkins - "It's a polished book with some really fluid dynamic art and well thought out panel and page structure... it's exciting, builds up the characters well and has enough little twists and turns to keep you reading and looking forward to the next issue."
Randy Stone - "I knew going in that with Michael Penick's art, this would be a great looking book, but I was equally impressed with the story he did with co-writer Dean Deckard. The ideas were fun and the pace was exciting. This is a blockbuster on the page!"
Mark Freeman - "Recovery Incorporated is everything I love about independent comic books. The story itself is fresh and different. The characters are written as real people with real-world issues. The artwork is crisp, clean and easy to follow, while the writing has layers of complexity. This makes for a fun and engaging read. I can’t wait to see what happens next."
Danny Gorny - "The action is compelling. It's a pleasure to read a globetrotting heist story with such an elegant setup. The art and colouring are great - featuring excellent use of dramatic shots during the exposition scenes, and the backgrounds and setting are exciting. The colouring choices, especially during the flashbacks, is inspired."
Gabriel Hernandez - "Recovery Incorporated starts strong and gets stronger with each page. It's a refreshing update to  the 'Gentleman Thief' legend for the 21st Century."
I'm not asking for a lot. I'm keeping it simple because I want this to succeed. If i can pass my funding goal, I'll shoot for some simple stretch goals like a nicer cover stock and a couple of other things I'll introduce later in the campaign. What I am asking for is covered in the graphic here:
As you can see, there's nothing fancy here. No thrills, no frills - nothing outside what it costs to run this campaign, print the books, and get them to you.
Here's what you can expect from me once the campaign has ended. You can see the plan right here; I'll keep backers up to date as each step here comes to pass so you'll know everything is going as scheduled. If there are any hiccups, I'll let got know immediately and tell you how that will affect the schedule.
2/11 - Campaign ends 
2/26 - Receive funds from Kickstarter 
3/1 - Place ptint order
3/15 - Receive print order at my house 
3/29 - All orders packed and shipped
5/23 - Domestic orders received by mail
Media mail can take 8 weeks to arrive - that's why the long shipping window. Many packages may arrive quicker than that, but I'd rather have you're package arrive earlier than I told you than later. During this time I will be busting my hump to get issue 02 pencilled, inked, colored, and ready to go so that I can launch the campaign for issue 02 right on the heels of you getting issue 01 in your hands. If you want to follow my progress along the way, my newsletter is the best place to do it! If you missed it before, you can sign up for it here.
I'm offering three covers for my first issue of Recovery Incorporated. The main cover, drawn by me, will be used everywhere. The two alternate covers will only be available here on Kickstarter, possibly only during this one campaign. I will never offer them anywhere else - that's a promise. So let me show you the covers:
     As I mentioned before, my longtime friend and co-writer Dean Deckard helped me create Mia Raven and the story that covers this first mini-series. We’ve been the closest of friends for 30 years now. We challenge each other over everthing, make each other think, and work well as writing partners because neither of us care about ego. All we care about is story.
     My only other collaborator on this issue was the Eisner award winning colorist John Rauch. I can't begin to tell you what a joy it is to get pages back from John. I've worked with him on several projects and never once have I had to fret over a single thing. Its like he reads my mind, but more clearly than I can. My biggest hope for this campaign, in fact, is that I can raise enough funds to hire him to color issue 02 for me as I get the pages ready - that will allow me to get issue 02 to you in the shortest time frame possible. That's one of those stretch goals I mentioned a second ago.
     Now let's take a look at the pledge levels I'm offering up. I've tried to keep them as simple and easy to understand as I could. 
 Update: Funding goal bonus reward - all backers at every level will now receive free access to an audio commentary of me talking my way through issue 01 as both a writer and an artist 
Allow me to take a moment and explain the "Prior Work Bundle" limitation. I don't have 10 bundles in reach of the three tiers I'm offering it in, I have ten total. If a person pledges for one in one tier, it reduces their availability in all three tiers together. To reiterate: I only have 10 Prior Work Bundles in total. 
On top of these support tiers, you can add any of the following items to your pledges (in case you're wanting to build your order in a way I haven't thought of in the tiers, want more of one thing, or even two forms of original art):
For the sketch cards, pin-ups, original pages of art, and covers, I will contact each person in the order that they pledged to choose which piece of art they want from the available choices. 
Thank you so much for your time, and, if I get your support, for helping me get this ball rolling. You are an essential element of my future and I value you more than I can say. Every day when i get up and work, I will endeavor to make sure i have given you more than your money's worth.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As far as risks and challenges go, the book is ready to go to the printer, which I've already chosen, and is here in the US, so turn around time will be quick. I'll pay for insurance on the shipping so if anything were to happen, I'll be covered to get another print run done. That just leaves getting your packages to you. I've taken lessons from the most experienced kickstarters and have gotten the best materials to make sure your books reach you as safely and perfectly as possible, and while this is only my first kickstarter, I've been a professional artist and writer delivering jobs on time for over 20 years now - you don't stay in business if you don't communicate well, get your work done, and delivered on time. I'll keep you posted on the post production process and get your goods to you in as timely a manner as humanly possible. That's a promise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Printer update
updates.update_content: My book is officially in the print queue and ready to run. That's the good news. The not so good news is that I was informed there'd be no way to get the order in my hands before the 20th or 21st of June, so the print orders are going to be running right up against the very end of June getting to you - some of them might be going into July (I can only package the physically orders so fast, even with help). I will get the digital rewards to you before that, however. I'm working on getting the big sketchbook together now. It's going to cover a little bit of everything - stuff from my days in advertising, some film work, illustration work, and comics, of course.

updates.update_userinfo: Off to the printer... Finally!
updates.update_content:
I've been silent for a while. I've just been trying to get everything done. I was dumb enough - read that as smart enough - to hire an editor. I thought it would basically be for spelling and grammar checks, but I was wrong. We went through each page very meticulously, moved balloons around, made small changes to art here and there, and even shuffled a few pages around.
     The up side is that you're going to get a book that is much better than it was before. I'm really excited about this fact. The down side is that it's taken me so long to get it all done and ready to go to the printer. The reason for this is that this all happened after the book was, well, finished and the kickstarter had run. All this editing usually takes place on the end, and usually before I create the finished art. That's what will happen from here on out, thankfully, but for this first issue it seems I'm having to do everything the hard way. It's been a real steep learning curve for me - one I will be happy to put behind me.

updates.update_userinfo: The prologue art is done!
updates.update_content:
I thought I might never get done, but it's finality happened! The pages are in the hands of my colorist, so while they're being colored I'll be inking and coloring the 7k bonus print and getting the rest of issue 1 ready for the printer so that when I get the colors back (in a week, we've agreed), off the book goes! 
     Getting the rest of the book ready includes getting everyone's names put into alphabetical order and added to the back (which I'm pretty sure is going to include adding more pages - I feel certain I can't get 550 names on 1 page, even at 9x12 inches). 😄 It also includes getting my editor to proofread the book and me making spelling and grammatical corrections based on that proofread. Then there's getting the front and back inner covers done. Not too terrible, but a very busy week while the colors are happening.

updates.update_userinfo: Art link and update on schedule of events
updates.update_content:
So the first two pages of the prologue are inked. I will have the second two pages inked by the end of this coming weekend. While the pages are being colored I will be correcting the mistakes my editor points out regarding spelling and grammar. I'll also ink and color the 7k stretch goal bonus pin-up. Everything will then go to the printer on Monday, April 26th and should be back in my hands two weeks from that date. 
     As soon as the book goes to the printer I can finally turn my attention to all the sketch cards and 9x12 inch pin-ups that still need to be inked! I shouldn't have any problem getting those done in the two week window that the book is being printed and shipped to me. I will also get the digital rewards all put together during that time period, so that once the physical books arrive at my house, I'll be ready to send out all the digital rewards - everyone will . Oh, and

updates.update_userinfo: Couple of goofs with Backerkit! I'm learning the hard way there. 😕
updates.update_content:
Thanks to everyone for the prompt responses and feedback from the Backerkit surveys! I've gotten almost 2/3 of the responses already and it's only been 24 hours since the full slew of surveys went out! So here's the two goofs I made:
     1 - I completely forgot to ask what name everyone wanted to have in the back of the comic book!!! Aaarrrggh!!! What a derp move! The easiest way for me to deal with this is to send a second survey out through Kickstarter with just that one question, so that's what I'm going to do. I'm so sorry I forgot this and  that you're going to get a second survey from me. I feel like there's a giant stupid sign on my forehead. 😬

updates.update_userinfo: BackerKit surveys are on the way
updates.update_content:
Super short update here - just letting everyone know that the Backerkit surveys have been sent, so they should be arriving soon! Yay! That's one big step taken. Now to get this flippin' prologue finished so i can get the book to the printer!
Michael

updates.update_userinfo: Backerkit surveys are finally starting to roll out! And some art!
updates.update_content: So when you use BackerKit, once your surveys are ready, you start with what’s called a ”smoke test.” They send surveys out to 5 percent of your backers across all pledge levels. I was finally able to hit the button for that this morning, so a few of you will see the survey’s showing up today. Once the BackerKit team and I see that those go well, everyone else will get theirs. I have to hand it to the BackerKit team - they’re very thorough and responsive. They’re not a nameless bunch of bots who don’t really interact with you much; quite the opposite. They are very hands on and willing to get into your survey setup with you and get quite detailed. I’ve been nothing but impressed. I wasn’t expecting to need the services of such a company on my very first campaign, so it’s been a pleasure to need them and to find that they’re a great company so far to work with.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick update - ATTENTION - Those who backed at any original art level
updates.update_content: If you backed at any original art level, please be on the lookout for messages from me. I'm trying to get you to select the art you want prior to sending out the Backerkit surveys. I will try for a reasonable time before I have to move forward anyways. I'm trying to contact people in the order they pledged to choose sketch cards, pin-ups, and original pages of art. If you're paying attention and haven't heard from me, don't worry, I'll get to you - I'm just trying to get earlier people on the list to respond. Some people don't respond as well as others, I'm learning! 😄 😬 Maybe this will help? Only time will tell...

updates.update_userinfo: The reason they tell you to build extra time into every step of your planning process
updates.update_content: Let me tell you, Murphy's Law loves me. I mean it sits around and waits over my should at every turn in life. If I didn't know better I'd think Murphy were simply a code name for Michael. I'd laugh about it if it didn't make me start crying at the same time. Case in point: the simple task of re-lettering issue 01. The first half went easily enough, but now that I'm onto the half where I had the help of an amazingly talented colorist, who obviously made a simple mistake that in most cases no one would ever have known about, I'm now dealing with that tiny little sliver of not-most-cases.

updates.update_userinfo: Progress report!
updates.update_content: Hey, everyone! Hope you've all had a wonderful week. I have! I've been busy bouncing back and forth between all kinds of odds and ends, all of them fun and all of them oriented towards stuff directly related to my campaign. I've berm getting Backerkit stuff set up, working on my Kickstarter post mortem, which might sound a little gruesome, but it's just a report you do to tske stock of all the numbers to help you know how things went so you can analyze them and use them to help you grow in the future. Not only that, but got take mental stock as well. That side was very easy for me - things have gone so amazingly well that there's little to no downside to this entire experience. I'm have all of you to thank for that!

campaign.story:
***READ ONE OF THE STORIES IN THE GODSVERSE FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE.***
***DOMESTIC US SHIPPING INCLUDED, and all books come signed by author Russell Nohelty.***
Are you obsessed with mythology?
Are you gaga for monsters?
Do you love new takes on old classics?
Then you'll love the Godsverse Chronicles. 
I LOOOOOOVE mythology, which is what inspired me to spend years researching, building, creating, and launching the Godsverse, my mythological fantasy universe.
Now we're BACK on Kickstarter with a brand new campaign!
Seven books, two graphic novels, SEVENTEEN stories, filled with action, adventure, magic, monsters, gods from Judeo-Christian, Greek, Roman, Norse, and Egyptian mythology, along with dozens of others.
This campaign features THREE new novels, including And Conquest Followed Behind Them, And Chaos Followed Behind Them, and And Darkness Followed Behind Her.
 ***These books are 100% complete and ready to print once the campaign is over. You can also order the graphic novels from the Godsverse as well.*** 
The Godverse takes my two most popular graphic novels, Katrina Hates the Dead/Katrina Hates Dead Shit and Pixie Dust, novelizes them, and adds FIFTEEN additional stories set across 13,000 years to fill in the mythology about how we moved from polytheism to monotheism, why the gods abandoned us, and why the universe feels like a chaotic mess with no rhyme, reason, or order.
These books are exciting, action-adventure mythological fantasy novels steeped in mythology, then filled with humor, action, conflict, and fun.
These novels will come as paperback books, while the graphic novels and anthologies will come as hardcover books.
What is the Godsverse?
The Godsverse is a universe where all gods are real, but they are kind of useless dicks, just like the old gods from mythology.
I could get the ethos behind those gods. They aren't all-powerful, all-knowing, or all benevolent. They just kind of sucked, like the humans they ruled. Those gods made a lot of sense based on how the world has devolved recently.
In the Godsverse, when a new habitable world is formed, all the gods from all pantheons come to make sure that it's functional and sustainable. They help humanity, fragile and weak creatures, flourish in the harsh universe.
That's why there were so many god sightings in the past, and not many at all right now.
They abandoned us.
Once a world is sustainable, then the gods move on to the next world, leaving one god in charge as regent.
Some gods are good rulers. Some are not so great. Others downright suck.   
The Godsverse is funny fantasy, with mythological and action thriller tendencies. It is fast-paced, full of plot twists, and will keep you on the edge of your seat...when you aren't falling off of it laughing.
Reviews of the Godsverse Chronicles
Don't take it from me that it's awesome, though. After all, I am biased. Here are some reviews from fellow readers. 
Who am I?
My name is Russell Nohelty, USA Today bestselling author and publisher of Wannabe Press, a small press that creates weird books for weird people, creator of Katrina Hates Dead Shit, Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, and Pixie Dust, along with the editor of both the Monsters and Other Scary Shit, and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthologies.
I have raised over $200,000 on Kickstarter from 13 different projects, and have gotten exceedingly good at crafting amazing books that audiences love.
I have a simple motto when it comes to Kickstarter. I outlay all the money to get the book print-ready, and then I bring it to my audience and try to raise finishing funds for the book.

Two types of Godsverse Chronicles books
There are two different types of books in the Godsverse Chronicles. The first type are individual character books, which feature stories from the individual characters from the Godsverse. The second is team-up books, which feature multiple characters teaming up to take on a massive threat to the universe. 
Below, I'll talk about each type of book. 
The individual character books and their heroines
The Godsverse is all about strong-willed women who take their fate into their own hands and fight back against their destiny, even if it's against the gods themselves. While that trait binds them, they are each very different as well.
Each of these books features one of the main characters from the Godverse. 
This is the series order, and how they will appear on Amazon.
And Hell Followed Behind Her
And Ruin Followed Behind Her
And Death Followed Behind Her
And Doom Followed Behind Her
And Darkness Followed Behind Her - NEW
While you can read the first four in ANY order, you absolutely need to read And Darkness Followed Behind Her AFTER And Conquest Followed Behind Her, as there are spoilers in that book for the rest of the series.
And Death Followed Behind Her
Katrina was just a normal person with a simple life. Then, the Apocalypse descended upon her, and she spent two years fighting with and living among monsters.
They were neither pleasant nor polite neighbors, so she snapped and set out to Hell to kill the Devil.
That's when the carnage started.
Action, adventure, humor, and chaos abound in this mythological fantasy supernatural thriller book box set that's paced for edge of your seat excitement.
Join Katrina on three hair-raising adventures that pit her against God, the Devil, Zeus, Hera, and Cronos himself as she traipses across the universe breaking as many things as she fixes, fighting her way through Greek, Roman, and Judeo-Christian mythology, and causing trouble at every stop along the way.
And Doom Followed Behind Her
The Universe is a dangerous place…even for the gods

   Rebecca Lobdell survived her planet being attacked by a vicious alien race in And Death Followed Behind Her, but now she has taken on her biggest challenge yet.
  Rebecca Lobdell has joined the Godschurch, an intergalactic agency that protects gods around the universe. For a time, their job was easy. However, a terrorist organization known as the Godless has found a way to kill gods, and they won’t stop until every seemingly immortal being is vaporized into oblivion.

   Follow Rebecca Lobdell as she journeys from planet to planet to bring down the Godless and return peace to the universe. Continue your journey through the Godsverse with the follow-up to And Death Followed Behind Her, but now from a totally different perspective.
And Hell Followed Behind Her 
Living is the best revenge…even if it’s living in Hell. And Hell Followed Behind Her combines three fantasy thrillers into one book.

   In Betrayed, Akta is poisoned, sent to Hell, sells her soul to the queen of the underworld, and comes back from the dead to seek revenge on the king that killed her.

   In Fallen, God asks Akta to retrieve a fallen angel in Hell, which sends Akta traveling across the underworld with her new guide, Lucifer, as she seeks to fulfill God’s wish and achieve eternal salvation in Heaven.

   In Hellfire, a conspiracy has arisen to kill the Devil, and Akta is the only one who can protect the newly appointed king of the underworld, Lucifer, and assure he’s not murdered before he’s even settled into his new job.
And Ruin Followed Behind Her
Pixies are real. They are being hunted. Julia Freeman must protect them. And Ruin Followed Behind Her combines three books into one.

   In Mystery Spot, Julia Freeman finds out that she is a pixie and must stop a dangerous cult from using her blood to open a portal to Hell.

   In Into Hell, Julia travels into Hell to rescue a young pixie who was kidnapped by an evil banshee as a gift for the dark lord, Lucifer.

   In Last Stand, Julia tracks a secret society that wants to use pixie blood to summon a demon to do their bidding, and only Julia and her new apprentice can stop them. However, when their investigation goes south, Julia must survive her most difficult challenge yet; the pits of Hell.

  If you love dark fantasy, demons, action, and adventure, then pick up And Ruin Followed Behind Her today.
And Darkness Followed Behind Her
After the first four individual character books came out in 2020, fans asked me to write a book starring Kimberly, Julia Freeman's ward and acolyte in And Ruin Followed Behind Her. 
This is her book, and like the four before it, there are three stories inside, which take place at different places throughout the timeline of the Godverse Chronicles. 
Kimberly hasn’t had an easy life. It started with her being kidnapped by a banshee at the tender age of eight years old. As a teenager, she watched in horror as her mentor was sacrificed at the hands of a bloody cult. As an immortal, she helped save the world from the throes of Ragnarök.
However, there is so much more to her incredible story.
And Darkness Followed Behind Her follows fan-favorite Kimberly across three stories encompassing different monumental, never before seen moments in her immortal life.
The first story, Death’s Kiss, sees a college-aged Kimberly as she desperately tries to summon Julia from beyond the veil of death with the help of the demon queen Lilith.
In the second story, Death’s Return, Kimberly tries to find the love of her life during the first days of Hell’s bloody siege on the Earth in The Godverse Chronicle’s first story set during the Apocalypse since Katrina Hates the Dead.
The final story, Death’s Bargain, picks up after the events of And Conquest Followed Behind Them, and deals with the ramifications of Kimberly’s new role in the cosmos.
Team-up books
These are my Avengers-style team-up books featuring multiple point-of-view characters from through the Godsverse universe. It's a great way to catch up with your favorites in epic adventures with the fate of the universe in the balance. 
***And Conquest Followed Behind Them - NEW
POV: Characters: Katrina, Akta, Julia, Kimberly
The Lords of Hell collude to ruin Katrina and end her reign as Devil.
Katrina has been the Devil for over 150 years, and the demons of Hell hate her. Not only is she a woman, and a human, but she’s trying to modernize Hell, bringing technology to Dis, and treating monsters like employees instead of slaves.
Blasphemy to the natural order.
A conspiracy congeals to take down Katrina by summoning the Four Horsemen and initiating the cataclysmic destruction that is Ragnarök.
If the demon dukes succeed, the Universe is doomed.
Only Katrina, Julia, Akta, and Kimberly have any chance of stopping the world from descending into chaos.
***IF you buy only one book, this is the one I recommend. It will introduce you to all the main characters, even though it will spoil some of what happens in the previous books. 
And Chaos Followed Behind Them - NEW
POV: Characters: Katrina, Akta, Julia, Kimberly, Rebecca
The end of the Universe is coming, and it will consume everything in its wake.
It’s been over 10,000 years since the Apocalypse, and all is not well in the cosmos.
The Godschurch is in shambles after the events of And Doom Followed Behind Her, hemorrhaging money and support among the pantheons. Katrina, Julia, Akta, and Rebecca spend their days fighting for backing among the deities but are making mercilessly little headway with them.
In the eyes of the immortals, the Godschurch is a joke. However, when the gods start dying at an incredible rate, the church might be the only hope for the galaxy…whether the divines like it or not.
Join Katrina, Akta, Julia, Kimberly, and Rebecca in the most explosive entry into The Godsverse Chronicles yet, as they work to stop the Primordials from unraveling the very fabric of existence…with the fate of the universe hanging in the balance.  
Which pledge should I choose?
I know there are many pledge levels.
This is the curse of having so many books. 
I tried to design the pledge tiers in three tracks: digital, physical, and pin, each of which is broken down below, with what is included in each.
I have found that people are either physical book backers, digital book backers, or pinheads, and either way, I want to make sure you have the right options for you.
If you don't see something you like, please message me and let me know. I'm sure I can help you select the right pledge level for you.

I'm a huge fan of your work. Do you have any extra goodies only available during the campaign?
Absolutely I do. The great part about Kickstarter is that YOU are helping me create the books and make them available. No other humans in the history of the universe will help this book get made, except for my team, and Kickstarter backers.
Because of that, I always like to offer something unique and special for backers that nobody else, no matter how many copies they buy, will receive.
Special thanks
Every pledge over $50 receives a special thanks inside all four books for helping me creating this universe. Every printing of the book and every person who buys it digitally will see your name inside the book. You must have your name to me within 48 hours of the campaign ends, or I will use your Kickstarter name. 
Tuckerization
Every pledge over $100 gets themselves written into a future Godsverse book as a minor character, in name only. This is perfect if you or somebody you know is a big fan of the Godsverse. I've only offered this inside two of my books ever, and it's a lot of fun.
Every person who ever reads the book will see your name, and you'll be able to tell them that you helped me make this series happen.

Where is the money going?
This is easily my most expensive novel series, as they are the longest and most involved of anything else I write.  As I'm still printing POD, I still don't know exactly what I will be paying for printing and shipping, but I've used last year's numbers as my estimate of what it would cost to break even on these books. 
Production - $4,900
Printing - $3,000
Shipping - $2,000
Kickstarter - $1,100
Printing will be more expensive because there are SEVEN books to print this time, instead of four, which brings the total cost to $11,000 to break even on these books. 
They are still just so, so, so expensive, but I love them so, so much. 
 Other books and pins
So, there is a chance you've gotten this far and don't know that I am a pretty prolific author who's written a lot of well-received comic books that, um, weren't drawn, but were still written and published, by me.
During the Kickstarter campaign, you can choose from several of our other books. Here's a quick rundown of what we have available.
Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter
Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter - Ichabod is my most beloved graphic book, and has gone into eight printings thanks to the help of thousands of fans. It's about a mental patient that escapes from an asylum and becomes a monster hunter during the Apocalypse, but doesn't know if he's killing monsters, humans, or its all in his head the whole time.
Check out the first issue for free by clicking here.
Katrina Hates Dead Shit
This is my most popular book and the first comics drawing credit for Marvel artist Juan Frigeri, who has worked on things like Renew your Vows and Immortal Hulk among others.
Katrina is about a woman who gets sick of living during the Apocalypse so she sets out to kill the Devil, and along the way gets embroiled in a battle between Heaven and Hell.
Here's a couple of interior pages.
Get a preview of issue #1 by clicking right here.
Pixie Dust
Pixie Dust was drawn by Nicolas Touris and is meant to be read like an animated movie. It's been likened to Zelda with gore, or a failed D&D campaign.
Pixie Dust is about a pixie monster hunter who sells her soul to the queen of the underworld and comes back from the dead to seek revenge on the king that murdered her. This second book takes place 3,000 years before Katrina Hates the Dead/Katrina Hates Dead Shit. You can find the novelization of this graphic novel in the And Hell Followed Behind Her book.
Here are a few of my favorite panels from Pixie Dust.
The first two pictures are of Akta, and the last is of possibly my FAVORITE character in all the Godsverse, the goddess Velaska.
Get a free preview of Pixie Dust by clicking right here.
Cthulhu is Hard to Spell
Cthulhu is Hard to Spell is the first volume of our smash hit anthology series. It contains 35 stories about the gods and monsters of Lovecraft. There are funny stories, cute stories, scary stories, psychologically damaging stories, but they all deal with the gods and monsters themselves.
The first volume of our anthology series is a 176-page hardcover collection featuring 35 amazing stories from 70 more creators, featuring stories by Lea Hernandez (Teen Titans Go) and Megan Hutchinson (Will o' the Wisp).
Here's a rundown of the styles.
Check out a sample of the stories by clicking here.
Cthulhu is Hard to Spell: The Terrible Twos
Cthulhu is Hard to Spell: The Terrible Twos is the second volume of our smash hit anthology series.
It contains thirty-eight all-ages appropriate stories from 73 creators about the gods and monsters of the Lovecraft universe. Yes, there is horror, but there are also silly stories, funny stories, sci-fi stories, whimsical stories, and slice of life stories as well. The focus is on the gods and monsters themselves, with plenty of psychological and cosmic horror thrown into the mix, too.
The second volume features stories by Paul Jenkins (Spider-Man) and Tony Donley (Grimm's Fairy Tales), Ray-Anthony Height (Wakandaverse), Christian Gossett in his FIRST comic book art duties since The Red Star years ago, and a fantastic cover by Aaron Alexovich (Invader Zim).
In total, over 70+ creators contributed 38 incredible stories to this 160-page hardcover collection, and the results are pretty mindblowing.
Here is a rundown of the styles.
Check out a preview of the book by clicking here.
Monsters and Other Scary Shit
Monsters and Scary Shit is an anthology filled with 30 stories from more than 50 creators. It's cute stories, scary stories, funny stories and more all about monsters, and it's the cover that the nightmare elf is from, drawn by Invader Zim artist Aaron Alexovich.

campaign.story:
The Effervescent Adventures Of Fight-Bunny is a new hardcover graphic novel meant for ALL AGES! For the young and young at heart...for anyone who loves mellifluous mammals saying silly things, as hijinks and high adventure ensue! 
Fans of Paddington, Ratatouille, Babe, and Winnie The Pooh will want to spend time with Fight-Bunny and her beautiful bevy of beleaguered beasts in The Great Flooded Forest!
LEGEND TELLS OF A BUNNY!
...but not just any bunny. Oh no. A Fight-Bunny! 
The Effervescent Adventures Of Fight-Bunny is the super-true story of a bunny what likes a fight, so she grabs a sword and a cape (like you do) and goes trawling for tussles.
Art by Meyer, Script by Cosby, Letters by Maher
She travels, from forest to field to fjord, seeking to assist any with an issue only resolved by outsized confidence, and butting in before she understands what the problem actually is!
All was well in The Great Flooded Forest! Squirrels and foxes played gin rummy, birds enjoyed bubble baths, there was a hippo with very judgy opinions on tea preparation...life was swell. But on a specifically particular day, WATER started FLOODING the forest...and the cause? BEAVERS WITH IMPRESSIVE WORK ETHICS! While some of the animals prepared to move on to higher/drier ground, others fretted and flailed and fanned out for a hero to save their home! 
GLUP (a mouse)
Luckily, at that very moment, they were visited by (spoiler)... Fight-Bunny!
CAN Fight-Bunny battle and baffle a bevy of belligerent beavers? WILL the secrets of The Great Flooded Forest unfold in time to save all those that live there? WHY is the hippo SO adamant about the boiling temperature of their English Breakfast tea?
Find out in this all-new, all-ages comic!

Who Are We? 
JENNIFER L. MEYER is an award-winning artist whose work has been featured multiple times in Spectrum: The Best in Contemporary Fantastic Art. Her previous work includes Star Wars Adventures: Chewbacca, If I Could Give You Christmas, Saving Emma The Pig and many more. Born into a fantasy-loving military family, she grew up a big fan of comics, reading, and drawing animals (especially bunnies).
NATE COSBY is an Eisner and Harvey Award-nominated writer/editor/producer who's worked on Cow Boy, Thor The Mighty Avenger, Red Sonja, Jim Henson's The Storyteller, Buddy Cops, World War Hulk, Spider-Man Loves Mary Jane, James Bond, The Wonderful World Of Oz, Flash Gordon, World War Hulk: Aftersmash: Damage Control, and soooooooooo many other things. He runs indie comics publishing house LINNEY INCORPORATED.

ARIANA MAHER is a Brazilian American letterer with a decade of experience. She is a new member of Virtual Calligraphy, a lettering studio that works on titles produced by Marvel Comics. Her recent projects include Outpost Zero (Skybound), Lupina (Legendary), James Bond (Dynamite Entertainment), Catwoman (DC Comics), and Excalibur (Marvel Comics).

What Can You Get?
The Book: The Effervescent Adventures of Fight-Bunny is 45 pages of story, printed in an 8.5x5.5 inch hardcover, color book. You can also get the book digitally, or with a bookplate by Jennifer and Nate!

The Pins: We are excited to provide Fight-Bunny as a small enamel pin (measuring approx. 2") as part of some of our reward levels! You can also get the amazing hippo pin, as an add-on. How do add-ons work? Well, select your reward level, pledge, and then you will see the opportunity to add-on a hippo pin to your pledge!
These pins are possibly the MOST aggressively adorable things you can put on your jacket/bag/cork board/etc (y'know, pin places!), and are of course designed by the great Jennifer L. Meyer!
Commissions: At higher levels, you can get yourself a custom commission from artists Chris Eliopoulos, Roger Langridge, Bob Q, Jacob Edgar, or Marc Laming. 
What's up with shipping?
Due to the unpredictable nature of shipping costs, we will be adding shipping prices onto this project later in Backerkit. You will be sent a survey to your e-mail, closer to when we actually ship the book in 2021. The survey will ask for your shipping address. Our estimates for shipping costs are as follows: 
Pin: US - $3 / Canada -  $12 / Elsewhere - $14
Book Only: US - $3 / Canada - $19 / Elsewhere - $25+
Bunny Pack: US - $9 / Canada - $19 / Elsewhere - $25+
Retail: US - $15
Why Kickstarter?
We have had this idea of a lil' fighting bunny for years, and we want to make it exactly the way we see it in our heads. Kickstarter finally makes it possible for us to give Fight-Bunny life and send it directly to the people who will love it most, in the MOST affordable way possible!
Where does the money go?
The funds raised in Kickstarter will make it possible for us to pay our creative team and produce a limited print run of Fight-Bunny!
Thank You!
From the bottom of our pie-loving hearts, we (and Fight-Bunny!) thank you so much for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any project has its risks in creation, manufacturing delays, and the unexpectedness of the world (as we all know more and more). Between us, we've got years of experience meeting monthly comics deadlines and publishing books, and we've given ourselves plenty of time to bring you this incredible project.
The story is set, there's several pages drawn and lettered, and we're excited to get the budget to finish it!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
If you need it, there are English subtitles available on the video. If you use a screen reader there is a text only version of this campaign here.
The Board Game Survival Kit is a fun gaming accessory that contains a combination of common board game player pieces and dice that allows you to play as your colour even if the game doesn't include it. No more deciding between a bunch of playing colours you don’t want. Instead, take your survival kit with you to every game night and use your own game pieces.
It comes in a mint tin that fits neatly in your pocket. The tin will have waterproof vinyl stickers as well to make the product more durable for travel. There are three versions to choose from: Basic, Meeples and Deluxe (see 'Tin Contents' below). There are also 10 colours available to choose from: White, Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple, Pink, Black and Any. See 'Examples' later in the campaign for some possible uses for your Board Game Survival Kit.

You will be able to decide on your colour in the pledge manager after the campaign ends, in the meantime I'd love if you could comment on the project with your preferred colour, not only will it be lovely to see but also it will help me gauge the numbers of each colour that I need.
The tin fits neatly in your pocket and has a sliding lid that will stay closed rather than hinged tin lids that can open by accident.
The 'I play any' kit is designed for the person who always says “I’ll be any colour." It comes in a rainbow tin with a mixture of different coloured pieces inside. The two dice will match each other and the 5 (or 10) meeples will match each other too so that the kit is useable for you.
These are just examples of the many combinations you could receive.
Photography by Small Fries Games
But I want it all!!
Why can't I have 10 meeples and the mini dice set?! The answer is of course you can! I've included the mini dice set as an add-on item. If you choose the meeples reward tier you can add the dice set with Kickstarter's new add-on system. Please keep in mind with those 10 meeples taking up space you wouldn't be able to fit your dice in the same tin but they'll come in a little black drawstring dice bag.

Do you have trouble differentiating between colours?
I would love if this kit is not only fun but beneficial for those who struggle to differentiate colours. I would like to send out stickers to anyone who may need them to adorn their player pieces with so they can tell which are theirs. Hopefully this would mean you could use your kit to help with many games, no need to put stickers on your own copies of games you may want to resell in future, or a friend's game you wouldn't want to mess with. If this would be beneficial to you, I will provide stickers to anyone who feels like they may help (at no extra cost), just get in contact with me to let me know.
Please excuse the labels printed at home for the prototypes and the missing black cylinder and purple pawn
Image for scale of the mini 7 piece dice set (red) against standard size set. Close up of both D20s
 Basic - 5 meeples, 2 D6 dice, 1 cylinder and 1 pawn
 Meeples - 10 meeples, 2 D6 dice and 1 cylinder - made with worker placement games in mind
 Deluxe - mini 7-piece dice set* in black mini dice bag, 5 meeples, 2 D6 dice, 1 cylinder and 1 pawn - made with tabletop role playing games in mind
As you can see from the photos provided the components all originate from different sources so the shades of each colour on each piece will vary.

*The mini dice set is only available in 6 colours (red, purple, green, blue, yellow and orange) I really wanted to accommodate pink, black and white but sadly I couldn't find a supplier for these. Because of this anyone who backs this project for the deluxe kit (whichever colour you choose) will be able to choose from these 6 colours in the pledge manager after the campaign.
As a Kickstarter exclusive you can get a personalised copy with your name on the tin!

I've put some examples together for you to see, if you'd like to see an example of your name before committing to your reward tier just let me know. (These images are quick examples, keep in mind the finished labels will be trimmed to size and will have rounded corners).
Names up to 5-6 characters can use black and white text, longer names are best in black or white text only and may need to be repositioned.
All Board Game Survival Kits are available in the 10 colour options seen on the main image (White, Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple, Pink, Black and Any (Mixed)). With the exception of the mini 7-piece dice set which will be available in 6 colours (as listed in the 'tin contents' section).
Custom Mini Memory Mischief means you can choose the two dice and two heart action tokens that come with the game (it doesn't include a personalised tin like The Board Game Survival Kit).
Dice bags measure approximately 9cm x 8cm when flattened and fit a standard size 7-piece dice set.
Handmade dice bags and meeple keyrings in a variety of colours will be available for you to choose from in the pledge manager after the campaign, feel free to contact me ahead of time to check if a colour you want is available, this also gives me a chance to make enough of the colours people want.
 Please keep in mind that add-ons may increase the cost of postage.
UK - The Board Game Survival Kit is a UK developed gaming accessory and I'm delighted to be able to offer Free Shipping within the UK.
Rest of the world - I will ship worldwide and shipping will be calculated and charged in the pledge manager after the campaign. Here are the estimated shipping fees:
Important shipping information, please read:
Keep in mind that the delivery month on your reward is the date by which I will fulfil the project, it may not arrive in the same month.
If you add more games (weight) to your order these costs may be greater. The cost will be worked out by weight in the pledge manager for you, if you'd like to check ahead of time what your final cost will be just message me.
Please note that you may be responsible for duties, handling fees and taxes applicable to your region, especially if choosing to buy in bulk.
*Shipping for bundles/large orders outside of Europe will be sent via 'Economy' mail which can take a long time to reach its destination. If you would like to pay extra for 'Standard' delivery I can arrange that for you, for details check the FAQs.
These are just a few examples of when your Board Game Survival Kit might come in handy. With the exception of Tri To Win, I am in no way affiliated with any of these games and they are only used for illustrative purposes. These examples focus on the playing pieces rather than the dice which you could choose to use whenever you need a dice roll with 1-2 D6’s or the 7-piece set when playing Dungeons and Dragons and other tabletop role playing games.
Atikin Games is an indie tabletop games publisher and very much a one woman show. It's just me, Nikita, hi! I do all the game design, art, writing, etc for my games and gaming accessories myself. I'm very proud of my work and love the board gaming community and being a part of it.

I run The Indie Tabletop Newsletter which is full of news from other indie designers and is released once a month. And I regularly host #BoardGamersLift's over on Twitter on a Monday.

There are some very important additions to my team for whom Atikin Games wouldn't be the same without:

There's Captain; he's the Atikin Games mascot and even has his own page on the website. He's a wonderful mascot and a great therapy cat for when times are tough. He's also very good at testing the durability of a game.

My husband is always my first play tester, and then another close family friend helps as well so that I can iron out any possible problems and strengthen the game before play testing with a larger audience.
So far, I’ve created 3 games, and I love them all. If you’d like to know a little more about my games please keep reading.

Mini Memory Mischief – is a cute and nerdy mint tin game for 2 players based on Last-In-First-Out memory processing played with Mikro and Chip, two cute pixel cartoon characters that let you play on their memory stacks. In the game you use operators to push and pop letters on and off of memory stacks in order to get the most letters in alphabetical order before your opponent. It funded on Kickstarter in October 2020 with the help of 231 backers.
Small Fries Games Review
Tabletop Games Blog Review
Movin' Meeples Review
Boardgamegeek Ratings

Tri To Win – is a triathlon themed card game for 2-6 players and tonnes of fun for friends and family. You build up the skills of your athletes whilst building the race course together before racing on the board game you’ve just built out of cards. It funded on Kickstarter in February 2020 with the help of 132 backers.
Small Fries Games Review
Amazon Reviews
Boardgamegeek Reviews

Malum Hortus – is currently in development and already has a fan base all of its own. It’s a much bigger board game with a horror theme and some wonderful artwork. It’s a 1-4 player co-operative game, you play as nymphs trapped in and trying to escape an evil garden that’s beautiful by day and dreadful at night. I hope to be able to kickstart it towards the end of 2021.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As I have previously worked on a small mint tin project made from my own home (Mini Memory Mischief) which fulfilled early, and a manufactured game (Tri To Win) which I fulfilled within 2 days of receiving the games from China, I feel confident in my own ability to fulfil a campaign. There are always some risks and challenges, especially with suppliers meeting deadlines and a pandemic still going on. I will do my best to fulfil on time despite any hiccups that may occur.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
There are no disposable components. The metal tin, plastic and wooden components, and drawstring bag are all durable and designed to last.
Sustainable Distribution
The games are being assembled by me in the UK. This means I'm not outsourcing manufacture and not shipping/importing a large quantity of games from China. There is a chance if the project is very successful that I'll be purchasing some components from China but these would be small packages rather than a large shipment as you would see for many board game Kickstarter projects.

Whats next?

95% of The Board Game Survival Kits are on their way to you! It’s been a very busy week working on fulfilment but well worth it.

Not all of the orange and purple meeples I ordered arrived with my first shipment so the last 5% of packages are waiting on more to arrive. Rest assured it will still be well within the estimated fulfilment date in June.

updates.update_userinfo: We're nearly there! Early fulfilment!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
There have been some exciting deliveries over the last week or so which means I'm able to start putting your kits together!! I'm sending off the labels to be printed on Tuesday and then I'm just waiting on the larger tins to arrive which shouldn't be too long. It looks like fulfilment will be happening/starting in April! If you might be at a different address please let me know (I know some people have given me an address specifically for June so I'll be in touch)

updates.update_userinfo: It's getting exciting, and a little pledge manager nudge ;-)
updates.update_content:

It's especially important if you have ordered custom copies of the kits as I'll need all the details to design them and then place an order with the printer.

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Manager Open!
updates.update_content:
The pledge manager is open! How exciting!
As promised, I’ve included the dice bags and meeple keyrings from the mega bundle as add-on items so anyone can add them during checkout. I also have some lovely photos on there of the mini dice sets now so you can take a look before finalising your choices.
You should all have a welcome email from GameFound (please check spam/junk folder). I’ve included both standard and economy mail options for you, it’s calculated by weight and the minimum weight I can give an item is 10g (extra meeples, cylinders, etc weight 2-3g). Therefore, if you’re ordering a lot of extras for your kits and the shipping amount seems off please let me know and I’ll do what I can from my end.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goals!
Thanks to all the generous support I've received so far it's time for some stretch goals!
 $3,100 - REACHED
Upgrading the card finish from the basic card finish to the BETA finish which is an ultra-smooth finish that allows cards to glide beautifully and effortlessly together aiding playing card performances such as magic tricks and cardistry.
 $3,800 - LOCKED
Upgrade the card stock from smooth card stock to linen card stock which is casino quality.
 $4,300 - LOCKED
Upgrade the tuck box to have a sealed base for the box.

When I think of mobsters, I think of gambling...
From the glittering and glamorous casinos of Las Vegas to the back-room poker games where they'll break your leg if you don't have the money to back up your play...mobsters and gambling are two of a kind.
The Dust Bunny Mafia comic has been running since 2012 and has over 700 individual comics in it's archive. Since their creation, these mafia bunnies have been featured in two full-length comic collections (Meet the Family and The Blind Tiger), several booklets (Based on a True Story Vol. 1-2), and have run amuck in countless comic anthology projects (Unlawful Good, Out of the Deep, Forgotten Histories...just to name a few). 
And yet, after all of these successful products, there's one project that really shows the true nature of the Dust Bunny Mafia outside of the comic book landscape, which has eluded me thus far: playing cards. With this Kickstarter, I plan to make that dream into a reality. 
Introducing Dust Bunny Mafia Playing Cards
This deck will be a 55 card, standard poker-sized deck of playing cards featuring 52 of my favorite Dust Bunny Mafia characters from the comics to complete the standard deck. 

This will be a limited edition print run for the deck. No more than 500 decks will be produced.
Here you'll find all 52 cards that complete the standard deck.
Deck Specifications
For the funding goal of $3,000, below are the playing card specifications. As stretch goals are unlocked, there will be chances to upgrade elements of the cards. The more funding that's raised, the better deck quality I will be able to produce.
 Card Stock: (S30) Standard Smooth
 Size of deck: 55 cards
 Print type: Full color print
 Finish: MPC game card finish
 Packaging: Custom Tuck Box (Unsealed) - Glossy
 Box seals: Custom seal

Joker Cards
Along with the standard deck there are 3 Joker cards. Two of the Jokers are by guest artists, which will be revealed during the campaign. 

The first guest artist Joker card is Floyd the Crow as drawn by Sean Luke, creator of the Zombie Raygun comic. You can find Sean Luke on Instagram, check out Zombie Raygun on Facebook, or pick up your own copy of Zombie Raygun on Indyplanet
The second guest artist joker card is by The Awkward Yeti (Nick Seluk)!
Nick Seluk is the creator of The Awkward Yeti, Heart and Brain, Medical Tales Retold, and Olo.
You can find Nick on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and Patreon.
The third, and final Joker card, is a Mobimal (Mobster animal) commission card.

***DOMESTIC U.S. SHIPPING INCLUDED***
What do people say about the Dust Bunny Mafia?
 ***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY VOL. 1, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
Campaign Exclusives
Limited edition poker chip
Limited edition enamel pin
Limited edition signed deck
Hand-crocheted mobimal characters
Your mobimal (mobster animal) on the limited edition poker chip
Your mobimal (mobster animal) on the Joker card
Jimmy the Nose Enamel Pin
With this campaign, I will creating another enamel pin featuring everyone's favorite furry consigliere, Jimmy the Nose. This pin will be made with hard enamel and is 1.25" inches. This will be a limited edition pin, with only 100 of them being made. Any extras left over after the campaign is run will be added to my online store.
DBM Whiskey Glasses
With this campaign, I will be working with Gingee Girls Studio to create a limited run of Dust Bunny Mafia branded whiskey glasses. If you're going to play poker like a mobster, you've gotta have the appropriately branded drink-ware! Below is a mock-up of what I imagine the whiskey glass to look similar to. This is only a mock-up and is not finalized. 
(Design not finalized)
Make 100
With the Make 100 Kickstarter initiative, there is a limited tier specifically for autographed decks of cards. While I am aiming for a larger print run for the decks only 100 copies of the decks will be signed with a Silver Metallic Sharpie on the front of the box. All other decks produced in this campaign will be unsigned.

Where's the Money Going?
Bret "The Fedora" Juliano - Creator
Bret Juliano is a cartoonist and creator of the all ages Dust Bunny Mafia comic, which has over 700 comics in its archive and Mobimals. In late  2016, Bret published Meet the Family, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic  collection. In 2019, he successfully funded a Kickstarter for Based on a True Story,  a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection. In 2020, Bret returned to Kickstarter to fund his second Dust Bunny Mafia collection, The Blind Tiger and the second volume of the Based on a True Story mini comic collection. His dust bunny mobsters have also been included in several anthologies including Unlawful Good, Forgotten Histories and Out of the Deep as part of the Let’s Make Comics: Chicago Collective. He is an avid consumer of mafia trivia, both fact and fiction, and a passionate collector of fedoras.

What about the rewards?
***DOMESTIC U.S. SHIPPING INCLUDED***

Add-on's
Catch up on limited edition poker chips from previous Dust Bunny Mafia Kickstarter campaigns by utilizing the Add-On menu after you confirm your pledge.

Milestone Bonus Gifts
For each of the major funding goals we pass (shown below), I will unlock a new Milestone Bonus Gift that will be automatically included in all backers rewards.

Backer Count Bonus
Just like the Milestone Bonus Gifts, for each of the major backer counts we reach, I will unlock more free stuff for all backers!

Project Timeline (Estimated)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my fifth Kickstarter project that I've run and I am confident that my planning and timelines are accurate. Everything has been budgeted for and the design work is already 98% done on the playing cards. Photos on the page are physical proofs, not just mock-ups, so I can attest to the quality of the cards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Reusability and recyclability
