campaign.story:
There Be Dragons!

Hi! I'm Keri and I'm a cartoonist and illustrator. Over the last four years I’ve been bringing a gang of cute little dragons to life with my weekly webcomic, Zookie the Dragon.
The series follows protagonist Zookie, a cookie munching, doughnut loving little drake and the mischief he gets up to in the hills and woodlands he calls home. Joining Zookie are a cast of colourful characters; best friend Aero, brother Sparky, Welsh dragon Cinder and ice drake Frizard.
In Spring 2020 I started work on my first full length comic starring Zookie and his ice dragon rival, Frizard. Fans were updated online with new pages on a weekly basis, with positive feedback received for the story and development of my characters. It is now my desire to get the comic printed in a lovingly created paper back book. The story follows the misadventures of Zookie and Frizard, as they race across the countryside for the ultimate prize - doughnuts! Expect plenty of pitfalls along the way!

campaign.story:
"Picture this: You’re a restaurateur. A craftsman of the culinary arts. Celebrities fill your tables and your bar is never with an empty seat. You’re living the good life, rolling in the dough, when the Dust Bunny Mafia comes knocking at your door. They might look harmless, but it’s hard to resist their investment. You’re partners now, forced to fill their bellies and give them a cut until you’re broke. But the Bunnies aren’t finished. They drop a stogie and burn your baby to the ground. Good thing they made you get insurance. Except the check isn’t going to you." - Frank Martin
The Dust Bunny Mafia is my series of noir stories featuring anthropomorphic animals.  I'm doing this Kickstarter to pay for the printing of a new set of tales based on real life mafia events.  Here are some of them:
In 1944, Joseph Barbara bought a 58-acre parcel of land in the rural town of Apalachin, New York, and built an estate on 625 McFall Road for a total of $250,000. Barbara soon involved himself in local business circles and philanthropy. When Barbara applied for a New York handgun permit, the police chief of Endicott, New York, served as a reference. 
In November of 1957, an estimated 100 Mafiosi from the United States,  Italy, and Cuba are thought to have attended the Apalachin Summit.  Local and state law enforcement became suspicious when numerous  expensive cars bearing license plates from around the country arrived in  what was described as “the sleepy hamlet of Apalachin”. After setting  up roadblocks, the police raided the meeting, causing many of the  participants to flee into the woods and area surrounding Joseph Barbara’s estate.
Up to 50 men escaped, but over 60 were apprehended, including  Commission members Genovese, Carlo Gambino, Joseph Profaci and Joseph  Bonanno. Virtually all of them claimed they had heard Joseph Barbara was  feeling ill and that they had visited him to wish him well.
Introducing Based on a True Story Vol. 2
Based on a True Story Vol. 2 is a 32 page  mini comic collection (8.5" X 5.5") containing 29 comics, printed in  glorious full color, each based on a real life mobster story.
For years I have been fascinated with mobsters, but more memorable to me than Hollywood interpretations of the mafia lifestyle are the real life stories of the Italian American mafia. 
 ***DOMESTIC US SHIPPING INCLUDED***

Truth is Stranger Than Fiction
Frank "The Prime Minister" Costello
In June of 1944, the Prime Minister of the New York Underworld, Frank  Costello took a short cab ride. When he exited the cab, he left behind  two envelopes containing $27,200.00 in hundreds and fifties. Edward  Waters, the honest cabbie, found the envelope and turned it into the NY  police. After the story hit the papers, Costello made a claim alleging  this was his money and it was from a debt he collected from a friend. A  court case followed. In the end, Costello only retrieved $120 of the  original amount.
Milestone Bonus Rewards


What do people say about the Dust Bunny Mafia?
Who will love Dust Bunny Mafia?
Fans of mafia-related pop culture like The Godfather, Goodfellas, and The Sopranos.
Lovers of Saturday morning cartoons and the Sunday funny papers.
People who like cartoons such as Looney Tunes and Animaniacs.
Collectors of high quality independent comic books.

Mobimal (mobster animal) cameo in the booklet

***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY VOL. 1, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
***DOMESTIC US SHIPPING INCLUDED, and all books come signed by creator Bret Juliano.***

Apalachin Cola Kickstarter Exclusive Tee
 In 1946, Joseph Barbara was convicted of illegally purchasing 300,000 pounds of sugar (intended for the manufacture of bootleg alcohol). Soon after this, Barbara entered the soft drink distribution business, buying a Canada Dry bottling plant. Barbara eventually gained control of the beer and soft drink market in Binghamton, New York.
In memory of the historic Apalachin Summit of 1957, I am releasing this Kickstarter-exclusive heather black t-shirt only available in this color variant during this campaign. Once this campaign ends, no additional Apalachin Cola shirts will be sold in this color.
Where's the Money Going?
Bret "The Fedora" Juliano - Creator
Bret Juliano is a cartoonist and creator of the all ages Dust Bunny Mafia comic, which has over 700 comics in its archive and Mobimals. In late 2016, Bret published Meet the Family, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection. In 2019, he successfully funded a Kickstarter for Based on a True Story, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection. Earlier this year, Bret returned to Kickstarter to fund his second Dust Bunny Mafia collection, The Blind Tiger. His dust bunny mobsters have also been included in several anthologies including Unlawful Good, Forgotten Histories and Out of the Deep as part of the Let’s Make Comics: Chicago Collective. He is an avid  consumer of mafia trivia, both fact and fiction, and a passionate  collector of fedoras.
For as far back as I can remember I was always drawing. When I was a  kid, my dream job was to be an animator for Disney, but as I grew up, my  focus shifted into the world of comics...newspaper styled comics  especially.
Garfield, Calvin and Hobbes, Peanuts, Zits, Get Fuzzy...I could keep  going, but I won't. I would read the Sunday funny paper back to back for  years.
These were the things that brought joy to me and my comics, the Dust  Bunny Mafia in particular, is my opportunity to tell my stories and give  back in comics form.
What about the rewards?

campaign.story:
Becoming a comic book professional isn’t like becoming a doctor or a lawyer. There’s no license you can obtain or standard path for you to follow. The business of comics is chaotic and complex and can riddle you with questions like:
How much money do I need to publish my comic?
  How much money should I charge for my comic?
  Does social media matter?
  How can I work with comic shops to market the comics?
  How do I select a printer for your books?
  THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING answers these questions and more. Organized in three easy-to-read parts (pre-production; production; and post-production) with chapters devoted to topics including intellectual property management; production; distribution; sales and advertising; marketing; and everything in between.
THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING explains the business and legal concepts of the comics industry so you can maximize your creativity. By minimizing doubt and frustration around the business end of things, you can get back to the thing you love: publishing and creating comics!
Gamal Hennesey
Comic book attorney and business consultant Gamal Hennessy taps into more than 2 decades of experience to break down the complex comics business into layman’s terms. When he’s not practicing law, Hennesey writes novels and provides both practical business advice and inspiration.  THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING is edited by Aftershock editor-in chief Mike Marts, and features a foreword from writer and Heavy Metal executive editor Joseph P Illidge. It’s a book by pros, for pros and aspiring creators alike. If you’re serious about a career in comics, this book is an essential read. After all: who wouldn’t want to create the next Superman (and retain ownership of the intellectual property)?
The book will guide you through the following:
Turning your creative ideas into published comics
  Developing intellectual property that you own and control
  Creating a business plan tailored for your specific publishing goals
  Finding and hiring a professional team to create your book and support your business
  Understanding the distribution process
  Creating comics—that you can be proud of—on time and under budget
  Using your comics to generate multiple streams of revenue
  Building a long-term relationship with your readers
  As acclaimed writer and editor Joseph P Illidge writes in the introduction to THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING:
“We are living in the time of a global paradigm shift, from a business culture that wanted to marginalize, trivialize, and ignore the stories and lives of people from diverse communities, lifestyles, life conditions, and gender identifications, to a global corporate complex that invites new stories, diverse narratives, and creators of different cultures.
The business relationships of the future will be determined by an understanding of mutual value between the creator and the publisher, making it more important than ever that both sides are armed with the knowledge to protect their intellectual properties.
THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING is the roadmap to a secure creative future, a journey that begins with personal and tough questions.Questions requiring the aspiring entrepreneur to be self-aware and honest….
The comic book industry, and business of intellectual properties based on characters and worlds, can be both exciting and perilous. A journey of great importance and substantial reward is best undertaken with the aid of a guide, and the dawning clarity of a clear path.
You have found your guide, and the means through which to illuminate your path.”
Comic Pros & Cons' Derek Becker, Gamal, and Dirk Vanover of Vanover Legal, LLC
Testimonials for Gamal Hennessey
“Hard-working, patient, keen eye to detail, and always on your side. That’s just a few words that described my experience with Gamal and his services. I felt very positive with the work he did and when the need comes about, I would go to him in a heartbeat.”— Tim Smith, acclaimed artist for Black, Marvel, DC and Archie Comics
“Gamal has provided me with excellent advice on potential publishing contracts on several occasions, and he steered me away from some deals that just weren’t right for my own goals. As a result, I was able to place my creator-owned properties in better situations. I highly recommend Gamal for any comics creator facing the legalese of a publisher contract.”— Rob Anderson, Writer of Creature Cops, Rex the Zombie Killer and My Little Pony
“Deadline oriented expert. Innovative, strong and detail oriented professional. He is not only a responsible and hard working General Counsel but also an inspiring professional. I have had the pleasure of working with Gamal since we both left CPM and I have seen him turn his passion into his profession. It's amazing to work with such a person.”—Sara Erickson, Creative Director Design & Development, Hasbro
“Gamal was the first attorney who bothered to explain my contracts to me. He wasn’t just interested in tweaking language, he wanted to increase my understanding of contracts going forward.”— Andy Schmidt, President of Comics Experience
“Gamal is very knowledgeable about IP and Entertainment law and very professional, but that’s just the minimum. He went above and beyond the call and he took the time to make sure I felt listened to and not only that I understood things, but that I felt understood as well. I have already recommended several people to talk to Mr. Hennessy and I hope to work with him for years to come!”—Ian Powers, President of Dragon's Gate Entertainment, Ltd.
“I went to Gamal to help me a create work for hire contract and to give me a legal analysis to protect my work. He was incredibly helpful and explained things thoroughly in my consultation. He was also reasonably priced in comparison to many others that I’d inquired after which was a huge help for a small business owner.”—Jack Wallace, President of Disposable Fiction Inc.
“I hired Gamal to help me put together a boilerplate contract for use as a freelance writer, so I would have clear terms to hold clients to. Gamal directed the conversation, asked me the right questions about what was important to me, and helped me put together a contract that has since served me well (and that I haven't once had to enforce). He was quick, responsive, and far more affordable than just about any other lawyer you're likely to find. I would absolutely recommend his services.”— Brandon Carbaugh, Author of Black Knight and The Wish
"Highly recommended."—  Chris Lewis, Author of Karma Police
Why We’re Bringing This Project to Kickstarter
The plan was to release THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING at New York ComicCon. It’s unlikely there will be cons anytime soon, so we’re turning to Kickstarter to release the book. Think of this campaign as a debut at a digital Artist Alley!
We’re raising money to help offset printing costs and marketing costs associated with this book.

updates.update_userinfo: Your book is on the way...
updates.update_content:
The six hundred artists, creators, and publishers in the comic book industry who have backed The Business of Independent Comic Book Publishing are a special breed. They all have a unique vision and story that they want to get out into the world.
They are also the only people who are going to be able to receive this book in 2020.
With less than a week to go, the success of the campaign has caught the attention of influential players in the publishing industry. While nothing is finalized yet, I’m going to hold off publishing the retail version of the book on my own so I can explore other options.

We've Funded - Stretch Goal  
At $1250 all backers at the $12 level and up get a physical color copy of the awesome paper Shark of War toy template in 24 lb paper!
It's Jaws Meets Robocop!
For fifty years, we've had dozens of shark stories. One was great, a few were good, most were mediocre to bad. But they all had one thing in common, the shark was the monster. The creature for the human heroes to defeat. What makes Shark of War different is that there is never any doubt who the hero of this story is - it's the shark. Whether he's escaping the scientists who created him or the bad guys who will do anything to kill him, he's the one we're rooting for. And even though his intelligence has been increased, he's still a shark and when push comes to shove - he does what a shark does best.
Free US Shipping on all physical rewards!
New Bonus 1- All Physical Backers Get A Bonus Sticker Added In!
New Bonus 2 - All Backers Get The Template To Make Their Own Paper Shark of War!
New Bonus 3 - The Creature Feature Digital Comic Book Bundle!
That's a total of 8 comics for ALL Backers!
New Bonus 4 - All physical backers get a cool bookmark!
New Bonus 5 - All backers get to decide how this animation ends!
In issue 1, The New King of The Sea,  we learned his origin and how he came to take on everything bad happening on the Eastern Seaboard. In issue 2, A Parade of Piranha, the bad strikes back. They've hired one of his creators to make creatures even deadlier than he, piranha who've been modified just as he has. But there are hundreds of them.
 CLICK HERE TO READ ALL OF ISSUE 1 FREE 
 Sample Pages From Issue 2
The Shark of War Helps A Navy SEAL team.
The Cartel Has Finally Tracked Down The Shark of War
The Battle Begins - But who holds the upper hand?
 What You're Getting:
First and second issue of exciting five issue story arc of the world's first shark (anti)hero.
The dark humor of Robocop.
More shark action than all the Jaws movies combined.
28 interior pages of story in each issue.
Saddle stitched with gloss paper and cover.
2 variant covers for each issue.
Digital deluxe pdf full of extra content for each issue (over a 100 pages of content all together)
Both issues are 100% complete
100% Complete!
Testimonials
"Shark of War leans all the way in to its over-the-top premise with gusto. From its savage opening sequence to its killer cliffhanger, Shark of War is bloody fun comics."  -Tyler James (ComixTribe, ComixLaunch)
"The story is like a B horror movie. This comic would make a great B movie.
USS Gnasher does so much good he likes feeding on drug smugglers and other criminals. Dr. Brooke Douglas and her piranha will leave you wanting even more than the armed shark. You will be coming back for piranha vs shark."  -Rich Reviews of FirstComicNews.com on Shark of War 1
"Loads of fun with blood and wacky ideas. A must read for all the shark fans out there." -Tyler Glass of Shattered Glass Comic Reviews on Shark of War 2
Rating: 5 out of 5 stars -Rich Reviews of FirstComicNews.com on Shark of War 2
Meet The Creator
I've been an engineer for 30 years and have degrees in nuclear, aerospace, and mechanical engineering. I've used this to integrate actual science into over the top science fiction in the technology used to power a cyborg shark.
I've wanted to write comic books all my life, but I didn't know any artists and didn't know how to draw. But I've always been good with computers. So when I had the idea for Shark of War, I knew I had to get it made no matter what. I spent the last year learning the different digital drawing and modeling programs that let me create exactly what I envisioned.

The books are 100% complete. The funds are to cover a large enough print run to get the book in the hands of many fans as possible. All the other funds are going to cover shipping, packaging, Kickstarter fees, and the exciting rewards being offered to those who back this project.

campaign.story:
In 2018, we launched Kinetic, the story about a young man, Johnny,  who developed superpowers, and thought he could do a better job than his city's resident hero.
Johnny is able to create and manipulate kinetic energy.  He's the first person born with superpowers.  The city's current hero, The Ascender, was patrolling the skies in a metal suit (like Iron Man).  After Johnny's brother got hurt by a psychopath, and the Ascender chose not to intervene, or even help, Johnny decided that he could do a better job, and became KINETIC.
Well, after two years, eight issues, and thousands of books sold online and at conventions, he's beat the bad guy, mastered his powers, and got the girl.
NOW WHAT?!
Kinetic: Identities #1 picks up where the story left off.  When a villain from his past is up to his old tricks, it's up to Johnny to save the day!
But is Kinetic a match for the villains when this time, they're ready for him?!
If you are a card-carrying Kinetic VIP, welcome back!  But if this is your first time hearing about this series, don't worry, I've got you covered.  You don't have to have know anything to read and enjoy this issue, and I've also got plenty of catch-up tiers to get you up to speed.
Three Main Covers to Choose from!
I get emails, messages, and even mail to my PO Box all the time asking me when there will be more Kinetic. 
I'm happy to know the answer: RIGHT NOW.
There are even more awesome rewards further down the page, but here's a sneak peak at a couple of our reward tiers for backers:
At some of  our higher tiers, we also have rare and Kickstarter exclusive rewards, such as Physical Scripts, and these Ultra-Limited Black and White Variants:
Ultra-Limited - ONLY 30 available!
This is the first time Kinetic is being offered internationally, but also, ALL ORDERS SHIPPED IN THE USA HAVE FREE SHIPPING!
I've also got a few other fun surprises up my sleeve as the campaign moves forward...
Though I'm the writer and creator, Kinetic wouldn't be able to happen without the help of my entire creative team!  They should get all the accolades for how great this book looks!  Here's a little about me, and the rest of the creative team:
This book wouldn't be able to happen without the help of my wonderful creative team, and I am proud to call them collaborators and friends!
Since my very first time behind a booth at my first comic convention, Kinetic has built up a dedicated fanbase...
And a few reviewers, and industry professionals have had some nice things to say, too!
There's been a little hiatus since the last Kinetic book released.  We've had to deal with losing an artist and finding a replacement.  Thankfully, we found a wonderful talent in indie comic veteran Luis Rivera.  I met him at a convention, and hit it off immediately.  With Luis onboard, we could get started again.  I am proud to say that, except for Rafael, the creative team remains completely unchanged!
I just had to tell more of Kinetic's story.  Like so many of you, I've also fallen in love with the world of Velo City, and I knew Johnny's tale wasn't over yet.
We're coming back to Kickstarter because my first campaign was so successful, and I want to keep sharing Kinetic with this wonderful community.  Since joining Kickstarter as a backer, I've helped over 50 creators by backing their projects and make their dreams come true.  Kickstarter really is the place you want to find the newest and freshest comics!
Since last year, we've been running the gauntlet with 2020.  So why now?  Well, with so much going on in the world, the best way I feel that I can help is to continue offering up awesome comics to you.  A sense of normalcy is important in turbulent times, even if it's just a little getaway time away from the madness.
The funds raised here will be used to fund the print run of Kinetic, Identities #1, and shipping those books to you.
If we're lucky enough to overfund, we'll put that towards making more great comics.
 I would never ask you to back something that I wasn't 100% sure we could completely finish in a timely manner.  The artwork is almost totally done for this book, and I think Luis and Omi did a great job:
Now, you may notice a few characters are unfinished.  Astute eye, my diligent reader! For the first time ever, we are offering to have you (or a loved one!) DRAWN INTO KINETIC!  You can either be a citizen saved by Kinetic (and help him try to catch the bad guys) OR become a nefarious GOON.
Find out more about that, and a ton of other fun reward tiers, below...


Here's the plan:
This is the first campaign I have run where our custom reward tiers (being drawn into the story) actually mean the art is almost entirely done.  I'm factoring in extra time it will take Luis, Omi, and Lucas to have high end backers drawn in the story.  I doubt it will take as long, BUT I'd rather estimate a long time and get you the book ahead of schedule than the other way around.
Here's what our timeline looks like:
Again, I think this timeline is the worst case scenario.  I'd rather estimate a longer time period, and deliver early, than the other way around.
I want to get these books into your hands as fast as possible. 
We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.
You pay premium prices on Kickstarter, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:
These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.
And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?
I'll replace it free of charge.

Thank you for checking out this Kickstarter!  Kinetic would not be possible without the support of the wonderful fans, and I appreciate you giving me the chance to make my dreams of becoming a comic book writer a reality!
Now, I'm going to ask you to look over our awesome reward tiers, find the one you like best, and let's get Kinetic: Identitites #1 in YOUR hands!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the best parts about working on Kinetic, Volume 1 was it let me get a lot of the inconsistencies and mistakes out of my system. This book is nearly complete: all that's needed now to finish the art is to add in any likenesses from the higher end reward tiers, and then send it to the printer. My last Kickstarter fulfilled before it's estimated time, and I will do my best to fulfill this campaign early, as well.

With the uncertainties in the world, mainly shipping delays due to COVID, we have added a healthy buffer in the timeframe to account for any delays. We've also estimated very, VERY conservatively for how long it will take to finish artwork and print the books.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to our second Kickstarter campaign!
The “Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide” has been in the making for roughly 8 years now, I wanted to create a visual-heavy book dedicated to Coin-Op arcade games, and so this book was born.  It features a huge collection of amazing arcade titles in one book for the very first time, ranging from the '80s to the '90s. This second book from me (Darren Doyle) & Greyfox Books will pay a huge tribute to this incredible and fascinating past time we all loved during our childhood and even now into adulthood. These classic Coin-op arcade games have made a great come back in recent years, becoming very popular once more through emulation or even Mini Arcade cabinets. 
Like our first book “Atari: a Visual History” which successfully funded in May of 2019. It was backed by 665 people, which enabled me to produce the ultimate unofficial Atari book for everyone. Once again I need your help to make this second book a roaring success.
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide Front Book Cover
Coin-OP: The Arcade Guide Back cover
Coin-Op@ The Arcade Guide page sample
Coin-Op@ The Arcade Guide Index page sample
The Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide is a first for a book specialising in a visual aspect of classic arcade games never represented in this manner before. The full premise of this book is to produce a visually rich experience based on multiple genres of classic arcade titles. 
The book will be split across 9 chapters to cover all areas of the Coin-Op gaming scene in a fully-fledged hardback book. Chapters in the book will cover:
 Side-scrolling Beat'em up games 
Arcade Driving games
 Arcade Shoot'em’ ups 
Arcade Action games
Miscellaneous arcade games
Obscure arcade games
Arcade Horror inspired games
1 vs. 1 Fighting games
An arcade Hall of Fame
With over 100 classic arcade games covered, each one has its own bespoke layout to showcase each game in all its visual beauty. We have some amazing arcade trivia for you in here too and some exclusive interviews and much more ensuring a premium publication with a word count of 60,000 – 70,000 words.  I have also included some really neat bespoke ideas that you will discover as read the book, but that will have to remain a surprise for now. The main aim is to produce the book in an A4 annual sized orientation. I believe it would be criminal to have it any smaller than this and it will feature the following specifications:
Annual Size format
Book size:  8.5” x 11.5
Book Cover: Gloss finish
Paper stock: 140-150gsm page thickness
Page count:  300 pages + endpapers (imagery)
Print quality: Satin Silk Finish (highest finish)
Binding: thread-sewn bind
 Weight: 1.68kg  
Coin-OP: The Arcade Guide book preview
This publication will only be available in a hardback form, making the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide a must-have coffee table book. The print quality will consist of a 150GSM gloss cover stitch bind with a satin page finish on each page within the book to ensure beautiful quality throughout this publication. 
-=STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED=-
All Stretch goal reached! 
 1 x 4-page gatefold will be added to the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide. 
 1 x 4-page gatefold will be added to the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide. 
Everybody will now receive a large Holographic Arcade Sticker with their book.
Ten Extra pages with more arcade titles will now be added to the book for everyone.
Now that we have funded the book thanks to all our amazing backers, We want to add even more to the book for you. So Become a backer and find out what these stretch goals are. 
Content within the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide
Let’s have a look at what the book is about? 
When I started working on the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide it was initially planned to be part of another publication back in 2012.  I felt this would be such a missed opportunity to simply have one arcade title covered in each issue of this magazine. It was then that I decided to make it a fully-fledged publication in its own right hence the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide was born, The book covers some fantastic and unique arcade games from your childhood.
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide Side-scrolling beat'em up introduction pages
So let me introduce the chapter covering side scrolling fighting games. I decided to display each game in a way never seen before in a publication. For example, I cover classics like “Double Dragon” & “Cadillac & Dinosaurs”. Each one includes many elements and not just simple screenshots or write-ups and that's the same for each title covered. They will include pre-mastered “Arcade Flyer” artwork including specifications on the year of release and the hardware used. All in-game imagery has been all captured in the game's original resolution so as not to spoil the final presentation or look.  Every game featured in the book gets a description of what was so good about them and maybe even tempt you to play them if you haven't before. Also, each game gets some facts and trivia you may have never read about previously. 
Double Dragon (© Technos / Taito 1987) - Alien vs. Predator (© Capcom / Twenty Century Fox 1994)
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide 64th Street (©Jaleco 1991)
The Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide is a book aimed at both newcomers and arcade enthusiasts. Each chapter of the book covers 10 select arcade titles as well as other surprises I can't tell you about for now. One great piece of trivia about the project is each title has its very own layout and design, this is something I am extremely proud of, ensuring every game in the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide is completely different and something you simply do not see other publishers and authors doing, but then again they aren’t creating the ultimate arcade guide book are they?
Following on from the side scrolling chapter is the shoot'em up/SHMUPS chapter where we look at games like Namco's™ ”,” detailing the original cabinet artwork to showcase just how stunning this cab was. Another game we look at is the epic Sega™ isometric arcade hit “Zaxxon” from 1982. We use a ton of imagery from each shooting game so you will need to spend quite some time examining each game in detail. So if you are a vintage shoot-em-up fan you’re going to love this by your side.    
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide - Shootem' Up title introduction
I wanted to cover a varied collection of shoot'em up titles in the book due to the sheer amount of games in this genre. So it was tough to choose which games to include and leave out, but remember the focus here is heavy on the visual impact of these amazing games and how much they have come on as you read about them.
Zaxxon (©1982 Sega)
All the classics are here for you to reminisce about, to stare in amazement at those beautiful graphics and gameplay screenshots. This chapter is a very special addition to the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide book.    
Parodius (© Konami 1990) - Galaga (© Namco 1981)
One of the most popular genres in arcade gaming has to be the “Arcade Driving game”. I've spent many hours deciding which driving games to cover in the book from the arcades of the past trying to balance what people remembered fondly or never got a chance to experience back in the day and I think I’ve managed to select some of the greatest driving games we all loved to feature in the book.  
OutRun (©Sega 1986)
Sega’s™ 1987 hit “Outrun” has to be the best one of the best arcade machines and do you remember that thumping music? Or the adrenaline injecting turbo-boosting thrill ride of the brilliant Taito™ hit “Chase H.Q.” both are covered in all their visual glory for you to reminisce over and will hopefully urge you to have another play once more.
Chase H.Q. (©Taito 1988)
Next up is the “Arcade Action” chapter which covers some great classics like Bally Midway’s™ “Joust” testing the patience’s of a saint or Atari Games™ & LucasFilm™’s second collaboration with the brilliant ”Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom”  I feel have covered a diverse collection of action arcade games in this section of the book for you to read about. 
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide - Arcade Action Introduction sample page
A few examples of what you can expect in this chapter below.
Indiana Jones & the Temple of Doom (©Atari Games 1985) - Joust (©1982 Williams) - Black Tiger (©Capcom 1987) - Strider(©Capcom 1989)
When faced with the sheer amount of content we could have added to this book, I took the decision to add two extra special chapters that would cover “Miscellaneous Arcade Games” like platformer style arcade games, examples like Taito’s™ arcade perfection that was “Bubble Bobble” or Bally Midway’s™ ingenious beer tender arcade classic ”Tapper” to name but a few are all in here for you.  
Tapper (©1983 Bally Midway) - Dig Dug (©1982 Namco) - Bubble Bobble (©1986 Taito)
Once you have seen the attention to detail that has gone into the book you will understand why it is the ultimate Coin-Op Arcade guide. Classics like Atari Games™ Gauntlet, Cinematronics™'s "Dragon Lair" and Capcom™ 's "Ghost’n’Goblins" and so on are all covered. I have done my utmost to present a wide range of content throughout the book for you and promise that it will not disappoint, in fact, I believe it will only fuel your love for arcade games as you progress through it.
So rather than simply having you read about one game after another, I have broken up the game content with some unique material with a section of the book. I’ve called “Did you know?” covering some great and rare trivia facts that I researched across 4 full pages of arcade goodness.  
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide "Did You know?" Sample pages
I wanted to cover some arcade history within the book and "DataEast" was the company I chose mainly because of their prolific output of games over the years. This is followed up by another great showpiece within the book called the “The Arcade Hall of Fame”, covering an additional 30 arcade flyers from the very best arcade vendors of the 1980s & 1990s completely remastered to their original state. Also included is a huge array of classic marquee artwork included from a total of 60 remastered pieces, all in ultra-high-resolution artwork. You will see every line and dithered colour halftone as it was meant to be seen in the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide book
Dataeast Feature - Arcade Hall of Fame sample pages
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide Marquee Art sample pages
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide Arcade Flyer and Marquee Art sample pages
And finally a collection of unique interviews with the prolific Arcade Club based in the UK, Free Play Bar Arcade based in Rhode Island in the United States, and Level Up Arcade & Restaurant based in Limerick, Ireland to add something fresh and interesting about running an arcade.
Now, to the dark side of the book…yes..the Horror chapter of the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide covering a satanic collection of pixelated gore or blood and was quite surprised how little the genre has been covered anywhere in a publication, so this chapter is here to straighten this out. From the crypts of Exidy™ ’s sadistic minds brings “Chiller”, a Zombie mash-bash side scrolling beat'em up from DataEast™ “Night Slashers” through to the horrific mansion of Sega™ ’s horror light Gun smash hit “House of the Dead”, all the best of the best horror titles are featured in the book.  
Haunted Castle (©1988 Konami™) - CarnEvil (©1998 Midway Games™) - Splatter House (©1988 Namco™)
And finally one of the most popular genres in the arcades had to be the 1 vs. 1 arcade fighters. With many reputations on the line pitting life long friends against each other, facing off in a tag or 1 vs. 1 fighting tournament. I was heavily exposed to this culture back in the day it was only fitting to include this genre in the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide book.  
Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide 1 VS. 1 Fighting title Introduction page
Like the SHMUP section of the book, this chapter could get its own publication on its own right, I wanted to include so many fighting games and the task of choosing them was not easy either.  However, I believe I have chosen some of the best games in the genre, like Capcom™ 's "Street Fighter 2", Namco™ 's amazing "Tekken" or SNK™ 's fantastic "King of Fighters'94" are all in here for you. 
Samurai Shodown (©1993 SNK) - Fatal Fury 2 (©1992 SNK) - Mortal Kombat (©1992 Midway Games) - Street Fighter 2: The World Warrior (©1991 Capcom)
There is so much content covered in the Coin-Op: The Arcade Guide, it's been an amazing personal journey for me and after many years in production, I can finally bring it to you all on Kickstarter. I hope you will help make this happen for everyone by pledging so we can all experience these amazing games in all there glory in one magical tome. Allow yourself once more to cherish and hold these amazing arcade games close to your heart as much as I have. 
Let's shout together why a book like this needed to be published.

So let's see what we have to offer with the book, including exclusive and backer-only pledges when you pledge on the book. I have thought long and hard about presenting and producing incentive perks, created especially for this Kickstarter campaign. Something you don't see much of these days in people's gaming rooms is classic old school posters, sure you have your neon signs, etc, but where are the bespoke designs? I wanted to go all out and commission an original design so I contacted veteran video game artist and industry legend Simon Phipps. Simon has worked on many classic video game projects including, Rick Dangerous, Switchblade, and Harry Potter video game series to name a few. 
Simon Phipps Video Game Artist
Simon has been in the video game industry for over 30 years and I have always admired his work and am a huge fan, the design was a collaboration of minds, together with both Simon and myself created my vision for a poster in spectacular style any Arcade fan would love hanging on their wall in celebration of Coin-Op video games and I believe we have achieved just that!

Risks and challenges
Creating and publishing a book like this comes with some risks, after my successful first book and my extensive career as a graphic artist I feel I have all these potential issues fully covered. Should there be any issues that arise as we go through the project I will use the Kickstarter Update process to keep you all updated on things as they happen, good or bad, you will be informed.

Greyfox Books is a small single-person operation. We will always endeavour to price our books as low as we can, but due to the niche market for some of our titles, this isn’t always going to be possible. Always be assured you have purchased a unique book professionally printed that is currently only available direct from the designer/author. While every effort has been made to track down and correct any errors in our publications, there is always the possibility we didn’t catch them all.

campaign.story:
THE CAMPAIGN:
Hey everyone, and welcome back to our 14th Kickstarter. That's right, the crew at PAPERFILMS has put together another exicting issue of the successfully launched comic series POP KILL.  Issue #2 of this action packed, beautifully drawn, top quality production will be available for everyone to join in on the campaign.  Featuring some of the top talent in the field to present to you our 40 page second issue of an ADULTS ONLY comic mini-series called POP KILL ! 
Written by JIMMY [ Painkiller Jane, Harley Quinn, Jonah Hex ] PALMIOTTI and DAVE [ 100 Bullets, Red Son ] JOHNSON and illustrated by the amazing JUAN [ Painkiller Jane, Twilight Experiment ] SANTACRUZ with colors by BRIAN [ X-Men, Bloodshot ] REBER, lettering by SEAN [ Aliens, Aliens vs Predator ] KONOT and the brilliant design by John J Hill , the man responsible for so many great projects there are too many to list, but for the PAPERFILMS projects, he designed the PAINKILLER JANE Hardcover and the KILLING TIME IN AMERICA hardcover.
THE STORY:
Imagine a world where the two dominant and competing Cola companies, each worth billions, are owned by former Siamese twins who are now separated and have grown to hate each other so much they hire assassins, saboteurs, and espionage personnel to meddle with each other on a daily basis.  This is the story about brotherly love run afoul, and the people they enlist to do their dirty work.
In the first issue, we met the beautiful DINA DELUX, a scientist in the Fizz division at POPSO COLA. She's on the verge of creating a formula that will make soda 50% fizzier, keeping it carbonated longer than any other brand on the market. A breakthrough like this would put all the competition out of business in a heartbeat.
When Popso's main rival FIZZ ONE COLA hear the rumors about the discovery, they activate their best man, JON PYLE, an oversexed mercenary, to take care of the situation. His orders are to convince Dina to switch sides, and if that fails, to eliminate her. However, after they meet the attraction is undeniable and a third option kicks in, one which triggers repercussions from BOTH sides.
The story continues in issue 2 as Dina learns more about Jon and deals with her life going up in flames as they both hide out to let things cool down, which unfortunate for them, they do not.  With this issue, the excitement and espionage gets amped up a bit as both sides start to come apart at the seams trying to control their rivalry as Jon is fooling himself that he has everything under control.

Below is a short sample of what you can expect with this exciting issue of POP KILL!

STRETCH GOALS:
**UPDATED**  The great thing about hitting the campaign total so amazingly early is that we can plan some great STRETCH GOALS.  That's right, more bang for your buck just by helping share around and getting more people involved.  Your pledge goes farther.  Below is the list of new items that will be added to your pledge just by the campaign growing.  All we ask is that you help spread the love and share more!.   As each tier is met, we'll check that box off and push to the next.  Ultimately, we'd love to hit the big tier to get you not only POP KILL #2 but also POP KILL #3!  Let's make it happen!!!!

campaign.story:
Introduction 
I'm Travis Corcoran.  For 20 years I lived in the big city and worked at tech companies. My heat and water came from city utilities.  My food came from the supermarket.
One of our sheep, Elsif, and her daughter.
Seven years ago I moved to a farm in the countryside.  I still work for tech companies (remotely), but now I heat my house with firewood from my forest. I grow my own fruits and vegetables. I make my own bacon, from pigs I raise and butcher.
A sane, possible choice
This project is for people like you - people who live in the city or the suburbs.  Whether you're already convinced that there's a better, more in-touch-with-the-world lifestyle for you in the country, or just want to learn what your options are, this project has the information you need.  
A tomato, fresh from our garden.
The good news is that moving from the city to the country is easier than you think... and it can be a lot more affordable than you think too.  If you have even a modest home in the city or suburbs, you can trade it for a much nicer farm or homestead in the country, with all the conveniences you're used to, at the same price.  I know, because I've done it.  I traded a 1,000 square foot, two bedroom 1950s cookie-cutter house on a postage stamp lot, for a 5,000 square foot, five bedroom recent-construction house...and it came with 40 acres of forest, 16 acres of pasture, and two ponds.
I used to commute in stop-and-go rush-hour traffic and shop at an overpriced supermarket.  Now I work from home, where I eat lamb, pork, beef, eggs, fruit, and vegetables fresh from my farm - all of it higher quality than what I could buy at Whole Foods.
You can do the same. 
A beaver pond on our property. Good land is a lot cheaper than you might expect.
All you need is information
You can move to the countryside, work a good-paying job, see your cost of living drop, and see your quality of life improve. 
Most days half or more of the food we eat comes from the farm. Some days, it hits 100%.
The only tricky part is learning the skills.  When I moved to the country, I didn’t even know what questions to ask. I had to learn thousands of things about tractors, gardens, compost, livestock, and more.  A lot of it the hard way.
Now I've put it all in a book - two books, actually, because there's too much information to fit in one volume.  Absolutely everything you need to know about country living and homesteading, to help you move from the suburbs or city out to the country, and thrive once you're there.
Whether you want to plant orchards and raise livestock, or just want to have a few chickens for eggs, my books will give you everything you need to know.  They'll tell you what equipment and tools you need, and show you the skills to use them. 
We planted an orchard a few years ago. The peach trees are already delivering tons of fruit.
Why this book ?
There are endless books on gardening, farming, and homesteading - I know, I own hundreds of them.  All of them have three failures.
They don’t have sufficient breadth.  One will talk about compost but not gardening. Another will talk about gardening, but not tractors.
They all have blind spots. Especially about the basic stuff. They forget that thousands of things aren't obvious to everyone. The difference between straw and hay, between sweet corn and field corn, discing versus plowing versus rototilling, pastures versus fields, the different kinds of fencing, how utilities differ from the suburbs to the countryside. A book on gardening doesn’t tell you what you really need to know about hoses. A book on firewood might tell you to haul logs with your tractor, but not everything you need to do it safely.
The third failure is the lack of itemized lists and step-by-step instructions.  For every topic that I cover, there's a conversational discussion, but I follow that up with simple checklists, overviews, alternative choices for different price points or enthusiasm levels, and step by step instructions.  I also included dozens of recipes for every vegetable and fruit I grow, and for every part of every animal I raise, from apple cobbler to red wine, from beef fajitas to T bone steak, from Asian fried pork chop cutlets to head cheese and English black pudding. 
If you've never had pesto made from basil picked from your garden minutes earlier, you haven't lived.
This project delivers
This is not "here's what I’m going to do" kickstarter.  I've already written the book.  ...and I’ve done this before.  Three years ago I kickstarted two novels I wrote, released them on time, and went on to win awards for them.  All I need is your help to turn the manuscript into a finished, printed book...and put it in your hands.
You’ll get all the benefit of my experience — including dozens of misadventures, so you can learn from my mistakes.  Broken shear pins, logs jammed in snow blowers, bent tractor buckets, the wrong way to make vineyard trellises, invasive weeds and what not to do with them, trees falling where they shouldn't, broken tractor implements, trespassing neighbors, dogs barking at coyotes, dogs barking at bears, escaped sheep, and pig carcasses falling from great heights. 
Things break. But if you have step-by-step troubleshooting instructions and a list of the right tools, you can fix them and get back to work.
And, of course, I talk about the pros and cons of farmhands, and why I really don't believe the one who told me that the Hopi Indians planted corn seeds 4 feet underground.
Over the last decades millions of people have become more interested in gardening, ethically raised meat, becoming more self-sufficient, and having a lifestyle that doesn't feel consumerist, fake, and constrained. I’m guessing you’re one of them. Whatever your dream of living in the country is like - a small vegetable garden, eating home made bacon in an off-grid compound, or just having a bigger house than you have now and heating it with a wood burning stove - I'll tell you everything you need to know to plan realistically, and how to make your move to your country dream home a success. 
Heating with wood warms you three times: once when you log the trees, once when you stack firewood, and once when your burn it.
Collaborative writing and early access
In these crazy times, a lot of people are looking for information RIGHT NOW.  It's my intention to share early drafts of the book, and invite conversation with the first 300 backers.  You'll get access to the content immediately, to help you make decisions about your own life in summer 2020 and beyond.
The books
I expect the finished project to be around 1,000 pages of information - 800 pages of text, and 200 pages of photos, though that ratio could change based on a lot of factors.  I've already written almost 700 pages of text.
The book is split across two volumes because no printer can bind 1,000 pages, but this is, in essence, one large book.
The books will be professionally printed.  The trade paperbacks will be 6" x 9".  The hardcover books will be the same size and have dust jackets.  Pictures will be black and white (though all hard copies come with complimentary ebook versions which will have color photos).
Stretch Goals
The problem with writing 800 pages is not coming up with enough material to fill it all - it's deciding what to prune (because longer books cost more to print).
As stretch goals, I'll add extra content. 
There's no party like a farm party. Especially when you roast a pig and serve it with a variety of sides and four different BBQ sauces.

$ 15k - feast recipes #1: how to throw a pig roast for 50 friends

updates.update_content:
95% of orders placed
At this point my scripts have injected all orders for both trade paperbacks at hardcovers for all customers in the US, Canada, Belgium, Brazil, Austria, Chile, Israel, New Zealand, Hungary, Russia, Singapore, the United Arab Emirates, Thailand, South Africa, Mexico, Ireland, Japan, the Dominican Republic, Hong Kong, the Netherlands, Poland, Sweden, and Finland.

There are a few countries that are served by local Amazon websites: Australia, France, the UK, and Germany, and I have not yet placed orders for delivery to these countries.  I need to investigate to see if the money saved on import duties and shipping by sending these orders via the local amazon affiliates instead of from the American Amazon.com is worth the extra labor extending the screen scraping tool I wrote.  I hope to drive this project to completion (one way or the other) and inject all such orders next weekend.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping in Progress!
updates.update_content: My script is driving the browser, placing order after order after order of author copies at Amazon.com !

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping has started!
updates.update_content:
I've received proof copies of Escape the City in both trade and hardcover, and also of the Aristillus novels in hardcover, and they all look good.

This morning I sat down at my desk and fired up my tool that contacts Amazon and places orders.  The good news is that we got two orders shipped!  The bad news is that Amazon has a lot of security checks in place, and after the first two orders were placed, wanted me to re-verify my credit card number (quite reasonable).  In the process of fixing my script to do this additional step (plus other security steps that Amazon sometimes - but not always - adds), I kept getting 2FA phone calls to verify that it was really me ... and after 10 or 12 of these, I "used up" all of my Amazon confirmations for the day.

updates.update_userinfo: Locking addresses; shipping to start soon
updates.update_content:
Life on the homestead
I spent the weekend fighting invasive species (Japanese knotweed and bittersweet vine), and topping up raised beds with compost / loam mix.

I've mentioned it on twitter, but perhaps not here: one of our first year ewes (a small girl) somehow got knocked up last fall (often it doesn't happen until their second year), and delivered the tiniest lamb I've ever seen.  Without exaggerating, this fella was kitten sized when he was born...and now he's the size of a small cat.

updates.update_userinfo: Dropbox invite
updates.update_content:
Life on the homestead
Spring is here, and we're buried in work.  Last weekend I took down a dead tree, spread dirt to fill in some huge ruts (converting an old garden patch back into lawn), spread more dirt (filled in some holes left by stump removal in order to create a small area for my wife that we're calling "willow park" because she planted a willow tree next to the catchement pond), stretched some cross fencing in front pasture to improve our pasture rotation schedule with the sheep, etc.
Project status: ebooks

updates.update_userinfo: Almost ready to ship
updates.update_content:
Life on the farm
I've had an exciting few weeks - five baby lambs were born, we had one breach birth which necessitated wrestling a 150 lb ewe (with the head and one foreleg of her lamb hanging out of her birth canal) into the back seat of the sedan, and racing to the vet (they saved the mom but lost the kid), and after a week of walking around in shorts, we're now in the middle of a late spring snow storm.

updates.update_userinfo: Formatting is 99% done; printing is very soon
updates.update_content:
I told you you'd get the next update in early April, but I'm jumping the gun a bit and sending it a week or so early.

The last three weeks have gone by quickly, but very very productively.

I've been tackling post-production, which is - broadly speaking - layout.  ...but there's a lot to that.  I'm doing all of the layout programatically, which means that I'm writing scripts to do the work for me.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goals
Story 
Spring 1873 - Colman Cooper heads West with his wife Pearl and son Isaiah on their way to new beginnings in San Francisco. The hopes and dreams awaiting them at journey's end are foremost in their minds as the wagon train sets out from Independence, Missouri. But the perils of the trail to California are many and exacts a heavy toll. 
Falling behind the wagon train, they decide to take a southerly route to avoid the winter weather. They're deep in the Nevada territory when this decision proves disastrous as they're forced to ground by a deadly blizzard. 
When the storm breaks, Colman spies a town on the horizon, or is it two towns? Colman knows it's their only chance and he heads out to get help. The Cooper family is forced to seek refuge in Dugganville where they  become stranded at the worst possible time.  The town is host to a deadly annual contest that has attracted a collection of thieves and killers from far and wide. Without his good wife's counsel Colman finds his way into Lead City. 
Pitted against seven deadly fighters, Colman must find a way to outlast his adversaries in the anything goes, tooth and nail battle for survival. Who will win the richest prize in the West? A raven-haired pistolera with a penchant for lullabies. A jack Mormon looking for redemption. A Nepali man-of-war with a legendary blade. An Aussie sporting a mean Irish brogue and a chip on his shoulder. A Confederate guerrilla looking for a fortune. A Buffalo Soldier looking for revenge and a Shaolin Monk looking for a challenge. Ten thousand dollars goes to the best. 
Before Deadwood, Before Tombstone, Before Durango there was Lead City.
CAST 
WHO WILL LOVE LEAD CITY?
Fans of Jonah Hex, The Magnificent Seven, Unforgiven, & Smokin’ Aces will definitely dig Lead City. 
THE CREATIVE TEAM
Eric Borden - Writer
A writer of both comics and screenplays, Eric is most well-known for his Alterna Comics series, Scrimshaw. Along with Lead City upcoming comic titles for Eric include WinterSpring and Scrimshaw: Battle for Flower Palace. Eric currently lives in Atlanta, Georgia with his wife, son and one shameless Chihuahua. 

Kyle Brummond - Artist
Kyle Brummond is an award winning graphic designer, artist and founder of Splatter Comics. Kyle's first love has always been the sequential storytelling in comic books.  Along with Lead City upcoming comic titles from Kyle include the ongoing series Flesh or Blood and the cyberpunk, horror, thriller  Road Rage.  Kyle resides in Las Vegas Nevada with his wife and daughter.
 Want a Preview of Lead City #1? 
 Cover

Variant Cover

The Kickstarter Campaign: June 30th – July 30th
Kickstarter Funds Received: August 14th
Lead City #1 Files to Printer: Mid August
Book Manufacturing and Freight: Early to Mid Sept
Expected Delivery to Backers: Late Sept to Early Oct
SHIPPING
All rewards will ship in a Gemini Comics Mailer to ensure their safe delivery. 
THANK YOU
Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. We hope you'll support in any way that you can. Of course this is not limited to lending us your economic backing. If you're willing, any help you might give us in promoting our book on your social media platform would prove mighty beneficial to helping us reach our goal. You never know who might like Lead City.

Illustrators. Stop Starving. Start Thriving. 
Discover how you can turn your art skills into your own thriving career in Illustration. 
FACT: Being an Illustrator is tough!
You have hopes and dreams to make it big as an artist; but you don't know how to make it happen. Still, you push along doing the best that you can. Yet, as you move forward you can't help but feel stress & anxiety about the future. "Will I actually succeed with my art?" "Is it even possible to find an art career that will pay my bills and  fulfill me creatively?" To make things worse, you sometimes cave into your fears because of social distancing and/or your past.
Well, listen up! If you want to earn a solid living with your art skills, if you want to be recognized for your brand/content, or if you simply want to land your dream art job, then you need to read what I'm going to say...


Stop doubting! Your successful career in illustration is possible. I've written a guide to help you make it happen. 
These may be BOLD words from a stranger - Why can I make you this promise?


My name is Will Terry and I am a successful  illustrator. - I’ve illustrated over 30 children’s books for publishers like Scholastic, Penguin Random House, and Simon Schuster. I co-founded the wildly popular illustration podcast - 3 point perspective. I co-founded SVSLEARN.com with Jake Parker and Lee White where we teach illustrators all over the world. I’ve created a thriving comic convention brand. I taught illustration and business practices for 9 years at UVU. I’ve been giving entrepreneurial advice on my popular YouTube channel  for over 10 years!
The point is, I've made my own successful illustration career. I, along with 12 other award winning illustrators, will show you how to make yours.

 What They Don't Teach You In Art School is a guide to help you create new opportunities using your art skills to pay the bills, even if you have no prospects right now. 
In this BEAUTIFUL 300-page fully illustrated hard cover book; you're going to learn:
Industry Insights
You will learn the most relevant professional practices I use in my career to this date. To name a few: How to find clients, how to price effectively and close deals, how to figure out which industry your art is best suited for, how to correctly invoice, industry mistakes you should avoid, and more...
This means you will be fully prepared to find and secure the right opportunities that will fulfill you creatively and pay you fairly.

How To Land Your Dream Art Job
For some of you, landing that nice prestigious illustration job at a famous company like Disney, Riot games, or DreamWorks is your dream. In this guide you will learn how to network effectively, how to get yourself & your art noticed, how to nail an interview, and much more.
This means that you will have a competitive edge over all the other illustrators out there trying to get the top jobs in your industry.

How To Get Freelance Work
For those of you looking for the thrill of freelancer life, I've got you covered. You will learn how to get the best freelance work, how to get your work discovered to attract more clients, how to correctly structure your portfolio, best practices to follow as a freelancer, and more…
This means that you will be able to create the freelance work-hard/play-hard lifestyle you want, earn a living, and still have time for conventions and games.

How To Create Your Own Brand
As artists, what we want most is to be known for our accomplishments and abilities. In this guide, you will learn how to combine your talents and establish your own personal brand; what it takes to get your brand off the ground, and how to get your brand to scale.
This means you will have the groundwork to expand your influence so you can gain the recognition & wealth you desire.

How To Create Your Own Products/Services
Some of you have always wanted to create your own games/products/services and sell them online via Kickstarter, Shopify, or Amazon. In this guide, you will learn how to start your own line of products/services, how to fail fast & improve, and how to sell your products/services profitably.
Understanding & applying the lessons from this section means you will be on the fastest road to 6+ figures.

How to Develop The Successful Illustrator Mentality
You will learn how to think like a successful illustrator and see the world as yours to make & create. You will develop a growth mindset that will enable you to try hard things and accomplish great feats.
This means that you will be able to see opportunities that you weren't previously able to see and you'll have the courage to reach out and grab them.

And so much more...
 How you are going to get the biggest bang for your buck by backing this guide today. 
30+ years of experience, industry insights, and advice from 13 award winning illustrators who have all been in the trenches and climbed to success; the information in this book is worth thousands. You could spend an entire academic career at an art university and still not even come close to learning the gems that are in this guide. 
Luckily, this isn't art school so you won't have to take out student loans to get access to this valuable information. For this Kickstarter only, I am going to give you access to a massive discount. 
I'll give you one copy of "What They don't Teach in Art School" for the price of $29 for a soft cover or $39 for a hard cover. 
The invaluable knowledge of how to monetize your art skills and craft your own successful career all for a fraction of the cost of student loans, housing, text books, and Tuition. This deal lasts only for the duration of the Kickstarter. It will go back to full price afterwards. Claim your guide at a massive discount today!
Soft Cover
Hard Cover


So What? Why should I care? 
The vast majority of artists out there have the art skills to earn a living, but they have no clue how to monetize their skills; so they starve. Artists just assume that if they don't have any opportunities to make money with their art now; they will never have any opportunities in the future. This is false. They just lack the understanding of how to apply their art.
What They don't Teach in Art School gives artists the edge they need to go out there and make a successful career for themselves. 
If you personally apply the principles in this book:
* You'll learn how to establish a career where you are both earning a living and creatively fulfilled.
* You'll learn where to spend your time to get your career off the ground and save a lot of money in the long run.
* You'll skip past mistakes and obstacles that inexperienced illustrators make in the industry today.
* You won't have to listen to that naysayer in your life, you know the one, and instead you'll take life into your own hands.
* You'll be recognized for your own content and your own brand.
* You won't have to be afraid of the future and instead look at it as your oyster.
Fear is a tough thing to shrug off. It paralyzes you from head to toe; preventing you from taking the necessary steps towards success. The greatest source of fear is the anxiety of not knowing how your future will play out. But let me clue you in on a secret, the future is yours to decide. You have what it takes! Decide to make your future a bright one. I wrote this guide to help illustrators, like you, to succeed in the most challenging time of your life. It's going to take work, there are no shortcuts, but there are open highways.
- Will Terry

If you have any further questions, feel free to ask me personally.

Hi, I'm Robert A. Multari, but you can call me Rob. It’s been my dream since I was a kid, struggling with Attention Deficit Disorder and Dyslexia, to be in the comic book business. Comic books helped me learn how to deal with my learning disability. When I was 14-years-old, I wrote fan fiction for the X-Men and submitted it to Marvel in hopes that Stan Lee would read it. Someone from Marvel was nice enough to write back to me saying that Stan loves to hear from his fans and encouraged me to keep up my writing. As naive as I was at the time, it spread my passion for the business like a wild fire and inspired me to go to art school at Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, where I graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Applied Media Arts. I have been working on Night Wolf since I was 16-years-old. The story and the characters have grown up with me, evolving into the amazing tale that it is today.
Why a werewolf comic book? Well, I have always loved any werewolf or supernatural related entertainment in movies, video games, etc. I didn't feel like there were any comic books out there doing werewolves any justice, so I decided to make a comic book based on a werewolf anti-hero myself. In high school, after I started developing Night Wolf, I got into Werewolf: The Apocalypse is a role-playing game by White Wolf Publishing.  I love the artwork in the game guides so much that I longed for them to put out a comic book to build on their world. Unfortunately, it never happened, but the artwork heavily influenced how I like my werewolves should look in my comics.
Carlos Herrera is a Professional illustrator residing in Santiago City, Chile. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Chilean home but from abroad as well. Carlos specializes in heroic fantasy illustrations, comic book illustrations, and educational illustrations for schoolbooks. Carlos's talent stretches across various types of media and color illustration. He uses both traditional media meaning pencil, watercolor, graphite, acrylic, and more as well as digital media in use of a Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Carlos graduated from Arcos Institute with the highest marks possible. For a long period of time Carlos was an active member of the Illustrator staff for the Salo S.A. Company's trading card game "Myths and Legends". Carlos is the illustrator for Night Wolf Issue 4. He also did the Night Wolf character designs, the full spread cover and the first 5 pages of issue 1, the illustration for the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover, and did all the art for the variant cover for issue 3 featuring Snow Paw.
Gat Melvyn is a digital colorist living in Johannesburg, South Africa. He has a Bachelor of Arts in Motion Picture Medium. He has done coloring work for Big Dog Ink and Image Comics. Gat is taking on the role of colorist for the Night Wolf series, starting with issue 3.  He is also the colorist on the Keystone Comic Con Exclusive Night Wolf Issue 1 Cover and the rare variant cover for Night Wolf Issue 4, penciled by Chris Williams and the new very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 2, illustrated by Vincenzo Sansone.
Oscar Choquecota Ale is a professional illustrator residing in Lima, Perú. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Peruvian home but from abroad as well. Oscar specializes in heroic, fantasy, anime, and comic book illustrations as well as video game concept development. Oscar's talent stretches across various types of media and color  illustration. His digital media tools of trade is a Wacom Tablet and  Adobe Photoshop. Oscar, owner of Bokuman Studio, is an illustrator with over 10 years experience. Oscar is the illustrator of Night Wolf Issues 1 - 3.
Ross A. Campbell is a Professional Digital Colorist residing in Elgin, Scotland. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his native home in the United Kingdom, but from abroad as well. Ross has had no formal art school training, but is self-taught with an unbelievably natural eye for colors, lighting, and shadow creating amazing depth of space within the 2D realm. He has been in the business for over 5 years primarily working as a comic book colorist, with the occasional full illustration job. Ross's works include mostly the fantasy genre, but also dabbles in other genres as well. His color weapons of choice are the Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Some of Ross's clientele include DC, Action Lab, Image, Dynamite, Aspen, Top Cow, Sideshow, Zenescope, PKMM Entertainment, and Scout Comics. Ross did the colors for Night Wolf Issue 1 where Carlos left off, and he also colored the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover.
Chris Williams is a comic artist, writer and creator. After earning his BA in Animation & Media Arts in 2008 from the Art Institute of Philadelphia, Chris has sold many commissioned & contracted works locally and internationally. Some of his notable published works include cover art for Big Dog Ink (BDI)'s "Critter" & "Penny For Your Soul", Kenzer & Co.'s “Knights of The Dinner Table”, Markosia's "Geek-Girl", Source Point Press' "Salvagers" & "Franklin & Ghost", as well as promotional art for award-winning photographer, Nick Saglimbeni and his SlickForce Girl site. Chris is currently working on his creator owned comic series, "SUMMONS", among other upcoming indie titles. Chris is the illustrator of the Keystone Comic Con exclusive cover of Night Wolf Issue 1 and the rare variant cover for Night Wolf Issue 4.
Joseph Schmalke is a comics creator, writer, and illustrator residing in Westbrook, Maine. Joe is the writer/artist on several horror comics— including THE ELECTRIC BLACK, THE CALAMITOUS BLACK DEVILS, THE INFERNAL PACT, and CHERRY BLACKBIRD. He is also the writer and co-creator of the role-playing dark comedy MURDER HOBO. A lifelong lover of comic books and horror movies, he has worked behind the scenes in film and tv but has always focused on making the type of books that he loves to read— full of dark humor and dark themes. You can find his work featured on variant covers for Image comics, Boom! studios, Vault comics, IDW, Mad Cave, and Scout comics.  You will also find his artwork on Exclusive Marvel and FYE t-shirts, Super 7 /Killer Bootlegs’ card art, and A Sound of Thunder’s IT WAS METAL graphic novel anthology. Joseph is the artist of the new limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 1.
Conor Hughes's breakout work has been the popular Kickstarter comic White Ash. Previous to that he was one of the winners of the Millarworld art contest as well as being published in the Anthology Graphic Canon and Twisted Savage Dragon Funnies. You can troll him on twitch where he can often be found making comics as well as Hopewell NJ, with his amazing wife and giggle monster baby girl. Conor is the artist of a new limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 4.
Sean Forney is an eighteen year professional illustrator/comic book artist currently working on cover art for Lady Death (Coffin Comics), Marvel Premier sketch cards (Upper Deck), DudeBro (Spicy Pulp Comics), Lyaxia (Alcyone Studios), and his creator-owned comic Scarlet Huntress. Sean also works as a colorist for Counterpoint Comics for multiple titles including Tiggomverse, Hardlee Thinn, Notti & Nyce, Savage Eve, and Do You Pooh? Published cover work includes Vampirella Red Sonja (Dynamite), Totally Rad Wars (Totally Rad), Pestilence (Aftershock), Franklin & Ghost (SourcePoint Press), Bloodstrike (Image), Go West (Alterna), TMNT (IDW), and Back to the Future (IDW). Cover and interior work can be seen in Lark’s Killer, Black Flame Archives, Lord of Gore, and Zen: Intergalactic Ninja (Devil’s Due/1First), Delta Dawn (Corgi Press), and multiple titles for Zenescope Entertainment. Sean has also worked on commercial art for Tire Discounters, Red Roof Inn, Cut the Rope (Titan Publishing), Lego, Inc., My Adventures with Spider-Man (Marvel/Identity Direct), and the Bakugan toy line for Spin Master. Sean co-created and self-publishes the Scarlet Huntress series. is the artist of the new limited homage to John Byrne's X-Men 141 variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 2.
Dirk I. Tiede works as a professional artist, illustrator and teacher in the Boston area. He holds a BFA in commercial art from Millikin University, and has been drawing comics for as long as he can remember. Paradigm Shift is his labor of love, his magnum opus. He began it as an online comic in 1999, and was a founding contributor to premium comics portal ModernTales.com. His artwork has been showcased in the books Toon Art: The Graphic Art of Digital Cartooning and Webcomics, appeared the documentary Adventures In Digital Comics, and was featured in Season 3 of NBC’s Heroes. Dirk is the artist of a new limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 4.
Dan Ekis is an American comic artist and writer best known for creating the series Odyssey, Inc. and Soul of the World on Webtoons. He also draws the popular webcomic Tested for the New York Department of Health AIDS Institute YGetIt? Project. The comic has been featured on Webtoons. Dan currently works as a freelance illustrator doing commissions for various clients from his studio in Pittsburgh. He studied animation at Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, where he received a B.F.A. in Applied Media Arts. Dan is the artist of the very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 1.
Vincenzo Sansone is an illustrator from in Pisa, Italy. He has a BA in Italian Literature at the University of Pisa and a professional degree at International School of Comics. He’s been working for several publishers such as Approbation Comics, Dead Canary Comics, Interweb comics, Moonstone books and Evoluzione publishing. Vincenzo is the artist of the very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 2.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm a relatively new creator and Night Wolf is my first comic book series. In April of 2016, I launched a failed Kickstarter campaign for Night Wolf Issues 1-3. I played the game on hard, setting a $20,000 goal. However, I did manage to raise $5,064 from my 74 backers, unfortunately Kickstarter is all or nothing. At the time I only had the character designs, a cover and 5 sequential pages during that launch. Even though the Kickstarter didn’t fund I was bound and determined to publish my story. Because I didn’t have the funds to finish the first issue, I decided to raise the money on my own doing freelance web design work to pay for the artwork. 

After self-publishing Night Wolf Issues 1 and 2, I launched another Kickstarter in October 2019 to print Night Wolf Issues 3 with a more reasonable funding goal of $5,000. The campaign successfully over funded, thanks to the amazing 217 backers that I refer to as my Wolf Pack. Now I'm back and ready for round 3 to print Night Wolf Issue 4.

I know it seems like there's a lot going on all over the world right now that is very stressful for us all. Collecting, reading, and creating comics books have always been an escape from the stressful things in my life. My hope is that by creating my comics books and putting them out into the world for you to enjoy also helps to relieve some of your stress as well. And that is what I am laser focused on doing!

In addition, I have been educating myself through the Comixlaunch course, which is a Kickstarter training program created by Tyler James. Tyler is the Publisher of ComixTribe and has successfully funded over 17 Kickstarter campaigns. Through the ComixLaunch community I have also been a part of a ComixLaunch Mastermind group of independent creators that have all ran successful campaigns in the past, and I've spent time learning and being mentored by them.

updates.update_userinfo: What Are Your Thoughts?
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon my Wolf Pack! I hope you are having a great start to your week!
Yesterday, I sent out an update to the Night Wolf Volume 1 Kickstarter pack members informing them that my printer rep, Sam, estimates that the books won't be ready to ship from the printer until the end of April. The reason being is that a custom book like the die cut hard cover is going to take more time and attention. Since the Night Wolf Volume 1 trade paperback fulfillment is behind schedule, it is also throwing off my Night Wolf Issue 5 (a Spring launch) and Snow Paw Issue 1 (a Summer launch) Kickstarter dates as well. If you recall from my last update the Night Wolf Issue 5 prelaunch page is already live, and the issue is almost finished. Below is a Wolf Pack member exclusive sneak peek of the finished Night Wolf Issue 5 cover by Carlos Herrera! As you can imagine from seeing this amazing cover, I am super excited to get this book out into your hands as soon as possible.

updates.update_userinfo: Night Wolf Issue 5 Updates & Sneak Peeks!
updates.update_content:
Happy Werewolf Wednesday and St. Patrick's Day my Wolf Pack!

Fear not, I work well under pressure! I've been trying to keep busy while I wait for the Night Wolf Volume 1 trade paperbacks to arrive from the printer. Otherwise, I would drive myself crazy.
