campaign.story:
The Tutorials Books
How to THINK when you DRAW volumes 1 -3  are each 200 page full colour hardback books measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The books collect together MASSES of my drawing tutorials, covering an enormous range of subjects. The series is EXTREMELY user-friendly, designed to benefit every skill level, from the absolute beginner to the seasoned professional. BOOKS 1 and 2 have previously raised over a million dollars on Kickstarter, with volume 2 becoming THE MOST SUCCESSFUL ART BOOK OF ALL-TIME on KICKSTARTER. Both volume 1 and 2 have been completely sold out since our last campaign. BOOK 3 is BRAND NEW and being launched exclusively here. These books will NOT be available ANYWHERE ELSE ONLINE OR IN SHOPS outside of Kickstarter for at least the next two years - they are ONLY AVAILABLE ON KICKSTARTER. The tutorials are better seen than described, so GO HERE FOR 300 FREE TUTORIALS.
The Deluxe Collection TRILOGY
The Deluxe Collection Parts 1 - 3  are each 600 page softcover black and white books measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The artwork is divided into chapters themed around character design, pose and gesture sheets, monsters, robots, concept vehicles, environment design, world building and much more. Each book features THOUSANDS of illustrations.
The Art of Stranski reprint
The Art of Stranski is a 100 page full colour hardback book measuring 12" by 8.5". The book has raised over £90,000 in Kickstarter campaigns and has been sold out for 12 months. We're offering you another chance to get it. This book will NOT be available ANYWHERE ELSE ONLINE OR IN SHOPS outside of Kickstarter for at least the next TWO YEARS - it is EXCLUSIVELY ONLY AVAILABLE HERE ON KICKSTARTER. To learn all about the book, just visit THE ORIGINAL STRANSKI CAMPAIGN HERE.
The WRITING Tutorials Book 
How to THINK when you WRITE is my brother Robin's 200 page full colour hardback book measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The book gathers together two years of writing tutorials, tackling an enormous range of subjects. Created as a companion to the How to THINK when you DRAW series, the vast array of subjects are designed to benefit creators of all skill levels, from writers wrangling their first plot to the seasoned scribe. The book raised over £300,000 on Kickstarter last year, and has been sold out ever since. This book will NOT be available ANYWHERE ELSE ONLINE OR IN SHOPS this year - it is ONLY AVAILABLE ON KICKSTARTER. These tutorials are better seen than described, so GO HERE FOR 175 FREE WRITING TUTORIALS.
Shipping costs
For UK customers there is a small postal charge. If you live outside the UK you'll need to add a shipping cost when you pledge, as detailed when you click the pledge boxes. I'm sorry it's expensive, but these books are HEAVY. The top tiers especially are exceptionally heavy, and will be shipped in dual packages, in order to better protect your books.
A huge thank you for taking the time to watch the video and check out the campaign, you can find out more about me and my work HERE.
Now just scroll down to choose your rewards...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've had a great deal of experience with both publishers and printers from working on the many books I've written and illustrated. I've designed and produced books for large publishing houses such as Random House, and also successfully self published many ambitious projects, including six campaigns on Kickstarter, raising over a million pounds to date, and creating THE MOST SUCCESSFUL ARTBOOK OF ALL TIME ON KICKSTARTER. EVERY campaign I've run has been completely delivered on time.

All the artwork for the books in this campaign is finished, and the books are completely laid up. I already have proof copies, so once the campaign ends we can put the books right into production. Then it's just a case of prepping up all the packages in good time ready to ship to you in November.

campaign.story:
"I have waited 43 years to see Cerebus No.1 the way it was supposed to look. Thanks to Sean Michael Robinson and The Waverly Press that wait is now over." 
- Dave Sim, 2020 
Every legend has a beginning…
In December 1977, Deni Loubert published Cerebus No.1, Dave Sim's comic book that followed the adventures of a short-tempered, barbarian Aardvark. Originally conceived as a parody of Barry Windsor-Smith's masterfully illustrated Conan the Barbarian (which was a big hit for Marvel Comics in the 1970's), Sim quickly found his own voice as a storyteller and illustrator, abandoning the typical self-contained, single issue adventures in favor of elaborate story-arcs which would often span dozens of issues.  
Dave Sim at the Forest Heights College Comic Book Convention in Kitchener, Ontario, about a year before Cerebus No. 1 was published. Photo by Max Southall.
The dawn of the 1980's saw the popularity of Dave Sim's Cerebus explode, igniting a revolution among self-motivated artists and storytellers who were looking for ways to go it alone, outside of the corporate structure of the BIG TWO publishers at the time, Marvel and DC Comics. Dave Sim helped pave the way for countless other self-publishers of the day, including Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Bob Burden's Flaming Carrot, Jeff Smith's Bone, and Colleen Doran's A Distant Soil, to name a few... Along the way, Cerebus found its place as one of the most intelligently written, entertaining, and influential comic books of all time! Though the series ended in 2004 with issue No. 300 after more than 6,000 pages of story and art, Cerebus still enjoys an intense and loyal following to this day.  
Due to popularity of Cerebus, original copies of the first issue now command thousands of dollars, putting them out of reach for most collectors. 
The original Cerebus No.1 was printed on newsprint paper and after 43 years, most of the few examples that have survived are typically found in lower grades. This new edition is presented with fully remastered art, prepared by master digital restoration artist Sean Michael Robinson, and will be printed on premium paper for stunning crystal clarity! We are working with one of the best printers in North America to ensure the highest quality reproduction!
RED - 24 Page Standard Edition. The original 24 page comic as it was presented in 1977, with remastered art. It's like owning an original Cerebus No. 1, only cooler!
GOLD - 48 Page Expanded Edition. The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! Limited to the number of advance orders we receive.
PLATINUM - 48 Page Expanded Edition (Signed & Numbered). The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! Each PLATINUM copy is hand Signed & Numbered by Cerebus creator Dave Sim! Limited to the number of advance orders we receive. NOTE: Aardvark-Vanaheim "Cerebus Archive" patrons can specify their unique Cerebus Archive number for the Signed & Numbered platinum edition. 
PROOF EDITIONS - These are proof copies produced for final internal review by Dave Sim, Sean Michael Robinson and the Publisher. These final stage pre-production proofs that we are offering represent the culmination of all the work that went into developing the "Expanded Cerebus" No. 1. This is our way of sharing the experience of the final stage of production with Cerebus readers who will receive the exact same copies we will be reviewing before the book goes to press. 
RED (proof) - 24 Page standard Edition (50 Numbered Copies). The original 24 page story with remastered art, just like the original book as it was published in 1977, only better! NOTE: These 50 examples are the only 24 page "Standard Edition" remastered copies that will ever be offered with the original $1 cover price. The final production books will come with a $10 retail cover price! 
RED (proof) - 48 Page Expanded Edition (50 Numbered Copies). The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! NOTE: These 50 examples are the only 48 page "Expanded Edition" copies that will ever be offered with RED flames! 
 If you are already a collector of Cerebus, this edition will rank with the crown jewels of your collection. If you are new to Cerebus, this is the perfect way to get introduced to this classic series, from the moment where it all began... 
 MANY sincere thanks to everyone who has supported or will be supporting this project in it’s final week. We put our heads together with Dave Sim to offer all of you a wide range of exciting Cerebus No. 1 collectibles!
Everything below is available to all backers who pledged for the $10 physical book and up... The price of the first item includes any additional packing and shipping costs, with discounts on the 2nd item and up... Perhaps you own a comic shop, or you like to hoard for a rainy day, for those of you we are offering bundles of 10 of everything at a deep discount.
To add any of these items to your existing pledge, simply click the "manage your pledge" button at the top of this page and manually add the additional amount (on top of your existing pledge amount) based on the prices below. When you fill out your backer report at the end of the campaign, be sure to note what extras you added to your pledge.
You are free to add as many as you want of each item (unless noted otherwise). NOTE: The “Stretch Goal” items, Pins, and Posters are being produced exclusively for this Cerebus No. 1 project, based on the number of orders received. None of these items will be widely distributed or reprinted.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We completed all of our work ahead of time and have proofed everything in advance. Our primary challenge is the COVID-19 virus which has the potential to slow down or delay manufacturing and delivery chains. As of the launch our printer and postal service remain open and we expect to remain on schedule but will send out regular updates during production. We have listed a much longer shipping window just in case there are printing and shipping disruptions. However, we plan to go to print in June and get all orders shipped in July so long as everything remains open. NOTE: Orders shipping outside of the United States may see extended shipping delays. In the event that postal delivery services are temporarily halted in any country, we will hold your package until normal shipping resumes. Every person who pledges will receive their package!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Standard cover by Afro Samurai's Takashi Okazaki. Trade dress not final.
DEADSKINS! 1 & 2 is a 64-page, perfect bound comic book collecting the first two issues of the series critics call:
DEADSKINS! was the first graphic novel we ever created, and it was serialized on our website from 2013-2014. The full story clocks in at 5 issues, roughly 30 pages each. 
We're remastering this book 2 issues at a time, darkening the lines to improve print quality and bring out the beauty of our black, white, and red production. 
Here's the pitch:
"A Harvard-educated dandy and his blind, drunk companion are all that stand between the Old West and an Undead Apocalypse. This is the true story of Custer's Last Stand... whatever they taught you in school is bullsh!t." 
In addition to the 64-page, perfect bound book, backers get: 
Credit inside the book
Exclusive digital bonuses
FREE U.S. SHIPPING!
 WANT TO TRY BEFORE YOU BUY?
No problem! Here's a 9-page preview:
We're keeping our rewards pretty simple this go 'round. But in addition to our main cover by Afro Samurai's Takashi Okazaki, we have... 
THE BEN TEMPLESMITH VARIANT 
And if you missed any of our other campaigns for RED XMAS or PBOW, you can catch up with our ...
Box of Fries 
More details below...
NOTE ABOUT THE TIME PERIOD
DEADSKINS! takes place in the Wild West, and as such, some characters--particularly the villains--express attitudes that seem outdated today. We think our readers are smart enough to know that we aren't condoning these things, but we also know that in 2020, some people don't want to read about it. So: fair warning. 
There's also donkey-f*cking.
FRIED Comics is a proud purveyor of offbeat, irreverent pulp fiction since 2013, and a labor of love for Clay Adams and Alexandre O. Philippe.
So far, we have seven successful Kickstarters under our belts. (And between us we have a lot of belts. ) So, we're stoked to return to the scene of the crime.
Clay is a writer and filmmaker who's funded seven projects on Kickstarter with FRIED Comics. His feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards, and his latest comic, ELECTRIC YOUTH, co-written with Kyle Roberts, was recently featured in the LA Times. He has written and directed for television and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU. When Clay first met Alexandre, he thought, "My, what a sophisticated European." Boy, was he wrong!
Film nerd/director Alexandre's most recent documentary is LEAP OF FAITH: WILLIAM FRIEDKIN ON THE EXORCIST. He holds a Masters Degree in Dramatic Writing from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and has written and directed numerous award-winning films and documentaries, including MEMORY: THE ORIGINS OF ALIEN, 78/52: HITCHCOCK'S SHOWER SCENE, AND THE PEOPLE vs. GEORGE LUCAS. When Alexandre first met Clay, he thought, "My, what a stupid American." Boy, was he right!
Leila is a comic book artist and writer living in Portland, Oregon. She draws SLEEPLESS, SHUTTER and writes AFAR at Image Comics. Leila has drawn for titles such as THE WICKED + THE DIVINE, SCARLET WITCH, AMERICAN VAMPIRE, and THE PANTHEON PROJECT. In 2015 and 2016, Leila was nominated for the Russ Manning Promising Newcomer Award for her work on SHUTTER. She only took this job because she thought she'd be paid in fries.
Brett Nienburg is a Denver-based artist who has worked as a concept artist for LEGO and  designed sets for feature films. We're sorry we made him peel so many potatoes. He looks pretty sad about it.
Charles is from Canada, so we imagine he looks like one of those flappy-headed dudes from South Park.* He has lettered books for Aftershock, Image, IDW and Top Shelf (among others) and is a founding member of Frozen Beach Studios. (*As far as we know, Charles has a normal-looking head.) 
Ugh. Just... ugh.
The Package
We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.
You pay premium prices on Kickstarter, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:
These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.
And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?
Frieda will replace it free of charge.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
PLAY

We are coming to Kickstarter to put the first two issues into print. The book is 100% complete, our printer is still operating as an essential business, and we are ready to deliver quickly. We just need YOU to make it a reality.
All funds from this campaign will go to:
Printing rewards
Shipping them to you
Anything above our goal goes towards making more comics
Image copyright Can Stock Photo / pressmaster
THE TIMELINE
The Kickstarter Campaign: 23 days (Apr 29-May 22)
Kickstarter Funds Released: ~June 15
Digital Rewards Released: ~June 15
Book Goes to Printer: ~June 15
Book Printed and shipped to us ~June 30
Pack and ship - ~July 1
Expected delivery to US backers - 2 Weeks (Early July)
Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (late July)
 THANKS, HON!
We're not asking for a million dollars.
We just want to put a cool book in your hand and entertain you for a bit during these crazy times.
So find a pledge level you like and pre-order. We'll make more comics.
Oh! And finally:
We heard somewhere that Kickstarter campaigns do better when they have pictures of cats on the page. So, here's a picture of Clay's cat:
"Don't just stand there... refill it."
Thanks for supporting! And remember...

campaign.story:
Hey everyone, and welcome back to our 13th Kickstarter. Yes, the bakers dozen of Kickstarters. We are so excited to get the oppertunity to distract you all from the madness going in in the world and offer you our latest campaign! The crew at PAPERFILMS has put together an exciting new project that we think you will love.  Featuring some of the top talent in the field to present to you our 40 page first issue of an ADULTS ONLY comic mini-series called POP KILL ! 
Interior Art by Juan SantaCruz and Brian Reber
Written by JIMMY [ Painkiller Jane, Harley Quinn, Jonah Hex ] PALMIOTTI and DAVE [ 100 Bullets, Red Son ] JOHNSON and illustrated by the amazing JUAN [ Painkiller Jane, Twilight Experiment ] SANTACRUZ with colors by BRIAN [ X-Men, Bloodshot ] REBER, lettering by SEAN [ Aliens, Aliens vs Predator ] KONOT and the brilliant design by John J Hill , the man responsible for so many great projects there are too many to list, but for the PAPERFILMS projects, he designed the PAINKILLER JANE Hardcover and the KILLING TIME IN AMERICA hardcover.
THE STORY:
Imagine a world where the two dominant and competing Cola companies, each worth billions, are owned by former Siamese twins who are now separated and have grown to hate each other so much they hire assassins, saboteurs, and espionage personnel to meddle with each other on a daily basis.  This is the story about brotherly love run afoul, and the people they enlist to do their dirty work.
Meet the beautiful DINA DELUX, a scientist in the Fizz division at POPSO COLA. She's on the verge of creating a formula that will make soda 50% fizzier, keeping it carbonated longer than any other brand on the market. A breakthrough like this would put all the competition out of business in a heartbeat.
When Popso's main rival FIZZ ONE COLA hear the rumors about the discovery, they activate their best man, JON PYLE, an oversexed mercenary, to take care of the situation. His orders are to convince Dina to switch sides, and if that fails, to eliminate her. However, after they meet the attraction is undeniable and a third option kicks in, one which triggers repercussions from BOTH sides.
Each book you buy will come with an official CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY pictured below with a variety of reward tiers consisting of 4 different covers being offered of issue 1 of POP KILL. 
UPDATE:  CONGRATS, STRETCH GOALS!!
We hit the second goal and below are the new stretch goals we hopefully hit over the remaining campaign days! As we hit each one, everyone that backed this Kickstarter will enjoy the extra benefits!
Stretch Goal $52k

campaign.story:
Saint Louis, Missouri, 1920. Prohibition, the Constitutional ban on the sale of alcohol in the United States, comes into effect.... And business couldn't be better at the Little Daisy Cafe.
But things aren't what they seem. Atlas May, proprietor, uses the charming little restaurant as a front for his real cash cow; the Lackadaisy speakeasy, where flashing the club symbol from a deck of cards grants everykitty in-the-know access to more moonshine than they could ever drink. Life is good... Until Atlas is murdered in cold blood.
Now, it's 1927. Mitzi, Atlas' widow, struggles to keep Lackadaisy afloat, as the patrons drift away and a skeleton crew of staff sticks by her side. Scrappy young musician/rum-runner Rocky Rickaby, his wide-eyed but tightly-wound cousin Freckle McMurray, and the endlessly resourceful and sharp-tongued Ivy Pepper, heiress to the quickly-dwindling Lackadaisy fortune, are forced to make do in a world of increasingly unfriendly competition, intent on shooting, smuggling, and conspiring their way back to a successful bar, against all odds. 
Lackadaisy Cats has been running online since 2006, immersing its readership in a world of sepia-toned crime, adventure, action, and comedy. And now, it's ready for its next big move... to a screen near you.
Why a cartoon? Why now?
There's never been more interest in adult animation, with shows like Bojack Horseman, Big Mouth, and Primal capturing the attention and imaginations of millions of viewers. 
Lackadaisy is an exceptional webcomic, but in her mind, Tracy has always pictured it as an animated film. It’s a side effect, perhaps, of a childhood nourished on Looney Tunes, Disney, and Don Bluth features; a dream of sharing that living, breathing, musical version of Lackadaisy with its dedicated readership. But the when-and-how something like that could ever be achieved has always lacked an obvious ingress.
As the 20s dawn upon us again, with new animation tools and techniques available, with talented and excited artists on deck an raring to get to work, and with the internet eager for more independently-created media, the auspiciousness seems writ-large - splashed across an art deco picture palace marquee, if you will. 
Now’s the time.
The Lackadaisy animated short proposes a 10-minute, fun-and-action-filled adventure, full of car chases, shootout, sass, and  un-requested violin solos. And with your help, we can make it happen!
The finished short will be available for everyone to watch!
Meet the people in charge of (and contributing to) the project! 
A former game dev, illustrator and graphic designer, Tracy Butler began Lackadaisy after researching the history of her century-old Saint Louis home, and being inspired by her love of jazz music and 1920s aesthetics. Boasting over 1,600 backers on Patreon, Lackadaisy has been her full-time job for years, garnering a dedicated readership of thousands. As the creator of the comic, Tracy will play a role as co-director on the animated short, as well as overseeing art direction.
Fable Siegel is a veteran animation professional, boasting a resume that includes Titmouse, Starburns, the internet phenomenon Hazbin Hotel, and two Game Grumps Animated shorts, along with storyboard work for Cartoon Network (Ben 10), Stoopid Monkey (Adam Ruins Everything: Reanimated History), Warner Brothers (Wacky Races), Shadow Machine (F is for Family), and more, as well as being a board artist, animator, and designer for Six Point Harness (Like Share Die).  Brought onto the Lackadaisy animated short as a production manager, director, and producer, they'll be overseeing the project utilizing their years of professional experience and skill.
 Our awesome line-up of talent, in no particular order:
 Michael Kovach  (@kovox) as Rocky Rickaby! 
 Belsheber Rusape (@BelRusapeVO) as Calvin "Freckle" McMurray! 
 Lisa Reimold (@lisareimold)  as Ivy Pepper! 
 Ashe Wagner (@TheQueenViking)  as Mitzi May! 
and SungWon Cho (@ProZD) as Mordecai Heller! 
Character Design
Tai (@corvidmonster)

Wondering what awards await you if you decide to back the project? Look no further!
Lackadaisy Essentials is the primary means by which we intend to fund the animated short, and Iron Circus Comics' part in this incredibly ambitious project! Planned as a hardcover volume of about 100 pages, Lackadaisy Essentials contains never-before-published minicomics, one-offs, sketches, and other creative work by Tracy, delving into the world and details of the Lackadaisy webcomic.
 Lackadaisy Volumes 1 & 2 ebooks are the collected Lackadaisy webcomic! Grab the tiers including this reward to read the comic offline at your leisure, at a beautiful, high resolution!
Want to see the finished product in its snazziest, most high-quality form? Back a tier that grants access to an HD download of the finished animated short! The Lackadaisy short will be a fully-polished final product, professionally animated, voice-acted, and scored by musical and animation professionals!
 There's so much that goes into making a cartoon. Storyboards, animatics, a soundtrack, 3D models! Back at the Goodie Bag level and higher to grab all these cool bits 'n' pieces. The perfect backer level for folks who wanna see how the sausage is made. Higher levels even grant special thanks in the credits!
 ALL IN! Really wanna become an indispensable part of the project? Maybe even make animation history? The very highest tiers of support grant in-story cameos, personalized Lackadaisy-sona designs, original art from Tracy and the crew, and MORE. 
 There's something available at practically every level of support!
 $85,000 is the minimum we would need to make sure this one-of-a-kind project comes to fruition. But in case we overfund, we already have some awesome plans to make this Kickstarter even better.

And our final two stretch goals...

Whatever you may decide, thanks for getting this far down the page, and reading all about this new venture! We hope to see you on the other side in 2021, with the very first Iron Circus Animation!

Hi! I’m Ben Bender, a freelance cartoonist who works mostly with all-ages and kid-friendly art and stories. I’m making BEORN: The Littlest Viking Saga, and with your help I'm printing the first issue of this all-ages adventure comedy!
Hardcover Edition!
Hardcover Edition Upgrade Unlocked for all backers receiving stretch goals! 7.5x11 size pages, Case Hardcover
Stretch Goals Unlocked So Far!
Stretch Goals already unlocked include: Printable Coloring Pages, Vinyl Sticker, Signed Art Print, Choice of Bookmark! All available at the "Book+" or higher Tier
Book Upgrades already unlocked include: HARDCOVER EDITION, Larger Page Size, Extra Story Pages, Pinup Art Section, Gold Foil Stamped Cover, Embossing Highlights, and UV Spot Gloss Effect! All available at the "Book+" reward level or higher!
AMAZING Guest Artist Pinups printed in the Hardcover Edition! More artists to be announced!

 This book will print the first chapter of Beorn's saga. In it, readers will be introduced to Beorn, and the fantastical island on which he lives. You will get a first look at the magic (and danger!) that awaits our little Viking. What adventure will find young Beorn as he travels this new land? What mystery? What peril? And will the Littlest Viking be big enough to rise to the challenges that come his way?
This book will be the first 24-page chapter in Beorn's saga. It will be professionally offset printed, saddle-stitched, with full color interior pages on 60# bright white paper, and 80# gloss cardstock for the cover.
We are currently working toward (and through!) Stretch Goals that upgrade the book! Backers at the "Book+" and higher tiers will receive these upgrades. Things like: more story pages, larger size/dimensions, and Hardcover! And there will be more after these are unlocked! Check out the Stretch Goals section to see what we've unlocked so far!
I want to make the most beautiful book possible! This is a labor of passion, and I am working hard to ensure the physical book embodies the love I have for Beorn's story. That is why I am sinking as much of the campaign funds as possible into book upgrades. Things like Case Hardcover, Gold Foil Stamping, Embossing, and Spot Gloss Coating have all be unlocked! As well as extra story pages, and an amazing Guest Artist Pinup Section!
 Check out some free pages HERE.
Beorn is a little viking trying to be a legend in a big world
Beorn knows he will be a legendary warrior any day now. In the meantime, he’ll spread his personal brand of mischief across his new home...a fantastical island where ancient myths, powerful gods, and magical fairy tales come to life. 
As rambunctious and unruly as Beorn can be, he somehow manages to endear himself to those around him and forge friendships with an amazing cast of characters and creatures. None of those friendships is more special than his secret friendship with a little troll named Goob.
Some of the first colored concept art for Beorn and Goob.
I've been working on Beorn's saga for around a decade. It was initially inspired by my long-time love for newspaper comic strips. But as I was writing the daily strip, Beorn's world kept growing. His slice of life experiences couldn't be separated from the amazing and fantastical world in which he lived. Soon, Beorn's story was chalk full of Norse mythology, and Old-World fairy tales. Epic fantasy and high adventure followed this kid wherever he went! His curiosity and his thirst for adventure were insatiable.  
Available as a signed print in Rewards below!
Beorn was a little Viking who kept leading me down roads full of big moments...and big feelings. I fell in love with the cast of characters. It was a delight to see how their relationships with Beorn, and each, other grew.
Of course, not all of Beorn's world was safe and welcoming! Outside the safety of the small village where Beorn settled was a Dark Forest filled with dangerous and mysterious creatures and beings. Sometimes they were misunderstood and harmless. Other times, Beorn found himself in very real danger! 
Available as a signed print in Rewards below!
But no matter how Beorn's world and saga grew, there was always one constant. At it's center, Beorn's story was about friendship. A magical friendship between a little Viking and his best friend who happened to be a troll. I have found it to be something very special, and I'm excited to finally share it. 
A quiet moment shared between best friends.

In this first chapter, we will see Beorn's first fateful experiences as he lands on the island and discovers some of its inhabitants. I hope you'll join me in seeing this project come to life, and enjoy reading Beorn's adventures as much as I do!
Beorn and Goob out for an afternoon ride.
 Aside from the printed copy of the book, I'm offering some fun rewards to celebrate the printing of the first issue of BEORN! Stickers and Prints are available at various backer levels, detailed below. And at the higher level reward tiers, I am offering original ink sketches and watercolor paintings!
Add-ons are a way for Backers to get more rewards from the campaign, and support the creator in the process! Simply click the "Manage My Pledge" button at the top of the Campaign page, and adjust your total pledge to reflect all the goodies you want to "add on." We will collect details of what you added at the end of the campaign in a Backer Survey!
All add-ons help support me since the budget for the campaign is focused solely on making the absolute best book I can make. Adding on a little something extra for yourself, lets me keep a little something when the campaign is over. NOTE: Digital backers will need to add shipping costs to receive physical Add-ons. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is my first Kickstarter, there are always risks. I have worked incredibly hard to be aware of, and avoid, the common pitfalls first-time creators come across. I have done a good bit of research going into the campaign to try and understand how best to run a smooth and successful Kickstarter, and how to provide the best possible experience for my backers. I'm also lucky to have a solid group of folks in my corner who have all run successful campaigns, coaching me since long before the actual launch. 

I am starting small with this campaign, printing a single issue rather than a large volume graphic novel, so that the creative burden on my end is drastically reduced. And as of now, the entire book is drawn, and lettered, and more than half of it is colored and ready to go. As of the date of the campaign launch, that leaves me ample time to finish the remaining coloring and editing before the campaign comes to a close.

Production of materials always offers risks of slowing down a project. With all the social isolation, and small business slowdowns, or shutdowns, I have taken extra care to ensure the book and rewards are printed on schedule. 

The location where I am having the books printed is still up and running. It is a small operation, and has no plans to shut down for social distancing as that is not a problem for their setup. In the unlikely event they do close down for some reason, I have another printer lined up already. 

The rewards are all set to be printed, or have already been printed! A first batch of stickers is already printed and in my possession, ready to ship. And the prints are designed and ready to go to the printer. If something happens with my usual printer, I have a backup in line, and as a last resort am fully set up to print high quality prints in my own studio. 

To better guarantee fulfillment in a timely manner, I have given the campaign an ample buffer. I have set the date for when folks will receive their rewards as August, but I fully plan to have everything shipped out at least a month before that. I'm giving a large buffer to accommodate any miscalculations on my part, and also to have adequate time to deal with any reward fulfillment outside my control. I'd rather you get your rewards early than late!

Throughout each stage, I will communicate with backers to make sure everyone is kept up to date with developments of the campaign and reward fulfillment.

updates.update_userinfo: Less that 48 hours for Beorn Book Two
updates.update_content:
Hi, folks! I've really tried to not spam announcements here for Book Two, but I also would hate for anyone to miss out. I know we don't all check our emails all the time, or don't give places like Kickstarter our best contact email, so with that in mind, I just wanted to take one more shot at letting everyone know that the Book Two campaign is drawing to a close. I know a lot of y'all have already backed it, and that means a heckuva lot! Thank you. 

We've unlocked some sweet stretch goals already, so backers will be getting lots of extra Beorn goodies, no matter which reward tier you choose. So far, we have unlocked the digital coloring pdf pages, the digital "Strips" ashcan comic, the bonus print "Comics," the bonus bookmark "Chase," and the digital "Togo the Destroyer" comic. On top of that, as of the time of writing this update, we are SUPER close to unlocking both the printed version of the "Strips" mini comic, and the printed version of the "Togo the Destroyer" comic! Here's hoping!

updates.update_userinfo: One Week until Beorn Book Two Campaign launch!
updates.update_content:
Hi, folks! Thank you all so very much to everyone who has already signed up to be notified when the campaign for Book Two goes live. Seeing over 200 folks on there really helps my heart. I'm very nervous about this campaign, because now I know what I'm in for. I'm making a much bigger book (three times the story!), and it will be just as beautiful as the first. 
The first campaign snuck up on me, and I had no idea how it would take off. It was such a special time, to see Beorn's world come to life. For me, it was like witnessing magic. Now, I'm hoping lightning will strike twice, and I hope you will all join me. Please follow the link to get notified right when we launch. I'm planning some fun "Milestone Goals" like, First 24 Hours, First 100 Backers, Halfway There, etc. Some of those will be bonus stickers and bookmarks, but also some small sketchcards of original art sketches. Get in early, and enjoy the bonus goodies! The beginning of a campaign is crucial, so I'm hoping we can make at least a big dent right out of the gate.

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Stretch Goals! And Pre-Launch Link for BOOK TWO!
updates.update_content:
Hi, folks! Two quick announcements, but first a huge thank you again. With all of the packages out, and seemingly in-hand, we are really excited with how everything wrapped up from Book One. 

The last digital rewards will be in your inbox by the end of the week. My wife, Ady, has been hard at work sorting and scanning old Beorn production art so I can put together some fun pages for the digital sketchbook, and we're going to include some of the new inked pieces I've done for the digital coloring pages. Thanks so very much for your patience as we wrap up this last bit of the project.

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Rewards coming! And Pre-Launch link for Book Two
updates.update_content: This is just a short update to let everyone know that we are drawing to an official close of the campaign for Beorn Book One. I cannot thank you all enough. This has been one wild ride, and I feel like I am walking out of a crucible just in time to launch the campaign for Book Two. But, more on that in a later update. You have all been so amazing, so supportive, and so incredibly encouraging and enthusiastic about Beorn. It's funny, because I still feel like I'm reeling from this first amazing step, and it doesn't feel real. Maybe after the next one...

updates.update_userinfo: Coming to a Close
updates.update_content:
Another big batch of books just shipped. I know it's taking awhile to get through them all, and I'm sorry for that. Thanks so much for y'all's patience, folks. But, the good news is that we are almost completely finished with all domestic shipping, and about halfway through International shipping. My wife and I are certain we can finish it up this week, and everyone's books should be on the way before the weekend. 
Thank you so dang much for your patience as we work through this stage!

updates.update_userinfo: Almost done with shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hi folks, and Happy New Year!

What a ride! Over the holidays, we had some friends get Covid tested and quarantine so they could come spend a few days with us and help package and prep books. We got the majority of books all set to go out, and were waiting for the holiday USPS craziness to die down before attempting to ship the books (on the advisement of my local post office...which turned out to be sound advice from all the shipping nightmares I'm still hearing). Now, I was trying to schedule the pickup for this first big batch of books, but that isn't working! After going into the post office and discussing options, the way that gets these books out quickest is me loading them into my car a few boxes at a time and just driving them over. This is when I wish I had a big truck and not my tiny toy car Nissan Versa :)

updates.update_userinfo: January Update! Books are packaged and going out!
updates.update_content: Just a really quick note to let you all know that books should be with me any day now! We are geared up and ready to get them packaged with the already-bundled rewards and get them out the door to y'all. I'll post updates over the next couple weeks about shipping and fulfillment as the clusters of books go out. I'm still hopeful books will get to folks by Christmas, which has been a big goal of mine (and I'm sure your's as well!) With international shipping, that might be tough for some of y'all, and I apologize in advance. Every step of the process has taken longer than I would have liked, but hopefully the prep we've done around here for the final push of shipping will keep this last stage as quick as possible!

updates.update_userinfo: December Update!

Hi! 
First up, for anyone who doesn't want to wait for the physical book, here is the digital download link for Book One! LINK FOR DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF BEORN BOOK ONE
Let me know if you have any trouble, and I'll get you sorted out. Also, let me know what you think! I'm very excited (and nervous!) for folks to read the first chapter of Beorn's saga :)

campaign.story:
Art is a journey, and I'd like to invite you to walk through mine.
Bright Ideas, Dark Mind is a 60-page softcover, perfect bound art book that celebrates the process of creating art, from the initial sketches and thumbnails to the final piece. 
This book collects the concept and marketing art from my first creator series, Sunmaker, through the last three years (2016-2019) of covers, pinups, and anthology submissions with insights to the creative process.
I believe books are works of art. Therefore, I've taken great consideration to make Bright Ideas, Dark Mind of the highest quality I can.
Of course!
Each physical book will receive a numbered and signed 3" x 4" bookplate, exclusive to Kickstarter! Pretty cool, right?
I mean, since you're helping me make this thing I wanna make sure you have something you can't get anywhere else.
Keep an eye out for an upcoming Kickstarter update where YOU can help choose the final art!
 
  Hey, there! I'm Ryan Kroboth, and I'm an illustrator, colorist, and writer from Pennsylvania. 
Most of my art education has been self-taught through books (and later blogs). However, in the last few years I've taken digital coloring, lettering, art, and digital inking courses through Comics Experience. 
Through these classes, I’ve experienced a large leap in my artistic growth in a short period of time. The biggest being learning to color digitally, and learning about color in general.
Perhaps one of the most exciting parts of Bright Ideas, Dark Mind is it contains just about all of my digital colors after the Comics Experience course. You’ll get to see my experimentation and growth across the course of the book!
I have a passion for teaching, and I love sharing the lessons I’ve learned with others. And I’ll be sharing a story or two throughout the campaign.
To bring you the best possible book, I teamed up with Dave Lentz to help me with the logo and the finalized design of the book. Dave has been a big help with Sunmaker, and you'll see some of his art in Bright Ideas, Dark Mind in our Cthulhu story!
Here's a bit more about Dave:
Dave Lentz is a family man, letterer, graphic designer, and sometimes artist. When he's not making comics he's usually reading them.
He is a fan of Star Wars, Batman, Ninja Turtles, and ninjas in general. 
Some of his credits include Metalshade, Spero: Breaker of Worlds (coming soon from Source Point Press), and Arabella Damage (coming soon from Action Lab).
You can find some of the things he do here
Few things get me as pumped as an awesome art book!
What's not to love?!
While some collectors are looking for a single image that resonates with them to hang on their wall, I prefer a book that collects the work of an artist.
I love seeing the growth across multiple projects. 
Not only that, but I feel like I get more value from an art book. I wanna see all the art!
And I wish more artists collected their work into books. I feel it's not a common thing in the comic artist space... I'm always looking when I find a new artist I dig! Seriously, every artist should make an art book!
(You can ask my friends. I'm always bugging them.)
With my passion for art books, I'd love the opportunity to offer one of my own.
Reaching the point in my artistic journey to consider this is a bit mind-blowing, honestly.
As there was a point that I almost gave up on art.
In high school I discovered Deviant Art. This was my first window into seeing art from other artists. The sheer talent of the work crushed my confidence. In retrospect I know this is silly, but at the time I felt like I'd never be "good enough". So I stopped drawing for a very long time.
Ask any artist and they will tell you drawing is a part of who you are.
Eventually I found my way back. And through the encouragement of my wife I finally took the steps of becoming the comic artist I'd always dreamed of being.
I'm still learning and growing. Over the last few years I've released two self-published creator owned comics, done several anthologies, and had the privilege of sharing the worlds of other creators by doing pinups and a few covers.
Bright Ideas, Dark Mind collects developmental material and sketches of those pieces.
And I'm hoping to raise money on Kickstarter to fund a print run of the book so I can share those with you.
At one point seeing great art crushed my confidence, now it inspires me.
I'd love the chance to inspire you and others.
The book is already 99% complete! The only page left to complete is the one bearing your name as a backer.
I'm looking to print 100 digital-press copies of the book through PrintLore.
Therefore, most of the funds will go to cover printing costs. Kickstarter and Stripe take a small fee off the top, with the rest of the money raised going to cover shipping.
 
   
  Here's what to expect for the campaign:
As an avid collector of books, I want to make sure you receive your book in excellent shape.
Not only will it be shipped in a Lil Packaging bukwrap cardboard mailer to keep your book protected, you will find it secured by cardboard inserts and wrapped in a plastic sleeve to shield it from the elements.
But the real secret?
Ninjas.
That's right. Your own personal package protector. These guys will keep your shipment safe, as no one wants to mess with a ninja.
No one.
While I've done my best to attempt to select shipping materials that will best keep your product safe, I'm aware that things do happen.
If for any reason you receive a package at fulfillment that doesn't meet your quality standards I will replace it at absolutely no cost to you.
I know there are collectors out there, and I want your book to make it to you in excellent condition.
 Thank you for the opportunity to share my project with you.
I'd like to ask for your support in bringing Bright Ideas, Dark Mind to life. Please back this campaign today and allow me to share my journey with you!
With gratitude,
Ryan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I understand what it means to ask for your support. 

This is my third Kickstarter, so I (more-or-less) know what to expect.

The biggest challenge to the campaign is the outside vendors, namely our printer. I have nothing but confidence in our printer, PrintLore. I've worked with them on my previous Sunmaker campaign. If any problems arise, I have had great communication from the company and I don't think that will change.

All the shipping supplies have been purchased, meaning all shipping costs will be for postage.

I'm very familiar with Kickstarter platform having backed over 300 campaigns. This helps give me insight to what a backer looks for and expects. In addition, I am a part of the ComixLaunch course which specializes in crowdfunding comics. With this community I have an experienced group to turn to should the unexpected arise.

And above all, I pride in communication. So if we run into any problems you can be assured that I'll let you know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
***DOMESTIC US SHIPPING INCLUDED, and all books come signed by creator Bret Juliano.***
  Introducing, The Blind Tiger, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection.
What's contained in this 132 page collection?
The Blind Tiger contains over 200 comics, a pin-up gallery, Bret Juliano's guest strips for other webcomics, and a brand new book-exclusive comic chapter focusing on the Corvalus mafia family, entitled "As the Crow Flies."
Campaign Exclusives
Mobimal (mobster animal) drawn into the book
Crocheted Mobimal Characters
Limited edition poker chip
   Who will love Dust Bunny Mafia? 
Fans of mafia-related pop culture like The Godfather, Goodfellas, and The Sopranos.
Lovers of Saturday morning cartoons and the Sunday funny papers.
People who like cartoons such as Looney Tunes and Animaniacs.
Collectors of high quality independent comic books.
Here's What People are Saying...
 Based on a True Story
  You can read Based on a True Story, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection, for free by clicking here.
Bret Juliano - Creator
  Bret Juliano is a cartoonist and creator of the all ages Dust Bunny Mafia comic, which has over 650 comics in its archive and Mobimals. In late 2016, Bret published Meet the Family, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection. In 2019, he successfully funded a Kickstarter for Based on a True Story, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection. His dust bunny mobsters have also been included in several anthologies including Unlawful Good, Forgotten Histories and Out of the Deep as part of the Let’s Make Comics: Chicago Collective. He is an avid consumer of mafia trivia, both fact and fiction, and a passionate collector of fedoras.
For as far back as I can remember I was always drawing. When I was a kid, my dream job was to be an animator for Disney, but as I grew up, my focus shifted into the world of comics...newspaper styled comics especially.
Garfield, Calvin and Hobbes, Peanuts, Zits, Get Fuzzy...I could keep going, but I won't. I would read the Sunday funny paper back to back for years.
These were the things that brought joy to me and my comics, the Dust Bunny Mafia in particular, is my opportunity to tell my stories and give back in comics form.
I am coming to Kickstarter in order to create The Blind Tiger, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection because there's a supportive audience here that can help me grow my brand's reach and I know people need a to laugh and I know that my Dust Bunny Mafia comics can help with that.
Why did I write this book?
  I love mobster stories, they are the modern day version of the cowboys of the wild West.
 This book proposes a world where mobsters may not be evil. What if they are not the corrupt ones after all? What would it look like if the mobsters didn't know they were the villains at all?
What will the funds be used for?
With this Kickstarter, I'm looking to do a 200 copy first run of this collection. Last go-around, I was shooting for a 250 copy print run and was looking to cover all expenses of the project.
This time, I am only looking to cover the cost of the smaller print run, packing materials, getting the books delivered to me, and of course the Kickstarter & Stripe fees.
With a smaller campaign goal and less books, it should still allow for enough copies to fulfill the Kickstarter pre-orders and have some stock to sell at conventions in the future. 
Main Chapter: The Sugar Ban
When a nationwide sugar ban goes into effect leaving citizens craving  sugar, Leo Veronisci only sees opportunity. Allying himself with the  Corvalus brothers to leverage both families to push his bootleg sugar to  the masses makes both families rich. Until a bumbling detective  accidentally stumbles into a sugar delivery.
A Look Inside The Blind Tiger
So...What's in it For Me? (The Pledge Levels)
  Get Your Own Mobimal Drawn Into the Book!
At the Boss ($175) and Boss of Bosses ($300) pledge levels, I will draw your very own mobimal into the book in an advertisement for the Four Deuces casino, run by the Dust Bunny Mafia. Limited to 5 characters only.
Project Timeline
Milestone Bonus Gifts
  After we reach funding at each of the major milestones above, a new Blind Tiger related Dust Bunny Mafia mini-print will be revealed. Each print was done by a different comic artist, but I need your help to unlock them! Digital mini-prints will be sent to everyone at the Soldier level ($15) or above. Physical mini-prints will be sent with every Made Member level ($30) or above.
What's left to do?
The Blind Tiger is 99% complete.
There is only one page that hasn't been finished, the Four Deuces advertisement page. Once the Kickstarter ends, I will be in contact with the backers at the Boss and Boss of Bosses levels to get started on their mobimal characters, and hopefully be able to draw them in during the two weeks while I wait for the funds to clear.
Once that's been done, I can send the files to the printer and then ship the books out once they're printed.
Last year I brought my first project to Kickstarter, a mini comic collection, Based on a True Story and I can't thank everyone enough for supporting my work before on Kickstarter. You are directly responsible for helping me achieve this dream of producing my own comics. Please join me and back this Kickstarter to help my dream of making comics come true.
FREE PREVIEW
***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***

campaign.story:
WE ARE FUNDED!!! 
So how about a quick stretch goal - at $1,500 all physical backers get a bookmark. If your pledge already included a bookmark - you get two!
Get the free 20 page preview comic book - CLICK HERE 
Click on image for free 20 page preview comic book.
New bonus get digital editions of these 6 great comics with any pledge level
It's Jaws if the shark were the hero. It's Robocop if the cop were a shark. After a massive bioengineered shark escapes a secret military lab, he makes himself the law of the sea. Able to fly, bullet proof, and armed with guns and teeth, he cuts a swath thru the bad guys. But the Mob and the evil scientist who created him have a plan to stop him - make even more dangerous creatures.
Shark of War Page 1
Shark of War Page 2
First issue of exciting five issue story arc of the world's first shark (anti)hero
The dark humor of Robocop
More shark action than all the Jaws movies combined
28 interior pages
Saddle stitched with gloss paper and cover
2 variant covers
Digital deluxe pdf full of extra content  (at least 60 pages of content)
100% complete
BONUS - All backers receive a personalized thank you with an exclusive backer only animated GI
We've Hit The Second Milestone Reward!!!
Testimonials
 "Shark of War leans all the way in to its over-the-top premise with gusto. From its savage opening sequence to its killer cliffhanger, Shark of War is bloody fun comics."    -Tyler James (ComixTribe, ComixLaunch)
 "Unapologetic gore mixed with righteousness with at least one underclad villain - what's not to like?" Maco Stewart @MacoStewartNM on Twitter
Meet The Creator
I've been an engineer for 30 years and have degrees in nuclear, aerospace, and mechanical engineering. I've used this to integrate actual science into over the top science fiction in the technology used to power a cyborg shark.
I've wanted to write comic books all my life, but I didn't know any artists and didn't know how to draw. But I've always been good with computers. So when I had the idea for Shark of War, I knew I had to get it made no matter what. I spent the last year learning the different digital drawing and modeling programs that let me create exactly what I envisioned.
Why Kickstarter?
The book is 100% complete. The funds are to cover a large enough print run to get the book in the hands of many fans as possible. All the other funds are going to cover shipping, packaging, Kickstarter fees, and the exciting rewards being offered to those who back this project.

campaign.story:
With Geek-Girl's Super-Team established in Geek-Girl #5, things take an unexpected turn... So Ruby, Summer and new team-mate The Minger - now getting a night off - meet Ruby and Summer's (mean) girl friends at a fabulous, fancy-dress club nite - themed on Seinfeld's-alternative-xmas, Festivus. And Summer gets to go in the Geek-Girl costume and glasses - with powers!
But meanwhile, a guy with red skin and his young female associate are tailing them, someone is contacting the dead, Johnny Carlyle's right-hand man Digger Mensch is having conflict with his super-villain pals 'cos of being involved with the super-team - and there's the introduction of Cabra Cini: Voodoo Junkie Hitwoman!
 PREVIEW:
Say, why don't we meet the creative team for all 7 issues of the Geek-Girl ongoing-series-so-far - ? ...
"I'm Sam Johnson, the British creator/writer of Geek-Girl. I have a Masters in Creative Writing for Film & TV and have been working in comics for over ten years. Among this work, I created Cabra Cini: Voodoo Junkie Hitwoman, a character who had a strip annually in the Halloween issue of H!M Comics' IF-X anthology, and is coming into the Geek-Girl ongoing series in the new 'Tights 'n' Capes' 2-part Story Arc. I have self-published two The Almighties one-shots (a comedy super-team co-created with Mike Gagnon); released a 4-issue Geek-Girl Mini-Series through publisher Markosia monthly from Nov 2016, and ran a successful Kickstarter for its TPB, and then for the first four issues of the ongoing series, which are now collected in the Crime War TPB.
"My favorite comic and biggest influence is Grant Morrison's bizarre run on Doom Patrol,  which has helped inspire a number of weird and wonderful creations that, now we're ongoing, I am going to be bringing to the pages of Geek-Girl.  Weirdness such as The Hall of Diamonds, the Rat Fink and Groovejet: The  Living Party are all in GG's future, as well as the aforementioned Cabra Cini."
Colombian Carlos Granda is Geek-Girl's artist. His previous work includes Grimm Fairy tales, The Jungle Book, Heroes of Home Room C (which was successfully funded on Kickstarter) and Pirouette.  Besides handling his own workload, Carlos is co-director of The National Comic & Manga Hall and FICCO - groups dedicated to nurturing and exhibiting the artwork of local creators in Medellin. www.artstation.com/grandacomicfan
Geek-Girl Colorist Chunlin Zhao lives in Sichuan, China. She has been coloring and illustrating comics since 2012, working on such comics as Wretches, The Misadventures of Electrolyte, and Shogun Knight Dyson V - for publishers including Oddworld, Jackalope and Outland Entertainment.
Geek-Girl's letterer Paul McLaren started off drawing comics as a kid, with his school friend and fellow Scotsman Mark Millar (Kick-Ass, Kingsman, Secret Service)   - though went on to have a career in the police. He left the Police Service to work in the Middle East as an Explosive Detection Dog  Handler in the private security industry but then (as you do) got back into the comic scene in 2008, when he lettered a small 6 page project called "Camouflage" written by Martin Conaghan (Fallen Heroes), later lettering Martin's Graphic Novel Burke and Hare.
He  now works on a number of projects for various publishers, and his most recent have been comics for the Unseen Shadows  Universe,(www.unseenshadows.net) and a Graphic Novel about the life of  Aleister Crowley.
Geek-Girl #5's cover is by Sun Khamunaki,  a comic cover artist & illustrator from Victoria BC Canada known for her fine art inspired style. Her works have graced the covers of  Coffin Comics' Lady Death, Rothic, Monsterella, and various Zenescope titles including Oz and Van Helsing. www.sunkhamunaki.com
Jason Hehir is the Cover Artist on Geek-Girl #6 & #7 , the new 'Tights 'n' Capes arc. Jason lives in Georgia, in the States, he's the co-creator and artist of The Crew, and has also worked on many other comics, including Wicked Righteous, Sister Mercy and Shahrazad. www.facebook.com/jason.hehir.3
Cover artist for the new Tights 'n' Capes story arc's interlocking Limited Variant Covers is Claudio Avella. Italian artist Claudio lives in Napoli and has done work for Aspen, Zenescope and Devil's Due, among others, and his creator-owned project Junky Cable will be published by Behemoth later in 2020. www.instagram.com/avellart
NOW, let's check out the comics! :)

campaign.story:
Mission Decks are a multi-purpose tabletop gaming tool developed by Nor Cal Mythos entertainment. There are two initial decks: Khieron’s Keep developed using the 5e open gaming license, and Haedus 8B created for NCM’s own Carbyne Jungle.
 Players adventure through the dungeon or base, facing horrific challenges, dealing with NPCs, and discovering the mysteries of the game. Each game is designed to last for one session, but also can be played repeatedly, delving deeper into the story, learning new secrets, or just playing for fun where the whole table can level and grow together. 
Check out the Free Sample Deck on DriveThruRPG right now!!!
 Khieron's Keep 29 Card Sample Deck 
Mission Decks work perfectly as a cooperative play game. On nights when no one wants to DM/GM, or players couldn’t make it to the game, this is the perfect activity. Map and Conflict cards take players through randomly drawn dungeon, facing different encounters, and exploring storylines. Monster cards and loot cards keep the party progressing, allowing the players to grow together at the table. Parties encounter NPCs and work their way to the Boss Fight of the Dungeon.
 Each Mission Deck has a built-in storyline that requires repeated playthroughs to be fully explored. When players tire of the storyline, map cards also have untyped maps designed to be used in any setting. Players can the map cards to enjoy randomly drawn dungeons again and again.
 In addition, DMs/GMs can use the decks as tools for quick no-prep or low-prep sessions. Using the Conflict and maps cards, you can build quick encounters in interesting locations as well as build quick monsters to fight against.  
The web-based App expands gameplay options. Parties can also use the App to load map cards onto tablets, allowing for the use of miniatures in gameplay, generate random loot, or generate random encounters.
In addition, while the conflict cards come with a prebuilt story, the App allows parties to expand on that story, tracing down different storylines. By adding in the code found on the map, the party can then play in one of several arcs that expands their adventures, dives deeper into the storylines, and builds up their capabilities. When used in succession, the app allows for the Mission Deck to expand beyond merely a one-shot and into a campaign.
PLAY

Built using the 5e Open Gaming License, Khieron’s Keep takes players under the ruins of an ancient fortress exploring the mysteries that called to them. The deeper they journey into the keep, the stronger its hold upon the party grows. Ancient power, deadly challenges, and epic glory await those who journey into the keep.
The OGL has most of the classic monsters you are used to from your campaigns. These will be the Baddies you are facing as you go through Khieron's Keep, along with a few additions we have added of our own.
PLAY

Haedus 8B takes players deep into the Carbyne Jungle’s Reknown-Galaxy, exploring a recently discovered research facility abandoned for millennia, Codenamed Hell’s Gate. Parties dive into the base, searching for the lost secrets of the fallen Spine Empire and seeking to stake their claim. Rival corporations, horrific monsters, and a dark secret all threaten to the tear the party apart.
Both game decks are built with custom adventures, bosses, and multiple storylines accessible through the Web-Based App. In Khieron’s Keep: Card fronts have images and quick combat information on the monster, while the backs have the complete stat blocks. For Haedus 8B, the cards have both the full stat blocks, and the front of the cards have Carbyne Jungle’s Flip and Fight ruleset information.
Digital Deck copies: Print and Play decks are also available, and each P&P deck comes complete with all the same cards as the print deck and the same access to Web-Based App features. In addition, the digital copy also comes with 8.5 x 11 PDFs of all the maps.
Map Cards
Map cards are two sided. The first is a setting specific map with details about the location, objects in the room, and a scale for the room to give an idea of the size of the area. The back of each card is a non-typed map, also with objects and scale, that can be used in any setting type the players or DM/GM would want. 
Useful both for cooperative play, or for running a game, the map cards allow everyone to get a good idea of the setting. Every map card also comes with a code that can be loaded onto the Web-Based App, so the map could be loaded onto a large phone or tablet. With the printable PDF of the decks, each map also has an 8.5x11 printable version for tables who prefer to have a map large enough for miniatures.
Encounter/Conflict Cards
Encounters for 5e, Conflicts for Carbyne Jungle, these cards deal with the challenges and stories the players face in the game. Like the map cards, these are a mix of setting specific cards and generic conflicts that will work for any setting. Because of this, the decks can be used indefinitely for cooperative play, or also as a tool for DM/GMs. In any setting, whoever is running the game can pull a map card, grab a conflict card, and then plan out a quick encounter.
With the app, different conflicts can also be added. Each deck has multiple storylines available, so players who complete either Khieron's Keep or Haedus 8B can use the web-based app to load alternative storylines with different challenges for the party to face. 
Monster/Target Cards
Everyone needs a good fight, and there is no reason that fights need to be the same every time. Used in conjunction with the Conflict/Encounter cards, the Monster/Target cards allow for a different challenge every time the table plays the game. Each encounter is built differently.
Loot Cards
Sure, you can find gold or credits, or possible a sword or mass driver in a fight, but that can get old. Loot cards allow for unique rewards as well as unique fights. Roll up loot before the fight, and all of sudden you are fighting a goblin with a staff of fireball.
Boss Cards
Boss cards are templates added to monsters cards, allowing for unique challenges to finish the dungeon every game. Every time you enter Khieron's Keep or Haedus 8B, you don't know how the game is going to end... which is exactly how it should be. 
NPC Cards
In the mission decks, not only will you face monsters, but you will also run into Non-Player Characters that will present unique interactions and situations. NPCs will make offers, ask for help, offer rewards, join the party, and possibly even betray the party. 
 Decks are broken into Tiers, giving players the proper challenge for the level of the players and their characters. As characters advance, players can buy full decks to get more variety on their maps and conflict cards, or players can just pick up the next Monster Pack, getting new creatures and Boss cards to contest against, along with new loot specific to your levels. In short, you get the game that will be the best challenge on most fun for your party.
Khieron's Keep (5e OGL)
The Keep Decks will be broken into 3 Tiers: Levels 1-4, 5-10, and 11-16. Each tier  will be offered also as Half-Decks for tables who only want the Maps/Encounters or the Monsters/Boss/Loot.
Haedus 8B(Carbyne Jungle)
For the Hell's Gate compound, their will be 3 sets: The Alpha/Beta deck, the Gamma Delta Deck, and the Epsilon/Omega Deck. Like the Khieron's keep decks.
Deck Options
Each deck will be over 100 cards of awesomeness and can be bought Complete or as Half Decks. After players have completed the mission, they may find they want to move up to the next set of challenges or just add more rooms and conflicts to their game. Each Tier of decks will have a Map/Conflict Half Deck and a Monster/Boss/Loot Half Deck. So if your party is happy with the map and conflict cards they have, they can just expand their collection of baddies to fight, or get a new set of encounters, more rooms, and additional story.
All of the decks will come with a PDF Guidebook explaining how to use the decks, along with guidelines for dealing with parties of different levels/tiers, and sizes. The guidebook for Khieron's Keep will work for all the 5e OGL decks, as the Haedus 8B will cover all the versions of the Carbyne Jungle decks. (For those interested in crossing over, the backs of each PDF guide will include the information for the other deck system).
$4,000 Stretch Goal Unlocked!!! - Face the Undead Legions
At the $4,000 mark, we will be adding undead decks with nifty baddies to both our 5e and Carbyne Jungle games. So any backer can choose to get an undead deck for either system! These decks will have many of the classic undead you love, along with some of our own creations you can enjoy as well as a nifty necromantic boss to raise your game (it's a bad pun, we know, we just don't care)!
$5,000 Stretch Goal - An additional Storyline and Free PDF Deck for all $20+ BACKERS!!!
Starting off, each deck will have 3 playable storylines: 2 deck specific for the level tier and one that is shared by all three. Reaching the $5,000 mark, we will add another shared storyline for each system, giving each deck 4 storylines, and 8 total if you get all three decks!!! Both of these storylines will also be expanding on the undead decks, with a strong Necromantic theme! Every backer of $20 or more will get a free Printable PDF copy of this deck!
$6,000 Stretch Goal - "The Nameless Terrors of the Void" Storyline, Deck option, and Free PDF Deck for all $20+ BACKERS!!!
At $6,000 we will build a Lovecraftesque horror deck filled with unspeakable terrors, demoniacal beings of unspeakable fear, and other fun stuff! We will also add a storyline in the same vein as the deck and every $20+ backer will also get a free digital deck!
Carbyne Jungle Decks
On top of the mission decks, we also offering the Carbyne Jungle starter decks as options. The starter decks have all the information for species, power domains, archetypes, along with the starter equipment for any character. On top of that, we also have expanded equipment decks, and ritual decks.
Do you want to try out Carbyne Jungle? 
For those of you who haven't tried Carbyne Jungle yet and would like to get a copy of the game, all backers can get a discounted copy of the core rulebook!
Backers can buy a digital copy for $5 or a color hardback copy for $25+shipping (on the survey when you pick your deck after the Kickstarter, you can select to get one of these options if you so choose).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second kickstarter. Our first was completed and delivered successfully. We have prototype decks built and are currently playtesting and fine-tuning. We have a distributor lined up, and an app developer ready to go. While there is a chance the app might not be ready to go in November, it's small and we do believe we should be able to deliver our product by November of this year.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome athletes to race day! At this very special triathlon you will build your skills as well as contribute towards creating the three courses that make up the race. Tri To Win is a card game where players build their own board game. Everyone can see the race course, you're building it as a team. But only you know what skills your athlete has, this means each player is trying to build the course that their own athlete is more likely to win, and leave the others in the dust.
An example race from Tri To Win
The race course is different every game, your athlete's skills will be different every game, and so your tactics will need to be as well. Can you build the ultimate athlete? Good luck!
Here's a lovely little gameplay video for you. Scroll down to 'Game Instructions' for written explanation and a link to the full rules.
PLAY

This campaign is to raise funds for the first print run of Tri To Win, a card game where players build up the skills of their athletes and create a triathlon race made up of three courses which is then played like a boardgame. The game is 2-4 players, age 8+, can be played in 10 to 30 minutes depending on how you play and is a great game to play with family and friends.
The initial idea for Tri To Win came about 18 months ago during a weekend where my husband competed in the Blenheim Triathlon and we also went to the UK Games Expo at the NEC in Birmingham. After the idea formed, I left it for a while and the rules for the game started expanding in my head until I had to create a prototype. My sneaky plan was to create the prototype, iron out any problems by playing it with my husband and then get a single print copy for him as his Christmas present. It very quickly transpired that not only did my husband like the game, he loved it! Persuaded me that everyone else would as well and here we are!
Play tests have been going really well and I'm looking for local gaming groups to bring the prototype along to throughout my Kickstarter campaign so if you're local to Hampshire, UK get in touch.
The game is played in two phases. In the first phase of the game players draw and play one card per turn to build up their athletes’ skills, create the race courses, and a little bit of card and skill thievery. Skill cards are played face down next to your athlete, only you know what skills you have. All other cards are played face up, the Course cards are played along the corresponding course (as in the image below). And Action cards are used to cause some mischief, with Action cards you can steal skills, cards, remove pieces of the race course and stop other players actions. Phase one ends when a player uses their turn to play the 'Start The Race' card at the end of the running course.
Example of how the race course can look, using the new updated cards. I am gradually replacing the graphics on this campaign with the updates, stay tuned!
In phase two, players use their accumulated skills to race on the course they made in phase one. The Course cards are used as a board game with coloured player tokens that match each athlete. Add up all skills your athlete has gathered and these are now your movement points. Each player takes turns moving their token the number of swim points they have, then cycling, then running, stopping at each race transition until their next turn. The winner is the first player to make it past the finish line to the Gold 1st place position at the end of the running course. Keep playing to find out who comes 2nd and 3rd! We haven't been able to play a game yet without continuing after we have a winner; we just have to know!
Click here for the full rules of Tri To Win
In the game box you will receive:
84 x 310gsm black core playing cards
6 x wooden player tokens, one for each athlete card
What's in the box
 £1 - Thank You - an extra big thank you to anyone who just wants to back the project without a reward, you will be able to keep updated on the project as it progresses.
£12 and £24 - Early birds - I'd like to thank my first 40 backers who'd like one or two games, you can use these two reward tiers to get the game for £12 each. RRP £15. You'll also get any stretch goals that are unlocked during the campaign.
£14 - Get the game for less than the RRP of £15 along with any stretch goals unlocked during the campaign.
£28 - Get two copies of the game for £14 each (RRP £15) along with any stretch goals unlocked during the campaign.
£52 - Buy in bulk - Get 4 or more copies of the game for £13 each (RRP £15) add an additional £13 for each extra copy you'd like to receive, e.g. for 6 copies pledge £78. You will also get these games with any stretch goals unlocked during the campaign.
£70 - Personalised game - work with me to create your very own athlete card, just one personalised card. There are only 5 of these available so if you are interested get in quick. The personalised card will arrive at the same time as your game but won't be included in the same box and will be slightly different card stock as I'll have them printed up independently from the larger manufacturer. This also means you'll have your personalised card as well as the original six athlete cards to choose from when playing. Your game will also include any stretch goals unlocked during the campaign.
£170 - Personalised game - work with me to create your very own athlete cards, all six personalised cards. There are only 5 of these available so if you are interested get in quick. The personalised card will arrive at the same time as your game but won't be included in the same box and will be slightly different card stock as I'll have them printed up independently from the larger manufacturer. This also means you'll have your personalised cards as well as the original six athlete cards to choose from when playing. Your game will also include any stretch goals unlocked during the campaign.
 If everything runs according to plan then your rewards will be delivered in May 2020. However, I have set the delivery date on the rewards to June 2020 to create a buffer for any unexpected international delivery delays.
UK - Tri To Win is a UK developed game and I'm delighted to be able to offer Free Shipping within the UK.
Rest of the world - discounted shipping to the rest of the world in the hopes that shipping won't be a blocker for anyone wanting to back this campaign. See reward tiers for specific shipping rates as they vary (for bulk orders for example)
We will ship Tri To Win worldwide. Please note that you  may be responsible for duties, handling, fees and taxes applicable to  your region, especially if choosing to buy in bulk.
Funding goal - £2,800
When we reach this funding goal we will try and work towards the below stretch goals. 
6 players - target: £3,400 - updated to be included at £2,800 funding goal
The game is currently optimised for 2-4 players. It's not impossible to play with 6 players at the moment but the deck is not optimised for it. More cards will need to be added to make this a 6-player game. I'm very keen to reach this goal as I was set on having 6 athletes, two for each triathlon discipline. So, you're asking why isn't it 6 players to start with? It's more cost effective at the moment for it to be a maximum of 4 players, but it's not a massive stretch goal to be able to add enough cards for inclusion of 2 more players. Fingers crossed!
Interrupt cards expansion (working title) - target: £5,150
This adds an expansion to the game where a new deck of cards is used for phase two of the game. A card is drawn each time you move your token in the race, you choose when you play the card (at any time during the race) they all interrupt the race in some way. A player may have to wait an extra turn at their next transition or be stopped from over taking the owner of the card, you might get +1 for a chosen skill. 
This expansion pack will be sold separately after the Kickstarter campaign but will be included for anyone who backs the campaign to get the game.

Risks and challenges
All projects contain the potential for surprise and delay. Although this is my first Kickstarter campaign, I have researched my options for manufacture and fulfilment services and feel confident in my choices, however I'm aware delays can still happen and I will do my best to keep to schedule and keep backers up to date should any surprises arise.

The game itself has been played many times, both in its first draft and after updates from feedback, I'm still in a position to make changes based on any further feedback but at this stage the game is 95% complete and being played regularly seeking any improvements before production.
