campaign.story:
47 Furious Tails, Issue Two:  The full color Samurai Epic 
Issue Two Cover Art by Alexia Veldhuisen
47 Furious Tails is a 12 issue limited series which tells the story of the 47 Samurai in a new and exciting way. Participants of this historic event are depicted as members of the animal kingdom. Join us as we tell the tale of this legend from Japan's rich history.
This KickStarter campaign funds the printing, shipping and remaining art costs of Issue Two. Issue two is 20 pages of full color excitement!  
5.5 by 8.5 mini print / Art by: Alexia Veldhuisen / Ako Castle from Issue One
ISSUE TWO
Asano Naganori, lord of Ako, is setting off on his fateful trip to Edo leaving Yoshio to protect Ako in his absence.  As Asano and his entourage depart, the Grey Wolf strikes out at Ako!  Journey with us as we go back in time and examine the story of these legendary figures.
Alexia is currently illustrating and coloring pages.  We will be adding pages from issue two in updates throughout the campaign to showcase her work on this issue and to give backers an inside looking into the creation process.
Variant Cover Art by Paul Walcott
Our campaign funds the art, lettering, printing and shipping/fulfillment of this issue.  By reaching our campaign goal I am able to pay our artists and letterer fair wages while they complete this issue.  Successful funding will  also allow us to order the press run for the printed comics on the same high quality stock we used for issue one!  These comics are made to last and are being crafted to be an example of what I and my little company can do. Every effort is going into making this series one that people will cherish in their collection for decades to come.  
Issue 2 campaign t-shirt ~ Available in white, black, red and baby blue ~ Sizes up to 3XL (Image courtesy of Printful)
 $16,000 ~ Second Art Print!
Reaching this goal will permit me to commission a second art print at 5.5 by 8.5 which will be included in all reward packages which include art prints ($25 and up). 
We are printing this issue in the United States through Mixam as they did an extraordinary job of printing issue one.  We're using the same high grade materials to bring you a comic book that will be beautiful, durable and a real treasure in your collection for decades to come!
 New to 47 Furious Tails?  Want to see what these comics are like?  Download your FREE digital copy of issue one today by clicking on the image below!  
Click on image to download free copy of issue one from drivethrucomics/drivethrurpg

 Where the money goes!
The chart below illustrates the breakdown of how funds are allocated to produce and ship the backer rewards from this campaign.  Funds raised in excess of goal will be applied toward development of future projects.
Based on costs and quotes from artists, printers and the USPS
You may have noticed that there isn't a calculation to pay the writer (me).  That's by design. I conduct crowdfunding campaigns to pay for the creation of the product/publication at the highest quality I can deliver.  I plan to make money subsequent to the campaign through sale of finished product AFTER the campaign is fulfilled.   If we fund well over goal I'll be using the majority of any excess funds to pay for production of art for issue three.
Shipping
Since 2017 I have seen constant increases in shipping costs.  International shipping will be done via first class international mail through the USPS.  For all backers outside of the United States, please be advised that you may be charged import tax / VAT for your rewards upon arrival. We cannot and will not falsify the value information of your rewards, we must report that information honestly and will do so.   Rewards will be inspected prior to packaging and will ship to the address you indicate.  
When completing your backer survey, please indicate the English equivalent for your address.  This is necessary to ensure accurate addressing for USPS first class international mail and to help me avoid potential errors with shipping addresses.
I will ship to any address that is serviced by the USPS. 
This banner was created under contract by artist Brian Lee
Founded in 2017, Sinopa Publishing LLC is registered in the Commonwealth of Kentucky.  My little company exists to publish role playing games, comic books and children books.  I operate by funding product creation through crowdfunding campaigns and pay my artists/contributors fair wages.  
Since 2017 I have successfully funded and fulfilled campaigns under this (my private account) and under the Sinopa Publishing account (set up so I can hand it down to my children one day).   Each of my successfully funded campaigns have been fulfilled.  When you support one of my projects you can be certain that you will receive your pledge rewards.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Writing is done, panel layout is finalized. 

Identified risks include:

1) Art delays - Injury or illness befalling Alexia will slow art production. She is in good health and we do not expect any sickness, but this is a point that caused a slight delay on issue one and I wanted to make certain that it was addressed in Risks.

2) Print delays - Any delay in printing will slow delivery of finished printed products. We don't expect this to be an issue. Mixam provided our copies of Issue one well within their projected delivery date and we expect the same to be the case here.

3) Shipping problems ~ Shipping is always a big point of concern for any KickStarter creator. We hand off the product and place it in the care of the shipping partner and hope that it arrives in pristine condition. To this end we take precautions, using Gemini comic mailers to protect comics and using the USPS who have proven reliable. The biggest challenge with shipping is in addressing. Please double check your address data when you fill out your backer survey. For addresses outside of the United States, please provide the English equivalent for your address as that is the only format the USPS will accept from us.

updates.update_content:
Good evening everyone!
Alexia has been hard at work on pages for issue two.  We're expecting all interior pages art (full color) to be done the first week of November.  Brian will begin lettering as those full color pages come in.
The plan is to have the book completed during the campaign so we can get the copies ordered and begin shipping asap.  I'm hoping to get rewards to everyone before the end of January 2021. updates.update_userinfo: Post campaign update
updates.update_content:
Dear friends, fans and foes,
Lex here, with an update following the end of our campaign.
First off, apologies for not posting this sooner. Life had my mind occupied these past couple of days as Life tends to sometimes do . 
Second off, I wanted to thank all of you have supported us now, have done so in the past and have expressed their continuing support in the future. As Sam has mentioned, we will relaunch this book's campaign later this year following any acquired excess funds from the next couple of projects to help bring the goal for this campaign down. Sam and I like to keep a positive spirit which is why we launched with such an ambitious goal to begin with butWe both believe in this book and we to see this entire series realized so we'll keep trying to promote, produce, package and preserve this story until the end. We hope that you'll continue to support this and other endeavors as we continue to grow Sinopa and our audience. We couldn't have started this without your help and we shall not finish it either. So in lieu of this, please consider supporting our next project the Pin- up Art Book of female Fantasy races. If that is not your cup of tea (or coffee ) perhaps you know someone who's it is. Share it with the nerds and geeks in your life, for the more we over fund on this art book, the more money we can put into 47 Furious Tails Issue Two. ;)

updates.update_userinfo: End of the campaign: Plan to relaunch later this year!

updates.update_userinfo: Good morning everyone
updates.update_content:
As I write this we have a little more than 24 hours remaining in the campaign.  While we haven't yet reached goal, I am thrilled by the tremendous support we've seen for this issue.  Thank you all so much.
47 Furious Tails is very important to Alexia and I.  The link below is for Alexia's recent interview with Adam Watson of the Darkslinger Mafia Podcast.  Adam has been a great friend over the years and has provided valuable insights into crowdfunding and production of comics (Check out his titles, such as Ghost Assassin).

updates.update_userinfo: Last week of the 47 Furious Tails DRIP Exhibit!
updates.update_content:
Dear friends, fans and foes,
Lex here again! We've been seeing a growth in pledges the past couple of days and have broken the 25% mark. Sam and I are very grateful for your new or continuing support. We're still ways off from our goal to make this happen but we are not giving up! We are continuing promoting the campaign through all possible means. Additionally, the original pages for 47 Furious Tails issue One are still on sale at Drip Coffee Madison. But this is the last week they will be there! If you are in the area and still interested in purchasing one DO NOT WAIT! I will be there this Tuesday, Friday and Saturday and the following Monday and Tuesday. Three of the pages, the Issue One Kickstarter promotional poster and one of the character sketches have already been sold but there are still some banging pages looking for a good home. Please don't hesitate to contact me through this campaign or through other channels for further inquiries.

updates.update_userinfo: Good morning and Great News!
updates.update_content:
Great news first:
Thanks to all of you we are now at 25% of our campaign goal!  This is fantastic!  Thank you all so much for bringing us to this first big milestone!!
We still have over 100 people following the campaign page and as those folks pledge we should see the campaign surpass 50%.  From previous experience I expect that once we reach that next big milestone we'll see more people pledging as they see the phenomenal level of support from all of you.

updates.update_userinfo: Appearing on Crowdfunding Comics, Wednesday night 9PM EST

Alexia and I are appearing on "Crowdfunding Comics" in support of the campaign. We'll be taking questions and talking about 47 Furious Tails, the campaign and the series.  I'll be posting a link to that show once we're live.
Recently I appeared on Indie Comic Book Showcase .  I'm making every effort to promote this issue and the series overall.  The biggest and best promotion for this campaign has been the kindness shown by all of you, the backers who came out in force on day one for issue two. We've had a magnificent start to the campaign and I thank you all for showing such terrific support to the 47 Furious Tails project!

campaign.story:
I'm Charles Brubaker, creator of THE FUZZY PRINCESS. Last year I was able to publish the first volume of FUZZY comics with your generous help, and today I'm hoping to make the second volume a reality!
The Fuzzy Princess centers on Katrina, the adventurous feline princess of St. Paws, watched over by Chiro (a batty bat) and Kuma (whose love for haiku is only matched by his love of eating). Now they’ve been stranded in our world! Can Kat’s new human friend Jackson help them survive? Will Jackson be able to survive his new friends?
 Continuing off from where the first book left off, join Princess Kat on a voyage of self-discovery in this sec, as she explores her new talents such as:
Urban exploration!
Crimefighting!
Attempting to make Christmas dinner!
Surviving a surprise visit!
Babysitting!
Witches!
And enduring Kuma’s slam poetry!
It’s all here, and so much more.
The book contains bonus goodies such as brand new title page for each chapter, as well as an introduction and illustration by Dana Simpson of "Phoebe and Her Unicorn"!
192-PAGE PAPERBACK BOOK
PRINTED IN FULL COLOR
DIMENSIONS: 6x9"
I'm offering a variety of rewards: the book itself, original art, stickers, prints, and more!
If you missed the campaign for the first book volume but you're interested in getting it, there are tiers where you can get BOTH volumes bundled together!
NEW (2-14): You can now get TWO sheets of stickers, and FIVE buttons! They will be automatically added to all reward tiers ($40 and up) that already come with stickers and buttons.

project_data.project_name: Broke Down and Four Dead Bodies - Issue 1 - 3 - CRIME NOIR

campaign.story:
A team of award-winning creators bring you 'A Boxer,' Comicbookyeti.com's "Most Anticipated" crowdfunded comic of the year.
To be published by BHP Comics (Killtopia, Charlie Adlard: Drawing and Sketches, Frank Quietly: The Art of Comics) this campaign is running to pay the costs of a creative team that boasts an Eisner Award, a Dente Award and three Masters degrees in Comics and Graphic Novels.
The first six pages of the comic are available to read for free at the bottom of the campaign.
A Boxer is a 100-page graphic novel that tells the story of Mike Shepherd, a British fighter trying to succeed in the hyper-masculine world of boxing, whilst struggling to manage his sexual identity.
The book is narrated by Mike’s partner and medical consultant, Jude who faces his own challenges as an openly gay man in the sport.
The story begins with Mike taking a silver medal at the Olympics. Despite being the better athlete, Mike loses the final bout as he fails to overcome his internal conflicts. His struggle intensifies as he turns professional, making the decision to keep his relationship with Jude a secret to ensure that he has equal opportunities in the international sport.
But when Mike’s first opponent makes a homophobic remark to Jude, his two warring identities are forced into conflict.
Mike Shepherd: Mike starts the book as a young, amateur athlete turning professional and is trapped between the traditionally masculine persona that boxing demands and the industry’s perception of homosexuality.
Jude Collins: University educated and with a strong sense of self, Jude is both a lover and guide to Mike, as well as to the audience. Jude’s academic approach to sexual identity offers a different perspective to Mike’s working-class upbringing.
Victoria James:  Acting as a ‘beard,’ (a partner who aids in concealing sexual orientation), Victoria is a soap actress and single mother who agrees to attend fights and events as Mike’s ‘girlfriend'. Initially only interested in the publicity opportunities, Victoria grows to care deeply in Mike’s struggle.
Andrei Bitaev: The champion of Mike’s weight class, Bitaev dominates his sport and is thought of as a once in a generation talent. His fights are highly publicised, making it more difficult for boxers below him to gain media attention.
An analysis of modern identity, A Boxer takes artistic inspiration from the traditionally masculine art of American realist, George Bellows and contrasts it with ‘theatrical’ lighting techniques to create a sense of conflict and imprisonment within the everyday.
Printing and costs
A Boxer has already secured a deal with BHP Comics for printing and distribution. This crowdfunding campaign is to pay for the creative costs of our fantastic team. Our funding target of £25,000 is to cover:
£17,000: to pay the creative team to produce the book. At 100 pages, this works out to a cost of £170 per page. The writer is not including a page rate until all stretch goals have been met in order to keep this cost to a minimum.
£6,450 to purchase the backer's rewards from the publisher. This is the cost based upon the estimated number of backers required for the Kickstarter to be successful.
£1,250 to Kickstarter, based on their 5% fee.
£150-300 to PledgeManager, according to their fees based upon the number of backers. 
Shipping costs will be handled after the Kickstarter by PledgeManager, meaning that they are not budgeted into our costs. For more details on this, please see the Important Details section of our page.
Themes
When we initially pitched the project it was named The Boxer but we decided to change the title. We felt that A Boxer suggested the story was universal rather than specific, which resonated with us as Mike’s journey is one experienced by multitudes of people. While cultural boundaries have shifted, sports are still one aspect of society that struggle to deal with these issues and confront bias. This was made clear by the experience of the Twitter account ‘The Gay Footballer’ (https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-49093329) and even the English national football team (https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/50212951).
A Boxer details the experience of a homosexual man struggling to find his place between two worlds, feeling himself equally impassioned and alienated by both the boxing and LGBTQ+ communities.
Writer - Dominic Archer: Dominic is a comic book writer and graduate of MLitt Comics and Graphic Novel s  from the University of Dundee. His work includes Love In The Time of Wertham, an analysis of the infamous Fredric Wertham ‘anti-comics’ Senate hearings, as told from the perspective of two books that fall in love; and The Architect, the tragic story of a man who designs supervillain lairs, and longs to be remembered, only to see his work inevitably destroyed by the forces of good. Dominic’s work is available at: dominicarchercomics.com
The first draft of script for 'A Boxer'
Pencils - Gary Welsh: Gary is a graduate of the MDes Comics and Graphic Novels course at Dundee University. He is currently working as a freelance comic book artist in Scotland.  He recently worked with 2000AD founder, Pat Mills on Ragtime Soldier and was an artist on Scottish superhero comic Saltire: Invasion. Gary's work is available at: gw2000.artstation.com/
Gary's pencils for Page 5 of 'A Boxer'
Inks - Marc Casilli: Marc has two Master's degrees, one in comics and the other in film. A Brazillian artist, he works as comfortably on his semi-autobiographical comic Legit, as he does on the surrealist series Jesus Christ: Time Traveller. When not working on his own books, Marc also teaches comics classes to low-income communities in Sao Paulo. Marc’s work is available at: https://www.marccasilli.net/
An inked page, courtesy of Marc Casilli
Colours - Amanda Miranda: Amanda is a cartoonist, illustrator, and designer. She's the author of Infestatio (2015) and Hibernáculo (2018), which was awarded the 2019 Dente Award for Best Independent Comic. She's currently working on two new comics, "Objetos no Espelho" e "Máquina Tropical Universal", the latter in collaboration with Simone Campos, and to be released by Companhia das Letras in 2021. She has worked as an illustrator for The Intercept_ Brasil. Amanda’s work is available at: https://www.amandamiranda.net/
Amanda's amazing colours really bring the book to life.
Letters- Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou: Hassan is the Eisner award-winning editor of Panel X Panel magazine. He is also the host of the Strip Panel Naked YouTube series. His lettering work includes Peter Cannon: Thunderbolt (Dynamite) and Killer Groove (Aftershock). Hassan’s work is available at: https://hassanoe.co.uk/
Completed page, with Hassan's lettering.
PledgeManager
A Boxer will be using the PledgeManager platform to handle addresses, postage charges and rewards. PledgeManager helps streamline the delivery of rewards and allows the creative team to focus on making the book. 
With PledgeManager, backers are charged for shipping after the Kickstarter. These charges are based on the weight and dimensions of your reward, which means more accurate shipping costs for you and no chance of the Kickstarter underestimating the cost of shipping.
Deadline
The artists have set themselves a deadline of 8 months from the successful Kickstarter campaign to complete work on A Boxer.
During that period, all pledge supporters will have access to a monthly creator content made specifically for this project. This will include interviews with A Boxer’s creative team, analysis of the art and the creative process, as well as content exploring the themes and influences on the book.
Once the creative work has been completed and the book has been edited, the digital comic will become available while BHP Comics organises printing and distribution. If you are hoping to read the book as early as possible then we recommend backing a reward that comes with a digital comic. 
Rewards
There are a variety of reward tiers available for backers, ranging from A Boxer in digital form, up to paperback and hardcover versions of the book.
Higher reward tiers also come with a set of collectible postcards, featuring important events from the book and a variant cover by Robert Carey (Aliens: Resistance, James Bond 007, Red Sonja, Power Rangers, Batman/The Shadow.) 
Backers of the Greatest of All Time tier will also receive an original penciled page from the book, as drawn by Gary Welsh. But there limited pages available so don't wait!
Stretch Goals
The A Boxer campaign comes with 4 stretch goals to expand the book to a total of 120 pages.
£26,000 - A 5-page epilogue for Mike and Jude detailing the changes in their relationship after the end of the main story. This epilogue is already written and will be created by the book’s artistic team.
£27,000 - A second 5-page additional story that explores the character of Victoria James in more depth. This will serve as an interlude between chapters, and will be written and drawn by Amanda Miranda.
£28,000 - An essay written by Dr Ryan Storr, a researcher in diversity and sport at Western Sydney University and founder of LGBTQ sports charity Proud 2 Play, analyzing the relationship between sexual identities and sporting culture. This essay will follow the epilogue and further expand upon the themes of the narrative.
£29,000 - A third 5-page short comic following Andrei Bitaev and his rise to the championship title that Mike so badly wants to take from him. As A Boxer is told from Mike and Jude’s perspective, this chapter break is an opportunity to delve into the character that embodies traditional masculine identity. This strip will be written and drawn by Gary Welsh.
£30,000 - Dominic gets paid.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The creative team have collectively identified the most significant risks for the project and we’ve taken proactive steps to mitigate these risks wherever possible.

To tackle our limited audience size, we’ve set about identifying our core buying personas and engaging with popular websites, publications and press organisations to maximise awareness and engagement amongst those groups. We are currently scheduling interviews with a number of leading comics and sporting publications, discussing the themes of the project and promoting the Kickstarter.

To maximise speed of distribution we have secured a printing and distribution deal with leading comic publisher BHP. This will help us get from creative to print as fast as possible, ensuring contributors get their hands on rewards quickly.

To ensure that we’re inclusive of all contributors we have scaled our rewards from £5 to £80, promising a range of rewards from exclusive content from the creative team and expanded assets including hardback editions of the book.

campaign.story:
Fully funded in three hours. All stretch goals unlocked, including a stunning variant cover and an exclusive digital short story for all backers later in 2020.
Here’s what you can get...
Almost all the rewards you can get!
The first image from the upcoming HER short, due later in 2020.
An exclusive preview of the next HER short, which you’ll get if we hit £1,250

The dusty landscape of Propserity is best known for two things: fine bourbon and the women who go missing there.
No one wants the real answers about what happened to them. No one, except HER.
In the space of 24 hours, she’ll need to uncover the truth and deal with the inevitable, violent consequences of standing up for the women that powerful men victimise. 
Whatever the cost, someone’s going to pay.

HER PROSPERITY is a 32-page noir thriller, where the dialogue’s delivered like gunfire and the consequences for missing the target are hard, cold and often final.
It’s dangerous being a woman in the world she lives in, with heavy shadows and smart suits masking powerful mens’ depraved desires.
She’s going to rip those masks off and even the score. 
I’m a huge fan of badass women in stories, so I’m hugely excited to share the next chapter in the story of HER. I wanted to capture the spirit of the classic EC crime comics but with a modern, feminist twist. Writing the pulpy dialogue and that heavy noir art is some of the most fun I’ve had in comics so far. 
Prosperity is the sequel to my Instagram short, HER. Don’t worry if you missed out on part 1, all tiers include a digital copy of it. And speaking of tiers...
 What's on offer
Some of the rewards you can get, including The Grave, HER, pen and ink sketches, a recreation of the cover image and the cool A5 print on the right.
32-page black and white digest-sized comic in print and/or digital formats
Print copies of my two graphic novels, The Grave and Decades
David's Digital Delights - my full back catalogue in digital format
A Kickstarter-exclusive print by me
Exclusive A6 pen, ink and copic sketches by me
One of four pen and ink recreations of my PROSPERITY cover at A4 size
An exclusive one-off pen/ink A4 commission of your choice
Here’s the Kickstarter exclusive print...
About me
I'm a Scottish creative type with a passion for comics and stories and any way I can tell them. My favourite thing is crime fiction and I write, draw and letter all my own work. These are my babies, going out into the world in a haze of sharp one liners, human frailty and bone crunching violence. 
This is my fourth comic project and second Kickstarter campaign, and I love the little community I’m building. I hope you’ll join it and back HER PROSPERITY.
Let's share a shot
The original HER was so much fun to create and it was amazing seeing how people took to the character. PROSPERITY was a great opportunity to spend time with HER again and expand the world she lives in. 
Want a taste? Look below. 
 Why I’m on Kickstarter
I’m really proud of this story. I love the world and the main character, and I know the best way to inspire that love in others is by getting you involved in making this book happen.
That’s what happened when I launched The Grave last year - you turned my personal passion into a real product. It was the highlight of my 2019 and I’m hoping to kick 2020 off in similar style. 
Your pledges will help me get this book into print and create some cool extras and maybe even a few stretch goals. And if we can make this another success, it’ll allow to dream up even more crime thrills in the future.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've self-published before, so I've got a good grip of the risks of Kickstarter and indie comic creation. The book's all finished though, it just needs to go to print (along with any stretch goals). My main printer is a stalwart of the UK scene but I’ve got quotes from a few backups just in case. 

All the content for the extras is already prepared. If we reach any of the stretch goals, I’ll update this section to cover them. But I’m keeping this project clean and simple, so you can get your rewards as soon as possible.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Hello and welcome to Sword of Justice #1 Kickstarter!

Some of you already know me, and some of you don't, so let's get acquainted. I'm John Daniel Taylor IV, the Owner and Creator of most of the Top Secret Press products. We are entering our seventh year of making color comics, with over 40 successful and completed Kickstarters behind us.

Let's talk about this Kickstarter...

Most of the time, I have a list, but I want to say something first. 

I have been working with Silvio for some time now on the Sword of Justice #1 project. This project is created, written and owned by Silvio Spotti.

It's a project I believe in and one I have faith in as well as the creator. At the same time, as a publisher, I want everyone to know I have a firm hand on both the project and delivery. I mean that for myself as well as the people I work with. I've been doing this a long time, and I've delivered every time. This one will be no different. Everyone will get their Incentives. That's a promise!

NOTE: If you want to hear more of what I have to say, you can see the video above entitled, "Let's do the right thing."

Right now, Silvio has pages coming in on a weekly basis. I hired a new colorist for this project and you can review her talents above. She is talented and excellent at her craft. She is also a new addition to Top Secret Press.

1) ABOUT THE COMIC - Silvio has completed 12 of the 20 pages. He makes about a page a week, so we have plenty of time. The colorist has also completed the first five pages. All covers are done and ready. So, all is well on on the way. The rest is up to you guys!

2) WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO? - As far as where the money goes, 80% goes to artists and printing; the rest to Incentives, Kickstarter Fees and Shipping. Every penny counts! I get paid in copies that I sell at shows when I promote the product.

3) Sword of Justice #1 comic is scheduled for a April 2020 release.

Okay! That's it for now! I hope you can pledge to help get this series finished! Thanks in advance everyone! You guys are great! All of you!

Any questions please email me!

Thanks for the support!
John Daniel Taylor IV

campaign.story:
BOOM! Thanks to you we are funded!!
New Reward Tier Added!! (Scroll down to see more.)
Now on to the Stretch Goals...
STRETCH GOAL #1 is a gorgeous pin-up by Karl Ottersberg of Caitlin and Alma. He is the creative force behind Danger Comics. (Scroll down to see the pin-up and more about Karl.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #2  Six  amazing digital comics that are available to anyone who has pledged $6  and above! (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #3 is a fantastical pin-up of Caitlin, Duncan, and the demon by Rafael Maldonado-Bad Hand. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #4 Six  wonderful digital comics that are available to anyone who has pledged $6  and above! (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #5 Three new bookmarks. All three will be UV Coated so the colors pop. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #6  This is the big one. If we make this one, I will be able to print the books in North America. REACHED!!
STRETCH GOAL #7 This is our last stretch goal and it's for everyone! Six digital comics, one of which is the Eisner nominated, Contact High #1. This is available to anyone who has pledged to a reward $6 and above. ( Scroll down for details.) REACHED!!
Everything beyond this point will go into producing future Boston Metaphysical Society comics.
***
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print our new standalone story, GHOSTS AND DEMONS (35 page story in a 44 page perfect bound book) AND our first ever BOSTON METAPHYSICAL COLORING BOOK.
Here's our cover!
Who will love Boston Metaphysical Society?
Fans of Penny Dreadful, Girl Genius, Ruse, steampunk and gaslamp fantasy stories.
People who like to read paranormal, historical fiction, and/or alternate history.
If you like character-driven comics with a mix of paranormal and science fiction, then these are the comics for you!
THE STORY
Caitlin and Alma have continued Mary and Frida’s work as union organizers, but when Caitlin has a disturbing dream about her childhood friend, Duncan the ghost, she decides to return to Boston to find out what’s wrong. Though it is a happy reunion with Samuel and Granville, something much more sinister awaits her and the team.
Ghosts and Demons was inspired by my standalone short story, Here Abide Monsters, which was part of the Some Time Later anthology, published by Thinking Ink Press.
First three pages:
THE BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY COLORING BOOK
I am so excited about this! The amazing Alejandro Lee has put together twenty (20) gorgeous illustrations for you to relax and color away to your heart's content. Includes illustrations of Samuel, Granville, Caitlin, Tesla, Houdini, and more! It will be an 8 1/2 x 11 book and is suitable for all ages.
For those of you who don't Alejandro, he is a Taiwanese-American illustrator, freelance storyboard artist and concept designer for studios in Hollywood, Santa Monica, and Burbank.  A graduate of Art Center College of Design, and nominee for 2015 Russ Manning Award for new graphic  novelists.
SAMPLE ILLUSTRATIONS:
NEW TO BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY?
If you are new to the series, the original six issue mini-series is  about an ex-Pinkerton detective, a spirit photographer, and a genius  scientist who battle supernatural forces in late 1800’s Boston. They  live in an alternate steampunk history where ghosts and demons are a  normal part of life. Families known as the Great Houses control the  economy of the Great States of America while the middle class and lower classes sole purpose are to serve the Great Houses.
The original trade paperback is available in several reward tiers.
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the original mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a ten page  short story called, Hunter-Killer, and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria  Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version  of the American Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship.  I introduce three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain; Emmet  Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
The complete sequential art version of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade. The original six issue mini-series and the trade paperback were picked up by Source Point Press in 2018.
WHAT ELSE IS THERE?
Our two previous standalone sequels will be available as well. 
THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN
 STORY: Granville and Tesla are in a race for time to save Boston from a mysterious disease that turns human beings into machines.
THE SPIRIT OF REBELLION
STORY: Caitlin flees to Philadelphia only to discover a ghost, a rebellion, and perhaps, her destiny.
NEW REWARD TIER!
This limited package includes a signed copy of Ghosts and Demons along with 4 pieces of Chocolate Covered Vegan Caramels adorned with edible printed yellow gears. 68% Dark Chocolate (single origin:  Madagascar) Organic & Vegan, coconut cream, fresh vanilla bean and sea salt. AND a 3 oz. Chocolate Bar of Hard Caramel  Apple which is used as a mosaic throughout this shareable bar with spices  from the Spice Mill (TM), a local Connecticut spice monger.
You can find Belle Monde at: https://www.etsy.com/shop/BelleMondeChocolates
THE MONEY:
Where the money goes - Your backing would enable us to pay for a  print run of the two books which means printing enough copies to send off to  backers with some leftover to sell at conventions, incentives, shipping  (which includes mailing envelopes, postage and handling.) And, of  course, the fees (5% off the top, plus credit card fees.)
THE TEAM FOR GHOSTS AND DEMONS, THE SPIRIT OF REBELLION, and THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A  TV, feature film, comic book writer, and novelist, Madeleine holds an  MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as  the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories, novellas, and a novel based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Other comic projects include the short story, The Scout which is part of The 4th Monkey anthology, The Sanctuary (The Edgar Allan Poe Chronicles anthology), The Marriage Counselor (The Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthology) and the upcoming The Airship Pirate which will be part of  The Rum Row anthology.
Gwynn Tavares – Artist/Colorist: Gwynn  starter out her art career as a sculptor. After a few years working on  movie special effects, she decided to go into sequential art and was the  artist for Amelia Sky. Majoring as in illustrator, Gwynn is also an accomplished comedian and currently lives in France.
Troy Peteri – Letterer: Troy is a Los  Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON  MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the  last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series for  Radical Comics.
THE TEAM FOR BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY TRADE PAPERBACK:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing, Writer/Creator. (See credits above.)
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from  the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever  since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a  comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky Cloonan,  and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for BOOM!  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series. Emily is  currently doing storyboards for Nickelodeon. 
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta,  she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent  projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone  else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre  related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist: Based in  Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist. He worked  as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to his work on  he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work includes Bob  Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn  Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for  his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also  writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist Christopher  Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT bestselling  anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6) (See credits above.)
The graphic novel was nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 Geekie Awards.
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston  Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art  by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling,  Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is  both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly  illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with  Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk  world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in  believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them." -  Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY. Not only does it bring my  love of science fiction and history together, (which by the way, equals  steampunk), the steampunk time period allows me to address the themes  of classism, sexism, and racism in America in a thoughtful and engaging  way. For at its very core, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American  story. And you can't tell an American story without including women and  people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters  who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different points  of view, are able to work together for the common good.
OTHER REWARDS
In addition to GHOSTS AND DEMONS, we are offering the trade  paperback, the anthology Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude,  the first novel set in this universe, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS, plus a NEW BOWLER HAT PIN. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique bronze color. (See image below.)
 (Proof. Enlarged for better viewing.) Pin designed by Bill Meahan.
Lapel Pin Set
A set of SIX Boston Metaphysical pins (Bowler Hat, Teapot, Dirigible, Tesla, 1800's Box Camera, and Triquetra) in a lovely gift box with our logo are available as well.
(Sample Only. Box will contain a complete set of all six collectable pins.)
HERE ABIDE MONSTERS
A few reward tiers include the standalone short story of Here Abide Monsters (ebook version). This is the origin story of Duncan the ghost. It was originally published in the anthology, Some Time Later, from Thinking Ink Press. 
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS
The award winning novel, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS, is a prequel to the original graphic novel though it can be read as a  standalone. It takes place five years prior to the original series.
It was awarded a Silver Medal as well as The Write Companion Award for Best Overall TOP PICK - Adult, Children's and Young Adult categories in the 2019 Feathered Quill Book Awards.
Story: As the Great Houses of Boston jockey  for power, an ex-Pinkerton detective, his psychic wife, and his  father-in-law must contend with treachery, subterfuge, and a new demonic  threat, in this political and supernatural thriller set in an  alternate-history Boston of 1890.
The award winning cover is by Luisa Preissler. Title Graphics by Anke Koopman.
And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of  short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel  met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how  Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers  include it as either a pdf or print version.
SPECIAL COMMISSION REWARD TIER (Kickstarter Exclusive)
Did you ever want to hang out with a demon? Well this may be the closest you'll  come as Gwynn and I are offering this limited (6) reward tier where YOU  will be drawn next to the DEMON (in appropriate period  costume) in an 11x17 print. Here is the portrait in which a chosen few  will be drawn into.
STRETCH GOALS
STRETCH GOAL #1 - $5,900 (Kickstarter Exclusive) **REACHED!**
Backers who have pledged $10 or more to a physical reward will  receive  this wonderful 8 1/2 x 11 inch print on 10 pt. cardstock gloss  by the amazing Karl Ottersberg.
 Karl Ottersberg is a mostly self-taught artist influenced comic books, movie serials, and classic pulps. A decade ago, he and writer, David Thomas, began self-publishing webcomics under DANGER COMICS.  
Contact: dangercomicscorp.com; facebook.com/DangerComics; twitter.com/DangerComics1; facebook.com/KarlOttersberg; twitter.com/KarlOttersberg
STRETCH GOAL #2 - **$6,900 REACHED!**
DIGITAL COMIC BUNDLE #1
This stretch goal is available to anyone who has pledged $6 or more.  And one of the comics is a double-issue which means seven more digital  comics to add to your collection!
The Gamma Girls by Stefano Terry
The Story: Kira, Harriet, and Sue are your average high school students at Brightstone City High School by day, but by night, they are The Gamma Gals, protecting Brightstone City from countless super villains, monsters, and more!
Stefano Terry is an artist, writer, and Associate Game Designer residing in Los Angeles, CA.  When not working on comics, he is an avid gamer, reader, and D&D player.
Published by Fanbase Press
Harland Buck – Free Sword by Scott Weldon
The story: Harland Buck is a tough, cynical mercenary swordsman burdened with a conscience he sometimes wishes he didn't have. Join him as he plies his trade in a world of hard men, tough women, frontier wilderness, myth, magic and adventure.
By day, Scott Weldon is a mild-mannered Personnel Tech for the County of Santa Cruz, but when he’s not pushing papers for the local government, he’s the writer/creator of Harland Buck – FreeSword, an independent comic book series he has self-published through his own Weldon Studio since 2016.  www.weldonstudio.com.
The Children’s Vampire Hunting Brigade by David Lucarelli
The Story: In 1954 hundreds of school children descended upon a Scottish cemetery looking for a vampire with iron teeth they believed had killed a couple of local kids. Today it is looked upon as an incident of mass hysteria. But what if some of those children found what they were looking for?”
David Lucarelli is the writer of the best-selling critically acclaimed crime drama comic Tinseltown from Alterna Comics about one of the first female police officers in Hollywood. He is also the author of The Children’s Vampire Hunting Brigade Trilogy of graphic novels published by Creator’s Edge Press.
Dragon’s By the Yard by Kelly Swails (based on a story by D. Lynn Smith)
The Story: Anna is a woman who handcrafts all things dragon, but when she meets a strange woman at the swap meet who sells her some extraordinary fabric, she gets more than she bargained for.
Kelly Swails is a writer, editor, and all-around geek. She is co-Director of the Gen Con Writer's Symposium. Her credits include short stories, novels, and comics. Find her online at www.kellyswails.com. Published by http://www.kymerapress.com
Norah by Kasey Pierce
The Story: A dark surreal sci-fi, the titular character Norah has the ability to delve into the mind’s eye of the comatose—retrieving them from their state or helping them cross to the other side. This ability was obtained while working in pathogenic development for the CIA, creating viral weapons for means of bio warfare.
Kasey Pierce is an author from the Metro Detroit area. Her prose horror novella, Pieces of Madness, gave her residency on the comic convention circuit in 2015. She joined the Source Point Press shortly after and created the "Norah" series.   Other titles include Viking-horror series, “Seeress” and the upcoming paranormal space opera about Alzheimer’s, “The Other People Who Live Here” (currently in production).
http://www.sourcepointpress.com
The Locksmith by Terrance Grace
The Story: There is a room inside an old tenement building in the Bronx. Inside the room is a doorway that leads to another dimension where past, present and future exist simultaneously.
Terrance Grace is an award-winning writer, director and visual artist. He has seven optioned feature screenplays and three independently produced films to his credit. Aside from "The Locksmith," he has also published "The Crossroads" board book and is working on the graphic novel, "Spanish Moss".
 STRETCH GOAL #3 - $7,900 (KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE) **REACHED!**
Backers who have pledged $10 or more to a physical reward will  receive  this wonderful 8 1/2 x 11 inch print on 10 pt. cardstock gloss  by the wonderful Rafael Maldonado-Bad Hand.
Rafael is the creator of Pilla, Kaui, and Lakota Playing Cards. He owns an operates áyA Studios with his wife Kristina. 
 STRETCH GOAL #4 - $9000  **REACHED!!**
DIGITAL COMIC BUNDLE #2
This stretch goal is available to anyone who has pledged $6 or more.  
Love Town by Matt and John Yuan
Love Town is a supernatural noir thriller set in the fictitious city of Los Amores, a town where magic is real and the supernatural is the everyday.  For Detective Allie Saxon, life as the only vampire and the only female detective on the force is a difficult one as she struggles to balance her existence as a newly infected vampire with her duties as a police officer in a world where the line between up and down, black and white, and right and wrong is a razor thin one.
Matt and John Yuan write and illustrate Love Town as well as Inspector Oh and Serving Supes, all of which are available through First Comics.  In addition to writing and drawing, Matt and John are also actors, having appeared in feature films like Observe and Report with Seth Rogen and Michael Pena, and television series such as Arrested Development, Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, and It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.
Ah Heck!! by Mary Zorilita Bellamy
When Angel suddenly finds herself in Heck, forced into an afterlife of never-ending maid duty she must dodge evil bunnies, killer teddy bears and other perils, while seeking to find a way to change her fate. But her actions just might turn all Heck on its ear, pitting the rulers of the underworld against each other in a cosmic war. 
Mary has worked on properties like My Little Pony, Marvel, DC Comics, Ghostbusters, Adventure Time, Rick and Morty and more. She has illustrated over 4,000 artist trading cards for official sets and has been published in over 150 books, some of which are internationally distributed. 
Pilla by Rafael Maldonado-Bad Hand
“Pilla” is the story of a young girl searching for her father in a post-apocalyptic world where humans are on the bottom of the food chain. Befriending a giant cat like beast she names Dog Dog, they try to survive being hunted for food long enough to reunite with her father.
Rafael Maldonado Bad Hand is a Denver based graphic artist and creator of “Pilla." He and his wife founded an independent publishing company, áyA Studios LLC.  Rafael is a commissioner on the Denver American Indian Commission and is passionate about community, equality and artist rights.  You can find and follow Rafael on social media and at https://www.ayastudiosllc.com/
Is'nana the Were-Spider: The Ballads of Rawhead & John Henry by Greg Anderson Elysée
After defeating the steam drill in a race to build a railroad, John Henry finds himself transported into a different world where machines rule and hunt humans down for fuel. Is’nana and his father, Anansi the African Spider God of Stories, must find Henry and bring him back to his original world, but can they help Henry defeat the machine bent on hunting them down first?
Greg Anderson Elysée is a Brooklyn, NY born Haitian-American writer, educator, filmmaker, and model. He  has been teaching various forms of filmmaking, including narrative and documentary, from elementary level to the elderly since 2012.  
Is'nana: The Were-Spider was his first comic series, and is a multi-award winner, including 2018 Fan Award, Rising Star, and Best Male Character, and 2019 Best Writer and Story of the Year (Glyph Awards).
https://webwaycomics.ecwid.com/
Monstrous by Greg Wright
The quiet villages of Frankenstein's Europe get a lot louder! A girl's father is killed by a monster so she seeks revenge by hiring an even tougher monster.  The duo face steam-powered robots and undead gangsters.
Greg has written the Holliston graphic novels, Last Monster Standing, Monstrous, and Wild Bullets. He earned a Ph.D. in American Literature and Film from Michigan State, and his award-winning fiction has appeared in a variety of journals.  
http://www.sourcepointpress.com
Impure Blood by Nathan Lueth
Roan is an enslaved gladiator, and a half-blooded descendant of an ancient mystical race that has been hunted to the point of extinction by humans. He is rescued by the mysterious Dara in exchange for his help in seeking out the last full-blooded member of his kind before an army of monsters can beat her to it.
Nadja Baer has been a word-nerd all her life. She speaks English, German, Italian, French and Spanish (with varying degrees of fluency), and can teach Taekwondo classes in Korean. She has a BA in Creative Writing with a minor in U.S. History from the University of Minnesota.  She is now focused on writing The Eternal Watch series of urban fantasy novels. 
Nathan Lueth is a Comic Book Artisan, Freelance Illustrator, and Traveling Caricaturist. He has done Illustrations and developed logos for clients large and small (Target, General Mills, Stone Arch Books).  His steam-fantasy graphic novel, Impure Blood, is launching a Kickstarter in February. Nathan is a graduate of the Minneapolis College of Art and Design. He is also a 2019 DINKy award nominee, a 2009 Zuda finalist, and a 2008 finalist in Rising Stars of Manga. 
impurebloodwebcomic.com
STRETCH GOAL #5 - $10,150  **REACHED!!**
Three new bookmarks. Designed by Gwynn Tavares, they will be UV coated so the colors pop. They feature Duncan, the demon, and Alma. (Those who have pledged to a physical reward will receive all three bookmarks.)
STRETCH GOAL #6 - $11,550 **REACHED!!**
This is the big one.  I always keep my budget lean, which means I often have to send the books to overseas printers. However, if we make this goal, I will be able to print the books in North America instead of overseas and get them to you SOONER!!
STRETCH GOAL #7 - $12,550 **REACHED!!**
DIGITAL BUNDLE #3
This stretch goal is available to anyone who has pledged $6 or more.
The Rumble Kings by Ryan Cummins
A group of exiled soldiers travel through an alternate futuristic dystopia as they sell their violent skills to the highest bidders.
Ryan is a freelance website contributor, blogger and his collection of prose short stories will see release in late 2020.
Skeletal Press is the home for Michigan based comic book writer & creator Ryan Cummins. https:/www.skeletalpress.com/
Wordsmith by Stephen Kok
All it takes is a word. When one of Victoria's words goes awry, she sets off on an adventure to try and get things back the way they were. With her dragon Sparky, will she succeed or make matters worse? Word Smith is a steampunk fantasy adventure where words can come to life!
Stephen Kok launched his first graphic novel Tabby (a retelling of Romeo & Juliet with cats) in 2015. His graphic novels are in over 500+ public libraries in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Canada and the UK. 
Milford Green by Samuel George London
Apart from winning "Prettiest Village in the British Empire, 1897" Milford Green is a normal village in the rolling hills of Southern England. That is until on one summer's evening, Alfie Fairfield, a socially awkward inventor, sees some kind of flying vehicle shoot across the sky and crash land into a field.  Alfie investigates to find out that we are not alone in this universe.
Samuel George London is a comic book writer from Winchester in the UK. He's best known for his Victorian space adventure series Milford Green but he's also written the all-ages horror comic Project Hoax and the all-ages sci-fi comic SAFFRON: Spacetime Academy Adventures. Twitter and Instagram on @SamuelGLondon and visit  www.SignalComics.com .
Night Wolf by Rob Multari
Born into the outcast breed of werewolves known as the Monoki, eighteen-year-old Rodney Marcelli is reluctantly thrown into an ancient war between good and evil. With the help of Snow Paw, the Pureblood Monoki, and the supernatural evil slayer, Night Hunter, Rod must learn to master his newly found lycanthropy and mysterious kinetic energy power that only he possesses. 
Robert works in multiple genres including horror, supernatural, superhero, and antihero themed comic books. Founder of Lone Wolf Comics. In July 2017, Rob released the first issue of his ongoing comic book series, Night Wolf, both in print and digital formats.  https://lonewolfcomics.com/

Encoding Bushido by Jessie Toves 
 It is the story of a master robotics designer who wants to imbue his creations with something that has all but disappeared from modern Japan - the Bushido code of honor.
Raised on Guam, transplanted to California, Jesse started working in advertising and computer graphics in San Diego. Moving to Los Angeles, Jesse went on to earn two Emmy nominations and two Visual Effects Society awards for work on television shows like Battlestar Galactica and Caprica.
https://m.comixology.com/Encoding-Bushido/comics-series/40962
Contact High by James F. Wright
A 2018 Eisner Award-nominated story about a future where people are forced to live their lives in protective suits, skin-to-skin contact is akin to drug addiction. This is the story of what one man will endure, amid those conditions, to feel the touch of another.
 James is also the co-creator (with artist Jackie Crofts) of Nutmeg, a coming-of-age culinary crime comic published by Action Lab Entertainment, which debuted in April 2015. He is also working with Liana Buszka, Bex Glendining, and Ariana Maher on Lupina,  to be published by Legendary Comics.  
http://www.jamesfwrites.com/

campaign.story:
***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
***DOMESTIC US SHIPPING INCLUDED, and all books come signed by creator Bret Juliano.***
What's contained in this 132 page collection? 
The Blind Tiger contains over 200 comics, a pin-up gallery, Bret Juliano's guest strips for other webcomics, and a brand new book-exclusive comic chapter focusing on the Corvalus mafia family.
Campaign Exclusives
Crocheted Dust Bunny Mafia Characters
Mobimal (mobster animal) drawn into the book
Limited Edition Variant Cover by Travis Hanson
With this print run, I am doing a limited edition print run of 50 copies of a variant cover designed by Eisner-nominated, fantasy illustrator, Travis Hanson, creator of The Bean, and Life of the Party - Realities of an RPG'er. 
 Who will love Dust Bunny Mafia? 
Fans of mafia-related pop culture like The Godfather, Goodfellas, and The Sopranos.
Lovers of Saturday morning cartoons and the Sunday funny papers.
People who like cartoons such as Looney Tunes and Animaniacs.
Collectors of high quality independent comic books.
Here's What People are Saying... 
Based on a True Story
You can read Based on a True Story, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection, for free by clicking here.
If you enjoyed the Based on a True Story, click here to share it with your friends!
"Just downloaded Based on a True Story from @dustbunnymafia! You can get it here! (Click to Tweet)"
Bret Juliano - Creator  
Bret Juliano is a cartoonist and creator of the all ages Dust Bunny Mafia comic, which has over 650 comics in its archive and Mobimals. In late 2016, Bret published Meet the Family, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection. In 2019, he successfully funded a Kickstarter for Based on a True Story, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection. His dust bunny mobsters have also been included in several anthologies including Unlawful Good, Forgotten Histories and Out of the Deep as part of the Let’s Make Comics: Chicago Collective. He is an avid consumer of mafia trivia, both fact and fiction, and a passionate collector of fedoras.
For as far back as I can remember I was always drawing. When I was a kid, my dream job was to be an animator for Disney, but as I grew up, my focus shifted into the world of comics...newspaper styled comics especially. 
Garfield, Calvin and Hobbes, Peanuts, Zits, Get Fuzzy...I could keep going, but I won't. I would read the Sunday funny paper back to back for years. 
These were the things that brought joy to me and my comics, the Dust Bunny Mafia in particular, is my opportunity to tell my stories and give back in comics form.
I am coming to Kickstarter in order to create The Blind Tiger, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection because there's a supportive audience here that can help me grow my brand's reach and I know people need a to laugh and I know that my Dust Bunny Mafia comics can help with that.
Why did I write this book?
I love mobster stories, they are the modern day version of the cowboys of the wild West. 
This book proposes a world where mobsters may not be evil. What if they are not the corrupt ones after all? What would it look like if the mobsters didn't know they were the villains at all? 
What will the funds be used for?
With this Kickstarter, I'm looking to do a 250 copy first run of this collection. 200 copies of the standard cover and 50 copies of the variant cover by Travis Hanson. This should allow for enough copies to fulfill the Kickstarter pre-orders and allow me with copies to sell at conventions in the future. If the project is wildly successful and over-funded, I will look into printing more copies as the funding allows.
Main Chapter: The Sugar Ban
When a nationwide sugar ban goes into effect leaving citizens craving  sugar, Leo Veronisci only sees opportunity. Allying himself with the  Corvalus brothers to leverage both families to push his bootleg sugar to  the masses makes both families rich. Until a bumbling detective  accidentally stumbles into a sugar delivery.
It all ties in together... 
One of the biggest influences for me with this campaign was planning all of the details, not just with the actual logistics of the campaign, but rather, with incorporating the small details that most people wouldn't notice or even know about. For instance, with both this campaign, and the book itself, the overarching theme is Prohibition. And the inspiration for this came from my researching of Al Capone, one of Chicago's biggest bootleggers. 
This campaign was launched on Al Capone's birthday, January 17th; it's running for 29 days, which is just past Valentine's Day; and in 1929, Al Capone was supposedly the brains behind the St. Valentine's Day Massacre, which resulted from the struggle to control organized crime in the city during Prohibition between the Irish North Siders, headed by George "Bugs" Moran, and their Italian South Side rivals led by Al Capone.
In fact, I did an in-depth Facebook live-stream explaining all about it, which you can watch by clicking on the screen below.
https://www.facebook.com/DustBunnyMafia/videos/207316790427776/
So...What's in it For Me?

Get Your Own Mobimal Drawn Into the Book!
At the High Roller ($150) and Boss of Bosses ($300) pledge levels, I will draw your very own mobimal into the book in an advertisement for the Four Deuces casino, run by the Dust Bunny Mafia. Limited to 5 characters only. 
 Project Timeline
Milestone Bonus Gifts
After we reach funding at each of the major milestones below, a new Blind Tiger related Dust Bunny Mafia mini-print will be revealed. Each print was done by a different comic artist, but I need your help to unlock them! Digital mini-prints will be sent to everyone at the Soldier level ($15) or above. Physical mini-prints will be sent with every Made Member level ($35) or above.
What's left to do?
The Blind Tiger is 99% complete.
There is only one page that hasn't been finished, the Four Deuces advertisement page. Once the Kickstarter ends, I will be in contact with the backers at the High Roller and Boss of Bosses levels to get started on their mobimal characters, and hopefully be able to draw them in during the two weeks while I wait for the funds to clear.
Once that's been done, I can send the files to the printer and then ship the books out once they're printed.
Last year I brought my first project to Kickstarter, a mini comic collection, Based on a True Story and I can't thank everyone enough for supporting my work before on Kickstarter. You are directly responsible for helping me achieve this dream of producing my own comics. Please join me and back this Kickstarter to help my dream of making comics come true.
FREE PREVIEW
***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
If you enjoyed the Based on a True Story, click here to share it with your friends!

campaign.story:
Premise
The year is 1942, and World War 2 rages on. You are the head of an elite team of cryptanalysts tasked with breaking the infamous Enigma code. But you're not the only one working towards this goal. It seems that rival teams are trying to decipher it as well - and only one can gain the fame and recognition that comes with deciphering this near impossible cipher. It seems the fate of the war rests on your shoulders.
You better get crackin'.
Game Features
Code Crackers: The Enigma is a 3-5 player “cooperatively competitive” game where players work towards the same goal of cracking the enigma code. However, there can only be one winner. Whomever has added the most percent when the tracker reaches or exceeds 100% on the end of any given player’s turn wins!
Who’s this game for?
Code Crackers is a 3-5 player game meant to be an entry level game along the same level of difficulty as Catan or Ticket to Ride. Each of the game’s mechanics are simple, but together they create a complex, dynamic system that rewards clever planning and creative playstyles.  It is a game that can be quick to learn but difficult to master! Cardgame players will find Code Cracker easy to pick up!
While Code Crackers’ board layout may seem traditional, it relies on it’s unique tracker mechanic that shows the overall progress rather than each player’s individual contribution.  It’s great for people looking to transition from more traditional board games (like monopoly and risk) to more complex games that are still easy to pick up. With 3 different ways to play, plus characters with their own unique abilities, you can make the game as difficult or as easy as you want!
What’s in the box?
1 Game Board
  5 Player Cards
  30 Coins
  15 Player Percent trackers
  5 Main Percent Trackers
  150 Research Cards
  85 Asset Cards
  7 Character Cards
  18 Event Cards
Print and Play

Here is a print and play for you all to try the game!
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1pO57k-4qmJkndFfNUi51lO3GGc9YTwDS
How to Play
Full rules here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zqJoImC7arp3Oz1mdRmnb7zsCgjZuvoDfCKlo8jneMU/edit#
Players on their turn will go through 2 phases: the Research Phase and the Investment phase.
Research Phase
During most player’s research phase, they will turn any active cards on their facilities clockwise from 3 descending to “Research Complete”. When Research Complete is hit, the card is flipped over and the player does what the card says.
For example, if it says add 5%, the player adds 5% to their own personal board and 5% to the main board.
If it says minus 4%, the active player chooses another player to lose 4% and 4% is lost on the main board.

Investment Phase
Each player has 3 actions during this phase and can choose from any of the following options. A player may choose the same option multiple times, but they must take all 3 actions on their turn.
Purchase: Market
The player may purchase a Research card from the Market row. Spend gold equal to the number in the gold circle in the card’s bottom right hand corner, then add that card to their hand.
Alternatively, face down Research cards may be purchased from the top of each deck for an amount of gold equal to the number in the gold circle in the bottom right hand corner.
Immediately replace empty spots in the Market row with the top card of the respective Market deck.
Purchase: Asset
The player may spend gold to purchase an Asset card from the Asset row. The cost of the card is located in the gold circle at the top of the card.
Immediately replace empty spots in the Asset row with the top card of the respective Asset deck. Make sure that the top card of the deck is face up.
Immediate effects resolve as soon as the card is purchased. Conditional Effects can never be triggered off of an immediate action on the same card.
If it has an immediate action, the effect happens as soon as the player purchases the card. If the card has a Conditional Effect, it does not trigger itself when the card up.
Activate a Card
The player may place one of the cards from their hand face down on one of their open facilities with the circled number on the back completing the circle on their player card.
Expedite
The player may turn one of their active research cards clockwise, as if it was in the research phase.
Receive Funding
Take 1 gold from the bank.
At the end of their turn, if a player has more than 5 gold, they must reduce down to 5 and return their extra gold to the bank.
Our Story
Code Crackers: The Enigma was born over 3 years ago with a simple idea of adding and subtracting percentage. Stored in a closet for about a year until Rob, newly moved to Massachusetts, decided to turn this idea into a reality.
Rob went to Great Stories, his local game shop, to see how the game would fare, and it was a great success!  Spending the next year and half refining and expanding the game, it has been played hundreds of times by dozens of people.The reception has been extremely positive from people of all walks of gaming.
We are now trying to get this game to a market near you! We hope that you enjoy Code Crackers: The Enigma!
campaign.risks:

The game’s art is mostly done and just needs about a month or two of extra work to refine. However, as this is our first board game, we fully expect there may be some unforeseen challenges. We have gotten our quote from Panda Productions and have built extra money into the budget to cover the cost of the game as well as the fees for Kickstarter. 

Thank you for looking at our game!

The Following Casework returns with the start of a brand-new journey. T. Titus Thyme and Bev investigate a church that had been struck by lightning seven times. Meanwhile, a small high school in Connecticut has a new hero tragically brought to life as she takes on a shooting in her classroom.
Saving Grace part 1 is filled with wonder, battles, magic, and standing up against past forms of deity.

Dive deeper into the world of The Following Casework
Enjoy a new take on faith and divinity in the modern era
24 pages gorgeously brought to life in Full color
The beginning of this ongoing series
Interested? Click here to read a 6-page short story right now! 

 www.arcaneinkdustries.com
 https://lulisluc.deviantart.com/gallery/49893021/ComicArt
 http://Skysunnymq.deviantart.com
 https://micahletterscomics.com
"The Following Casework" provides us with a fun, creative examination of what things we truly revere as "gods" from the lens of two instantly affable characters in a magical world. - John Robinson, Creator of Scorpio
I finished my Master's degree in Divinity in mid 2018, specializing in Church and the Arts. Through my study, I saw that art pieces were allowing me to see God in a way far clearer to me than treatises. Art brought on a new way to bring faith to life, and explore the nature of belief.
Saving Grace is the starting point of what The Following Casework is going to be all about: a tale of belief, magic, gods, current conflicts, and the power and costs of faith. What do we gain when we believe, and what do we lose? The Following Casework hopes to bring these questions and answers to life.
Kickstarter has proven to be our best way of getting the word out to you, dear audience. The first issue of Saving Grace is complete, and ready to go to print. The funds will go to offsetting the print run cost, and moving us towards the next issue. 
This is the beginning of a four-issue arc. With your support, we will be able to make The Following Casework a success, launching onto the next issue and beyond.

We love making comics. It is absolutely wonderful to be able to bring these to life. Most of the funds will be used for printing our books. We have set some aside to begin the production of part 2, and excess funds will help make it a reality. The more that we are able to raise, the faster we will be able to turn around and make the next issue!
 Thank you so much for reading so far. Enjoy the first seven pages of "Saving Grace," absolutely free!


We have fantastic books coming to you from Arcane Inkdustries. Make sure you check out everything and get caught up on all of our works, including:
Print and digital editions of "Saving Grace"
Our one-shot for The Following Casework, "#INeedaMiracle"
"Why Faith?" a new comics anthology featuring 30 comics on faith, compassion, and raising awareness of belief.
Prose Books from Arcane Inkdustries, including "Dealing with the Apocalypse," "Demon Riders," and "Born of Magic"
Error 60D: Immortality Not Found Titus T-Shirt!
Thank you so much for reading about The Following Casework. I cannot be happier that you care this much about our comic. 
Please back our project and get your copy of "Saving Grace." I hope it is something that is enjoyable, thought-provoking, and an exciting new journey in your life!

campaign.story:
THE SIX SWORDS is a 96-page Kung-Fu spaghetti western graphic novel, that is set in a post World War IV United States. This post-apocalyptic pulp fiction prints issues #1 - 3 of the series, collecting the first story arc of THE SIX SWORDS into a trade!  
 If you love:
Tons of violence with a side of comedy
Dystopian futures
Spaghetti westerns
Quirky ensembles
  Then you THE SIX SWORDS is perfect for you! 
 Click here to read the first 22-page issue of Six Swords absolutely FREE! 
A look inside the graphic novel!
I'm so sure you'll love THE SIX SWORDS that I want you to try it for free. I know you'll want to see what happens next!
In the wake of World War IV, a group of rag-tag miscreants are force to team up and travese across a post-apocalyptic United States searching for personal redemption and the pursuit of those who wish to cash in on their bounty. As they fight against cults, gangland wars, and mob rule, each town the Six Swords visit offers a new promise of hope, but mostly danger.
Artwork from the graphic novel
Will this motley crew of has-beens and wannabes reach their goal? Or are they just making everything worse? 
Chris Massari, Co-Creator and Writer
Chris is the writer/co-creator of THE SIX SWORDS and writer/creator of THIRTEEN, creator/editor/writer of JUST ANOTHER REGULAR DAY and 生きがい - IKIGAI for KAYFABE: A WRESTLING ANTHOLOGY VOL. 3, as well as other online, magazine and news publications to include ComicsVerse, Ain't It Cool News, Heavy.com, Screen Rant, Black Belt Magazine, PanelxPanel and others. 
He is also a United States Airman and lifelong martial artist.  
Hi! I'm Chris Massari
Have you ever played a roleplaying game like Dungeons & Dragons, and everyone is really in character, but no one takes the story seriously? And then you get into a bunch of trouble and things go off the rails?
Yeah, this is kind of like that.
More artwork from the graphic novel
Picture the craziest bunch of nutjobs you could play D&D with and you've got the THE SIX SWORDS! It's perfect for fans of:
Quentin Tarantino
Cowboy Bebop
Samurai Jack
Kill Bill
The Hateful Eight
Akira Kurosawa
Mad Max
Westerns, Pulp or Post-Apocalyptic Fiction
  You know you're friends with guys like this
BUT, turn back now if you don't like:
Heroes who drop wise cracks as often as they drop bodies
The occasional decapitation
A lawless wild west with no rules.
  Because seriously, this one is NOT for you.  
Reviews are in - "Six Swords" is awesome!
BRAND NEW FINAL WEEK TIER!!!!!!!!!
 Since the birth of THE SIX SWORDS seven years ago as nothing more than a drunken Facebook post about the 2012 "Mayan apocalypse" and it's evolution since, starting from our first script in 2014 and our first printing in 2017, it's been a long and bumpy ride trying to bring this series to life. And honestly, I've been blown away by how many folks are as excited about the Six Swords as I am!
Spaghetti westerns, throwback kung-fu movies, and pulp fiction are quirky and weird and awesome. It's so cool to see how many of you like goofy R-Rated stuff like I do!
A look at how we plan to use the funds
The thing about the THE SIX SWORDS is, even though they're a bunch of strangers and weirdos, they come together as a team. And that's what Kickstarter is about - all of us coming together to make stuff we love.  
Rewards expected to fulfill April 2020
I'm so proud of THE SIX SWORDS, and I'm proud to share it with you. And that's why I'm so grateful - because I don't just want backers to read my work. I want you to be a part of it, and to feel just as proud of this graphic novel as I am. Thanks for giving me the chance to share my dream with you.
Always grateful,
Chris Massari
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The story and artwork are already completed, and Kickstarter funds will be used for printing and fulfillment. We're using overseas printers, which can result in delays out of our control, from labor strikes to inclement weather to customs inspections. However, we are working with a reputable printing partner to ensure the process is as smooth as possible. Additionally, we have retained a campaign manager who has run six successful Kickstarter campaigns and published five original works to help us avoid common pitfalls.

updates.update_userinfo: Books Are In Print - Update Jan. 3, 2020
updates.update_content:
Hi all,

I hope you have all had a great holiday and new year and are still surviving and in good health in these turbulent times.

To start with the obvious, once again, I apologize for the continued long absences and updates, and lack of information. As I'm sure it was for most of you in 2020, it did not go in any shape or form as expected and new problems were the only consistency about it. Fulfilling this Kickstarter has been a true expression of 2020.
