campaign.story:
Thank you for checking out this Kickstarter for Kinetic, Volume 1.  There are more preview images and information below, but I am also inviting you to enjoy the first issue of Kinetic absolutely FREE so you can decide if the book is right for you!  Just visit www.ycomics.net/kickstarter 
Enjoy Kinetic either Physically or Digitally!
Imagine you are developing superpowers, but there is just one problem...
Your city already has a hero.
But that hero is a jerk, and he doesn't really care, so you think you can do a better job.

Hi!  I'm Bill Coulombe (pronounced "cool - ohm"), and for the last year and a half I've been pitching those sentences to anyone who will listen!  That's the basic premise for my behind my comic, Kinetic, an independent superhero story.
I've sold Kinetic comics at any comic convention that will have me.  I've appeared at over 50 comic conventions and have sold over 11,000 of these books.
Join the hundreds who already enjoy Kinetic!
Now, I want to take the story and turn it into a Trade Paperback. 
We've packed the entire first story arc, issues #1 - 8, into one oversized book.  It's going to feature the first eight issues of Kinetic, as well as a cover gallery so you can take in some of the beautiful artwork of Jason Metcalf and Ivan Nunes.
One cool thing about Kinetic, that you don't see in too many comics anymore - it is the same creative team for all 8 books.  This even stays true for the revised pages for the trade paperback!
Revised pages?!
In the first printings, there were a few pages that I put a mental asterix by.  I wanted to spruce them up.  I rehired on the original team to draw and color a few revised pages.  They don't affect the story at all - any changes are very minor.
Example of one of our revised pages. Old on the left, new on the right!
WE ARE ALSO INCLUDING FREE U.S. SHIPPING ON ALL PHYSICAL PLEDGES!
Not familiar with Kinetic?  Shame on you!  (I kid, of course)
But good news: this is the best way to hop on board and read the full story.
 Here's a little something to help you figure out whether this book is for you:
 But enough about me.  It takes a whole team to put together a comic...
We have all put a lot of blood, sweat, and tears into this series, and we think it's a pretty great read.  But of course we're going to say that!
Here's what some others have said about the series:
Below is a small preview from the first few pages: 
Page 1
Page 2
Page 3
Page 4
Page 5

But I just don't want you to take THEIR words for it, or even this short preview.  I'm inviting you to try out the first issue of Kinetic for absolutely FREE at the link below:
Just go to www.ycomics.net/kickstarter and I will send you a digital copy of issue 1, totally FREE.  So you can go check out the first issue, and decide for yourself!
Kinetic always started with a simple idea:  I thought that it would be a good name for a superhero.
I had written some comic scripts in the mid-2000s that never really went anywhere, but had never really tackled producing the books.  Back then, the internet wasn't as advanced as it is today.
In 2016 I decided that this is something I seriously want to do.
Next thing you know I had a script, then some artwork, then a comic, and then a whole series!
But until now, Kinetic has not been available outside of convention sales or my company website, which begs the question...
I have a confession.
When I started Kinetic, I didn't think very highly of Kickstarter.  Way too easy for someone to walk away with my money, I thought.  And I considered it a source of pride to self fund my books.  But as the platform has expanded, I had two epiphanies:
I would never walk away with anyone's money.  So...what exactly is stopping me?!
And as the platform expanded and I have backed more and more of my fellow creators, I realized that Kickstarter is not just a funding platform...
It is an awesome community!
I want to share my story with this awesome community.  And also, let's face it, printing a 192 page graphic novel is a LOT more expensive than printing the 22 page single issues.
Like I said before, the book in totally done.  The artwork is done, including the revised pages.  We are using these funds just for printing the book.
Kickstarter takes 7% off the top, and another 3% goes to the card processor.
Now that we have the who, what, and why taken care of, let's talk about the most exciting part: some of our AWESOME pledge levels!
Here is a video showing off the Limited Edition covers available, perfect for collectors:
PLAY

Rafael Chrestani Concept Cover - 1 of 250
Jason Metcalf B&W Variant Cover - 1 of 200
 ALL PHYSICAL BACKERS ALSO RECEIVE TWO KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE PRINTS:
John Jones "Flying at Night" - KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE PRINT
Rafael Chrestani "Superman Homage" - KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE PRINT

What's the Plan, Man?!
So here's the plan:
In closing, thank you for stopping by my page and checking out my book.  By now you should have a good idea about the campaign and some of our awesome rewards.
Since writing Kinetic, the last few years have been crazy (in the best possible way!).  I am very blessed to do this and hope I will continue making fun stories for years to come.
So now it's time to act.  Whether it's just the High Five Level, Digital Bundle or the Ultimate Collector Level, go pick out your favorite reward tier, and let's make this happen!  I can't wait for you to read my story!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The best part about Kinetic, Volume 1 - since it has already been released in comic form, all the artwork is totally and completely finished! There are a few pages I wanted to redo or update slightly for the TPB, and I have already taken action. They are done

I've already spoken with my printer, PrintNinja, so we are on the same page. They are ready to start as soon as this gets funded.

All I have to do is click "Approve Proof" and the ball gets rolling!

My last Kickstarter failed to fund. It was my first time on the platform, and I did a lot of things wrong. I thought I could just hand out fliers at conventions and have people flock to the page. 

I know now I need to be hands on with the campaign online. I need to reach out before it actually launches to get people on board, which I have. I have signed up for ComixLaunch, who specialize in Kickstarter funding.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: Kinetic, Vol. 1: Origins - An Action Packed Superhero Story

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal 1 Unlocked! 
Unlocked for backers of a physical tier £7 and above.
Stretch Goal 2 Unlocked! 10 new cats in hats in the book. 
My project
My name is Patrick Brooks and I am a children’s book illustrator and writer www.psbrooks.com.  I have also volunteered looking after cats in adoption centres for over a year. I wanted to create a book inspired by the cats I have met and get a collection of illustrations together. 

Why hats? 
Because cats are incredibly stylish!
I thought it would be a fun way of getting a large group of cats together and show how unique they all are. Every single cat has their own personality, and all need love and understanding. I also wanted to try to raise awareness of rescue cats and those who work with and volunteer with them. Some are abandoned and unwanted and I thought it would be interesting to include some of my experiences within the book too, showing how rewarding and important it is to help cats get re-homed with caring owners. 
The book also contains information on hats (some are quite unusual, such as the umbrella hat!) and some quite fascinating cat facts too. I hope this book will appeal to cat lovers, will make people smile and also encourage readers to find out more about the work adoption centres do to help cats in need. 

 Original art available too. 
My plan
The artwork is complete and the target of £550 is to cover printing/shipping. 

Rewards







 Other books in rewards: 
DREAMS
A 100 page collection of artwork. 
THE MAGIC ACCORDION
A pirate cat adventure.
GOOSE VS MOOSE
A story about teamwork and emotional well being.
Hugs for Mummy
A deer and fawn story.
Hugs for Daddy
A story about a lion and his cub.

campaign.story:
Orson Welles: Warrior of the Worlds is a two-volume graphic novel series with the premise that Orson Welles's legendary War of the Worlds radio broadcast was not a prank: an alien invasion really happened. After Welles's first interaction with "Martians", he joins an organization that defends Earth from extraterrestrial threats and lives a double life as a film director by day, alien-hunter by night. This Kickstarter campaign is for Volume 1, which tells the first half of the story.
Each chapter of the graphic novel is illustrated in a different style, often as an homage to one of the many films of Orson Welles. The structure of the story is inspired by Citizen Kane. When Orson Welles dies, he leaves Paula, a lifelong friend and filmmaking collaborator, a clue that leads her to search for answers to many mysteries Welles left behind. She soon finds herself in over her head - amidst secret government agents, laser guns, and powerful alien technology. Her curiosity puts her on an irresistible path to adventure. Film lovers will find several easter eggs and Welles aficionados will notice thematic parallels between our alien-hunting warrior and the maverick film director.
Volume 1 will include approx. 85 pages of art and story, a mixture of black and white and full color. 
Preview art pages: 
Double-page splash by Erik Whalen:
Two pages from a chapter with Welles in Brazil in 1942, art by Martyn Lorbiecki:
 Here is the cover and the first five pages of Orson Welles: Warrior of the Worlds :


Orson Welles: Warrior of the Worlds is written by Milton Lawson, the writer of Roger Ebert and Me (Ghost City Competition Finalist), Winter Sale, and Thompson Heller: Detective Interstellar. 
The team of artists on Orson Welles: Warrior of the Worlds has been assembled to bring an array of visual styles to the story - with the art for individual chapters often being inspired by films from Welles's work as a film director. The artists in the book are: 


The lettering for Orson Welles: Warrior of the Worlds will be by: 
VIDEO ART TEAM
The promo video for the Kickstarter uses illustrations by Dave Chisholm and Christopher Doray. If Volume 1 is successfully funded, there's a good chance you'll see both of them again, contributing chapters to that volume in 2021.


 EXTRA SPECIAL THANKS 

Special thanks to Maurice LaMarche for providing the audio narration for our video. DISCLAIMER: The narration in this video is fictional, any similarity to any historical figures is simply due to the marvelous vocal talents of Mr. LaMarche. 
BUDGET BREAKDOWN
Where does the money from the crowdfunding go? Funny you should ask, we've got a pie chart for you that shows where the funding money goes:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge for the project will be maintaining the original artist lineup 100% as planned. We've given ourselves enough of a delivery window to overcome most scheduling conflicts, but, the comic industry is unpredictable and it's possible one of the team members will need to leave or delay their contribution until the second volume. We already have a roster of amazing talent already helping the project in various ways, including prep work for volume two, so if one of the collaborators has to change, we will be able to do so swiftly and be able to maintain a high level of quality.

This is my first Kickstarter project, but I have delivered two comic shorts, one of which was a finalist for the Ghost City competition. I've also completed a three-issue miniseries which has a publishing deal and is expected to be in comic book shops in 2020. Since there are multiple artists on the project, once it is funded, all of them can begin work simultaneously, and make progress quickly. We hope to deliver ahead of schedule. We will frequently update backers as to our progress throughout the production and completion phase.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Orson Welles: Warrior of the Worlds => TO BE PUBLISHED BY SCOUT COMICS!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers! Guess what? We're proud to announce today that ORSON WELLES: WARRIOR OF THE WORLDS has a publisher => SCOUT COMICS!
Ever since our initial Kickstarter campaign, we've been keeping busy trying to find ways to make the book happen, and we've got great news here.
First of all, the book will be published by SCOUT COMICS. Scout has been amazing to work with in developing this project. Also, we've been impressed by some of their recent titles, including the hilarious and visual bonkerfest that is "Metalshark Bro," and the deeply felt and fantastically drawn science fiction story "CANOPUS."

updates.update_userinfo: New concept designs! Only 6 days left.
updates.update_content: Today we're featuring some new concept sketches by Daniel Franco. Dan has been working on character designs for "old Welles." Since our story runs the full span of Welles's career, when we get to volume two, we will occasionally be featuring the elder Welles, the maverick indie director who put together projects on shoestring budgets outside of the Hollywood system - who also fought aliens on the side. In addition to the final designs, there are a few early rough sketches to show some of Daniel's process.

updates.update_userinfo: One week left! New pin-up art by Renton Hawkey
updates.update_content:
Only one week left to pledge for a reward!
Today we're previewing a new piece of art by Renton Hawkey. He's a hidden gem in comics at the moment. I met him first as a writer in the Comics Experience workshop where I was enthralled by several of his espionage-genre comic scripts. As a writer, he's got a keen sense of character psychology and a gift for writing action scenes. He's shifted gears in recent years and is working towards adding that hyphen to his creator identity, as a writer-artist. He's done a cover for our "Orson Welles" project that you've already seen. He is slated to draw one of the chapters in the book, but we can't give you any details about it because it'd be a spoiler. However we can at least share with you a pin-up he did to promote the project. He's got a newsletter that you can to join - I highly recommend it, he gives insights into his process. You can also find him . Without further ado, here it is, the new pin-up!

updates.update_userinfo: Amazing new art preview... Double-page splash by Erik Whalen!
updates.update_content: Today we're previewing a new page from the comic, technically two pages, since it's a double-page splash. This moment occurs late in chapter one, where Welles confronts an alien commander. This marvelous piece is by the anchor of our art team, Erik Whalen:

updates.update_userinfo: 100 backers! Plus, a recommended comic, "Frank at Home on the Farm"
updates.update_content:
We hit 100 backers this week! Thanks to our supporters and their continued help spreading the word on "Warrior of the Worlds," we've managed to hit the milestone. We've posted a few new preview pages recently - as well as some podcast interviews in support of the project. If you can take a moment to spread the word again, share the URL, it'd be a great help to getting our funding goals hit faster. Thanks again for your support.
Today we're also including a teaser promo for another cool indie comics project on Kickstarter that we think you'll find interesting, "Frank at Home on the Farm" - which also combines comics with cinematic influences. Below is a description and some promotional images:

updates.update_userinfo: New Walter Ostlie page preview! + Word Bros podcast
updates.update_content:
Today we are sharing an awesome new page from Volume 2 - art by Walter Ostlie. Walter is a fantastic sequential storyteller as anyone who's read METALSHARK BRO knows. This page is inspired by Orson Welles's THE TRIAL.
Also - Walter's METALSHARK collaborators were kind enough to invite me on to their WORD BROS podcast to discuss the project - and some basebl talk! Check it out online here - http://thewordbros.com/season-3-episode-2-milton-lawson/

updates.update_userinfo: New Preview Page Art! Plus, some new interviews...

Hello supporters, we've got another new piece of preview art, today by Martyn Lorbiecki. 
This is actually a sneak deep into the future of the project, from a storyline that takes place in volume two. This chapter involves an older Welles, with the look and vibe loosely inspired by the classic noir film Touch of Evil.  In this scene, we find Welles tracking down a vital piece of lost technology:

Martyn is doing art duties for a chapter that takes place in Brazil in 1942 during Carnival, where Orson was filming documentary footage. Martyn's vivid watercolors really fits the moment well. Born into the outcast breed of werewolves known as the Monoki, eighteen-year-old Rodney Marcelli is reluctantly thrown into an ancient war between good and evil in today's world where the line has blurred. With the help of Snow Paw, the Pureblood Monoki, and the supernatural evil slayer, Night Hunter, Rod must learn to master his newly found lycanthropy and mysterious kinetic energy power that only he possesses. Rod must fight the Dark Covenant in order to avenge his friends and family, and to save the girl he loves from the master vampire, Lord Malice. Rodney Marcelli is Night Wolf!
 Who will love Night Wolf? 
Fans of Supernatural, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Underworld, and other anti-hero monster horror stories.
People who like stories that encompasses elements of horror, magic, and science  in a modern setting.
Collectors of high quality modern independent comic books from an amazing team of up-and-comers!
If you like unique takes on the horror, supernatural, theology, mythology, and fantasy genres. 
If you love stories about supernatural beings like werewolves,  vampires, demons, witches, zombies and more then this is THE COMIC BOOK FOR YOU!
 What Exactly Do You Get When You Join the WOLF PACK and Back This Campaign? 
 Night Wolf #1-3 are 24-page comic books in standard American comic size, on printed on high-quality paper.
All backers at any pledge level will receive a Night Wolf Issue 1 Cover Art Digital Wallpaper. Artwork by Carlos Herrera.
All backers at any pledge level will receive a Lone Wolf Comic Characters Art Digital Wallpaper. Artwork by Lovalle Davis & Ross A. Campbell.
All backers at any pledge level will receive a FREE digital copy of Six Swords Issue 1 by Chris Massari.
All backers at any pledge level will receive a FREE digital copy of Tart Vol 1 Adrift by Kevin Joseph.
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Night Wolf 1.25" Round Button. 
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Night Wolf 3x4" Sticker. 
All physical pledge level backers, $50 and higher, will receive a Night Wolf Logo 1.5" Hard Enamel Pin designed with Skelton Crew Studio.
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Night Wolf 3x4" Refrigerator Magnet. 
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Night Wolf 3x4" Die Cut Sticker. 
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Snow Paw 6x4" Metallic Foil Printed Post Card. 
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Night Wolf 6x2" Bookmark. 
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Snow Paw 2.4x4" Die Cut Sticker. 
All backers at any physical pledge level will receive a Black Claw 3x4" Die Cut Sticker. 
At higher pledge levels, backers will access campaign exclusive mystery boxes possibly containing CGC graded Night Wolf comics, limited edition variants, rare comics signed by both the writer and artists, as well as awesome merchandise!
At highest levels, limited opportunities to get your own website for your blog or business and YOU could be featured as a supporting character in issues 4-12 as your choice of a cop, FBI Agent, werewolf, vampire, or a witch! 
All backers will also receive loads of additional bonus content as the milestones are unlocked and the Night Wolf Theme Song MP3, Shadows by Hard Rock Band Crimson Dawn - Vocals: Rob Multari, Lead Guitar: Paul Bauer, Bass Guitar: Tim Bracken, Rhythm Guitar: Justin Booth, & Drums: Brandon Blatt! 
PLAY

Press PLAY to listen to the song Shadows in it's entirety.
UNLOCK NEW Stretch Goal Rewards! Once the stretch goals are met these bonus items unlock! Seven rewards have already been unlocked! The first was the Night Wolf Logo 1.5" hard enamel pin designed with Skelton Crew Studio! This pin has now been added to the physical pledge levels $50 and higher. Lower pledge levels can get the pin as a $10 add-on. Aside from the Night Wolf Logo 1.5" Enamel Pin, every Wolf Pack member who backs the campaign at any physical pledge level will receive the rest of the physical stretch goal rewards for FREE! All Wolf Pack members who back the campaign at any pledge level will receive the digital bonus rewards for FREE!
ALL Milestone Rewards have been unlocked! Every Wolf Pack member who backs the campaign at any physical pledge level will receive the physical bonus rewards for FREE! All Wolf Pack members who back the campaign at any pledge level will receive the digital bonus  rewards for FREE!
Critics, Pros, & Fans Are Absolutely Howling About Night Wolf! Here's What People are Saying... 
“Killer art and sharp banter, this is one book monster fans will want to sink their teeth into...” - Tyler James (ComixTribe Publisher, Host of ComixLaunch)
“Multari does an excellent job on articulating the science of nightmares to the essence of fictional storytelling." - Nicolas Duncan (ComicWatch Reviewer)
“Fans of classic monsters and dark magic should do well to check it out." - Frank Martin (Author, Severed Press)
 Since the release of Night Wolf Issue 1 I've been traveling to comic cons around the North East of the United States meeting people and introducing them to Night Wolf. The Wolf Pack is constantly growing in numbers, and we need you! Will you be the next member to join?
Here's What Wolf Pack Members are Saying...
“I'm hooked! If you're a fan of the classic monsters then this series is for you." - Anthony Lamberti
“The art is gorgeous, the writing draws you in..." - Kat
“Extremely well written and absolutely amazing artwork! - Steven Beltzer 
“I love this comic. Can't wait to read another!" - Frederick Knight
Hi, I'm Robert A. Multari, but you can call me Rob. It’s been my dream since I was a kid, struggling with Attention Deficit Disorder and Dyslexia, to be in the comic book business. Comic books helped me learn how to deal with my learning disability. When I was 14-years-old, I wrote fan fiction for the X-Men and submitted it to Marvel in hopes that Stan Lee would read it. Someone from Marvel was nice enough to write back to me saying that Stan loves to hear from his fans and encouraged me to keep up my writing. As naive as I was at the time, it spread my passion for the business like a wild fire and inspired me to go to art school at Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, where I graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree in Applied Media Arts. I have been working on Night Wolf since I was 16-years-old. The story and the characters have grown up with me, evolving into the amazing tale that it is today.
Why a werewolf comic book? Well, I have always loved any werewolf or supernatural related entertainment in movies, video games, etc. I didn't feel like there were any comic books out there doing werewolves any justice, so I decided to make a comic book based on a werewolf anti-hero myself. In high school, after I started developing Night Wolf, I got into Werewolf: The Apocalypse is a role-playing game by White Wolf Publishing.  I love the artwork in the game guides so much that I longed for them to put out a comic book to build on their world. Unfortunately, it never happened, but the artwork heavily influenced how I like my werewolves should look in my comics.
Oscar is a professional illustrator residing in Lima, Perú. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Peruvian home but from abroad as well. Oscar specializes in heroic, fantasy, anime, and comic book illustrations as well as video game concept development. Oscar's talent stretches across various types of media and color  illustration. His digital media tools of trade is a Wacom Tablet and  Adobe Photoshop. Oscar, owner of Bokuman Studio, is an illustrator with over 10 years experience. Oscar is the illustrator of Night Wolf Issues 1 - 3.
Gat is a digital colorist living in Johannesburg, South Africa. He has a Bachelor of Arts in Motion Picture Medium. He has done coloring work for Big Dog Ink and Image Comics. Gat is taking on the role of colorist for the Night Wolf series, starting with issue 3.  He is also the colorist on the Keystone Comic Con Exclusive Night Wolf Issue 1 Cover, penciled by Chris Williams and the new very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 2, illustrated by Vincenzo Sansone.
Carlos is a Professional illustrator residing in Santiago City, Chile. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his Chilean home but from abroad as well. Carlos specializes in heroic fantasy illustrations, comic book illustrations, and educational illustrations for schoolbooks. Carlos's talent stretches across various types of media and color illustration. He uses both traditional media meaning pencil, watercolor, graphite, acrylic, and more as well as digital media in use of a Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Carlos graduated from Arcos Institute with the highest marks possible. For a long period of time Carlos was an active member of the Illustrator staff for the Salo S.A. Company's trading card game "Myths and Legends". Carlos illustrated and colored the Night Wolf character designs, the cover and the first 5 pages of issue 1. He also did the illustration for the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover.
Ross is a Professional Digital Colorist residing in Elgin, Scotland. His amazing portfolio of artwork spans not only from his native home in the United Kingdom, but from abroad as well. Ross has had no formal art school training, but is self-taught with an unbelievably natural eye for colors, lighting, and shadow creating amazing depth of space within the 2D realm. He has been in the business for over 5 years primarily working as a comic book colorist, with the occasional full illustration job. Ross's works include mostly the fantasy genre, but also dabbles in other genres as well. His color weapons of choice are the Wacom Tablet and Adobe Photoshop. Some of Ross's clientele include DC, Action Lab, Image, Dynamite, Aspen, Top Cow, Sideshow, Zenescope, PKMM Entertainment, and Scout Comics. Ross did the colors for Night Wolf Issue 1 where Carlos left off, and he also colored the Night Wolf Issue 2 Variant Cover.
Chris is a comic artist, writer and creator. As an Art Institute of Philadelphia graduate with his BA in Animation & Media Arts, Chris has sold many illustrations, logos, graphic art and commissioned work locally and internationally. Some of his notable accomplishments include the cover art for the periodical magazine "Knights of The Dinner Table" #201, as well as promotional art for award-winning photographer, Nick Saglimbeni and his SlickForce Girl site. Aside from his creator owned comic series, "SUMMONS" Chris is also penciling an upcoming Native American themed comic called Tribal Force. Chris is the illustrator of the Keystone Comic Con exclusive cover of Night Wolf Issue 1.
Dan is an American comic artist and writer best known for creating the series Odyssey, Inc. and Soul of the World on Webtoons. He also draws the popular webcomic Tested for the New York Department of Health AIDS Institute YGetIt? Project. The comic has been featured on Webtoons. Dan currently works as a freelance illustrator doing commissions for various clients from his studio in Pittsburgh. He studied animation at Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, where he received a B.F.A. in Applied Media Arts. Dan is the artist of the new very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 1.
Vincenzo is an illustrator from in Pisa, Italy. He has a BA in Italian Literature at the University of Pisa and a professional degree at International School of Comics. He’s been working for several publishers such as Approbation Comics, Dead Canary Comics, Interweb comics, Moonstone books and Evoluzione publishing. Vincenzo is the artist of the new very limited variant cover of Night Wolf Issue 2.
We're coming to you to raise funds to print Night Wolf Issue 3.  I have already invested my own time and money to ensure that the book is 100% complete and ready to go to print. I've come back to Kickstarter to help get the book into as many hands as possible in order to continue publishing this incredible series.
I’ve personally backed several Independent Comic projects  on Kickstarter because I believe that Indie Creators have great stories that need to be told. I believe that Kickstarter is a powerful tool to help creators, like myself, to bring our characters to life for everyone to enjoy.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm a relatively new creator and Night Wolf is my first comic book series. In April of 2016, I launched a failed Kickstarter campaign for Night Wolf Issues 1-3. I played the game on hard, setting a $20,000 goal. However, I did manage to raise $5,064 from my 74 backers, unfortunately Kickstarter is all or nothing. At the time I only had the character designs, a cover and 5 sequential pages during that launch. Even though the Kickstarter didn’t fund I was bound and determined to publish my story. Because I didn’t have the funds to finish the first issue, I decided to raise the money on my own doing freelance web design work to pay for the artwork. Since then I have published both Night Wolf Issues 1 and 2 in both print and digital formats. Now, I stand ready to publish Night Wolf Issue 3, I’m more prepared and more determined than ever to fund this Kickstarter.

In addition, I have been educating myself through the Comixlaunch course, which is a Kickstarter training program created by Tyler James. Tyler is the Publisher of ComixTribe and has successfully funded over 17 Kickstarter campaigns. Through the ComixLaunch community I have also been a part of a ComixLaunch Mastermind group of independent creators that have all ran successful campaigns in the past, and I've spent time learning and being mentored by them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I've animated on some of the most unique films of the 1970s & 1980s and want to share some of my drawings and behind the scene experiences with you!
 Here is the front cover and some sample interior pages:
"RUFF SKETCH!" front cover
I’ve been a classical 2D pencil-on-paper animator for 45 years. I’ve always enjoyed capturing quirky personalities with my pencil; and now I want to share some of my favorite character drawings by presenting more than 80 of them in a large-sized 80 page 8.3 x 11.7 inch landscape portfolio...
...but I need your help to get the funding to lay out and print the book.
The following are more samples of the sketches I'll include:
I animated the first appearance of Boba Fett in the Star Wars Holiday Special. 
I animated on the cult classic feature ROCK & RULE...
The characters I focused on were:
Cindy the Rollerskating Disco Princess, 
Officer Quadhole,
 Mylar the Club Owner.
Cindy Schlepper
Officer Quadhole
Mylar the Club Owner
 AND one of my favorite projects I animated was the always entertaining four BATMAN ZELLERS commercials.
Batman
PLAY

My drawings are not just from the past...they are also my present day projects. Such as Snuffy & Zoey's ToyBox Adventures, which is a great way of introducing young kids to the joys of reading comics!
Snuffy & Zoey's Adventures: "What Do You Do With A Stinky Pirate?"
 Check out my YouTube channel John the Animator Guy!
These are just some of the projects that are included in my portfolio.
Please check out the various pledge levels, which on the top tier I'm offering a personally drawn rough sketch of Boba Fett, in my Star Wars Holiday Special style.
Boba Fett rough pose in my Star Wars Holiday style.
So, thank you for checking out my Kickstarter, and please share this with your friends.
Hope you have a great day!

campaign.story:
The Reset
A fully colored comic of high concept sci-fi action, time travel and corporate espionage!
Two men with a shared past, and two different ideas on how to save the world!
Everyone is faced with the countdown to a world ending event!  All hope seems lost, til one man presents a solution to save everyone...by resetting it all, but it comes with a cost.  His former business partner has other ideas, and a little revenge on his mind too!  
Cover to the Reset by Kevin Zimmerman
Format: Single Issue
Fully Color Cover and Interior Pages
Kickstarter Campaign Exclusives: Sketch Covers, a one of kind art piece only for Kickstarter Backers! Will not be sold at shows! 
Project Manager Matt Kund, creator of Digital Forvever, Multi-Larceny, RX-tiction, Life Cycle, Orryx, and stories in the upcoming "Why Faith?" and "My Kingdom for a Panel" Anthologies and the co-host of the "Constructing Comics" Podcast! Founder of DMV Indie Comics Creators.
Matt Kund, writer
Kevin Zimmerman, artist
Ertan Ceyhan, Colorist (also the colorist on Multi-Larceny)
Noah Ray, Letterer/Editor (co-creator of RX-tiction, Life-Cycle, Orryx and Where4RU? - and Co Host of the Constructing Comics Podcast)
This is my third kickstarter, after sucessfully kickstarting and delivering Digital Forever and Multi-Larceny.  
The Reset is a story I started working on shortly after the launch of my first Kickstarter. I thought, "What if time travel was doable, but it had to be for everyone and they all had to decide on the point in time we as a planet where going back to?  If someone had that abliity, that would make them pretty powerful.  It would be pretty hard to not let that corrupt some."  We tackle those issues and a lot more in "The Reset"!
I am coming back to kickstarter because I enjoy the indie spirit of making comics and the community support by other creators and fans of indie comics! It's a powerful platform to connect and support others with that creative drive. 
The Budget
 Preview Pages (Preview Pages 1 and 2) 
Page 1
Page 2
We will offer different Rewards for your choice for you reading enjoyment!
Digital copies
Sent right to you for reading on your favorite digital device
Print Copies
A print copy of the "Reset" to hold in your hands!
A Digital Catch Up Plan 
Here's a great way to catch up on any comics we've made that you might have missed out. It's a great way to read them anywhere, scrolling through the pages!
6 Digital Comics sent directly to you for reading on your favorite digital device!
A Print Catch Up Plan 
Missed out on any of the comics we made to this point?  This is a great way to read them! Go old school and have the comics in your hand and turn the pages!
Like paper? With the old school feel and smell of comics, this is the reward for you!
We all have a passion for storytelling and comics and have worked together very hard as a team to make the comic!
Thanks for checking out the Kickstarter! We are very excited to get this book out in the world and hope you enjoy it.
It would mean a lot if you were able to back and share this project!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have minimized the risks as much as possible. The book is well underway which increases the likelihood that we will meet our delivery date. While we all have work, family and other things going on, we have built in a time budget for any unanticipated delays. We have improved our budgeting and planning process and should meet our delivery date, but if there is a delay, we will keep everyone informed with updates during the campaign, the production, and the shipping of the comic!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Raytoons Cartoons Avenue has gotten this cartoon series to the printed at Print Ninja! 
Hi! My name is Raymond Mullikin and I'm the Creative Director (as well as an artist/writer) of the Raytoons Comics Avenue Comic Series. 
 Raytoons Cartoon Avenue is a "genre free" cartoon magazine featuring a variety of comics and illustrated stories by Raymond Mullikin, as well as the works of many different artists and writers. It for comic book creators to showcase their work in the magazine. Different Cartoonists and Illustrators are interviewed in each issue as well.
In each issue, you'll find a wide range of story types that appeal to all you comic book readers out there... and beyond!
This is a family oriented comic, meaning both kids and adults can read this.   :)
Here are a couple sketches of the introductory pages of the first issue:

 And here are examples of the kind of comics that you might find in the magazine...(The examples below were from the pages of the 2007 edition that I made years back.)
Please note that the upcoming Raytoons Cartoon Avenue Comic will be in Color, not Black and White.
 THE CREATIVE TEAM
Raymond Mullikin, the creator of Raytoons Comics, has been drawing cartoons since he was 5 years old. For much of his life, he has drawn cartoons of himself in his essays, notes, and school projects, doing the narration.
Over the years Ray (including his cartoon version of himself) have showed up on websites, comic books, and film festivals. (You can find him at the Raytoons Website at raytoons.net) Now, he has collaborated with other artists to bring this character to life in an ongoing comic book anthology series, called "Raytoons Cartoon Avenue".
Raymond has a very dedicated team for his comic projects. Some are professionals in their field... and all are excellent at their work. I am glad to count them as part of the team.
 Raymond Mullikin - Writer / Creative Director / Lettering
 Kevin Erickson - Artist and occasional writer for most of the Raytoons intros (and some of the Miced stories)
 Alex Hoffman - Inking / Coloring for most of Raymond's projects
 Andrew Han - Artist (For some of the Raytoons short stories.)
 Nick Palazzo - Artist (For some of the Miced stories.)
 Carla Mullikin - Assistant Editor
 James Mullikin - Assists with some of the Graphics Editing
 Raytoons Cartoon Avenue is also an "open-artist" project. That means we are open to other artists and writers contributing to our projects. We also do "publishing publishing" with other creators.
Don't see enough Raytoons stuff here? Want to see more? Or maybe information about other upcoming Raytoons projects?
I also post the latest updates on twitter. Information sometimes shows up here before it shows up anyplace else...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have successfully fulfilled Kickstarter campaigns before and are now fairly familiar with the process, including printing/shipping times.

For printing, we will use the reliable services of PrintNinja for our printing. So the only real risks if there are delays in shipping or if there is some illness or injury.

I have also been very careful to create reward tiers that offer items that I would not have difficulty producing... and I will ensure delivery goes as smoothly as possible. Everybody here takes our responsibilities seriously!

Get a special printing of issue #6
I'm happy to announce that you can now order a special printing of issue #6 through this campaign. The next time this issue will be available for print will be in September of 2020 inside the volume 2 campaign. Read it in print a year early, exclusively through this Kickstarter. I am printing issue #6 to order.  
CLICK HERE TO READ THE FIRST ISSUE OF ICHABOD JONES MONSTER HUNTER
and...
CLICK HERE TO GET A PREVIEW OF ISSUE #5
***NO ADDITIONAL DOMESTIC SHIPPING CHARGES!***
Cover for Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter #5
Do you love crazy stories filled with monsters, magic, gore, and humor? 
Have you ever read about H.P. Lovecraft's Dreamlands and thought..."I wish this was funnier and gorier"?
Are you excited by stories that keep you on your toes and make you question the very fabric of reality?
Then you are going to love Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter. Ichabod comes from a deep, almost primordial, place in my soul. It's the part that devours movies like In the Mouth of Madness, Event Horizon, and Jacob's Ladder, while still binging on Gravity Falls, Frankenweenie, and Army of Darkness. It's the part that read Johnny the Homicidal Maniac and laughed hysterically at every gruesome scene. 
All of that went into Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, which is what has made it my most beloved property, and for the first time since it released in 2014...there are more issues, written and drawn by the original creative team. 
That's right. Renzo Podesta is back on art for the fifth issue (and the whole second arc). Renzo brings so much to the look of the book, and turns Ichabod from a creepy psychopath into a lovable character...who is also a bit creepy. 
We're now ready to release the single issue of Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter #5, a 32-page ode to monsters and monster hunters, which starts the second arc of the series.
This Kickstarter is to fund TWO different print jobs. 
 The 96-page paperback re-release of volume 1 (containing issues 1-4), Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter: A Psychopath's Work is Never Done.  
The 32-page fifth issue of the book, single issue comic, which starts the second arc and is independent of the first trade paperback.
What is the story about, really? 
A lot of people told me when the book came out that it wasn't the right time for a book about a psychopath. 
Honestly, I think that criticism would be even more valid right now. However, I think those people are missing the point. 
Ichabod isn't about a psychopath who's ruthlessly killing people. It's about a broken man, who was cast off by society, and whether that person, a person who nobody wants, can be a hero. 
Can he find his place in the world? Can he come to terms with everything that he's done? Can he become a hero? 
I'm very interested in that idea, as a person who is severely broken myself. I've had depression and anxiety for as long as I can remember, and it's getting worse with every passing year. 
I never felt like I fit in for the first 30 years of my life. It wasn't until I went out into the world and became the hero of my own story that I started to think that maybe I wasn't the worst human being on the planet. 
Ichabod, though, came from a place where I was very much alone, broken, and wondering if it would ever get better. 
I think what makes Ichabod really special is that is was started by a person who never knew if he could be fixed, one who felt like he was cast off from society, and now it's being written by a person who understands that the broken bits are what make him special. 
See, Ichabod, at its core, is about hope. It's about taking what's special about you and using it to bring light into the world; of shining hope in a bleak universe. Ichabod's world is harrowing and awful, but Ichabod can bring light into it, not despite of being broken, but because of it. 
A psychological mind screw
Ichabod Jones is about a psychopath that escapes from a mental asylum and becomes a monster hunter during the Apocalypse, but he doesn't know if he's killing monsters, humans, or it's all in his head the whole time. 
Ichabod has been imprisoned in a mental asylum for crimes he definitely committed. When he was arrested, the police found him wrist deep in the guts of his latest victim. 
While he's never claimed he was innocent, he says he only committed atrocious acts because an authoritative, and unwelcome, voice in his head told him he was doing God's work. 
He tried to say no to the voice, but it was very insistent and persuasive. It told Ichabod that the people he was killing were monsters and he was saving the world by murdering them. 
He was wrong...or so he thought. 
At the beginning of the story, Ichabod wakes up in the Apocalypse, being chased by a monster trying to devour his soul. He has no choice but to use his training as a monster hunter to fight off the beast, and accept his fate as the savior of the world. 
He meets a band of other inmates, helps them escape the asylum, and they begin their long journey across the desert to freedom, trying to carve out a bit of humanity as they go. 
Something strange happens to Ichabod throughout the story, and I say strange in a tale that is already at 11 on the strange meter. 
Every now and then...he snaps back to another place, where he's sitting with the his doctor, talking out what just happened to him, or on the run from the law, and definitely NOT in the Apocalypse. 
 Is he really there, is it a memory, or is he having a psychological break? 
It's that juxtaposition between reality and perception that makes Ichabod special. It's not just an Apocalypse story, or a dark fantasy, or a chosen one book. It also messing with your very perception of the universe, and whether Ichabod is truly a hero, or a psychopath killing the innocent. 
After all, he was wrong about being a savior once, and that's what got him locked away in the first place. What's to say he's not wrong again, only now he's having a much more vivid hallucination?
Or perhaps he's only fantasizing about being a hero, while being locked in his cell, unable to smell freedom ever again. 
What's new in the fifth issue? 
The fifth issues starts the second arc of Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter. Once the second arc is complete, the fifth issue will be bound in a second trade paperback along with issues #6-8, which are currently in production. 
While it continues the story, for printing purposes the fifth issue is completely independent from the first trade paperback that is also funding during this campaign. 
The volume one trade will be printed as a 96-page softcover (unless we hit our stretch goal), while the fifth issue will be printed as a 32-page, single issue floppy comic.
We are introducing a new character, and maybe my favorite of all time...Necromonica, the first wizard of the Apocalypse. 
Yes, the book is going full dark fantasy with issue 5, and what better way to go fantasy than to introduce our Gandalf. Necromonica is a blast to write and it takes less than a page to fall in love with her. 
Also, NEW MONSTERS! 
It's not an Ichabod story without tons of new monsters, and I can't wait to introduce you to the NIGHTMARE ELVES in issue #5!
And so much more. 
Who am I? 
My name is Russell Nohelty, USA Today bestselling author and publisher of Wannabe Press, a small press that creates weird books for weird people, creator of Katrina Hates Dead Shit, Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, and Pixie Dust, along with the editor of both the Monsters and other Scary Shit, and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthologies.  
I have raised over $100,000 on Kickstarter from 8 different projects, and have gotten exceedingly good at crafting amazing books which audiences love. My previous project, Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, raised over $39,000 on Kickstarter from over 1,000 backers, and the two before that, Monsters and Other Scary Shit and Pixie Dust, both raised north of $25,000 from over 600 backers each. 
I have a simple motto when it comes to Kickstarter. I outlay all the money to get the book print ready, and then I bring it to my audience and try to raise finishing funds for the book.
Who drew that dope art? 
Renzo Podesta is a bit of a king maker in indie comics. I didn't know it when I first started working together, but Renzo has helped some of the coolest comic creators on the planet build their careers. 
He's worked with Charles Soule on a book called 27 from Image Comics. From that book, Charles started working with Marvel, and has written Death of Wolverine, X-Men, Poe Dameron, Han Solo, and a bunch of books for them. 
He's also worked with Jeremy Holt, who has several books out with Insight Editions, including After Houdini and Skinned, and Skip to the End for Heavy Metal. 
He was also the original artist on Howard Lovecraft and the Frozen Kingdom before it was picked up as an animated movie. 
I met Renzo all the way back in 2010, well before I was a name anything. In fact, he was producing the first issue arc for me while he was producing the second arc of 27 for Charles, and well before Charles was even at Marvel, which seems like two lifetimes ago. 
He's one of my favorite artists, and he's the reason Ichabod became such a beloved character. He took a psychopath who could have easily come across as evil and creepy, and turned him into an enduring, lovable person. 
Are there any variants? Maybe from Walter Ostlie? 
You betcha. Your bro and mine Walter Ostlie from Metalshark Bro did a dope variant cover for this issue, and it's exclusively going to be printed for THIS issue alone. 
I'm printing it to order (with a small over run in case of defects and additional fulfillment orders) for this issue alone and then I'm never printing it on any cover again. 
Pretty exclusive right? Here's a mockup of what it will look like when printed. I looove this cover. 
If you love Walter's work, definitely pledge at least at the variant level, but I tried to do make a cool combo which has both variants (or both variants and the first volume) and a cool pin designed by Aaron Alexovich for $40. 
Aaron is an artist on Invader Zim, creator of Serenity Rose and It's Not Scary, and cover artist for both the Monsters and Other Scary Shit and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthologies. 
If you want a preview of the pin, just scroll down toward the bottom of the page. 
Why did I write this book? 
I still remember the moment I came up with the idea for Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter. 
I had just returned from San Diego Comic-Con 2010, after pitching my book, The Wannabes, a YA superhero story about fake superheroes who get real superpowers. Everybody, and I mean everybody, rejected it. 
They said it was too cute, or not cute enough, but most often they just flat out told me no without any explanation. So, I came home, disillusioned, and I told myself "If they're going to tell me no, I'll give them a good reason to say no." 
I set out to make the most unlikely hero imaginable. Something unpublishable by the standards of any conventional publisher. 
I didn't know the story yet. I just knew I wanted it to be my big screw you to publishing, and everybody who told me no. 
Then, it happened. 
I was cresting over the hill to the valley on the 405 in late 2010, looking out on the city below me, and that's when it hit me like a ton of bricks. 
What if the hero was a psychopath, somebody that society had written off for being objectively evil? What if he didn't even know if he was in his own head or the Apocalypse was really happening? 
Could a person like that...could they be a hero? 
Icbabod Jones is the exploration of that question. 
What's the history of the book's production? 
I originally wrote Ichabod Jones issues 1-4 in 2010, when I was 27 years old. It was right around this time of year in fact. Originally, I asked Renzo Podesta to do five sample pages to pitch to publishers.
Even though I was furious about being rejected by them, back then I still craved the validation of publishers. It took me years to shake that monkey off my back and realize that the existence of my work validated itself.
I pitched it EVERYWHERE. I figured everyone would say no, but was surprised when Viper Comics said they would take a chance on it, if only for a digital run of the book. 
Funny, right? My big screw off to publishers actually got me a publisher. Weird how that happened. 
So, I set about making Ichabod #1-4, expecting never to recoup a single dime of the money it took to produce the book. 
I didn't care. I just loved it so much. 
We finished production on the book in 2012, and took the first issue to San Diego Comic-Con that year, where it sold out of it's original production run. 
It was my first signing at SDCC, and I will never forget it.
Viper Comics does not publish this book anymore, and hasn't since 2012, so, once I got the rights back, I took it to Kickstarter in 2014. 
With the funds from the campaign. I purchased 1,000 copies of the trade paperback and started my company, Wannabe Press. It was an homage to my first book, The Wannabes, and an acknowledgement that I would never be accepted by the publishing establishment and would always be an outsider; a wannabe. 
Once the copies shipped to me, I quit my job and went out on the road selling Ichabod and my other books. Ichabod sold pretty well, but it wasn't burning up the sales chart. Still, it was slowly finding its audience. 
Then, in 2017, when we printed our seventh run of Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, it exploded in popularity. Sales went off the charts. 
It was so popular, in fact, that we ran out of our seventh printing faster than any run before it. I always thought Ichabod would fade from memory after the seventh printing, but something magical happened. 
With each passing year, people loved Ichabod more and more. It wasn't fewer people that came up talking about the book...it was more people. More people came every convention, and begged me to keep going with the book. They demanded more issues...
...but I always told them no. 
What changed?
We're currently working on the TV pitch for the show with an A list showrunner. Hammering out the details of the show gave me an epiphany about the comics. The same ideas that we were using to develop the TV show could be used to bring Ichabod back to life. 
Which brings us here 
That's why we're on Kickstarter; to see if the fans, you, really love Ichabod as much as you say you do. You've begged me thousands of times for more of his story, and here we are, ready to give it to you.
I love Ichabod and am ready to keep making Ichabod issues for a long time. I have 24 issues tentatively sketched out, and it could go on for much longer. 
Whether we continue the book or not all depends on YOU. 
We're here to see if there's enough interest in Ichabod to print an eighth edition of the first volume and fund the single issue printing of the fifth issue. The fifth issue is 100% complete, a 32-page thing of beauty. 
If there is, then I'll keep making them as long as you keep buying them. If not, then Ichabod will fade back into the ether never to be heard from again. 
The choice is up to you. Will Ichabod live...or die? 
This is the exact kind of thing Kickstarter was made for, and I can't wait to bring Ichabod back to you if we fund. I think we have a ton of great pledges, but it all depends on you. 
Ichabod's fate is in your hands. 
Can I get a look at the book? 
Absolutely. At any time you can:
CLICK HERE TO READ THE FIRST ISSUE OF ICHABOD JONES MONSTER HUNTER
and/or...
CLICK HERE TO GET A PREVIEW OF ISSUE #5
I also recorded this little video to show you inside the first volume of Ichabod Jones. While the fifth issue is complete, it hasn't been printed yet, but even if I could show it to you, just about every page is a big juicy spoiler, so I wouldn't. 
PLAY

Backers really love our books
There is no way I would be here without our fans and backers. I only have a career because of you, and I'm not being hyperbolic. Ichabod Jones started on Kickstarter, and with each Kickstarter I grow because of you. 
Here are just some of our super enthusiastic backers from our Monsters and Other Scary Shit campaign. 
Where is the money going? 
A valid and important question. Here is how the money will be used: 
Kickstarter - 10% - $1,566 
Production - 16% - $2,500    
Printing - 49% - $7,640    
Shipping - 16% $2,500   
Contingency - 9% - $1,460     
Total - $15,666
Like I said in the video, it costs a lot to produce comic books. 
Other books
One of the pledge rewards is the ability to pick up one of our back catalog hardcovers. All our hardcovers run for $30 by themselves + $8 shipping, so you are getting the digital for Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter issue #5 plus the digital for volume one for free, basically. 
Here's a quick rundown of our other books. 
Katrina Hates Dead Shit -This is the first book drawn by Marvel artist Juan Frigeri, who mostly draws on the Spider-Man team and have worked on things like Renew your Vows among others. 
Katrina is about a woman who gets sick of living during the apocalypse so she sets out to kill the Devil, and along the way get embroiled in a battle between Heaven and Hell
Here's a couple of interior pages. 
Get a preview of issue #1 by clicking right here.
Pixie Dust -Pixie Dust was drawn by Nicolas Touris and is meant to be read like an animated movie. It's been likened to Zelda with gore. 
Pixie Dust is about a pixie monster hunter who sells her soul to the queen of the underworld and comes back from the dead to seek revenge on the king that murdered her. 
Here are a few of my favorite panels from Pixie Dust. 
Get a free preview of Pixie Dust by clicking right here. 
Monsters and Other Scary Shit - Monsters and Scary Shit is an anthology filled with more than 50 creators. It's cute stories, scary stories, funny stories and more all about monsters, and it's the cover that the nightmare elf is from,  drawn by Invader Zim artist Aaron Alexovich. 
Here are some images from that book (assuming the .gif loads. If not, just give it a minute).
To get a preview, click right here.
Cthulhu is Hard to Spell - This is our most popular book right now. It's the sequel to Monsters and Other Scary Shit, but this one focuses on the gods and monsters of H.P. Lovecraft. It's 35 stories about the gods and monsters of Lovecraft's universe from 70+ creators, including a cover by Aaron Alexovich. 
Here's a rundown of the styles. Just like above, give it a second to load. 
Get a preview of the book by clicking right here.  
Please be aware that the Cthulhu is Hard to Spell book is not available at the $38 level, but it is available in limited quantities at the $39 level, and it is included as an option of all $80+ pledge levels that qualify for multiple books. 
Any additional copies will be made available during the fulfillment phase.
What about other add-ons? 
 ***YOU CAN ADD $15 to get digital copies of issues 6-8 when they finish, months before they will be available to the public***
Because I use Backerkit, I handle all of my add-ons after the campaign. For instance, if you would like a second copy of the variant, then I will have those available after the campaign is over on our store. If you choose to do so now, then you can add $23 to your pledge for each variant and $13 for each standard issue. Shipping will be charged during the final fulfillment process. 
I'll also have my entire collection of ebooks available once the campaign ends. If you want to add the money now just so you don't forget, then each ebook is $6, or you can pledge at the $28 level to receive all my novels. 
I also have a digital collect of all my graphic novels available at the $29 level, and my entire digital library, including novels, graphic novels, and anthologies, available at the $60 level.
I'll also have all of my pins. You can order the main pin, the nightmare elf, right now, but during the fulfillment stage you can order all the others. If you want to add some money now for it, each pin is $12 and shipping will be charged once you fill out your form. 
Or you can pledge $45 and get any four pins you would like from this set + the digital copies of issue #5 and the volume 1 trade.
While most of this will be handled once the campaign ends, there are a couple of things that are available during the campaign that I would like to talk about now. The first is the pin designed by Aaron Alexovich. 
This pin is straight from the cover of Monsters and Other Scary Shit, designed by Aaron, and the monster is straight from the pages of Ichabod #5. The nightmare elf comes upon you while you sleep, hypnotizes you and forces you to do it's bidding before killing you. It's very dark and creepy. 
This is what it looks like on a bag. 
You can get it at the $20, $30, $40 and up campaign levels, and ordering additional will be available once the campaign is over, or you can add $12 NOW to make sure you have it later, if you want. You won't be charged shipping for extras until after the campaign, though. 
Additionally, you'll be able to order from our library of hardcover graphic novels, including Katrina Hates Dead Shit and Pixie Dust, as well as our anthologies, Monsters and Other Scary Shit and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell. 
Pixie Dust and Katrina Hates Dead Shit are in a universe called the Godsverse, and there are multiple novels connecting them together, ranging from the time of Pixie Dust until 10,000 years after Katrina Hates Dead Shit. 
Pixie Dust happens at a time when gods and monsters roam the world. Then, the gods abandon us, monsters are hunter to extinction, and they come back during Katrina Hates Dead Shit. 
Also, we'll be offering our variant white eye addition of the Monster anthology, instead of the normal yellow eye edition. I only had a couple hundred of these white eye variant Soulless eye editions made, and they are almost gone! 
Our most popular book right now is Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, which is 35 stories about the gods and monsters of Lovecraft. There are funny stories, cute stories, scary stories, psychologically damaging stories, but they all deal with the gods and monsters themselves. This pairs very nicely with Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, and they are our most popular combo. 
The Crush it on Kickstarter course is my introductory course about how to run a Kickstarter campaign. It shows new creators (or ones who want to up their game), how to create, launch, fund, and distribute their campaigns. As a person who has run eight campaigns and successfully filled them all without going over budget, and having raised over $100,000 on Kickstarter, I know a thing or two about this stuff. 
More importantly, I am a seasoned course creator through my website, The Complete Creative. If you would like to see the course, you can do so by clicking here. 
My How to Make an Awesome Comics Anthology course is one I made specifically to help creators build better anthologies. 
After my first anthology campaign, people asked me a ton of questions about how to make a comics anthology, but I was too overwhelmed to answer them. Before my second anthology campaign, I wanted to be prepared, so I laid out my exact strategy for making an awesome comics anthology, and then went out and used the strategies I teach to raise $39,246 for Cthulhu is Hard to Spell. 
I'm very proud of this course and think that whether you are a seasoned pro at anthologies or just starting out, you can learn a ton from it. I take you all the way from finding your theme through running your Kickstarter campaign. 
Plus, if you buy this course you ALSO get my Crush it On Kickstarter course absolutely free. You can check out the course by clicking here. 
My signature course is called Build a Rabid Fanbase. It's all about how to find your perfect fan, find out what they love, make money giving them exactly what they want, and then find thousands of other people like them. 
It's pretty amazing, and if you back at the $500 level, you get all my courses, over $1,000 of my best stuff, for half price, plus you get everything at the special thanks level. You can check that out by clicking here. 
I also have a two hours consultation option, where I will help you build your creative career and move it to the next level, as I have done with numerous creatives around the world. If you get the consultation option, which is usually $600 by itself, I throw in all three of my courses for free, a $1000+ value. 
Sneak preview of the book
I don't want to spoil the fifth issue, so here are the first five pages of the first issue for you to check out.

and...

Still on the fence? That's okay.

I hope you believe in this book and love it as much as I do. This is all for you, so I hope to be able to make Ichabod for many years to come. All we need is your help to make it happen.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have delivered eight projects successful, and while they have all reached backer hands, each one has its own issues. I never start a campaign before I have the finished book through production, but even then there are potential issues with printing and shipping. 

I am conservative when I give my estimates and hope to beat them, but all I can promise is that I will keep you abreast every step of the way to make sure you are aware of the process. I try to work with the same vendors with every campaign so that I know their process, but even then there are unexpected delays that change things.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Titania, Queen of Faerie and Arcadia / Artist: Sandra Koehl (excerpted from print file : pages 30 - 31)
Sinopa Omnibus Volume Two:
The Sinopa Omnibus collects six months of content released to our Patreon subscribers into one book.  In May 2019 we published Volume One thanks to the support of wonderful backers!  Now we're back with Volume Two, collecting the content releases from April through September of 2019 (6 releases in all).  Stretch goals fund additional art, allowing us to include additional content!  
This campaign funds a small soft cover press run and the fulfillment of backer rewards.  We are printing soft cover editions of this book through the same printer we used for our comic 47 Furious Tails, Issue One  and expect the same remarkable quality.  The Sinopa Omnibus is printed in 8.5 by 11 format.  Our press run will be done with a heavy  130 lb cover with a satin / soft touch finish and with durable 80 lb text pages. 
You can see excerpts taken from the print file of Volume Two below.  We hope you will greatly enjoy this book and get great use from it in your games.  
Lilyandrea, the Spring Sorceress / Artist: Nick Caponi (excerpted from print file : pages 4 -5)
What is in the book:
This volume contains six (6) entries.  Content includes a powerful sorceress ; a monster out of Japanese folklore; a legendary Greek sorceress; a tragic undead monster; a faerie queen straight out of Shakespearean tales (a new sorcerous blood is detailed here as well), and "Major" the hell hound raised by a fallen angel (the narrative describes the angel's fall and how "Major" came to be named.  Each entry contains its own story, stats, treasure information, story hooks and more.
Sir Morgan / Artist: Zack Viola (excerpted from print file : pages 22 - 23)
Backer Rewards:
PDF of the Book ~  Backers at all reward tiers receive PDF copy of the Sinopa Omnibus, Volume Two.  This is fulfilled through Drivethrurpg.com
Print on Demand Codes ~ Print on demand codes allow you to order a print copy of the book through Drivethrurpg.com and pay only the actual print cost from drivethrurpg (no mark-up) as well as the shipping costs specific to your address.  This campaign rewards backers with PoD codes for both soft and hard cover copies.
Print on demand Poster codes ~ These codes allow you to order 12 by 18 inch mini-posters through drivethrurpg.com of the following illustrations at a cost of $0.50 each (plus shipping):  
Glenfallow Regional Maps (Players  & Game Master's Versions)  
Circe, goddess and sorceress of legend
Jorogumo, spider demon woman of Japanese folklore
Titania, Queen of Fairie and Arcadia
Ol' Jack, a legendary undead monster
Please note that Drivethrurpg folds these posters once for shipping.  {Yes, you can use these now.  Thank you for your support.}
Catch up on 2019 ~ If you're new to our work, this is a fantastic opportunity to catch up to date on the books we've released this year.  Backers receiving this reward get PDF copies of Sinopa Omnibus Volume One, Whispers of Persephone (mature content warning: this is our bloody little book of necromancy, it contains graphic images and references to ritual sacrifice, poisoning, and the darkest of magical practices... not suitable for children), and 47 Furious Tails, Issue One (our comic book series retelling of the AKO incident).
Signed Copy ~  I'll personally sign your print copy (soft cover from the press run) and mail it to you directly.  This is one of my favorite things about KickStarter fulfillment. 
Jorogumo, a monster from Japanese folklore / Artist: Anthony Ojeda (excerpted from print file : pages 10 - 11)
Campaign Coffee Mug ~ Size 15 ounces / Please specify which of these you would like in your backer survey.  ADDITIONAL MUGS: For backers pledging at tiers that include mugs, you may add on additional mugs of either design for an addition $20 each.  This amount covers the mug and the additional shipping costs.
Single wrap around image of Titania, Queen of Faerie and Arcadia / Artist: Sandra Koehl
Sir Morgan ~ Illustrated on both sides ~ Artist: Zack Viola
Campaign t-shirts ~ Available in white or black in sizes up to 3XL.  Please specify size and color in your backer survey.  ADDITIONAL SHIRTS:  For backers pledging at tiers that include sjorts, you may add on additional shirts for an additional $28 each.  This amount covers the shirt and the additional shipping costs.  (Yes, we're taking advantage of the marginal increase in shipping to offer the add-ons at a lower rate)

As we reach these funding levels, our artists will create the illustrations needed for additional content.  These will be added to the omnibus in both digital and print forms.

Reaching this level of funding we'll add the story of of Salvator's rescue of his cousin from the fearsome Blood Falls Tower.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First, a few words concerning KickStarter and the efforts by its employees to unionize:

Presently, the employees at KickStarter are working to establish a union. It is the position of Sinopa Publishing LLC and myself (W.S. Quinton) that labor has every right to organize without fear of reprisal.

Whatever my support is worth, the workers and organizers at Kickstarter have it. If and when the employees at Kickstarter call for work to stop, I'll stop this campaign. So far, the union hasn't called for a boycott. If they do, the very moment they do, I'll end this campaign and launch it on another platform. 

In the event of a strike I call on management and employees to keep cool heads on both sides of the picket line. Stay safe everyone.

Meanwhile, I'm cheering them on and I invite you to do the same.

~ W.S. "Sam" Quinton
Founder Sinopa Publishing LLC

Now ... Risks and Challenges

The book is in final the stages of formatting as of the launch of this campaign. 
Risks on this campaign are minimal.

I have experience in KickStarter fulfillment beginning in 2017 and have (thus far) found solutions for all problems that have arisen in campaigns to date. 

Potential issues include: 
Printing defects ~ If this occurs we'll resolve that with the printer and get books out asap.
Shipping problems ~ please check your address information prior to submission of your backer survey.
We will make every effort to resolve errors in shipping (damage/loss etc.)
Backers will be updated when rewards are triggered and shipped. If you don't get your rewards, contact us through the KickStarter messenger so we can begin to resolve the issue for you.

Thank you for your support!

About me
My name is Patrick Brooks and I am a children's book illustrator and writer with 17 books published and am represented by Advocate Art. www.psbrooks.com 
 What's the story? 
Goose and Moose live across from one another on two sides of a cliff. They compete in absolutely everything, from riding bikes, to eating the most sweets - always wanting to outdo the other. Their rivalry and fighting escalates until it gets way of out of control. Goose can't fly and Moose can't swim, which affects their confidence and makes them outsiders at school. Not even Mother Goose can calm them down.
 Why did I write this book?
I felt like it was important to create a children's book about the rivalry and conflict children might have with one another. It was also to explore themes such as problem solving, not fitting in, mindfulness and emotional well-being, but done in a way that was fun, educational and easily accessible. I hope it will help children through many everyday situations in and outside of school when interacting with those around them, and will benefit parents, teachers and others too.

campaign.story:
"The story by Ryan Burke is ingenious, relevant, and enjoyable. The art by Joel Saavedra and Damian Peñalba is luminous and alluring. Altogether a story that proves comic books elevates literature." - Graphic Policy
"Saavedra and Peñalba have shown off talent that is so precise, it could only be described as raw, attention to detail as natural as blinking. All three creators deserve a seat at the table with the fabled Big Dogs: if Image doesn’t want the finished product, Dark Horse will." - Fanfest.com
"Throw yourself in an alternate reality where self-dubbed IG lifestyle coaches and cosmetic surgeons roam supreme. The tension in this comic noir meets thriller would have Humphrey Bogart frantically scrambling for the nearest vial of Xanax." - Soda and Telepaths
Plastic surgery is free. London is gripped by madness, dominated by cosmetic surgeons, lifestyle coaches, and pill-pushers. On the run from cops and hitmen, an esoteric businessman sets to make amends while he still can.  
Justin Sharpe is the one responsible for creating the unattainable standard for women that drove them to buy his miracle pills and pushed them into the arms of his surgeons. Due to this, he has enemies both legal and criminal. As he runs for his life, he must put his business empire aside and find out what it means to live, love, and be loved in return. Throughout this chaos, Justin finds that his only chance at redemption may just be a young punk named Luna.
Coronary Volume 1 cover.
Click here to help us reach our goal by sharing on Twitter!
 Here are a few samples from the story so far. No spoilers! 
Coronary: Episode 4 cover.
If you're sick of ads with photoshopped models and the constant pressure to look a certain way, you're not alone. A recent study cited in GlamourHealth found that 97% of women admitted to having at least one moment where they hated their body. Coronary explores how advertising and the beauty industry can negatively effect our self-esteem and how we relate to one another. 
"We've all been tricked to feel inadequate about our bodies...We've all been made to think these things...Coronary will be the thorn in the side of this movement." - BleedingCool.com 
With your help, we can make, print, and ship both Volume 1 and Episode 4 directly to you. Volume 1 will be a full color, 120 page trade paperback containing Coronary: Episodes 1-4. If you've been following along with series so far in single issues, don't fear! We're also printing a run of single issues for Episode 4.
Coronary Volume 1 Trade Paperback and Digital.
Designed by guest artist, Caisa Jungell.
For the CEO tier, you (or a loved one) can become a part of the story!
The Media Magnate tier comes with a custom black and white commission from Coronary artist, Joel Saavedra.
Click here to share Coronary Volume 1 on Facebook!
Here's where your money will go! The majority goes to paying the artists, printing the copies, and get them shipped out to you. The final 10% of the pie pays for Kickstarter fees. We know it's not our finest pie chart, and we've come to terms with that.
Congrats on reaching the bottom of the Kickstarter page. If you've read this far, make sure to like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CoronaryComic/ , and follow our progress on Twitter and Instagram @ryanburkewriter!

updates.update_userinfo: Our survey says....a project update!

We're in the final stretch, folks!
Just four days left! As we chug along towards reaching our goal of $10,000, we want to remind you how much we appreciate your support. Just three years ago Coronary was no more than a 12 episode script with five pages of artwork.
Now, we're well on our way to having over 120 pages complete and 1,000+ copies sold. None of this would be possible without you. Whether you're new to the comic or have been with us since day one, thank you for being a part of our journey.
