Cover for Coronary: Episode Three.
Plastic surgery is free. London is gripped by madness, dominated by cosmetic surgeons, lifestyle coaches and pill-pushers. Within this insanity, a neurotic businessman reconsiders the course of his life when a freethinking outsider crashes into it. But she doesn't want him, or anyone.
Justin must put his business aside and concentrate on what it means to live, love, and be loved in return. He created an unattainable standard for women that drove them to buy his miracle pills and pushed them into the arms of his surgeons. Due to this, he has enemies both legal and criminal, that want to end ventures permanently. Throughout this chaos, Luna hopes to help him achieve redemption, while he's still breathing that is.
Help our campaign grow by sharing it on Twitter!
Episodes 1 and 2 of Coronary
              According to a recent study by GlamourHealth, 97 percent of women admitted to having at least one moment where they hated their body. Coronary explores what it means to love yourself, and what place it has in a rapidly modernizing culture. Coronary strikes a chord with those feeling the pressure of increasingly demanding societal norms.

campaign.story:
Cover art by Bret Juliano. Design not final.
Welcome! Out of the Deep is a comic anthology by Let’s Make Comics, a Chicago-based comic creator collective. Once a year for the last four years, we've pulled a theme out of a hat and then turned our members loose on it. This year the stories range from deep in the ocean to deep in space to deep in the mind, and the horrors (and beauty) you can find there.  
The book will be 52 pages, black and white and 8.5 x 11. The pages have all been turned in and the book is almost ready to go - we just need your help to get it printed. 
The goal of Let's Make Comics! as a group is, well, helping folks make comics. Books that don't go toward fulfillment are split evenly among participants - we're planning on 30 copies each this year - and leftover funds are put back into the group (convention fees, pizza parties, etc). Backing gets you a rad book and helps us us do a ton of cool stuff - If you're interested, take a look at the reward tiers below!
Featuring art by:
Bret Juliano  
Leo Mancini  
Deborah Lang and Robert Christie 
Patrick Cheng  
Celina Barajas  
Melissa Sayen 
Sam Hiebert
Paul Warner
Quinn Stephens
Dov Tennenbaum
Andrew Larkin
Bonus: Kelly Leigh Miller
Stretch Goals!
We're funded! That means it's time for some stretch goals:
Goal 1 ($1,850): a bonus 8 page comic by Daimon Hampton. MET!
Goal 2 ($2100): a $25 bonus for each participant. MET!
Goal 3 ($2270): a year of webhosting for the LMC! website. MET!
Everything after that will go towards book production (heavier paper, etc) and group activities (convention fees, etc). Thank you, everyone!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There’s always a chance we’ll run into print problems - formatting mistakes on our end, production errors on the printer’s end, etc - there’s a bunch of stuff that could could slow down delivery. We could also have trouble shipping from us to you - prices could go up, our packages could get lost in the snow, the possibilities are endless. This isn’t our first Kickstarter, however, and we’re confident that in the end we’ll be able to get you your books.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #9! Books have shipped!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone! If you've submitted a survey, then your books have shipped! 
Domestic folks, most of you should have yours by now. If you haven't gotten yours by the end of the week, please let me know.
International folks, it might take a little longer for your packages to arrive, but if you don't have them by June 22nd let me know.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #8! Books are shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hello, folks! I'm sorry about the delayed update - there was an issue with the bonus comic that took longer then expected and then my computer died. It was great. BUT! The books are shipping!
If you're in the US and backed at the $25, $40, or $65 tier, your books are in the mail. They're shipping media mail and should take 7-14 days to arrive. If you haven't gotten yours by June 4th, let me know.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #7! It's all coming together
updates.update_content:
The books have been delivered! We finally have everything! A bunch of Let's Make Comics members are getting together on Saturday to fill envelopes and apply labels and eat pizza (after handling the books), so everything should go in the mail on Monday! 
Here are the obligatory boxes-o-books photos:

updates.update_userinfo: Update 6! Stuff is coming in!
updates.update_content: Hey, folks! The buttons and prints are here, and I've gotten the proof! of the anthology! Take a peek!

updates.update_userinfo: Update 5! PDFs are sent!
updates.update_content:
Hi, folks! You should have all just gotten links to the PDF of Out of the Deep. Let me know if you run into trouble downloading it - we did some test runs, but there's always the chance something will go wonky.
Also! Stuff has started to arrive from the printers! We've got the buttons and the prints should be delivered tomorrow. I'll post another update with photos as soon as we have them.

updates.update_userinfo: Update 4! We have the funds!
updates.update_content:
Hello, folks! This is a quick update to let you know the money hit our account. I've started sending stuff to the various printers and we hope to start shipping by the end of April. More information - and photos - as we get it!
(I just realized I posted two Update 3s, whoops.)

updates.update_userinfo: Update #3! Thank You!
updates.update_content:
We did it! The Out of the Deep anthology is our most successful kickstarter yet and it's all thanks to you folks. Thank you! 
It'll take about two weeks for the funds to hit our account. We'll spend the time doing final prep on the book, so it should be ready soon afterwards. I'll let all y'all know once the money drops, and again when the books go to the printers. Keep an eye on your inboxes!
Thanks again!

Stretch Goals and Bonus Rewards!
For every $500 we raise past our $3500 goal, we'll donate 50 copies of Amazing Age #0 to a local library, school, children's hospital, or to the troops!
UNLOCKED! $4000 - Every backer that pledges for a physical reward will receive Alterna Comics bookmarks! 50 copies of Amazing Age #0 will be donated!
UNLOCKED! $4500 - Backers that pledge $20+ (before shipping) will receive a FREE Alterna Comics single issue of their choice. 50 more copies of Amazing Age #0 will be donated! A total of 100 copies donated!
UNLOCKED! $5000 - Backers that pledge $25+ (before shipping) will receive a FREE Alterna Comics 2" circle magnet! 50 more copies of Amazing Age #0 will be donated! A total of 150 copies donated!
UNLOCKED! $5500 - Every backer that pledges for a physical item will receive an 11x17 mini-poster of the AMAZING AGE #0 cover signed by publisher Peter Simeti! 50 more copies of Amazing Age #0 will be donated! A total of 200 copies donated!
UNLOCKED! $6000 - Backers that pledge $30+ (before shipping) will receive a FREE Alterna Comics 1.25" button pin AND an Alterna Comics 4x6 print signed with a handwritten note by publisher Peter Simeti! 50 more copies of Amazing Age #0 will be donated! A total of 250 copies donated!
UNLOCKED! $6500 - Backers that pledge $35+ (before shipping) will receive a VARIANT black & white cover copy of Amazing Age #0! This variant run will be a Kickstarter Exclusive, limited to JUST 300 copies made. 50 more copies of Amazing Age #0 will be donated! A total of 300 copies donated!
UNLOCKED! $7000 - Backers that pledge $35+ (before shipping) will receive a FREE copy of the AMAZING AGE graphic novel! 50 more copies of Amazing Age #0 will be donated! A total of 350 copies donated!
It's been a long road for AMAZING AGE #0...
We had submitted this issue for Free Comic Book Day but it was unfortunately rejected.  Newsarama reported on what had occurred and after talking with the AMAZING AGE creative team (and after hearing from hundreds of disappointed readers and retailers), we all decided that the issue still deserved to see the light of day.
So now here we are!
With your help, AMAZING AGE #0 will go to print and get into dozens of comic shops in time for Free Comic Book Day (the first Saturday of May).  We're looking to raise $3500 -- here's how it breaks down:
$1500 for the creative team
$1200 for the 10,000 copy print run
$300 shipping
$300 for Kickstarter fees
$200 for reward creation
This is the minimum we would need to produce the comic and get it to backers and retailers as well as get funds to the creative team for their hard work on the issue.
11x17 mini-poster
Wait -- $1200 for a 10,000 copy print run??
Yes! Alterna Comics prints all of its single issues on newsprint -- this enables us to keep costs very low! We also sell advertising space in our issues, which again, helps keep print costs down. So that's why a 10,000 copy print run will cost as low as $1200. We'll be combining this print run with our normal print runs as well, which is part of what helps to provide a lower unit cost too. Our average print runs are between 4000 to 7000 copies (as we print copies for distribution to comic shops and newsstands).
  Carry some comics around with this 13x15 tote bag!
  Show your Alterna Comics pride in this shirt!
  Keep your noggin warm with this Alterna Comics beanie!
So what's AMAZING AGE about?
This series focuses on three childhood friends that are no longer friends by the time high school rolls around.  But when they get sucked into the comic book world they all created as kids, their friendship is reignited as they must focus on finding a way to save the day and make it back home in one piece. The complete 5 issue mini-series is currently available in comic shops across the world and was one of our top 10 best-selling titles in 2017.  It's also available for purchase on this Kickstarter (or you can get the upcoming graphic novel compilation which is also available on this Kickstarter!).
#0 features the untold origin of the Amazing Age universe.
Matthew David Smith (writer/co-creator) Matthew's past works include the graphic novel BEE STING (with artist Jeremy Massie) which he later turned into a film that also spawned a sequel: BEE STING 2: Bear Sting.
Jeremy Massie (penciler/co-creator) Jeremy's past works include ALL MY GHOSTS, THE DEADBEAT, and BEE STING.  Jeremy is the sole creator, writer, and artist on ALL MY GHOSTS and THE DEADBEAT.
Christine Brunson (colorist) Christine has been involved with several other comics including UNDEAD NORM and AMAZONIA.
The graphic novel cover to AMAZING AGE.

campaign.story:
BOOM! Thanks to you we are funded!!
Now on to the Stretch Goals...
STRETCH GOAL #1 is a wonderful pin up from Karl Alstaetter who has worked at Marvel, DC and Image comics. (Please scroll to the bottom of the page to see the pin-up and more on Karl.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #2  Six amazing digital comics that are available to anyone who has pledged $6 and above!(Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #3 Upgrade the bookmarks to HIGH GLOSS WITH A UV COATING! (Please scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #4 A specially curated digital bundle of six comics. This stretch goal is available to anyone who has pledged $6 and above!  (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #5 The fantastic pin up of Granville and Tesla by Gwynn Tavares. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #6 I love the indie comics community, so ti gives me great pleasure to introduce you to five more creators. This stretch goal of six (6) digital comics is available to to anyone who has pledged $6 or more! (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
A BIG THANK YOU to Scott Baker (4scottbaker@gmail.com) for making this video.  Music by Emmett Cooke.
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print our new book, THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN (A Granville Woods and Nikola Tesla story). It is a 34 page story in a 44 page perfect bound book, which means 10 pages of extras!
If you are new to the series, the original six issue mini-series is about an ex-Pinkerton detective, a spirit photographer, and a genius scientist who battle supernatural forces in late 1800’s Boston. They live in an alternate steampunk history where ghosts and demons are a normal part of life. Families known as the Great Houses control the economy of the Great States of America while the middle class and lower classes sole purpose are to serve the Great Houses.
THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN is a standalone continuation of the series written by Madeleine Holly-Rosing. Art, inking, and color are by Gwynn Tavares.
THE STORY
Granville and Tesla are in a race for time to save Boston from a mysterious disease that turns human beings into machines.
Granville returns home to Liberty Row only to find an almost insane Tesla hiding there. But his efforts to get rid of Tesla hit a snag when they discover that a virus is turning humans into soulless mechanical men. Realizing that Emily and Travis Morgan of Morgan Medicinals are behind the outbreak, they fear that the twins are after more than just control of Boston – They want to take over the Great States of America.
EMILY AND TRAVIS MORGAN
Emily, a brilliant scientist, has spent her life creating cures for other people and seeing none of the financial rewards or acknowledgement. Her brother Travis handles the business side of the company and resents that neither he nor his sister has ever been given their due.
Can Granville and Tesla work together to save the city? Or will Boston and the Great States of America fall under the control of THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN?
Cover art, inking, and color by Gwynn Tavares.
The entire story is off to our letterer, Troy Peteri, so here are the first three colored pages for you to see the amazing job that Gwynn has done.
      NEW TO BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY?
No worries. The original trade paperback is available in several reward tiers.
 Cover art by Emily Hu. Color and inking by Gloria Caeli.
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a Boston Metaphysical Society ten page short story called, Hunter-Killer, and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship. I introduce three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain; Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
And for what the story is about, well I have two words for you - Airship Battle!
The complete story of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.
THE MONEY:
Where the money goes...Your backing would enable us to pay for a print run of the book which means printing enough copies to send off to backers with some leftover to sell at conventions, incentives, shipping (which includes mailing envelopes, postage and handling.) And, of course, the fees (5% off the top, plus credit card fees.)
THE TEAM FOR THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A TV, feature film, and comic book writer, Madeleine holds an MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories and novellas based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. She is currently writing the four issue mini-series, Kasai: The Homecoming, for Evoluzione Publishing/SFC Comics. She also has upcoming sequential art short stories in: The 4th Monkey Anthology, The Edgar Allan Poe Project, The Eynes Anthology, The Rum Row Anthology, and the Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, Ain’t It Anthology. 
Gwynn Tavares – Artist/Colorist: Gwynn starter out her art career as a sculptor. After a few years working on movie special effects, she decided to go into sequential art and was the artist for Amelia Sky. Majoring as in illustrator, Gwynn is also an accomplished comedian and lives on a sailboat in San Francisco Bay.
Troy Peteri – Letterer: Troy is a Los Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series for Radical Comics.
THE TEAM FOR BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY TRADE PAPERBACK:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing, Writer/Creator. (See credits above.)
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky Cloonan, and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for BOOM! BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series. Emily is currently doing storyboards for Marvel.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist. He worked as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to his work on he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work includes Bob Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist Christopher Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT bestselling anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6) (See credits above.)
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling, Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them." - Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
The original series was also nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 Geekie Awards.
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY
For those of you who have read the original series, my version of Tesla is not what you usually see in fiction, but it does stay true to his obsessive nature. Granville was a real person and a contemporary of Thomas Edison and Alexander Graham Bell. (He did business with both of them.) As a writer, I wanted to put my fictional versions of Granville and Tesla in the same room together for an extended period of time to see what would happen. Let’s just say that Granville is more of a hard ass than I thought he was. This story allowed me to delve deeper into the lives of those who did not belong to a Great House, but were closer to the rest of us. Specifically, I wanted to show what it was like to live in Liberty Row, the middle class Negro neighborhood I created for this universe, and those whose work was used by the Great Houses, but never received any benefit for their effort.
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY. Not only does it bring my love of science fiction and history together, (which by the way, equals steampunk), the steampunk time period allows me to address the themes of classism, sexism, and racism in America in a thoughtful and entertaining way. For at its very core, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American story. And you can't tell an American story without including women and people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different points of view, are able to work together for the common good.
INCENTIVES
In addition to THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN, we are offering the trade paperback which includes a brand new ten page story, a BRAND NEW bookmark, the anthologies, Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude and Some Time Later, and a NEW BMS TRIQUETRA LAPEL PIN. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique copper color. (See image below.)
(Pin designed by Bill Meahan.)
Lapel Pin Set
A set of all four Boston Metaphysical pins (Dirigible, Tesla, 1800's Box Camera, and Triquetra) in a lovely gift box with our logo are available as well.
SPECIAL COMMISSION REWARD TIER
Did you ever want to meet Granville Woods or Tesla? Well this may be the closest you'll come as Gwynn and I are offering this limited (6) reward tier where you will be drawn next to Granville and Tesla (in appropriate period costume) in an 11x17 print. Here is the portrait in which a chosen few will be drawn into:
The print will be on 80 lb. Classic Stipple to give it some heft.
And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers include it as either a pdf or print version.
The latest Boston Metaphysical Society short story, Here Abide Monsters, was published in the anthology, Some Time Later, in May 2017 from Thinking Ink Press and is available in a number of reward tiers. The anthology also includes stories from Harry Turtledove and a number of other notable authors.

STRETCH GOALS
STRETCH GOAL #1 - $4,600 (Kickstarter Exclusive) REACHED!!
Backers who have pledged $10 or more to a physical reward will receive this wonderful 8 1/2 x 11 inch print on 10 pt. cardstock gloss by the fabulous Karl Altstaetter.
 A bit about Karl:
Karl’s passion as a storyteller began when he received his first job drawing comic books professionally while still in High School. He quickly climbed his way up to an assistant position contributing artistic support and story concepts on Marvel's X-Men, Uncanny X-Men and X-Factor. He soon became an artist/writer for Marvel, DC and Image comics on such titles as X-Men, Avengers, Silver Surfer, The Hulk, Superman, Bloodstrike, and Battlestar Galactica.
Always looking for new challenges, Karl created his own comic book publishing company Hyperwerks Entertainment. While managing Hyperwerks, he co-created and published several hit titles including Saint Angel, Cats Eye and the hugely popular flagship title Deity.
After eight successful years in publishing, Karl entered the toy industry working with MGA Entertainment Inc.,Razor USA, Jada Toys, Playmates and Spin Master, Mattel and Lootcrate as a toy designer.
Karl is currently working on his comic book Mirror available on the Webtoons. You can see his work at https://spark.adobe.com/page/VPA2kXkIhAner/
STRETCH GOAL #2 - $5,600 REACHED!
DIGITAL COMIC BUNDLE #1
Over the last few years, I’ve run across a number of comics, both online and at Cons, I’ve enjoyed. I decided to curate a few especially for this Kickstarter from creators you may or may not be familiar with, but who have unique stories to tell.
This stretch goal is available to anyone who has pledged $6 or more. That means six more digital comics to add to your collection!
So, without further ado, let me introduce you to…
Katrina Hates the Dead by Russell Nohelty.
What would you do during the Apocalypse? How would you survive? Those are the questions that have plagued Katrina for years. All the good boys and girls were raptured up to Heaven, leaving the rest of humanity to ask a single, solitary question: “Why not me?”
Russell is the owner of Wannabee Press, The Complete Creative and has not only written graphic novels and novels, but has the best business book out there for creators called, Sell Your Soul: How To Build a Creative Career. http://www.wannabepress.com/about/
Gods of the Game by Jody Susskind
A group of friends who love to play RPGs find themselves in the world they created. A throwback to the 80’s, Gods of the Game is a mix of fantasy and D&D. http://godsofthegame.com/
Demon Hunter Kain by Gil Burrell
Mysterious disappearances… grisly, ritualistic murders… terrible things lurking in the shadows… All these can be found in New Babylon… the most haunted city in the world. Kain Smith’s plan was simple: Acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to become a Demon Hunter thereby continuing his clan’s ancient heritage and giving himself a chance to make amends for a horrendous event from his past. Things begin to get complicated when he meets and befriends Zandalee Joseph, a mentally unstable(?) girl with strange powers. Now… between being a teenager, befriending Zandalee, high school, ruthless Demon Hunting mentors, living in the most haunted city in the world AND whispers of the coming Apocalypse, will Kain survive long enough to achieve his goals? http://www.demonhunterkain.com/
Retro Blade by Freya Horn
In the year 3007 a reality crash has wiped everything out, and the last known survivor Axel Kepler is working his way backwards through time, trying to figure out where it all went wrong. With a severely out of touch Database, a Transmutation Device for food (that, if anything, makes molecules less edible than they were before) and only a cryptic Blueprint left by his sister to guide him, he needs help…He needs a Team. Together, they will find out how to fix things, who the good guys really are… and why people from the future have such cheesy haircuts. ‘Meanwhile’, a few millennia earlier… a young boy named Magnus is bestowed with remarkable powers he was never meant to have, and chooses not to save the world with them. http://retrobladecomic.com
America’s Kingdom by Brian Hawkins
America’s Kingdom is about a modern-day alternate history America under the rule and reign of one family – the descendants of George Washington, known now as King George I, after the end of the American Revolution in 1776. The series begins shortly after the demise of the latest sovereign, King George X, when his son, Prince Geoffrey, is poised to take the throne.
Soul’s Journey by Sophie Pfrötzschner
Anrak, crown-prince of the Kingdom of Antorea, finds himself trapped in a wolf's body after running away from home. Meanwhile his country is at the verge of war with two neighbouring states. Now Anrak has to figure out the nature of his current condition and find a way to reverse it in order to regain his actual body to prevent a conflict he so carelessly set in motion. Sophie is a Germany-based artist, writing and drawing the comic in her spare time.
When not napping on her couch she enjoys reading comics, lazing around Netflix and procrastinating on social media.http://soulsjourney.gerritianchronicles.com/
 STRETCH GOAL #3 - $6,600 REACHED!
Stretch Goal #3  is to upgrade the bookmarks to HIGH GLOSS WITH A UV COATING!! This will not only make them more durable, but make the colors POP! Those who have pledged to a physical reward will be getting one of a bookmark whether or not we make this goal. BUT with your help we will! So please keep sharing, posting, and tweeting.

DIGITAL COMIC BUNDLE #2
I have more awesomeness for you. Check out these six amazing indie creators. Anyone who has pledged $6 or more will receive this digital bundle. That's six more comics to add to your digital collection!
 Let me introduce you to...
MAIDEN OF THE MACHINE BY CAITLIN LIKE
A cartoonist based out of Portland, Oregon and Caitlin likes to make comics with fancy dresses, egregious floral motifs, occasional horror, and even more occasional face-punching.
The story: Maiden of the Machine is about a young woman named Elizabeth Watson who finds herself being the protagonist of a completely wrong kind of story. Too traditional to take part of her adventurer family lineage and too poor and obscure to be a true society lady, Elizabeth’s fortunes change with the introduction of famed industrialist Mr. Victor Lovelace in her life. She is soon pulled into his world of industry and conspiracy- where violence is the norm, sky pirates roam the skies and a woman with wings made of brass and steel hunts in the night. https://www.patreon.com/CaitlinLike
WRETCHES BY JAMES ROCHE
At the end of the day I just want to create some stuff and be able to look at the finished product and be proud. The idea of creating something totally new, that wasn’t here before, and to have it in front of me for the rest of my life, is why I do this. Here's a little "resume": • Been writing comics since about 2010. • Have had some shorts published. • Created the science fiction/fantasy series, Wretches, which has had its first two issues successfully funded on Kickstarter. • Co-Created The 4th Monkey: An Anthology for Awareness, which had it's first book successfully funded on Kickstarter. http://www.jameseroche.com/
The Story: This is a story about family. About loss. All Shea & Sean have is each other. Until they don't even have that.
SHAMAN’S DESTINY BY KYRUN SILVA
Writer, Artist and Creator of Shaman's Destiny. Writer and creator of Xob the Lightning Wielder
Kyrun's earliest memories are of drawing characters in his room while watching cartoons on TV. As a young boy, Kyrun couldn't stop drawing and creating. He was fascinated with everything from cartoons, sci-fi, fantasy and other geeky things, but comic books was and still is his main addiction. From the storytelling to the beautiful artwork, he knew he had to be a part of this world.
Kyrun launched Taurus Comics in 2018 with the slogan "less bull, more comics" His goal is to produce high quality books that will entertain and titillate the mind.
THE STORY: Follow the adventures of Malik as he is chosen by the spirit of the earth, Gaea, to protect our world. Our world is being overrun by threats from other planes and realms. It's Malik's job to help save us from these threats. Malik will be confronted by perils from all sides and with the help of his mentor, Jeph, he will have to decide who to give his trust to.
MY HERO BY JIM PERRY AND ALLI MYRES-PERRY
My hero! is a webcomic written by Jim Perry and illustrated by Allison Myres-Perry.
The story follows the adventures of a Guardian named Hasera who cannot perform even the most rudimentary requirement of her job: Healing. Hasera has been reading Harlequin romance stories since she joined The Order of the greatest Champion who ever lived across the 9 planes: Lark. One day she wishes to meet the great and chivalrous hero of her dreams. Remember two important sayings: “Be careful what you wish for.” and “Never meet your idols” http://www.myherocomic.com/
VANGUARD BY DAN BUTCHER (Adult)
Can and I have known each other since I first ventured on to Twitter. He was also kind enough to create fan art for the comic in the early years. He started, as do a lot of comic artist, by drawing and creating characters and comic strips at an early age. Studying art through school and ended up earning a degree in Illustration and Design. After a short career as an animator (where he realized drawing the same image over 200 times wasn’t for him), he defected to the ‘Dark Side’ and began working as a graphic designer, which he now does as his ‘proper’ job. He hails from the U.K. His work-to-date includes: The Awesome Comic – With Vince Hunt and Tony Esmond; El Marvo – with Luke Kondor & Ben Errington; Papercuts and Inkstains – Various; Assault of Fortress Doom – Lex McDonaldComichaus – Suited & Booted with Jon Laight
The story: Created, written, and illustrated by Dan Butcher, Vanguard focuses on an eponymous team of British superheroes, led by South London orphan Paul Drake AKA Pendragon.
http://vanguardcomic.com/
DELILAH BLAST BY MARCEL DUPREE
The editor-in-chief of Evoluzione Publishing and SFC Comics, I met Marcel while we were both running Kickstarters. I fell in love with Delilah Blast, a scifi steampunk version of Girl Genius. He has a number of other titles either out or in production including, Kasai: The Homecoming, which he brought me on board to write. Be sure to check out all the Evoluzione/SFC titles, including Angelica Reigns, Sword Theory, Villain, and more.
The story: Science runs the world and the Earth is governed by the E.S.A., the Earth's Science Association. Everyone is allow to join the organization on their sixteenth birthday, but unfortunately for Delilah Blast she oversleeps, missing the entrance exams and putting her dream in jeopardy. However, when another opportunity to achieve her dream presents itself, Delilah is more than willing and ready to take it, even if it means going to a dangerous alien planet to retrieve obscure technology that could change the world and Earth forever. https://www.facebook.com/evoluzionepublishing/

 STRETCH GOAL #6 - $9,500
DIGITAL COMIC BUNDLE #6 - REACHED!
Check out these six amazing indie creators. Anyone who has pledged $6 or more will receive this digital bundle. That's six more comics to add to your digital collection!
 Let me introduce you to...
DON WALKER
REAPER CORPS #0 'What if Cameron's Terminator and The Matrix had a love child?' Enter a world where sentient Cyborgs pray to a God. Clones fight for civil rights. And Mankind is an endangered species.
The Story: 2308. Earth. After a surviving a devastating galactic war with the alien Zartori, what's left of mankind's society has returned to Earth to rebuild.. With a human population under three hundred million, man must rely on the aid of a warrior class of sentient cyborgs for protection against a now subservient class of Cloned humans who seek a place in this new world order. In the midst of all this are a growing number of Cyborgs who believe mankind isn't worth the trouble.
Full color. Sci-fi action adventure. One shot. (W/P) DON WALKER (I) JEFF GRAHAM (C) NICOLAS CHAPUIS (L) ED DUKESHIRE AGENT WILD #0
AGENT WILD is a Hunter Agent (assassin) for the alien para military police unit known as 12TH HOUR. These agents are tasked with policing the secret alien presence on Earth. While on suspension for a failed mission that saw her partner killed, Agent Wild is re-activated and sent on a routine mission that turns out to be anything but routine. When a 'ghost' from her past returns with plans to start a galactic civil war. Agent Wild has to make a choice. Kill him, or help him overthrow the alien alliance they both serve, lead by Agent Wild's Mother. Full color. Sci-fi action adventure. One shot.
'Wonder Woman in a power suit.'
(W/P) Don Walker (I) Larry Welch with Jeff Graham (C) Nicolas Chapuis with Jesse Heagy (L) Ed Dukeshire
ANDY PURVIANCE
I, MUMMY
The Story: A steampunk mummy in a dress from the 22nd century, Jane is an impulsive teenager turned mummy who investigates her own murder with the assistance of a cantankerous ghost. Our story occurs in a future based on predictions from the late 1800s—a future where everyone can fly and there’s no such thing as wi-fi.
SUSAN LEE
WRAITH OF LOVE, VOL. 1
The Story: After a battering at the hands of her abusive boyfriend, Jameson Mercer's failed suicide attempt imbues her with unique powers and she becomes a vigilante for those who have become victims of destructive relationships.
MARCUS KWAME ANDERSON (ARTIST); LEONARDO FAIERMAN (WRITER)

The Story: Snow Daze is a comic book created by writer, Leonardo Faierman and artist, Marcus Kwame Anderson. Loosely based on Leo’s experiences shoveling snow as a teen in Queens NY, the story concerns enterprising teens of color in a strange suburban land, navigating the bridge.
JAMES KERSEY
THE AMOK BROS.
The Story: Useless Future is an anthology comic featuring the work of Jim Kersey. This issue features a possible origin story for The Amok Bros. escaping from an unlicensed robot factory, as well as the introduction of the mysterious Neutro Gina.

campaign.story:
Prospects is a new sci-fi comic from writer Max Majernik and artist Jean Franco. The Kickstarter is for a print run of #2 (and #1!) of the mini-series. The comic is a perfect balance of 50's sci-fi, 80's action, and everyday life.
The first Kickstarter for Prospects #issue 1 was a Kickstarter staff pick and funded in just 100 hours.
Story:  
The town of Ridgeville has been stuck in the middle of a 150-year-old battle between two mad scientists, and former colleagues, Edwin Grabowski and Victor Farsimov. Both claim to have figured out the secret of immortality and created armies of zombies and cyborgs using their respective methods. The scientists have waged a war for so long within the town that the townspeople now consider it an honor to be abducted by one of the mad scientists in their quest for glory. Anyone who shows any bit of potential, be it brains, brawn, or anything in between, will be captured by one of the scientists by the time they are 25 years old. 
On the outside looking in is 30-year old Colin Bates, who isn’t one of the prospects. He has been selected by no one, not by scientists, girls, or even friends. He spends most of his days watching TV in his basement where he avoids doing odd jobs for his Grandma and her friends. Everything changes when a notorious terrorist, intent on destroying both scientists, appears in Colin’s basement begging Colin to take over his legacy. 
On the inside looking out is 18-year old Andrew Russell. Andrew has it all, the brains, brawn, and looks to be whatever he wants: the ultimate 5 tool prospect. The problem is that the whole community wants him to be a soldier for one of the scientists, while he just wants a normal 18-year-old life. He has to deal with the pressure of the town, especially his mom, about every aspect of his day AND the thought that he can be abducted by one of the scientists at any moment.
Accolades
Preview
            Meet the Team
Max Majernik (Writer) @SnowballMax I currently reside in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. I have a passion for writing and took classes such as dramatic and theater writing in college in hopes of getting a dramatic writing degree. Over the past few years, I have written reviews, articles, and interviews for various comic blogs. The blog I have dedicated most of my time to is comicosity.com, where I had the pleasure of reviewing a wide range of comics and interviewing many industry regulars. This past year, I felt compelled to go back to my creative writing background and to focus my free time on writing an original idea. As my first venture into the world of comic writing, I put together a small miniseries that I hope people who love comics, or people who enjoy a fun story, can enjoy. Thank you for the opportunity and for taking time out of your day to read what I have begun to put together!
Jean Franco (Pencils, inks, colors, lettering...aka the whole art department) Jean is an Argentinian comic artist and a graphic designer. He started drawing as a kid inspired by the work of John Kricfalusi and Genndy Tartakovsky,among others. He works as a teacher of both professions and his recent work projects include “Monty the Dinosaur” by Action Lab Comics, as a letterer in the spanish edition of “27” by Image Comics, and “Prospects", of course. He's always working on personal projects, mostly humor comics. Jean loves beer, pizza, animated movies, and all kind of comics.
Digital PDFs
Drm-Free Pdfs of Prospects #1 / Prospects #2 / Hard Wyred #1 / Hard Wyred #2
Hard Wyred (W: Erik Bitmanis A: Ross Zucco) Welcome to the world of Hard Wyred, where everything moves at a speed of light pace. Yet, for those finding themselves living in the past, it’s a tough place to be.  
Sam Wyerznowski seeks to redeem himself in the eyes of his long-time crush, but the costs for this shot at redemption could be his undoing.

campaign.story:
Kasai is the second solo series of the SFC Comics line. SFC is world of super powered sports entertainment. These solo series are a chance to get to know the characters outside of the ring. 
Kasai Starting Out
 The Story
Kasai returning home to Kyoto to find her estranged demi-God father has broken his promise to his sister, Mizuhame, the goddess of water, never to fight again. Though Kasai begs him to stop, he refuses and Mizuhame exacts her revenge by kidnapping him. Now, Kasai must face her own fears to rescue a father who once abandoned her.
 The Cast 
 Kasai is a demi god who burned her mom at birth. She spent many years in an orphanage until her father Kagu wanted to train her. She stayed with her father for a few years then left to be on her own. She stumbled into the world of Super powered wrestling in her late teens. After a few years she was a big hit in Japan. Samson, CEO of SFC brought her to America to be a big star
Kagu-tsuchi aka Kagu is god of Fire who burned his mother at birth. He is the estranged father of Kasai. He is a care-free spirit that likes to have fun.
Mizuhame is water goddess with a stern belief of a seperation of mortals and deities. She is deeply bothered by the interaction of beings
 We can try to use words to try to convince but let's allow the comic to speak in this preview
     WHY THIS STORY?
When Marcel Dupree, editor and co-founder of Evoluzione Publishing and SFC Comics, approached me about writing Kasai, I was absolutely thrilled. I love mythology and action and though I’m not a pro-wrestling fan per se, I have a deep respect for their athletic skills. (Whoever tells you pro-wrestling isn’t real doesn’t know what they are talking about. It’s scripted, but every hit is real as are the injuries.) We talked about the world of the Super Fighting Championship and the mythos behind Kasai. It was clear that we had the makings of a complex character on our hands and I ran with it. But Kasai isn’t just about action and the ring, at its heart it is a father-daughter story. One that is fraught with resentment, trust issues, and love.
Please join us as we explore this world and journey with our characters into the unknown. I think you’ll like it and the lizards. Especially, the lizards.
   BONUS REWARDS
 SFC Comics believes in rewarding loyalty. All previous backers of SFC Comics Kickstarters get this print for free when they pledge $10 or more to Kasai: The Homecoming #1.
Boston Metaphysical - The Scourge of the Mechanical Men backers who also back Kasai: The Homecoming #1 at the $10 level get this print for free. 
CROSSOVER PRINTS
 If you back both Sword Theory #1 and Kasai: The Homecoming #1 at the $10 you get this free print by Phil Buckenham and Marco Pagnotta.  Sword Theory is an action fantasy tale of self-discovery and revenge as a young man perfects the art of the sword. 
 If you back both The Crimson Guardians #1 and Kasai: The Homecoming #1 at $10 or more you get this free print by Nick Garber and Marco Pagnotta. Apogee comics coming right off their successful Kickstarter with Bengali now want to bring you deeper into the Apogee Universe.
 Madeleine Holly-Rosing
Madeleine is the writer/creator of the popular steampunk comic Boston Metaphysical Society and the author of Kickstarter for the Independent Creator. She has upcoming sequential art short stories in: The 4th Monkey Anthology, The Edgar Allan Poe Project, The Eynes Anthology, The Rum Row Anthology, and the Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, Ain’t It Anthology.
Kasai: The Homecoming is her first superhero comic series.
Alessandro Miracolo
Alessandro is an artist from Italy. He has worked with various publishers thought the years such as Zenescope.
Marco Pagnotta
Colorist from Perguia, Italy. He colors SFC and Titanium.
Brant Fowler
Brant Fowler is a professional letterer and flatter (gonzogoose.com). He has had his lettering work published through Image Comics, Action Lab Entertainment, Arcana Comics, and many more. And he has flatted (base color work) books ranging from Spider-Man, to Batman, to Sonic the Hedgehog. Brant is also a member of YouTube channel Comic Frontline, and hosts a comics podcast called Zone 4 that began in April 2009. Brant has run, written and edited for several comic news websites, and still writes for Comic Frontline on occasion. He also co-founded his own comic publishing company, Last Ember Press (lastemberpress.com) in 2015 and continues to produce new content there and on his YouTube channel (youtube.com/brantfowler).

We have joined the Make #100 movement!  We are only going to print 100 copies of this book!  Truly a limited edition!
     SteamBear is an interactive children's picture book and comic. It's book two of  THE ADVENTURE BEAR SQUAD.  A Sci-Fi adventure story designed for the geek-parent and their children. It is built to stimulate creativity and learning. It is a team of bears across genres like the League of Extraordinary Gentlemen meets the Care Bears.
SteamBear is a 8.5 x 8.5 inch book, hardcover on color paper.  It is 32 pages long and will come signed with a personalized sketch inside.  They are all getting shipped next month in February.  No joke!
Being a parent of three children, I wanted something that would be fun for me to read as well as educational. Being a nerd-fan of all things geeky, I included pop-culture easter-eggs for the parents. Having experience in academia and science, I included teaching moments of science, astronomy and history. 
 THE STORY 
The exciting second installment of the Adventure Bear Squad book series is upon us!  Faced with the disappearance of dreams by every man, woman and child the world is thrown in turmoil and it's up to SteamBear and his compatriots to save the world from curmudgeonry.  They travel through time and space in SteamBear's Travel-train and find out why the dreams have gone missing and how to bring them back!
  PAGES FROM THE BOOK:
         And also available SpaceBear!
              A little bit about me, I am a professional writer, artist and creator and I have run two successful kickstarter projects. I created the graphic novel series Pariah, Missouri and work on a number of projects for graphic novels, boardgames, television and other media. Stories are my bread and butter and I have BIG plans for the ADVENTURE BEAR SQUAD and my backers will be able to participate in building this out to much more than children's books!
Why have a goal of $200?
I want to make the goal small and simple.  I want everyone to get the book.  It's going to the printers in January and will be ready to ship in February, so for me it's about getting more readers for the book and not about hitting a magical number.  If you back this book, you will get it.
  Kicking It Forward

campaign.story:
The first order of fiction is to entertain. Comics can be smart. Steve Rude’s and my creation Nexus has won every industry award, gone into multiple printings, and is a staple of libraries everywhere. Comics portray martial arts poorly, focusing on elegant poses rather than intricate fight choreography. 
It has been my lifelong mission to change that, first with Badger, then with Kato and Bruce Lee, now with Q-Ball, which I co-created with Denver artist Barry McClain. Barry is an explosive artist who is just getting started. Barbara Kaalberg is an amazing inker. Charlie Hogg is our talented colorist and letterer. 
Q-Ball Interior
Our audience used to pick up Master of Kung Fu or Iron Fist hoping for a glimpse of real kung fu. Q-Ball is more than fight scenes, it is also an exploration of character, a romance, and a spy story. 
The first issue is finished. It is stunning. One glimpse of the art alone will be enough to sell this project. 
We’re going the Kickstarter route because the starving independents have pinned all their hopes on movie franchise characters and no longer accept original concepts.
Q-Ball story is about Detroit homeboy Curtis Ball joined the Merchant Marine and ended up managing a warehouse in Manila. Curtis wanted only two things out of life: to see the world and study Kali/Escrima. But when a pack of tuxedoed sharks muscle their way into his warehouse, Curtis learns the hard way that it’s not always smart to mind your own business. The spooks are looking for Donna Wing, a beautiful Chinese blogger, forced to flee due to her exposes of human rights abuse. Now Curtis and Donna are on the run—from the Chinese government, the tongs, and a group of international cutthroats who will stop at nothing to stop them from reaching the United States and spilling their guts. Sometimes you have to spill some guts to spill your guts.

The Books
"Gumgah and the Grumpledonk" is illustrated by Micheline Hess (Malice in Ovenland), and follows the bedtime of a young girl named Gumgah, who is convinced there’s something scary in her closet. After failing to convince her parents of the existence of the monster the brave little girl decides to take matters into her own hands, and in doing so meets the creature known as the Grumpledonk. Readers will find out how Gumgah handles this encounter as the story unfolds. Preview Pages
 “The Booger Queen” is illustrated by Christine Larsen (Cartoon Network, Simon & Schuster), and follows an impassioned conversation with a diverse group of kids on a beautiful summer’s night. The children debate the existence of the Booger Queen, one-upping each other in rhyming verse sure to stay with young readers. The kids talk about where she lives, what she eats, and more. As the conversation gets out of hand, the youngest of them all asks a powerful question. Work In Progress

Custom individual, social media portrait (400px by 400px) of you (or your kid) by Micheline Hess in the style of Gumgah and the Grumpledonk. Micheline will illustrate them first come first served. Depending on the number of requests, the illustration will be done within a month at the latest.

The Team
Jacques Nyemb
Writer/Publisher
Husband to Wonder Woman and father to Thing 1 and Thing 2, Jacques Nyemb's life is never dull. When he's not writing his millionth script, you can find him passed out under a pile of hats he wears as he runs Not So Super Publishing.
Twitter | Instagram | Facebook
Micheline Hess 
Artist - Gumgah and the Grumpledonk
Born and raised in NYC, Micheline Hess works as a designer at a prominent ad agency and spends her spare time developing graphic novels, short stories, and interactive iBooks for kids. She has always been interested in the portrayal of black people in visual narratives like comics and movies and is constantly endeavoring to weave her own sense of humorous story-telling into both her personal and sometimes professional work. Micheline is most adept at creating characters and stories that provide a safe and fun way to inspire young children, especially girls. Through colorful flights of fun and fancy, she hopes to encourage a stronger sense of self-love, friendship, and a hunger to embrace all things new and different in the world around them.
Twitter | Instagram | Facebook  
Christine Larsen
Artist - The Booger Queen
Originating from the Pine Barrens of central Jersey, Christine is a Harvey Award Nominated cartoonist and Illustrator, creating art for comics, book covers, stories, posters, and websites. She has worked with clients such as Dark Horse, IDW, BOOM Studios, DC Online, Saatchi & Saatchi, Simon & Schuster and Cartoon Network. She is also an adjunct instructor at The University of the Arts and Deleware College of Art and Design where she teaches courses in sequential art and comics. Christine resides in a heavily fortified North Philadelphia row home with her two cats, very awesome husband, wee son and a sawed-off shotgun. She patiently awaits the zombie apocalypse.

Beverly Bambury
Editor (both books)  
Beverly Bambury edits comics and picture books, and is also a publicist and DIY publicity coach for authors and comic creators. She works with anyone from the occasional self-published author to creator-owned comics, all the way up to authors with major publishers. She's a Florida transplant living in Ontario, Canada, and yes: hilarity ensued.

The Goal:  
The initial goal is to raise the funds to get our books and the additional rewards produced and shipped. Any money raised beyond the initial goal will unlock more specialty Stretch Goal items, including limited-edition prints, bookmarks and many more surprises as we reach each goal.
About Not So Super Publishing:
Not So Super Publishing prides itself on creating diverse stories with diverse creators. Its approach is welcoming new readers, of all walks of life, who want something more from comics and publishing. NSSP started out publishing all-ages comics such as This Bites, Smörgåsbord Squad, and the flagship title Not So Super. Founder Jacques Nyemb and NSSP were featured in many media outlets such as Raleigh’s News and Observer, Spectrum News in North Carolina, and popular book site Tor.com. NSSP has also contributed to Jerome Walford’s award-winning anthology, Gwan and the New Frontier anthology.

* * * IF Anthology creator Peter Simeti will be personally donating 10% of the total raised on this Kickstarter to disaster relief efforts in Puerto Rico and Mexico City via https://hispanicfederation.org/unidos/ * * *
Make your own bundle!
What's the IF Anthology?
The IF Anthology was created by me, Peter Simeti (founder/publisher of Alterna Comics), and features a new theme every year. The book received rave reviews when it debuted in 2015 with a sci-fi theme and then went on to become a fan and creator favorite in 2016 (and three times the size) featuring a theme of super powers.
This year's theme is crime.  
Packed with 38 stories and clocking in at 336 pages, it's the first IF Anthology title that will contain mature content.  Stories will range from the impact that crime has on the lives it affects, the psychological and sociological factors that lead people down its path, to the way people deal with being victims of a crime. Crime-fighting has long been a staple of comic book storytelling, and this thrilling and thought-provoking graphic novel anthology will be no exception to that rule.
2018 "Horror" and 2019 "Hope" -- coming soon!
I see that the book is available for pre-order on Amazon and at comic shops when I use code SEP171104, so why should I pre-order on Kickstarter?
The IF Anthology began its life on Kickstarter and each year we've grown. It only feels right to be able to offer something unique to the Kickstarter community, whether that be signed copies of books, original artwork, sketches, merchandise, or even the ability to catch up on previously released versions and support directly.
If you'd like to pre-order the book at your local comic shop or on the website of your choice, by all means please do so. We're just trying to provide another means to get the book to people that want to support directly or people that would like to get things like original art, commissions, or signed/sketched in books.
Like last year, we're raising funds for the shipping cost of getting creators their books.  We have nearly 100 creators on board with over 20 that live outside the US.  Shipping is expensive and nearly everything raised of the initial $1000 goal will go towards those costs.
Who is involved on this year's book?
2017's IF Anthology features a cover by series creator Peter Simeti (that's me!) and over 100 creators involved.

campaign.story:
What is Coronary?  
Plastic surgery is free. London is gripped by madness, dominated by cosmetic surgeons, lifestyle coaches and pill-pushers. Within this insanity, a neurotic businessman reconsiders the course of his life when a freethinking outsider crashes into it. But she doesn't want him, or anyone.  
Justin must put his business aside and concentrate on what it means to live, love, and be loved in return. He created an unattainable standard for women that drove them to buy his miracle pills and pushed them into the arms of his surgeons. Due to this, he has enemies both legal and criminal, that want to end ventures permanently. Throughout this chaos, Luna hopes to help him achieve redemption, while he's still breathing that is.
*If you missed Coronary: Episode One - don't worry! Every reward level that's $7 and above comes with a digital copy of the first episode. And for $20 you can get a signed physical of Episode One.

"Beautiful art...with a determined-as-all-hell creative team." -Fanfest.com

campaign.story:
A great cataclysm has left the world concealed in snow and ice. To protect what was left of their culture, the Sunmakers sealed themselves away from the doomed world. Now, their numbers have dwindled, and Tibhan, the last of the Sunmakers, must risk everything by returning to the desolate wastes to find fuel for the fire that preserves his people's essence.
Even if the cost is great and unthinkable.
This is the first chapter of a three issue mini-series. 
Sunmaker is for those who like their fantasy with dark undertones but don't always want apocalyptic scenario's that are gray and drab.
     A fantasy story that takes place in a vivid apocalyptic world.
Strong theme of legacy and what happens when your values challenge your morals.
A story that features the struggle of realizing for something to thrive something else may have to be sacrificed.
22 pages of full-color sequentials plus 6 pages of extras which include a pinup gallery. That's a whole 28 pages total!
6.625 x 10.25 on 70lb gloss paper with a 85lb gloss cover.
             "When are you going to stop talking about making comics and actually make a comic?"
Not exactly the words you want to hear from your significant other, but for me they rang true and struck deep. They pushed me to take action.
And then?
I found the script for Sunmaker on an online editing column called The Proving Grounds, which is found on the ComixTribe website. I was captivated by the characters and the dialog, especially the villains catch phrase, "All things return to the cold!"
I had to tell Liam how much I loved the script, which ended up kicking off Sunmaker coming to life. My hope is to capture as much energy and excitement that I felt the when I initially read the story and bringing that to each page.
Now what?
Sunmaker is my first comic, and the thought of holding it in my hands...heck, the thought of anyone being able to hold it in their hands... is nothing short of empowering. I eagerly await the first time I get to open a box filled with comics that I helped create. It's a huge milestone.
With having printed books, the next big milestone will be the ability to attend cons. Being on the other side of the table and sharing a story I helped bring to life feels like one of the biggest joys of making comics.
Stories are meant to be shared.
    "After reading an early preview of Sunmaker, my only question is, 'When can I see issue 2?'"
          -James W. Powell, TEN31 Publishing
 "Ryan Kroboth's art crackles with energy and style."  
           - Clay Adams, Fried Comics
 "Hayes and Kroboth pull off the difficult task of introducing a mysterious new world without spoon-feeding the audience. They build to a revelation that has me yearning to know more, and a climax that leaves me fearing what will come next."
          - Kevin Joseph, Kechal Comics
    Don't worry, I got you covered! Here is the first scene.
                                         The book is 100% complete! The only thing left to do is print, and that is why we are coming to Kickstarter.
We are looking to fund an offset print run of 2,000 books through KrakenPrint that Liam and I will split for product to sell at conventions and other channels.
     Most of the funds raised in the campaign will go towards printing costs. Kickstarter and Stripe take a small fee off the top of the campaign, with the rest of the money raised going to cover shipping.
      Boom?
         If this hasn't been enough and you still want to see more, then how does an 11 page full-color preview sound?
Show me more!
                                            I love comics. The larger majority of books I get are from creators themselves, so I appreciate when someone takes that little something extra to be sure that my package gets there in excellent shape.
Here is a look at the packaging mock-ups you can expect to receive your reward in.
    For tiers that include the physical book, sketch-in, and aluminum prints this is what your shipment will look like. All comics are bagged and boarded, then packed inside a rigid cardboard envelope.
Original art mock-up packaging looks like this:
  The comic is still protected inside of a bag with a board. Aluminum prints have their own bag to protect them from being scratched. The original art will be placed inside a rigid plastic protector, then inserted into a priority mail box to make the package even more rigid. Finally, that box will be placed into a large bubble mailer to protect your reward even further.
But the real secret?
Ninjas.
  That's right. Your own personal package protector. These guys will keep your shipment safe, as no one wants to mess with a ninja.
No one.
While I've done my best to attempt to select shipping materials that will best keep your product safe, I'm aware that things do happen.
If for any reason you receive a package at fulfillment with a book that doesn't meet your quality standards I will replace it at absolutely no cost to you.
I know there are collectors out there, and I want your book to make it to you in excellent condition.
   The campaign will run throughout September. Since KrakenPrint does all their offset printing overseas, there is approximately a two month wait for books to arrive. Books are expected about the middle of January, and will ship immediately upon arrival.
Backers should expect to receive their rewards by February.
             A big, blue caption box can't express nearly how grateful I am for allowing me to share my project with you. Thank you for your time and attention.
I'd like to ask for your support in bringing Sunmaker to life. Please back this campaign today and join us for the fun we have in store for our backers!
With gratitude,
Ryan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter campaign. I realize that asking for your support requires much trust on your part. 

However, I'm very familiar with Kickstarter platform having backed over 100 campaigns. In addition, I am a part of the ComixLaunch course which specializes in crowdfunding comics. With this community I know exactly what I'm in store for and if unexpected issues arise I have a group that I can turn to who is experienced in these matters.

With printing overseas there are always possibilities with delays. By working through a print broker like KrakenPrint I always have someone who I can contact and know the exact status of the order.

Wha--?! I wouldn't use a Game of Thrones reference to get you to read this update, now would I?
Okay, yea, I totally did.
I hope you're all ready for the Thanksgiving holiday. Time is just flying by, isn't it? I mean... winter is coming.

updates.update_userinfo: Cthulhu lives! Apocalypse at seven.
updates.update_content:
Can you believe it’s September already?!
I hope you have been enjoying your summer. I say this in present tense since the last few years it’s stayed warm until mid-October.
Yup, nothing quite like cutting the grass after a pumpkin frappuccino.
A few weeks ago I shared a link to grab a preview of the Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthology. Did you get your copy? If not, it’s all good! If you did, and you have been foaming at the tentacles for more, you’re in luck!

updates.update_userinfo: What's going on with this apocalypse?!
updates.update_content:
The snow has melted.
The Earth has been reborn.
Life has returned to nature.
This can mean only one thing...

updates.update_userinfo: It's not just mine anymore
updates.update_content:
Basically the day after I found out that books would be showing up at the Kraken warehouse I was checking my porch every time I got up. Even if logistically it was impossible for them to get halfway across a country in 12 hours.
You can't blame me right?
Last Tuesday, after the 14th time I checked my porch, I figured the books weren't coming. It was late and the weather had turned to snow.

updates.update_userinfo: Time to confirm your shipping address ( ! )
updates.update_content:
Earlier today I received the best email ever.
Yup, that email.
Kraken said that the books were scheduled to arrive at their Chicago warehouse today!
There is a good chance that I'll be so excited I won't be sleeping tonight. I suppose that's to be expected.

updates.update_userinfo: Holidays, coffee, and colors
updates.update_content:
How's it going?! Seems like I may be on an unintentional trend of sending out an update during a holiday.
It's Thanksgiving here in the States, a holiday where you are meant to give thanks for the  things you're thankful for. Sometimes life comes at you so fast that we need that external reminder to slow down for just a moment and reflect. It sounds counter-intuitive, but I know that I'm always thinking of the next thing, and I'm sure I'm not alone.

NOTE: All proceeds from the $5 digital graphic novel reward tier of THE CHAIR will go directly towards families that have been affected by Hurricane Harvey.  
We will be coordinating the donation with Jen King, who is currently running a charity auction out of her comic shop Space Cadets Collection Collection -- thank you.
First and foremost... this film is dedicated to Roddy.
On a personal note, like so many others, Roddy was one of my childhood heroes. It was an honor to have him be a part of this film and it was a surreal experience to get a call from him, wanting to make sure that he did right by a character that I created.  His portrayal of "Murphy" in this film is absolutely disturbing and yet relatable at the same time; it's easily Roddy's best acting to date.
During the course of filming and even afterwards, I had a few great conversations with Roddy that I'll always remember but the one thing I regret, is that I never got the chance to meet him, shake his hand, and say thank you. 
So thank you Roddy, for being a part of this film.
You became more than a hero to me, you became a friend.
- Peter
ADD-ONs!
If you're interested in adding on rewards to your pledge, please reference the list below and add the amount to your pledge tier -- then send a message or comment via Kickstarter to let us know what you're adding on. 
Here's a list of some of the most asked about items and how much it would cost to add them on to your reward (if you live in Canada, please add $4 additional for shipping, if you live anywhere else outside the US please add $7 for shipping):

On Death Row, The Only Monster Is Man...
THE CHAIR began life on Kickstarter and it's only fitting that we've come full circle like this.  The film is done and everything is ready to go to press.
If fully funded, will enable us to start prepping and formatting the film for a digital release as well (iTunes, Google Play, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, etc.).  As the campaign goes on, we'll introduce stretch goals and stretch rewards as we try to unlock new digital avenues of distribution for the film.
Here's some history on THE CHAIR...
THE CHAIR started out as a print on demand comic in 2006, that was quickly turned into a graphic novel and released in 2008.  This year, it's been released in stores for the first time as a single issue mini-series - on newsprint - and for a dollar an issue.  Yes, it's been a long road!
The comic was created and written by me, Peter Simeti, and the pencil work was by Kevin Christensen. Erin Kohut, who wrote the screenplay, also edited the comic.  
...and a quick synopsis:
A man struggles to escape a grisly fate on death row in this intense story of betrayal, revenge, and humanity's horrifying capacity for evil.
Richard Sullivan (Tim Muskatell) is an innocent man struggling to escape his fate on death row... Witnessing the brutal killings of his fellow inmates (Ezra Buzzington, Jacob Banser, and John Siciliano) at the hands of the prison's sadistic and psychotic Warden (Bill Oberst Jr.) and his crew of guards (Roddy Piper, Noah Hathaway, Zach Galligan, Derrick Damions, and Kyle Hester), Sullivan decides that the only way to survive is to fight back. But as he's forced to match the brutality occurring in the prison, Sullivan is pushed to the brink of madness and begins to suffer from the trauma that his mother (Naomi Grossman) subjected him to as a child.
You can learn more about The CHAIR on our IMDb page.
The CHAIR is now available for pre-order on blu-ray & DVD!
  This is the "Creator Cut" of the film and is different from previous versions offered through Kickstarter.  While this version will soon be available in select stores and online, this Kickstarter campaign is the only place where you can get exclusive rewards like a "piece of THE CHAIR" with every blu-ray/DVD purchase (this is a square inch of wardrobe used in the movie and worn by one of the film's actors).
These wardrobe swatches will be chosen at random, included with each copy of the film, and will come with a signed Certificate of Authenticity and a tamper proof seal.
  THE CHAIR had a limited theatrical release in 2016. It made its debut in Burbank, CA.
   UPCOMING FESTIVALS AND CONVENTIONS
THE CHAIR is currently touring conventions and film festivals as well. See it on the big screen at these locations.

updates.update_userinfo: THE CHAIR is available on Amazon!
updates.update_content:
99% of all rewards have gone out and I'm working on getting the last 7 out in the next 2 weeks. Just waiting on a few issues (Amazing Age #5) and I'll send everything out at that point.

2017 has been a very busy year and 2018 will be even busier. I hope this year has been well for you too!

updates.update_userinfo: Update on rewards!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
80% of the rewards have shipped out except for rewards that are waiting on THE CHAIR issue #4 or any issue #4 (so any reward bundles that have The Chair 5 issue bundle, or the Awesome Bundle which features comics that won't be out until December). 
So if your reward is in this group, it'll be about 2 weeks more of a wait (the issues are printing now) -- thank you for understanding and I promise to throw in something extra that makes the wait worth it.  :)
Thank you as always for your support and if you're celebrating Thanksgiving tomorrow -- then Happy Thanksgiving to you and yours!  (For everyone else, have a happy and healthy November 23rd!)

updates.update_userinfo: Update!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Some exciting news!
THE CHAIR won the Silver medal for Best Feature at Stan Lee's Los Angeles Comic Con over the weekend!

updates.update_userinfo: they're heeeeere...!
updates.update_content: the movie is in and rewards will be going out soon!

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you!
updates.update_content:
It was a short campaign at about 2 weeks, but we managed to raise 250% of the goal, which is just great! To fans old and new, thank you for supporting and I hope you guys love the rewards that are coming your way soon.
In the last few minutes, we managed to top the $7K mark and unlock that third stretch goal -- so if you pledged over $35, you'll be receiving all 3 stretch goals.  Here they are below:

updates.update_userinfo: One day left (!!!) and a new reward tier added!
updates.update_content:
That's right... just one day to go!
I'm really grateful that so many of you guys are supporting this quick 2 week campaign.  I hope you dig your rewards when you get them and I hope the film rocks you a bit with its intensity... BUT... before we get to that point, let's finish strong on this campaign and *maybe* even unlock a 3rd stretch goal at the $7K level!
I completely forgot that I had 2 cast-signed 8x10s left and so I've just added them up at the $249 level. The film comes with that reward, along with all the stretch goals we've unlocked so far.

updates.update_userinfo: Stretch goal unlocked!
updates.update_content:
The $5500 stretch goal has been unlocked, which means that every backer that pledges $25 or more will also receive a digital download of the film in addition to their rewards. The extra funds will also allow us to process the film for digital distribution on Amazon Prime -- so thank you!!
We've got time left still and potentially could unlock the $7K stretch goal.
Here's a rundown of what's what:

updates.update_userinfo: The last 2 days!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
The last 2 days are here and hopefully that means we'll see a surge in pledges that will drive the campaign past $5500 and maybe even past $6000!  The extra funds will go a long way towards getting the film processed and formatted for digital distribution too, so thank you!
I also want to let everyone know that I've decided to donate all proceeds from the $5 digital graphic novel tier towards families being affected by Hurricane Harvey. I am going to coordinate the donations with Jen King of Space Cadets Collection Collection, who is currently running charity auctions from her store to help raise money for people in the area.

updates.update_userinfo: Almost there...!
updates.update_content: Thanks to a surge of backers yesterday and this morning, we've passed the $5000 mark and we're almost at the $5500 stretch goal!

campaign.story:
When 'Little Miss Popular' Ruby Kaye lands a pair of super-tech glasses (invented by brainiac college geek Trevor Goldstein) in a game of Strip Poker, she's granted flight, super-strength, and – due to a flaw in the glasses' programming – super-klutziness! And this is just the beginning of the changes the glasses will wreak on Ruby...
Trying to be a super-hero, Ruby Kaye stumbles across a mysterious and extremely dangerous new villain taking down her town's Numero Uno heroine - and is forced to step up and use her powers for more than just accidentally knocking drinks over her friends... Geek-Girl is entering the Super-Hero Big Leagues - whether she's ready or not! 
Created & written by Sam Johnson and illustrated by Carlos Granda, Geek-Girl vol.1: Lightning Strikes! is out August 25.
    Geek-Girl vol.1: Lightning Strikes! collects Geek-Girl #1-#4, written by Sam Johnson (The Almighties, Cabra Cini: Voodoo Junkie Hitwoman), and illustrated by Carlos Granda (Grimm Fairy Tales, Charmed); published by Markosia.
You can Join the Geek-Girl Mailing List for News on the series and to get the FREE Digital Preview Comic - with more preview pages - here!
NEW! 08/10/17: It's the FINAL DAY of the Geek-Girl Kickstarter - But Wait...
...we haven't had a Stretch Goal yet. ;)

I'm really enjoying running my first Kickstarter, its exceeded my expectations and I'm so happy at the love you've shown Ruby Kaye - and for the Final Day I want to give everyone who's backed the book something back while hopefully smashing our Final Target!
Once Geek-Girl artist Carlos Granda has completed the project he's currently illustrating he will be starting work on the second GG Mini-Series... but we already have cover art completed... So, if you order anything on the GG Kickstarter today, or have already ordered anything during the course of the campaign, if we hit $4000 (£3085) by the end of the show at 17:59PM EST (23:59 GMT) today, you'll all get a Limited Print of Cover Art for Geek-Girl vol.2 #1 - illustrated by Carlos, colored by regular GG colorist Chunlin Zhao, and signed by myself - featuring a BIG REVEAL following on from the events of the first Mini-Series (the Print would come sealed in its own packaging as you're gonna need to not see it before you've read the first collection)!
So if you'd like to order anything else, for yourself or as a gift, or maybe have a friend that you know would dig Geek-Girl, here's the link -
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/geekgirlcomics/geek-girl-vol1-lightning-strikes-pre-orders
- please Share on Facebook, Twitter and anywhere else you like, and let's smash our target and get everyone the Limited Edition Signed Print! :)
Excelsior!
:) Sam
