campaign.story:
"I loved the comics, I wish something like Lacey and Lily had been around when I was younger." - Katherine of The Nerdy Girl Express
Lacey & Lily is a comic book series about a middleschooler and her dog who, after finding a pair of super suits, keep their city safe from super-villainy, disaster, and bullies. This is an all-ages comic that blends the fun of silver-age silliness and pure heroics with modern storytelling in a format that is suitable for kids of all ages.
Lacey, through her actions both in and out of costume, shows that it doesn't matter your size, age, gender - that anyone has the makings of a hero. 
The money we raise will be used to produce and print the first two-issues of Lacey & Lily as full-color, 24 page comic books.  
The covers to Issues #1 and #2
Up to now, Lacey & Lily has been available only digitally and through VERY small print runs (under 100) that we have self-financed for convention appearances. However, small print runs cost more and that always means charging more. The money raised from this Kickstarter will allow us to produce a much larger print run, which means getting the books in the hands of more readers around the world, which is exactly what we want. 
These two issues provide the first half of what will ultimately be a four-chapter introduction story to Lacey & Lily. In issue 1, readers are thrown into the middle of a large-scale alien invasion and battle that Lacey herself tells us we've jumped into too late and will have to get to later.  
In the thick of it
From there, we back up to the day Lacey and her mom were returning from cleaning out her grandmother's house after her passing. Her grandmother's dog, Lily, has come to live with them, and when the two discover some costumes in Gramma's old trunk, the adventure begins and the mystery unfolds. 
      Finding the suits give them both super powers, Lacey & Lily begin helping around their city with everything from bullies, cats in trees, to helping little old ladies cross the street - you know, the things heroes do. 
What heroes do.
But when a super-villain strikes at the middle school spelling bee, Lacey & Lily go up against their first (but certainly not last) arch-criminal, The Wordsmith! 
The Wordsmith crashes the wrong party.
   There's a learning curve to this.
Adults and kids alike clamor to see the new hero, who reminds the adults of the city's hero of yesteryear, The Emerald Comet - even though it's a moniker Lacey isn't too keen to inherit.  
"Uh...yeah. That's not me. I haven't quite figured out what to call myself yet."
But can she juggle homework, school life, mean girls, her best friend's prattling, and saving the world daily? She's about to find out. 
Lacey's best friend, Weston.
Lacey & Lily was created by the team of illustrator Andrew Cieslinski and writer Dave Dellecese. Story editor for the series is Megan McCoy-Dellecese.
Andrew's art has brought to life not only the world of Lacey & Lily, but was recently seen in The Tellos revival honoring the late, great Mike Wieringo and the more adult-oriented comedy comic book series, Holidaze. Energized at the prospect of doing work for children, families, and all-ages, Andrew has fully embraced the super heroics in every panel he draws of Lacey and Lily.
Dave is a former television and newspaper journalist, working with Andrew previously on the aforementioned comedy series Holidaze, and last year published his first novel, One Missed Train.
Megan is a freelance writer and editor, a full-time certified school librarian, as well as a full-time mom. She puts up with quite a lot. And that's just living with Dave, not even touching upon her role as Story Editor for Lacey & Lily.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The nice thing is, the art, coloring, lettering, all of it, is complete for the first two issues of Lacey & Lily. So, with the exception of special additions/pages to be added following this Kickstarter campaign (Thank you pages, ad spaces), it's set to go off to the printers.

Once we approve of the printer's proof, it's just a matter of waiting on finished copies to be produced and sent to us and then it's off and into your hands!

updates.update_content:

It’s been a few days since I sent an update, so wanted to take a moment to say thank you to everyone who has so far lent a hand in our campaign to bring this incredibly fun comic to readers everywhere.
If this was a campaign to print a single issue, we’d be closing in on our goal, but we decided we really wanted to give folks the first TWO issues out of the gate, and because of that, what we needed to make it happen doubled.

We’re 31% of the way funded, so we’ve still a ways to go, but I know we can make it happen. I know it's a bit of a longshot, but getting to the 50% mark by this weekend would be tremendous. So if you know anyone who loves comics, great art, fun stories, or has kids that may like the same, please tell them about what we're doing.
I’d like to ask that if you were kind enough to pledge to our campaign to perhaps take a moment and write us a little something about your thoughts in the comments section.

updates.update_userinfo: 25 days to go and a new limited reward
updates.update_content:
Good morning, everyone.
As I write this, we’ve been hovering around $780 for a few days, I believe.
That in itself, I’m incredibly grateful and impressed by, that so many of you have come forward to help us spread the wings of Lacey & Lily and spread their message that anyone, no matter their size, gender, or age, can be a hero.

updates.update_userinfo: What a first day!
updates.update_content:
Hi, Everyone.
First, I can’t thank you all enough for your incredible kindness and generosity in our first day of launching this Kickstarter campaign to bring Lacey & Lily to a large audience.
And wow! What a first day it was! Thanks to your help, we’re now starting day two at 23% of our goal, which I find to just be incredible. Really, I do. We’re not the big publishers, we’re not even the smaller of the publishers. We truly are the little guys, just doing something that we love and telling stories that we think are just as fun to read as they are to craft.

campaign.story:
It's time for the second issue of DUNCE! My autobiographic story where the pointy hat character JensK struggles with his everyday life, in the far north of Norway. 
I had so much fun making and self-publishing the first issue of Dunce. With the help from you Kickstarters, hopefully Dunce 2 will come to life just as well, and maybe as soon as July 2017!  
Update: first stretch goal is reached! Scroll down to see next stretch goals and goodies :)
Dunce 2 is planned to be 36 pages (A5) in full color
Reviews
Here's what the reviews said about the first issue:
"Affectionate, heart-warming and most importantly funny (...) Made me laugh out loud, something comics rarely do"
Splank (Comics blog, UK)
"This book is an enrichment! Funny, hilarious."
Comicreview (German podcast)
"One of the smartest and most original Norwegian cartoons that has debuted in recent times."
Serienett.no (Norwegian comics blog)
"Like Watterson or Thompson, Styve’s simplified drawings are enhanced by his skillful use of traditional media."
Pome-mag.com
So, what is Dunce exactly?
DUNCE is the name of my autobiographic comic strip that has been running daily in Norwegian newspaper Dagbladet since January this year. It's sort of a modern day slice-of-life-strip, but it's also a personal tribute to the old, classic comic strips that I grew up with and adored. 
Doing a daily strip can be nerve wracking, but it's also a huge learning experience. The Dunce universe seems to develop in every strip, every panel. The main character is the pointy hat guy (that is somewhat similar to myself?), but I quickly learned that these other characters also want to take the lead. For instance the coworker (a fish!), the eight year old son and the red haired girl living next door. 
I'm translating the strips to English as I go along, and as long as there are Kickstarters willing to support it, I release these self-pubished zines!
Bundle
If you missed out on Dunce Number One, there are still some copies left. Choose the Dunce Bundle pledge and get them both! 
Get the whole story with a Dunce Bundle.
Original drawings
I love drawing the old fashioned way with ink, nibs and brushes. For those of you who appreciate a piece of original art, to hang on your wall (or to keep in your collection), I've added the possibility to pledge for Dunce with an original drawing. The motif will be based on a panel from the book, choose one of the originals pledges.
Signed originals for the real conniseur.
  Art prints for you early birds
If you're quick you'll become one of the first 100 backers! Early Birds will receive a free (signed) art print in the package. 
Early Birds (first 100 backers) get a free signed JensK art-print.
    First stretch-goal unlocked! Art prints for all :)
  Next stretch goal: DUNCE vinyl stickers!
 Timeframe
Dunce 2 shall be printed and shipped to you right after the campaign is over (that is: in the end of June).

campaign.story:
THE STORY  
The Thunderchickens is the story of Ray, Scratch, and Grampa Thunderchicken. Together they form a superhero legacy that spans generations. Grampa reminisces about it, Ray tries his best to shun it, and Scratch desperately wants to live it to its fullest. Their daily life is shaken up after a burglary at Lumiere Industries, a powerful corporation that was also once a client of Ray's. Without warning, villains Ray thought he had taken care of over the years begin to reappear, displaying startling changes both physically and mentally that threaten both Ray's livelihood and family. Forced to put aside his mounting distaste for the life of a superhero, it's up to Ray and the Thunderchickens to figure out what's going on before it's too late.
Father/Son relationships are challenging, combative, caring, and complicated. I explore this and other topics like mental illness and the media in this all ages book by myself and Mike Exner III... The Thunderchickens!
 Father/Son relationships are challenging, combative, caring, and complicated. I explore this and other topics like mental illness and the media in this all ages book by myself and Mike Exner III... The Thunderchickens!
   THE PLAN
The Thunderchickens is planned as a 5-issue miniseries, with the possibility of continuing stories. It's chock full of superhero action, comedy and family drama wrapped in every issue. We desperately want to tell this story, and believe the themes contained within the pages of action and adventure are important to our society. We also feel as if this is a story that isn't being told anywhere else, with characters both children and adults can relate to. The Thunderchickens is a story a long time in the making, but given it's the Year of the Chicken we figured it was about time to share it with the rest of the world. But we need your help to make it happen! Up above you'll find the first 5 colored pages of Issue #1. Throughout this campaign, we'll be releasing the first 15 pages of story to give you an idea of what's in store.
THE TEAM
Bill Blankenship - artist/creator (Double Jumpers, Vamplets, NFL Rush Zone)
Mike Exner III - writer/editor (Adamant, Out of the Blue, Once Upon a Time Machine, Kayfabe)
THE KICKSTARTER
We're raising this money to pay for the production and printing/shipping costs for the first issue of Thunderchickens. Stretch goals are targeted at producing the full 5-issue miniseries and any additional issues we can produce after that. 15 pages are currently in production, and we will be releasing them over the course of the kickstarter to showcase the project for our backers. If we are able to fund the first issue, we will launch stretch goals to fund the other 5 issues to provide to our backers digitally at no additional cost.
SO MANY REWARDS
Here's where it gets good...
Digital Copies - You'll receive a PDF/CBR file of each issue as we complete it.
Print Copies - Print copies of each issue as we knock them out.
Other Comics - We'll toss in digital copies of Double Jumpers (Action Lab), Adamant (Loophole Comics) and as many others as we can get our hands on.
   Prints - An 11x17 print of the cover to Issue #1 of Thunderchickens!
Sketches - Bill Blankenship will draw a sketch of anything you want in your issue of Thunderchickens!
Sketchbooks - Our most personal reward yet! You'll get the Madcap Sketchbook: The Psych Ward Sketches, which were drawn by Bill Blankenship exactly where it sounds like.
Art Commissions - Bill Blankenship will draw pretty much whatever you want.
Fursona Commissions - Bill Blankenship will create an original piece of art based on your fursona!
Comic Cover Commissions - Bill Blankenship will produce finished cover art for your comic! Like this cover for the indie comic Stray!
Portfolio Consultations - Thunderchickens artist/creator Bill Blankenship will work with you to hone your comics portfolio with copious suggestions, and a trio of phone and/or skype discussions.
Script/Pitch Consultations - Thunderchickens editor extraordinaire Mike Exner III will work with you to hone your comics script or pitch into a winner. No script on hand? No worries, this reward doesn't expire.
Pet Portraits - Bill Blankenship will draw your pet however you want your pet to be drawn. This reward is the best.
Comic Pages - Inked pages from Issue #1 of Thunderchickens on Bristol board. First come, first serve.
With rewards like those, how can you say no? We hope you dig what we're trying to do, and thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge to completing this project is simply allotting the time to do it and proper project management. I've recruited the assistance of a longtime collaborator and writer Mike Exner III (Writer/ Story Editor) and will be recruiting a project manager if we're funded. If we fund the first issue fully, we'll be doing extended rewards to fund more issues (up to 5 max) at a lower cost and add those issues to our backers rewards digitally so that no extra reward production costs are incurred. 

We have an art team that includes myself, Ludwig Olimba doing color separations, and Marco Della Verde on letter art. In order to produce the art in an effective timeframe, I've designed the art style around being able to be produced quickly with less work involved in the process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
NEW REWARD LEVEL ADDED!!  NEW ADD ONS!!!  see below!
When a school teacher and father of five from Humboldt, Saskatchewan discovers a staff that has fallen from the stars and is loaded with cosmic power he does what anyone would do…he puts it in the cosmic lost and found box…WAIT! No he doesn’t! He learns how to use that staffs power to become the Super Power of the Prairies…Auroraman!
In 2016 Auroraman made his first appearance on the Canadian comic book scene to and overwhelming show of support! In the time since Issue #0 debuted it has been a fantastic wave of appearances. The initial print run of 650 issues completely sold out and a second print run had to happen. The second printing has a variation on the first cover as well as some new content and is seeing high demand as well! 2016 also saw Auroraman appear in 5 mini-comics (4-12 pages in length), as well as a handful of single page comic strips. Media interest has been strong right from the start with coverage from outlets like; 107.5 Bolt Fm, Hey! Kids Comics radio show, CBC radio, CBC.ca, CTV Saskatoon, Global Saskatoon as well as numerous other online blogs and new sites. All this coverage has helped this prairies centric comic book across the whole country and beyond!
 “A fun and engaging addition to the pantheon of Canadian superheroes” – Mark Shainblum, writer and co-creator of the original Northguard, Angloman and Canadiana and in 2016 was inducted into the Canadian Comic Book Hall of Fame.
This Kickstarter holds 2 amazing additions to the Auroraman lore. First up is 'The Adventures of Auroraman' Issue #1! This is a giant 64 page comic bursting with fun action and adventure!
Cover for issue #1 Art by Gibson Quarter and Donovan Yaciuk
 This comic features 8 tales from within the Auroraman universe including the first full 'Adventures of Lil Auroraman and Friends' by Dan Collins and Sharon Gauthier! This issue will come with a pair of old school blue and red 3D glasses to be used with the 3D Auroraman adventure with art by Jason Sylesvestre!
Sample 3D Pin Up Auroraman by Jason Sylvestre
 This issue is jam packed with terrifical comic action featuring the artistic talents of artists from across the country such as key Auroraman artist Justin Shauf, A. Shay Hahn, Chris Yao, Sharon Gauthier, Jason Sylvestre and the first collaboration between Humboldt creators Elaine Will and Jeff Burton!
"As Mayor of our fine city, I am proud Auroraman calls Humboldt, Saskatchewan home. I would encourage everyone to get on board with this fantastic project. I hope Auroraman has room on his keychain for the key to the city!" - Rob Muench, Mayor of the City of Humboldt.
Quick looks at the inprocess art for various stories in the comic featuring art by Elaine Will (top left), A. Shay Hahn (top right), Justin Shauf (bottom left) and Chris Yao (bottom right)
"I love the Canadian superhero renaissance we're seeing right now, and indy-created, regional heroes like Auroraman deserve more attention." - J. Torres, editor/writer for True Patriot
 One of the stories in this issue is a lead in to the second phenomenal piece of this Kickstarter, the 'Axiom-man/Auroraman: Frozen Storm' novel co-plotted by Jeff Burton and written by Axiom-man creator A.P. Fuchs!
Axiom-man
A.P. Fuchs
A.P. Fuchs is a working writer and illustrator, and the author of more than forty books. He is most widely known for his superhero epic, The Axiom-man Saga, and his shoot 'em up zombie trilogy, Undead World.
He's been an independent publisher since 2004 and has played every role in the publishing business, including--but not limited to--editor, book interior and cover designer, publisher, and marketer.
His spectrum of work includes fiction, non-fiction, poetry, comics, essays, and articles. He also writes a weekly newsletter called The Canister X Transmission, which you can subscribe to here: www.tinyletter.com/apfuchs
His main website is www.canisterx.com and he can be found on most social networks sharing information.
A.P. Fuchs makes his home in Winnipeg, Manitoba, smack dab in the middle of North America.
Covers to the Axiom-man novels!
Axiom-man
One night, Gabriel Garrison was visited by a nameless messenger who bestowed upon him great power, a power intended for good. Once discovering what this power was and what it enabled him to do, Gabriel became Axiom-man, a symbol of hope in a city that had none.
Presently, Axiom-man's world is on the verge of descending into total darkness at the hands of Redsaw. His personal life is also a mess and he's barely managing to keep life as he knows it from collapsing, both for himself and for the planet. The last thing he needs is to suddenly be sucked into a parallel universe to tackle a new foe. But, perhaps, with Auroraman's help, the two can work together to find the Cobalt Crusader a way home before chaos reigns supreme in both their universes.
“Excited to see two of my favourite indie superheroes by two of my favourite indie creators teaming up! Can’t wait to find out what dangers these prairie protectors face off against!” – Andrew Lorenz; creator/writer of Canadian Corps, LEGACY, and New Guard (September 17 Productions).
So there you go, 2 great Auroraman adventures in one awesome Kickstarter! There are a lot of spectacular rewards for you to choose from in appreciation of your support of this project, with the ability to add on other rewards in case you want rewards not included in your chosen level or want extras!

updates.update_userinfo: Some words from AP Fuchs
updates.update_content:
Dear readers,

All pre-ordered paperback and lettered edition copies of Axiom-man/Auroraman: Frozen Storm were mailed out to Auroraman HQ aka the Watertower last week.

Both editions look fantastic, are high quality, and are receiving compliments on their presentation. You are in for a real treat.

Jeff and I are very thankful for your support and patience throughout this campaign. I know it's tough when delays happen and for that we apologize. You already know the story about what happened and it means a lot to us that our readers are willing to overlook that and give us some time to deliver on what was promised.

The next steps in this whole process are down to a mere two: Jeff's signature and mailout. That's it. Final steps, which have nothing to do with book and comic production. The work-work is done.

Thank you for your patience.

Please watch the following video with a message from me and a showcase of both editions of Axiom-man/Auroraman: Frozen Storm. Please also be sure to subscribe to the channel because superhero goodness and other intriguing things are being uploaded at roughly one video a week and you don't want to miss out.

Lastly, if you missed the campaign and wish to get your own copy of Frozen Storm in print and/or in eBook, please visit my Book and Comic Shop here:

Take care.

Thanks again.

- A.P. Fuchs

campaign.story:
On to Stretch Goal Rewards!  Scroll down to see what we've got to unlock!
  Peter Simeti here, founder and publisher of Alterna Comics and in case you haven't heard, we're bringing back newsprint comics in a big way this May (as covered by Newsarama) as we've also just brokered a distribution deal with PDG to distribute our comics to newsstands across the world. 
So why single issues and why newsprint?  It's true that Alterna's only published a handful of single issue titles in our eleven years and that we've mostly published graphic novels and digital comics -- but the answer is a simple one.  I've been looking for a newsprint printer since I started Alterna and until we found one, I really didn't want to move forward with printing single issues on premium paper. Some exceptions were made over the years but by and large, it wasn't a direction I wanted to fully pursue. But finally, the search is over.
So why was the search so difficult? Newsprint is a really thin paper and because of that, it's only printed on a web press.  Web press printing is generally only affordable once you hit a range in the tens of thousands, while traditional offset printing can take thicker, premium paper stocks at minimum runs of 500 to 1000.  The small runs are more appealing to comic publishers sadly due to the fact that the current distribution system can make it hard at times to sell more than that.  Comic books just aren't everywhere like they used to be and the fact that merchandise is sold on a non-returnable basis to retailers means that your local comic shop has to be very choosy with the books they stock on their shelves.  It leaves a lot of purchasing up to speculation and the harsh reality is that the average Marvel or DC title is just less of a risk than the average independent comic.  So for whatever reason, when it came to newsprint, I decided to reach out to grocery store circular printers, catalog printers, magazine printers, and local town paper printers - we ended up finding a few printers that could do exactly what we needed.  It's ironic that we had to look outside traditional comic book printing companies to find a printer that could print a traditional comic book.
Why the low cover price of $1.50 an issue? Can that last? It absolutely will as we found that printing costs on newsprint are about 3 times less for these runs, so we're passing on those savings to retailers and readers.  We're also selling very affordable advertising to support the runs of these books and we're allowing other comic creators and publishers to advertise as well -- another break from the traditional in-house only ads of most modern comics. 
You can see our first four offerings right here, available for pre-order at your local comic shop now. Read more about them below:
ADAM WRECK - created by Michael S. Bracco; this space adventure comic is a 3 issue mini series that is great for all ages and combines the feel of "Lost in Space" and "Star Wars".
AMAZING AGE - created by Matthew D. Smith, Jeremy Massie, and Christine Brunson; combining "Stranger Things" and superheroes in this 5 issue mini series, three teenagers have to save the universe after getting sucked into the comic book world they created as kids.
LILITH DARK - created by Charles Dowd; in this 4 issue mini series, Lilith Dark discovers that the monsters and beasties of her imagination are actually real and she must brave impossible odds to rescue her family before it's too late!
CROAK - created by Cody Andrew Sousa, Francesco Iaquinta, Chris O'Halloran, and Dezi Sienty; in this 3 issue thrill ride, three friends get lost deep in the woods where their worst nightmares come to horrifying life.
  Our second wave of titles will release to comic shops in June:  
MOTHER RUSSIA - created by Jeff McComsey; a soviet sniper comes face to undead face with a zombie apocalypse during World War 2 in this alternate universe tale that takes place over 3 issues.  
THE CHAIR - created by Peter Simeti and Kevin Christensen; an innocent man on death row must find a way to save his life and his sanity before it's too late. Unfortunately, the prison's sadistic Warden and his murderous guards have other things in mind.  A film adaptation starring the late Roddy Piper, Zach Galligan, Naomi Grossman, Bill Oberst Jr. and Noah Hathaway is slated for a DVD & blu-ray release this Fall.  
TRESPASSER - created by Justin M. Ryan, Kristian Rossi, and DC Hopkins; one father will go to unspeakable lengths to protect his daughter after a strange visitor crash lands in the forest. This 4 issue mini series is perfect for fans of "The Walking Dead" and "The X-Files".  
SCRIMSHAW - created by Eric Borden, Dave Mims, and Spike O'Laochdha; the only ongoing series in Alterna's newsprint lineup! Cyborgs, pirates, cut-throats and mutants are the good guys in this action-packed series about a team of post-apocalyptic mercenaries.
  Aside from distributing through Diamond Comics Distributors so that your favorite local comic shops will have these books on shelves, we've also secured a deal for newsstand distribution.  In fact - comic shops will have these books two months earlier than newsstands will as it's our way of saying thanks to all the shops that have supported us for our eleven years and giving respect to the retailers that have been the lifeblood of the comic industry. 
Since the books will be on a bi-monthly schedule (a series will release every two months until completion) by the time issue #1 is on newsstands, issue #2 will be in comic shops.  This will allow newsstand readers to seek out more titles in the comic shop and immediately get the next issue there if they wish.
The addition of newsstand availability also brings me to the reason why I'm running this Kickstarter to begin with.
While we budgeted for the print runs that will go toward comic shops, we weren't able to foresee the budget costs of expanded print runs for newsstand distribution (this is relatively uncharted territory) or the cost of BIPAD numbers (unique - and costly - UPC numbers required by the magazine industry) and because of those two factors, we're hoping that the Kickstarter community will come out to support our endeavor as we'll be the first creator-owned publisher in decades to have comic books available on newsstands.  Newsstand publications also have to have different bar codes than their comic shop counterparts, which adds another bit of a road bump.  That's because the newsstand industry has a standard 2 digit supplement code and comic book distribution has a 5 digit supplement code.  The cost to print different covers is minimal (interiors will remain the same) but it's still something that we need to do.
The BIPAD numbers are about $150 each, which set us behind on our budget by $3K as we needed 20 of these to move forward with newsstand distribution (yes, that's right, we'll be releasing at least 20 newsprint comics over the next two years+!) - so the first $3K raised will go towards filling that unexpected expense.  The next $2K will go towards supporting increased print run numbers for our first 4 books.  
So as long as we reach our goal of $5K we'll be all set to move forward - but it'd be great if we could raise more, as every $1K raised will unlock a small BONUS stretch reward for every backer (stickers, trading card, pins, coasters, window clings, signed mini-poster) and every $2K raised will unlock the ability to purchase a larger stretch reward at a discounted price (tote bags, shirts, beanies). The extra funding will also enable us to securely move forward on future increased print runs, and support them fully with advertising and promotional materials for your favorite comic shops and stores.  From that point on, the line should be self-sustaining.
UNLOCKED -- $5500 unlocks a random FREE newsprint comic from one of the four pictured below for EVERY backer that pledges for a physical reward!
UNLOCKED -- $6000 unlocks an "I Love Comics" sticker for all backers that pledge for a physical reward!
$7000 unlocks a 3"x4" "I Love the Smell of Comics on a Wednesday" clear window cling for all backers that pledge for a physical reward!  For backers that pledge $30 or more, you'll also receive an "I Love the Smell of Comics on a Wednesday" tote bag, a perfect bag for visits to the comic shop or when you go to a convention!
$8000 unlocks a few Alterna Comics button pins for all backers that pledge for a physical reward!
$9000 unlocks an Alterna Comics trading card, exclusive just for Kickstarter backers that pledge for a physical reward!  For backers that pledge $35 or more, you'll also receive an Alterna Comics fitted beanie!
$10000 unlocks an Alterna Comics coaster for all backers that pledge for a physical reward!
$11000 unlocks a signed 11x17 mini-poster for all backers that pledge for a physical reward! For backers that pledge $40 or more, you'll also receive either an "I Love the Smell of Comics on a Wednesday" t-shirt or an Alterna Comics t-shirt -- sizes run from Men's S to 4XL!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There's really no risk here - I've helped dozens of Kickstarter projects succeed as well as a few of my own - and the books WILL be made, distribution IS in place. Anyone that'd contributed to one of my campaigns knows that I always add on extras and I sign and sketch in books all the time.

Ideally, it'd be great if we could raise at least $10K, but this is a one week campaign so my expectations are definitely reserved. If you can't support monetarily, please spread the word about this campaign on social media with the hash tag #BringingBackNewsprint - thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: 3 days to go on the 2017 IF Anthology Kickstarter!
updates.update_content: The 2017 IF Anthology has just 3 days to go and we need $1300 more to fund the 2018 Horror-themed anthology stretch goal.   We're also donating 10% of what we raise to the Hispanic Federation for disaster relief efforts in Mexico City and Puerto Rico.

updates.update_userinfo: A new campaign!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
I hope this message finds you well.  I've got a new Kickstarter campaign up and I wanted to let you know about it since your support made this one possible.
It's a pre-order/pre-release for the film based on my comic, THE CHAIR.  With every blu-ray/DVD combo, I'm including a Kickstarter-Exclusive fabric swatch of wardrobe that was worn by an actor in the film.  It's a fun way to own a piece of movie (and Alterna Comics) history!

updates.update_userinfo: New titles out on August 16th!
Now available on newsstands!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
If you haven't heard (or seen them in stores for yourself) our first wave of titles that were originally released in comic shops in May, are now available on newsstands.
Here's the article:
http://comicbook.com/comics/2017/07/21/alterna-comics-newsstand/

updates.update_userinfo: Coming to comic shops this July...
updates.update_content: Don't forget to pre-order issue 2 releases at your local comic shop!

updates.update_userinfo: Rewards update!
updates.update_content:
June's comics are getting here this week and the remaining rewards will be shipping out at the end of the week and into next week.  Thank YOU all for making this possible and I hope you love the books once they're in your hands!
I also would like to thank many of you for waiting on May's releases that are shipping with June's books, but at least you'll be getting June's releases early! Hopefully that makes up for it a bit.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Comic Book Day!
We're increasing print runs to meet demand!
updates.update_content:
Early comic shop order numbers are in and they're about 25% higher than expected!  We're increasing print runs to meet demand and it's great to see how many readers and retailers are behind this initiative!  For quality creator-owned, unlicensed indie comics without any big names on board -- it's absolutely enormous.  Thanks for helping us to bring this to life!
You can find more information about this here >>
https://thenerdygirlexpress.com/2017/04/03/alterna-increases-initial-print-runs-for-newsprint-comics-alternacomics-from-kleffnotes/

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print the 156 page full color trade paperback of the six issue mini-series which includes a BRAND NEW ten page sequential art short story called, Hunter-Killer.
THE STORY
The year is 1895...An evil from a parallel dimension escaped and now roams the city of Boston. Faced with a new century and new steam technology, the social and political status quo is turned on its head. People are uncomfortable with change and, in fact, many people fear it. That fear and the violence which follows causes a psychic rift to puncture the veil of space and time allowing the entity known as "The Shifter" to escape. Feeding on the resentment and fear between the rich and poor, “The Shifter” triggers a rash of murders.
Four of the greatest minds of the time have banded together to try and stop this malevolent entity. Known only as B.E.T.H., they are:
 THEY FAIL.
Against their better judgment, they look to a man driven by revenge – SAMUEL HUNTER.
 For the one mistake "The Shifter" made was killing Samuel’s wife.
An ex-Pinkerton detective, Samuel gathers his unlikely team of…
Caitlin O'Sullivan, Medium and Spirit Photographer:
 and Granville Woods, Scientist Extraordinaire:
 They are the Boston Metaphysical Society.
Their job: Stop "The Shifter" before Boston tears itself apart.
COVER OF THE TRADE.
COVER ART BY EMILY HU. COLOR AND INKING BY GLORIA CAELI.
 WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a BRAND NEW Boston Metaphysical Society ten page short story called, Hunter-Killer, and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship. I will be introducing three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain; Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
And for what the story is about, well I have two words for you - Airship Battle!
The complete story of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.

THE MONEY:
Where the money goes...Your backing would enable us to pay for a print run of the trade paperback which means printing enough copies to send off to backers with some leftover to sell at conventions, incentives, shipping (which includes mailing envelopes, postage and handling.) And, of course, the fees (5% off the top, plus credit card fees.)
THE TEAM:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A TV, feature film, and comic book writer, Madeleine holds an MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories and novellas based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Formerly a nationally ranked epee fencer, she has competed nationally and internationally. She is an avid reader of science fiction, steampunk, fantasy and historical military fiction.
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky Cloonan, and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for BOOM! BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist. He worked as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to his work on he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work includes Bob Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist Christopher Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT bestselling anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6): Troy is a Los Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series for Radical Comics.
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY ABOUT BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY:
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling, Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them." - Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
Nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 GEEKIE AWARDS.
The Story Behind The Story
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY. Not only does it bring my love of science fiction and history together, (which by the way, equals steampunk), the steampunk time period allows me to address the themes of classism, sexism, and racism in America in a thoughtful and entertaining way. For at it's very core, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American story. And you can't tell an American story without including women and people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different points of view, are able to work together for the common good.
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY began as a TV Pilot which I wrote while I was in the MFA Program in Screenwriting at UCLA. It was somewhat inspired by a script I had written called Stargazer, which was about a real life astronomer who lived in Boston in the late 1880's. (Stargazer went on to win the Sloan Fellowship.) It was suggested that I adapt Boston Metaphysical into a six issue graphic novel mini-series. I agreed and the hunt was on for an artist. Many months later, I met Emily Hu through a mutual friend and a partnership was born. Her passion for the project matched my own and I knew the story was in good hands. I launched BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY as a webcomic in May of 2012. The following year we printed a special edition of the first chapter.
Through a combination of self-funding and the generous support of Kickstarter backers like you, we were able to finish the six issue series and now we are back to print this expanded version of the trade.
However by wading into the deep end of the pool, I discovered a terrible truth – I love writing comics.
So I bring you Samuel, Caitlin, and Granville who represent the best, the worst, and every shade of gray of the society in which they live. They are products of their world yet strive for not only more, but better.
Much like you and I.
By backing this project, you would not only be supporting the printing of the trade paperback, but a vision of a future where the teamwork and sacrifice of a diverse group of individuals ultimately defeats evil.

Backers who have pledged $12 or more will receive this amazing PDF comic bundle from some of the most talented people I know.
The bundle includes:

The Legend of Everett Forge by Scott Wilke – Issue #1 (PDF)
Bayani and the Old Ghosts by Travis McIntire – Issues #1, #2 and #3 (PDF)
Sepulchre by Christie Shinn - Issue #1 (PDF)
That’s a total of six (6) comics!!
 Let me introduce you to:
1.  The Ballad of Sally Sprocket and Piston Pete. (An all ages comic.)The story of Piston Pete is about a last-of-his-kind robot getting by in life in the Wild West as a tinkerer. Things take a turn when he saves a mysterious little girl from death, and she is remade into a cyborg whom he adopts and names Sally Sprocket. Follow this unlikely duo's adventures as they battle electromagnetic mad scientists, steam-powered prospectors and more!
2. The Legend of Everett Forge. (Steampunk Western). The Legend of Everett Forge is a Steampunk/Weird West tale set in an alternate 1889 where Machines control the American West. The story follows infamous outlaw, Everett Forge, as he ventures deep into the Machine Territory in search of vengeance!
3. Bayani and the Old Ghosts. (An all ages comic)  Bayani (11) desperately tries to care for his sick father and keep food on the table for his small family. Unfortunately, the sun has been shining down on the islands for the last month and night refuses to fall. The land is growing parched from the constant heat and the fish are moving further and further away from shore. The rain god, Pati', recruits Bayani to undertake a quest to rescue the nine kidnapped daughters of Lady Moon. Bayani embarks on this great adventure with his friend, Tala, to rescue each of the Moon's daughters and ultimately save their village.
4. Sepulchre. (Fantasy) In a world of swords, bullets, and blood, Lady Jaye Hawke, betrayed by the one she loved the most, seeks revenge. She finds like company in Flint “Buzz” MacAllister. The two allies take on a crime family that took from each of them what was best and most beloved from them – Lady Jaye Hawke’s voice, and Buzz MacAllister’s wife and son in a brutal and bloody fashion. They believe they not only have the right to avenge the crimes committed against them, but a duty to do so.

The bundle includes:
Black Suit of Death: Ides of March (Prelude) and Issue #1 by Benjamin Kreger and Edward Ellsworth (PDF)
Salvagers by Bob Salley – Issues #1 and #2 (PDF)
Bloodworth by Daniel Corey – Issue #1 (PDF)
Misfortune High by Jules Rivera – Issue #1 (PDF)
That’s six more comics!!
 Let me introduce you to:
1. Black Suit of Death: Ides of March.  When Doctor Seitsan presents his Black Suit of Death (B.S.D.), a killing machine, as the final solution to control the rampaging overpopulation on the planet Utopia IX, he is declared a traitor and banished to the one planet in the galaxy sick enough for his deranged appetite of destruction: EARTH! 
Bonus Features:
Li'l BSD. Words, Art & Letters by Tony Morgan;Colors by Shua Kreger
EDEN. Written by Benjamin J. Kreger & Ed Ellsworth; Art by Dexter Wee
 2. Black Suit of Death – Issue #1. Edd Grimes survived a drunken do-nothing abusive father, an inattentive mother, school bullies, and social awkwardness by escaping into the worlds of fantasy provided by comic books, movies, and tabletop role-playing-games. Though he found some reprieve through creative endeavors like writing and drawing his own comics, Edd continued to struggle with mental illness and after the "worst day of his life," he gave up. Where he thought he'd find a release from pain, he found only... The Black Suit of Death!
Bonus Features:
 Li'l BSD. Written and Illustrated by Fred Hembeck
 ZERO. Written by Benjamin J. Kreger & Ed Ellsworth; With Art by Stefano Cardoselli
3.  Salvagers. Issues 1 and 2. After the Galactic War ended, peace blanketed the galaxy; however, planets wiht little shipping resouces turned to piracy or developed small guerilla military units geared to pillage trade ships. This spawned the necessity for trade companies to hire private security contractors for protection.
Even under the security of peacetime, there is no shortage of violence in outer space; from looting raiders, Navy destroyers neutralizing a rebel movement to the simplest space station falling victim to a rogue asteroid.
These destroyed or abandoned ships and stations are classified as “wrecks”. 
Licensed crews are commissioned by governments, empires and corporations to remove these wrecks. In a hostile galaxy, the risk and reward is high for these crews. 
They are known as… the SALVAGERS .
4. Bloodworth. Issue 1 (Scifi). In the near future, people can upload their memories as a form of social networking, called "Thoughtshare." Special Agent Brenda Bloodworth leads an FBI task force that can enter the memories that people don't want to share, in order to solve crimes.
When Bloodworth falsely turns up in a memory that frames her for muerder, she must leap the Chain of Thoughts that will lead her to a conspiracy that threatens to control minds on a worldwide scale.
5. Misfortune High. Issue 1. (All ages comic)  Misfortune High is the story of Biscuit, a spoiled rich kid, who goes to the most prestigious magic academy in the city.  Biscuit gets caught cheating and lying, but his father decides not to bail him out as he usually does. Instead, his father punishes Biscuit by sending him to a magic school in a bad neighborhood. 
Biscuit finds himself in a place where his privilege and social status count for absolutely nothing.  Biscuit makes friends, but he also makes enemies, and he makes it his mission to get out of Misfortune High.

$50 pledge Original Artwork
                                       Plastic surgery is free. London is gripped by madness, dominated by cosmetic surgeons, lifestyle coaches and pill-pushers. Within this insanity, a neurotic businessman reconsiders the course of his life when a freethinking outsider crashes into it. But she doesn't want him, or anyone. 
Justin must put his business aside and concentrate on what it means to live, love, and be loved in return. He created an unattainable standard for women that drove them to buy his miracle pills and pushed them into the arms of his surgeons. Due to this, he has enemies both legal and criminal, that want to end ventures permanently. Throughout this chaos, Luna hopes to help him achieve redemption, while he's still breathing that is.
Early concept art for Justin and Luna.
    Coronary: Episode One will be the first of what will become a fully fledged Graphic Novel. 
With the funds we can complete the first episode, to the best standard. It will be a full color, 28 page comic book that we hope will grow into a full twelve issue series. 
We need the funds to cover paying the artists, printing the copies and get them shipped out to you. Joel Saavedra and Damian Panalba are complete professionals in their field, and they will produce the beautiful artwork for the project.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal Achieved!
Click to learn more about this stretch goal.
  Welcome (back) to Morgan's Organs, a comedy comic book series like Pixar's Inside Out but for grown-ups. Are you ready to see what might really be going on inside our insides?
In February 2016, we introduced Kickstarter and the world to Book 1 of our quirky concept. Now, we've returned to continue the adventures of college student Morgan as his body parts struggle to keep him alive, find purpose in life, and work together as a community. The great thing about this series is each book is a stand-alone story. You don't have to read Book 1 to understand what's going on in Book 2!
In Book 1 (40 pages of story), we saw Morgan's brain operator, Bran, and penis operator, Pepe, go head-to-head for control of Morgan's decision-making, all while Morgan battled the pressure to end a dry spell. You can enjoy a 15-page preview of Book 1 here!
In Book 2 (also 40 pages of story), things remain equally embarrassing, hilarious and awkward for Morgan. Except this time, we're exploring different body elements. Check out the Book 2 preview below! And make sure to check out our rewards options.
            That's right, Morgan is in a sticky situation yet again. And if you've read Book 1, you know we'll deliver on that promise. Here's a couple more pages in progress.
    Morgan's Organs is the wild brain child of me - Daniel Brodie - AKA Canadian #1. I'm excited to continue to partner with the incredibly talented artist, Robert Jennex - AKA Canadian #2 - who's handling all art for the book. We're a small team, but we've done it before, and we're ready to do it again.
Left - Dan; Right - Rob
We have exciting guest artists who've drawn beautiful rewards for this campaign. See the REWARDS section to check out what they produced.
Benjamin Mackey, co-creator of the Image Comics series, SAINTS. His poster "Last Supper" is available at the "ORGANISM" tier.
Greg Merritt, Canadian artist. His poster "Incredible Meats" is available at the "ORGANISM" tier.
Stady One, German illustrator, who drew the Book 2 collector's sleeve available at the "ORGAN" tier.
This series focuses on Morgan as he navigates everyday college life, which is made difficult by the fact that he isn't completely "human". Inside his body lives a variety of organ-like characters (called organauts) who control his various body systems and ultimately, are keeping him alive. The problem is these organauts don't always operate with the best interests of their host in mind.
The stories take place on two levels. Outside, we follow Morgan and his group of friends as they navigate college life. Zoom into his insides and we see how Morgan's struggles are made worse by a group of organ operators who bicker, lie, cheat, argue, act selfish, and generally, don't work together as one community.
Say cheese!
  Make sure to read the below highlights about our rewards.
Onto the REWARDS!
Below is a snapshot of the various reward tiers and the added item available at each tier. You can also click the below image to read a PDF version. See the REWARDS tab for full details of what's available at each tier.
Click to view PDF version
  I believe in complete transparency because I don't see this as a business - not yet, at least. These campaigns are part of my long-term vision to have Morgan's Organs picked up by a publisher, and eventually made as a television series. All of my rewards are priced appropriately to cover exactly what I need to support this vision. That means covering artist salary, production (including printing), and packaging/shipping.
In the KS campaign for Book 1, we raised ~$5,500 from over 175 backers (140% of funding goal). As I committed to spending up to $1,000 CAD of my own money on this project (if needed), I invested in a larger print run of Book 1 which drove down the per-unit-cost and created the opportunity to grow readership. I also invested in an Artist Alley booth at Toronto's Fan Expo 2016, where I was able to bring in many more interested fans. Overall, my personal spending on Book 1 was about $700 CAD.
I pay my artist what I am able, but we both have a mutual understanding this is a partnership and we're investing in a long-term vision. For Book 1, Rob received about $3,700 for all project work. This included a bonus payment for all his hard work after the entire project was done, based on what I could afford.
For this book, Rob will be receiving about $4,000, and if we're able to exceed our campaign goal by enough, I hope to increase his page rate further. I will invest up to $1,250 CAD of my own money into this project above what is raised, whether it goes towards printing, artist costs, or having a booth at an upcoming event.
Our Kickstarter goal of $4,000 CAD supports the below:
60% = artist salary
30% = the 4P's - printing / production / packaging / parceling (shipping)
10% = Kickstarter fees
Everything raised above this goal will go to a combination of:
Additional printing (further driving down per-unit-cost and creating opportunity to invest in our stretch goal rewards)
Increasing artist salary
Convention booths at 2017 Toronto Fan Expo and perhaps more!
This isn't just another comic book; it's a long-term vision. I have over 15 future stories planned (and counting), plus spin-off versions of the concept. The end goal is to produce Morgan's Organs as a television show, but until then, we'll continue to make great books, grow our audience, and look at the human body in weird, wacky ways! Thank you for helping us achieve our dream!
Pepe gives you approval to back this campaign!
  Hey, what are you doing all the way down here? Still not convinced this book is right for you? Then read some of the past coverage we've received on Book 1 of the series!
Comic Crusaders - 5/5 star rating - "Daniel lays out a wonderful story that I, no WE, need to read more of! The art is great, Robert brings to life the world of Morgan’s organs with a clean, animated style."
ComixBrew - "Morgan’s Organs is the kind of comic that is good to show your buddies for the laughs but also contains a deceptive amount of depth."
Comic Plug - "Morgan’s Organs is like Inside Out if it were written by Seth McFarlane."
Comic Unknown - "If you ever wondered how Inside Out would have worked through the eyes of a male college student, look no more. Morgan's Organs is a gut-busting comedy that while the idea has been seen before, it is the fresh take we need and want."
Other Worlds Than These - "The main thing this book really has going for it is the fact it’s laugh out loud funny in places. It’s also intelligently written and brings out real nostalgia."
The Outhousers - "The delightfully cartoonish art and exploration of maturity help [Morgan's Organs] defy expectations. It's a satisfying read for those that love thoughtful comedy."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have the experience from running a Kickstarter campaign for Book 1 to know how to deliver on our promise. In our first campaign, we were less than one month delayed in fulfilling rewards to our backers, which I'm happy about given that most campaigns are delayed even longer.

For this campaign, we've completed even more art pages going into the launch than before, and we have production and fulfillment down to a T so the process going forward should be even smoother.

Given that the art is not fully complete yet for Book 2, there's always the risk that our artist, Rob, is:
- crushed by a meteorite while chasing a seagull,
- poisoned by a rare Amazonian tree frog species that somehow makes its way to the coast of Nova Scotia, or
- selected as one of the first humans to colonize Mars (though if they can set-up electricity and Wi-Fi quickly, he should still be able to deliver).

What I mean to say is we expect minimal challenges in delivering on our promise within a reasonable time frame.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Chonicles Pg 1 preview (Art by Nicholas Webb and Strider Syd)
 What is Reynard City?
Reynard City is an online comic about three superhero foxes that come to Earth to stop an evil robot fox and various surreal adventures ensue.
Why do you need the Kickstarter?
Our £6000 target has been set up to cover-
The chance to provide a pay rate to our artists (This covers a third of the budget)
More promotion including a greater presence at the UK convention circuit (This will cover marketing, printing costs, transport etc)
Support for local businesses and creative talent (this includes more commissions for independent artists, merchandise lines created by local businesses and promoting local services such as Norwich Kitty business networking)
Characters-
AK Girl (Vibes McAllister): A psychic vixen who uses focus to call on various power modes (Strength, Speed, Shield, Stealth, Steal and Psychic). Her weakness is she inflates on contact with caramel.
Vibes is quirky, fond of fighting and prone to showboating. However she is also good-hearted and works hard to protect the city.
 Wondervixen (Sally Vixen)- A former beauty queen and Vibes' best friend. She gained her superpowers through the warp, granting her flight, super strength and agility. However she suffers from body dysmorphia, a condition where she sees herself as fat (something that ties in to a secret we find out about her later on)
 Hyper Rob (Guillermo Roberto del Zorro Rodriguez)- Guillermo's father Dante created the evil robot Mega Fox in a bid to control the planet Animal Kingdom. Now he uses his warp gained powers (super flight, strength and enhanced senses) to fight injustice on Earth. He is also Sal's devoted boyfriend, but his passionate approach can often get him in trouble!
 Mega Fox
Mega Fox is a cold, calculating robot that leads the forces of the Consortium, a group of evil aliens who wish to conquer the known universes.
Aside from his strategic knowledge he also has a number of modes he can transform (including jet, mecha and tank modes). With no known weakness he and his team of villains are potentially very dangerous.
For more info on the characters go to www.reynardcity.com
Sample WIP artwork by Nicholas Webb and Strider Syd
Why did you reboot it?
We wanted to build on the great work of our art team but also on the feedback we have received- the idea of this first graphic novel is to reintroduce the world of Reynard City, both to bring in new people but also to make it a better experience for our awesome fans!

campaign.story:
The Lost Ship is an Adventure game hoping to become a worthy offspring of established games in the genre. The story unfurls around the 18th century while the Spanish Empire is in decline and wars between European Colonial powers allow piracy to develop. These parties are trying to locate a ship full of gold which was travelling from the New World to Europe and has mysteriously disappeared.
 
Our hero is visiting colonial and pirate ports, cities and taverns in order to acquire information from locals, often in the form of gossip and legends. But where is the line between reality and legend? 

Join us in our journey to solve the mystery of the Lost Ship.

campaign.story:
Cadavers 2: Poltergeist tells the story of the most fearsome and terrifying Cadaver of them all.
Scary huh?
Yeah - things don't always go Poltergeist's way. 
Our diminutive, mouthy, native Tatduenden doesn't have the best of luck. Poltergeist's frustration combined with his potential as the most powerful of the Cadavers can cause problems. Basically get him angry and......
Mad Robot Comics invites you to return to the world of the Cadavers - supernatural outcasts and misfits - refugees from a parallel dimension, discriminated against, forced into a life of crime, all the while, stranded on our earth. And still drinking our beer.
Cadavers issue 1 told the tale of the Cadaver's attack on North Mansion from the point of view of the thoughtful, sensitive Doppelgänger - issue 2 follows Poltergeist and his colleague's very different approach to the task of confronting the Cadaver's nemesis Marckus North.
Page 3 - Mission Impossible as told by Jim Henson.
Fresh from the success of the first issue, we have poured that enthusiasm into a stunning looking, action packed second issue.
Page 4 - the new warning label for Cigarette packets.
Poltergeist's tale expands the world of the Cadavers further, looks closer at what happened between the scenes of issue one and continues the story onwards from Doppelgänger's attempts on North’s life. 
We get a chance to see more of the Cadavers in action as well as properly introduce you to the most troublesome, under-appreciated and volatile member of the group.
Page 5 - so much for subtle.
We also answer the question posed by the first issue - "Are the Cadavers all Dead?" (Actually we’ll answer that now. No. They are not. Where is the fun in that?)
We provide more detail on the traitor - we've already had a bunch of guesses as to their identity. Nearly all wrong. 
We examine North’s true motives. Is he truly the monster the Cadavers fear - or something even worse!
We take a closer look at the society the Cadavers find themselves forced to adapt to - 
Page 6. Coochy coo. Coochy coo little Poltergeist.
And finally we smash a lot of furniture and kill a lot of people. A real lot. This book writes itself. 
Pages 7 and 8. Poltergeist knows how to make an entrance.
Issue 2 also features a stunning 4 page fight scene, the likes of which we are certain has never been attempted in comics before (but which artist Edward Bentley won't let us post yet. Spoil-sport).
With the positive response to the cliffhanger ending of the first issue - we wanted to pick up the story ASAP. So Cadaver's artist supreme Edward Bentley has already completed pencils on the first 18 pages of the book: -  
Pencilled art on the wall of the Mad Robot Comics Studio. We have a studio. It's where all the drinking.....er work gets done.
For those that missed the first issue - this is an ideal point to jump on board. We catch you up quickly - and then it’s straight into Poltergeist's story. 
For those new to the world of the Cadavers here are our main characters: - 
      But as well as an exciting comic - you want Kickstarter goodies don't you? 
We feel that we have outdone ourselves on the Kickstarter rewards this time. We are offering LOADS of extras with each pledge tier: - 
NB: if you pledge for the opportunity to be mentioned and/or featured in an upcoming issue of Cadavers - where possible we will provide you with the ORIGINAL art of THAT page. Cool - huh? 
Check out www.cubeecraft.com for more details on those cool paper figures. 
Cadavers: The Card Game is a joint venture between ourselves and Dogeared Games - the guys behind the popular Stak Bots game: - www.stakbots.com 
Not final image.
Cadavers: The Card Game is currently in development - but will be coming to Kickstarter soon.
So who the devil are Mad Robot Comics?
We are an independent producer of comics and graphics novels. This will be our third Kickstarter. Check out www.madrobotcomics.com for our other products. 
Matt Hardy - raised by ancient and revered comic-monks, able to kill a man at 20 paces with the edge of a graphic novel; Matt's credits include Last Exit to Brighton, Madhouse and the upcoming gothic horror graphic novel Murder Most Mundane. A graduate of Andy Schmidt's Comic Experience class and co-founder of MRC. Matt owns no giraffes. 
Clark Bint art from the upcoming Murder Most Mundane. NOT a picture of Matt - he always takes his hair rollers out before getting murdered in strawberry jam.
Edward Bentley - Vat-grown in the MRC clone labs, Ed requires no sleep and runs solely on intravenous Nicotine-Cola. Chewing his way to freedom, Ed is currently working freelance at www.edward-bentley.com. Credits include Last Exit to Brighton and Madhouse for MRC and Hexes for Blue Fox Comics. Ed's solo project Skate or Die is due to hit Kickstarter in February. Ed is getting a dog. 
That's not Ed in the picture either. Although he does look a bit like the monster if he doesn't get to drink his 14 cans of coke a day....
Warwick Johnson Cadwell is known for his work on Tank Girl and most recently on the TMU Workshop's The Marionette Unit. Nominated for a British Comic Award (or Eisner) - Warwick is currently working on the keenly anticipated Gungle for Blank Slate Books. 
Rob Jones is the letterer of Cadavers, and part ghoul himself. You'll find his lettering on a variety of comics, find him writing for Madius Comics and often find him shouting angrily at the seagulls. He has won several awards and is the proud owner of at least 78% of his own teeth. Find him on Twitter yelling idiocy into the void @RobJonesWrites or at his website. 
This actually is Rob. He exists only as a two dimensional piece of art.
OK - The response to Cadavers 1: Doppelgänger has been overwhelmingly positive - people liking the crazy but human characters, the social commentary, the tense plot - but most of all - everyone has stressed how much fun the comic was.
And first and foremost - fun was what we were going for.
So please join us for issue 2. We promise even more craziness and fun. And of course, most importantly - this lot as well. 
Friendly bunch. Buy them a drink. NOW.
Cheers
Matt Hardy (Mad Robot Comics)

campaign.story:
Well, here it is! After many years of talking about creating my own comic book series, I’m finally doing it, and as a kickstarter, too! I have to be honest, this is both exciting and very scary at the same time. Okay, now let’s do this...
I’m Andrew Huerta, and I'm making SOVEREIGN: THE RETURN vol 1. As stated in the video, I’m coming to Kickstarter because I need your support to get SOVEREIGN made. With the funds raised by YOU, the Backers, I will be able to work on SOVEREIGN: THE RETURN vol 1 full-time and finally get this book in your hands. 
And if Sovereign doesn't get made, then so be it, but it’s all about taking a chance in life, right?
SOVEREIGN will be a 6.5 x 10.2 inch 132 page book that comes in both soft and hard cover formats. The book is being drawn by me and written by both me and Fred Kennedy with Joshua Perez on colors and Deron Bennett on letters. It is scheduled to be finished in December of 2017, and shipped out to backers in March/April of 2018.
Below is a glimpse of what the final product will look like...
Sovereign: The Return vol. 1 Hardcover
  MAIN COVER
  VARIANT COVER/PIN UP
  PAGE 1
  PAGE 2
  PAGE 3
  PAGE 4
  PAGE 5
  PAGE 6 (work in progress)
  PAGE 7 (work in progress)
   On the planet EÅ in the year 2516 M.E. (Machine Era). A post-apocalyptic future where advanced sentient machines known as The Grey, have laid waste to most of humanity and are draining the planet of its eon-energy.
Years ago, during “The Last War”, the conflict between man and machine caused the accidental destruction of the moon. Humans lost. And the machines grafted the moon to the Earth to save themselves, and in the process, created their own machine “planet”. Ecologies have been altered and mutated. The remaining humans live in massive metric Cities counting down the days as the planet is sucked out of its essence. But Eå resurrects its champion, the ultimate elemental being…Sovereign.
He assembles what resistance remains and scours the earth of The Grey and their creator.
      Map A
  Map B
  Full Map
    SOVEREIGN

  NARA

    SOVEREIGN by Jeffrey “CHAMBA” Cruz
  SOVEREIGN by Tradd Moore
  SOVEREIGN by Travel Foreman

  SOVEREIGN by KHARY RANDOLPH (NOT FINISHED)
             I wish I could ask for less money but $44,000 is the amount I need to make this happen. And I cut as many corners as possible to bring the costs down to something thats still realistic for making a book at a high quality at this size. About half the funds are going to the production of the content (writing, drawing, coloring and lettering the book) and the other half is getting the books printed and shipped.
Here's the cost breakdown:
Production: $30,000 This covers my time drawing and writing the book ($18,750), paying the Colorist ($8,750), paying the Letterer ($2,500), and getting the book ready for print. (60%) 
Printing and Shipping: $8,000 This covers getting the books printed then shipped to my place. Then comes packing the books and shipping charges. I will pack the orders in bubble wrap, then put into a strong cardboard case. (31%) 
 Fees: $6000 Kickstarter and Amazon fees. (9%)
2017
January - February: Manage Kickstarter campaign 
 February: Finish and tighten up the rest of the Sovereign script 
 March - December: Drawing, Coloring and Lettering the book. (I know this seems like a long stretch for making the book, but with my art style, it takes me about 2 months, give or take, to draw 22 comic pages and Sovereign: The Return is around 132 pages.) 2018
2018
January - February: Prepping for print and printing the book 
 March - April: Packing and Shipping
 CREATOR MAN aka Andrew Huerta - Artist and illustrator from Los Angeles, California, and the artist of Dynamite Entertainment's “Homies" comic book. Other credits include "Underworld: Rise of the Lycans” and “Jinnrise" by IDW, “Planet of The Apes” by BOOM! Studios, “Pathfinder" by Dynamite Entertainment, “Court of The Dead” by Sideshow Collectibles, various stories for the Los Angeles Times, and "Punished: Policing the Lives of Black and Latino Boys" by NYU Press.
WRITER MAN aka Fred Kennedy - Has been creating indie comics for over seven years and has recently begun working with Chapterhouse Comics in Canada on the quartily sci-fi book, The Fourth Planet. He still has a day job at a radio station in Toronto, loves Age of Empire 2, yelling at cats that crap in his garden, and pickled beets.
COLOR MAN aka Joshua Perez - Freelance Artist/Colorist; mostly on Godzilla, Armarauders and Transformers (IDW, FunPublications).
LETTER MAN aka Deron Bennett - Is an Eisner and Harvey nominated Letterer. Writer of Quixote.

The biggest risk to SOVEREIGN is not reaching its funding goal. Other possible risks range from production mishaps, malfunctions with the printer and shipping delays.

That being said, the SOVEREIGN team will do whatever we must, without ego, to make good on our promise and reward your support by making sure we deliver a great story, ON TIME, to our backers.

Lastly, communication and transparency is extremely important to us. Backers will get bi-weekly updates about the production of this book and will be notified immediately of any setbacks.

We thank you in advance for your support.

campaign.story:
In a world where bubbles and meat can be worn as clothing, I long for more simple style of dress. From flapper to rockabilly to hippie, Hollywood created some of the best fashions ever worn. Think of Audrey Hepburn’s little black dress, or Clara Bow’s flirty scarves, or Marilyn Monroe’s sexy white gown. There is a reason why these fashions keep coming back into vogue; because they are simply beautiful.
In this project I want to honor some of Hollywood’s most fashionable ladies, from the silent film era to the flower power days. Fashion changed so much during this 50 year period, and yet it remained the same in its mass appeal. Even today, there are Pinterest and Tumblr accounts dedicated to the looks of these women, and Etsy accounts where you can buy vintage clothing. To me, it’s not enough just to look at these pictures. I had to go out and recreate the looks myself.
I want to make a coffee table art book showcasing these amazing women and their incredible fashion sense, but with a modern twist. Instead of just using old pictures of the ladies themselves, I gathered a group of women who remind me of the celebrities and recreated the looks using similar outfits that were created by current designers to look vintage. I like to think of it as a marriage between now and then.
But why create a book instead of a website? This is a question that I get a lot. I am a firm believer in tangible goods, something that you can see as well as hold and smell. This book is a throwback to the days before the internet, and I want to preserve that feeling. I want this project to be as real to you as it is to me. I want this book to come alive in your hands.
So anyone out there who enjoys fashion, or worships these famous women, or even people out there who just applaud creativity, I hope this project speaks to you. Donate today to help bring it to life. Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is no real downside if this project does not go through. I will have amassed clothing, since I have already begun shopping, and there will be a lot of disappointed models out these who were looking forward to portraying their favorite icon. 
I do hope this project gets funded, because they aspect of creating art using fashion is hugely appealing to me. This project is mostly about expressing myself creatively. Having people check out my website is an added bonus, but after last year’s photo shoot, I realized that I have a passion for this type of hobby.
If there seems to be an interest, I will love to open an online store to sell the clothing in.

The Al Rio Tribute Art Book Volume Two!
This is Terry Maltos. I was Al Rio's business partner and friend for 10 years. He died unexpectedly in 2012 and left us with hundreds of amazing pieces of fantasy art, character art, model sheets, commissions, comic book cover art and pinups to enjoy, appreciate and learn from.
This Kickstarter campaign is to raise money to publish Volume Two in a series of books I'm producing to make a historical record of Al Rio's incredible artwork.
Total Needed? $10,000 - and we can do it with your help!
The cost of printing the books will be almost $6000. The remainder will be used to pay for Kickstarter fees, design, promotion, packing/shipping materials, shipping, promotional materials and official licensing from Al Rio's family, who was kind enough to let me make this book to help document Al Rio's life's work.

campaign.story:
Do you crave comic books like Kamandi, Shadowrun or Dune?!?   Well, do I have a comic book for you! I proudly introduce you to...
D.N.S. cover for issue #1
  David Pung and myself come up with a post apocalyptic tale that will be 4 issues long, in stark black and white and includes everything we thought were missing in comics with a weird twist on it all. David's art for the book has never looked better and I should know, we already worked together on 2 other projects! The comic is all done and ready for printing and 15 pages of art is already done for issue #2 as well. All the comics offered here will be Zine size, which is 6"x 8", printed on glossy paper to give it that POP!
    The story so far... Kat and the remaining Rebel Mutants plan to sneak into the Elder 3's citadel to find out the reason for the CHANGE, that has turned everyone into Mutants. It is up to them to end the genocide the Elder 3 has been inflicting on the land. Will everyone play their part in the plan or do some have a different angle to play..?
Artwork by David Pung, Colors by JAR of Comics
  D.N.S. cover for issue #2
  DNS Inktober sketch cards!!!
 Let's move onto the tiers! I have always believed that you shouldn't gouge your patrons with $10 PDF's or $15 comics and this Kickstarter will prove it. At $1 you will receive the PDF of #1 immediately after we get funded. For $4 you will get a 24 page black and white comic Zine with a PDF of issue #1. Now if you're a patient person and want to wait an extra month you can scoop up Regret #1 and #2 for $8. If you want to go all in and get every comic I wrote, then it can be yours for $20. We're also offering original art from the book with everything else for $50. We have commission tiers from David for $30 and the cover artist D.N.S. from Fifth Dimension comics for $70, again with everything else. We've priced every tier just enough to get it printed and shipped right to you! 
David Pung Commission examples-
Raphael
    Bride of Frankenstein
  Swamp Thing
D.N.S. Commission examples-
Jonah Hex
  Cthulhu
  Ghost Rider
 Original Pages (10 total)-
Original pages 1/2
  Original pages 2/2
NEW TIER!!!
Felipe Anguiano, from THE SERVANT, is now open for commissions as well! For $30 you can get a beautiful 9"x12" black and white commission plus REGRET #1 in print and PDF form and all of the stretch goals!
THOR!
  The Servant!
 Stretch Goals-
$800- We'll add a card stock cover to Issue #1!
$1000- We'll add a postcard sized print by Andrew Grieve!
$1200- We'll add a postcard sized print by Brian Manning!
$1500- We'll add 4 more new pages to issue #1!
$2000- We'll add an ART ZINE by Regrets own artist David Pung! It'll be a 20 page black and white book of his commissions! 
Thank you for checking out our Kickstarter!!! We are BOOM...OUT!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges are extremely low with Regret because the book is done, the printer has given its final quote, and I am ready to print as soon as I get funding. I’ve learned a lot from my past Kickstarter, which shipped long before the deadline. I’ve also been an indie comic self-publisher for years, so I’m well versed in comic printing and shipping.
 
The biggest obstacle will be getting eyes on the project and to get it funded!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
